XoVenU7PQ2RnZ1HMcY09FQ.review_text: This place is just ok. I'm a big fried chicken guy and the chicken was, well...it was just fried chicken. The crust was hard like it had been sitting, same with the waffles. The meat inside was nothing special..a tad dry...I just wasn't impressed at all. The service was fine, not good, not bad...just adequate. I ordered food, they brought me food....  Anyone that thinks this place is great needs to have fried chicken done by someone who cooks it in a pan not a deep fryer....  I probably won't go back

5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: Here's the scoop: The food is banging.  The service is atrocious. I have always made it a rule that I can tolerate bad service if the food causes my toes to curl in ecstasy.  Boy, oh, boy did my toes curl.  Of course, I got the chicken and waffles.  Though I will say I was strongly tempted by the lunch buffet.  The chicken was perfect.  Cripsy and crunchy.  This breading stuck to the meat.  The chicken itself was still juicy in all the right ways.  Such heaven.  The two waffles to the side were no small fries.  Generous amounts of butter were provided.  The pair were not equal; the chicken was far superior.  However, as a combined plate the dish rocked my world.  Like I left with my hair all messed up and my clothes ruffled.    Some pointers: come with good company because you will spend a lot of time chit chatting.  Or if you come solo (which I would not be opposed to), bring a book or an ipad (we are in SF).

RagOSUdGuse5dxwg8lj3VQ.review_text: Let me say first, THAT I THOUGHT THE FOOD WAS GREAT. No complaints there. Yum.   The SERVICE was terrible. Seriously, really, really bad. All 4 times I have been there, for breakfast, lunch and dinner. In other words, bad service seems to be the theme here. Every time I go, I wait....and wait....and wait. The staff is not busy at these times, because I see them hanging out by the kitchen, shooting the breeze with their friends etc. Each time, after 20 minutes of sitting and not getting any sort of greeting at all, I have had to get up and hunt down menus myself. Then, we usually go and find a server after another 15 minutes of no one taking the order. Then, usually a portion of the order gets forgotten, like the case of our drinks 1 time, or messed up, like the time our appetizer arrived after our dinner as we were asking for the check, and no I am not exaggerating. The first time this happened, I thought it was a fluke, but, after multiple instances of the same bad service, it's about to drive me away, no matter how good the food is. The staff is very nice, when they arrive, or maybe I should say if they arrive, at the table. Last time I was there, while I was waiting for my beer that never arrived, I heard the waitress talking to a patron about how the reason they don't have many regulars is because they think they should expand their menu options. Well, I can tell you why you don't have many regulars. People get sick and tired of not being served at a restaurant in a competent, efficient and timely manner.  Bad service = less repeat business. I hope the manager/owner of Gussie's is reading this. I would love to go back if this was fixed

C846EVeECXBwSOhamD5PZg.review_text: was so excited to try this place... & so disappointed by the food!  Went with my mom for Sunday brunch. The hostess was lovely & sat us immediately.  Our server was nice, but seemed uncomfortable and didn't know the menu. She seemed unsure about whether or not some items on the menu were available, which I found odd.  Our food took a really long time to get to us, and just wasn't very good. We both ordered chicken & waffles. My mom had the cornmeal waffles which were overly sweet & had an unappetizing spice. Both the cornmeal & the regular waffles were tough & chewy. The chicken was ok but the pieces were tiny & by no means extraordinary.  Frankly, (however ashamed I may be to admit it) I prefer KFC or Popeyes...

XvKlJSq1ugs_pzFMo3ejHw.review_text: Food was really good. It was kinda a a step up from other chicken&waffle places I've been to. Love that they have their own twist on the butter and syrup.   The service was mediocre. I felt like my fries and I kept being brushed off by the waitress because we were young and--no racial--were not African American. But the guy working with her was great!

s6aXINWoVpIhzZwv_YicGg.review_text: I love the cornmeal waffles and cornbread and the fried chicken is crispy. Friendly place.

0UXBRrG-floBz9_zLqMpHg.review_text: I think this place has changed their cooks. The chicken doesn't have any flavor and was brought to me a little on the cold side. I will not come back.  Good thing I used a groupon towards my order.

bV4m22UFyuNYC8vvQUgFwA.review_text: I only came here because my friend had a groupon.   Pros: - good fried chicken - their corn bread is really sweet and good! - really friendly waiter  Cons: - one waiter and 2 busboys for the whole place = long wait = bad service - really soft/soggy waffles, not crunchy like the belgium waffles - they were already out of shrimp by 8pm ish so we didn't get to order their shrimp dish.  - too pricey for what it is. (ie: collard greens = $4+ as a side dish)  Note: I like Hard Knox Cafe's chicken & waffles wayyyyyy better.

Mqw844tw81n4Y4agNgzYug.review_text: My first Chicken & Waffle experience. All I can say is they did not disappoint me. The sweet-potato waffle are soo amazing!! Their waffle is not thick either, so you will not feel bloated after eating 2 of them. Their chicken could be less salty but love the crispiness.  A lot of the side orders are over-priced, like a $4.29 small cup of baked mac & cheese. Believe me when I say it's really small. Might as well get the daily special.  Will definitely be back.

nO_5OkDDWYHe_GE6iYQa1w.review_text: Please think twice before coming here.  LIKE I AM SERIOUS!   It is super expensive for some friend chicken and the taste is really not that great at all. I would rather go to KFC for fried chicken. We ordered fried chicken, some fried catfish, and a lot of other appetizers. Fried chicken does not have taste at all and the fried catfish was wayyyyyyyyyy too saltyyy... errr..  The waiter we had was not welcoming but at least the host was nice enough in the beginning. The environment is nice tho, but difficult to find parking. I had some expectations before but now I would rather go try other places for some chicken and waffles.

55yqRlBLPqxmNiZnQ7VHKw.review_text: This place is confused. They think they're a San Francisco restaurant, but they look like a suburban IHOP. The decor is bland, the lights are on way too bright, the furniture is off the shelf IKEA-looking crap, and the silverware is pathetic. I actually have no problem with any of these details if everything on the menu was about 20% cheaper.  The service was also confused. The host's stand at the front was abandoned, so that was awkward. After a few minutes, a server noticed the confusion and managed to get a table. A different server swung by almost immediately to take drink orders. Suggestion: if the patrons haven't even sat down or taken off their jackets, they probably haven't had a chance to look at the menu. Relax. Then he comes back, and puts his hand on the back of one of our chairs. I get you're trying to be friendly, but that is a little bit creepy.  From there on, smooth sailing. The food was good. Nothing mind-blowing, but all very flavorful.  This would be a terrible place to bring a date, parents, or a friend visiting from out of town if you're looking to impress, but great for a big ass group looking to have fun and be loud if they don't care about having a gourmet meal.

9HeDzIP2Kg9WzxxPLa7M-w.review_text: Mmm... baby.  I love me some chicken & waffles!  I usually enjoy eating my fried chicken with a bit of honey, so naturally, I easily got down and dirty with my fried chicken and brown sugar syrup... 'twas a finger-lickin' good all the way!  FOOD & TASTE: [I ordered the Two's Company, which came with two massive chicken wings, two eggs, grits, and cornbread.  The chicken came with crispy skin and not overdone.  I got my eggs poached, which were cooked to perfection.  My grits were plain, so I just mixed in my eggs and it was tasty!  Cornbread was good too.  To my surprise, I finished the whole plate!  Also, I got a taste of their waffles, a bit thinner and softer than I expected, but still good.]  DRINKS: [Coffee & Iced Tea was bottomless.] CONVENIENCE: **** [Located on Fillmore & Eddy St.  Came on a Saturday morning when parking is an easy find.] AMBIANCE: **** [Spacious resto, but booth seating is weird.  I sat down and the booth seats dip down lower than my knees can bend... and I'm already short, so that's pretty short!]  SERVICE: ***** [OMG... service was UHHMAZING!!!  Pia was our server and we watched her take care at least 8+ tables, serving everyone with a smile!  My coffee was topped off before I even asked.  Now that's efficient!  Everyone was clearly enjoying their time during our visit.] PRICE:  $$  [With a $12 Groupon deal for $20 worth of food, our bill came out to $10.  We tipped Pia $10 for her stellar service!] OVERALL: **** [4-stars... for large portions, decent prices, and excellent service!]  Come early to avoid busy times.  We came in when the resto was empty, and left when the resto was packed.  Whew!  Nuff said.

0CEUndR7SQmTo3OF8kKg7Q.review_text: I absolutely love the vegan plate, but i'm giving this place 4 and not 5 stars because their waffles are not the best ever. they're good, not great though.

WXhNyUDObGP6FE8kPt5HJg.review_text: This place is completely disorganized. Although we arrived when there was no line two tables were seated before us. The service was HORRIBLE. We ordered immediately as we had been waiting so long and it took forever for our food to arrive. The kitchen staff finally brought our food out, not our server. We had the vegetable plate and the sweet potato pancakes The food here is mediocre at best and I have no idea how greens cooked without meat can be so greasy. No way I would ever go back.

9qMzUJhS46_KUHddw2JA7w.review_text: First time eating chicken and waffles, and I am hooked! I don't know how Gussie's compares to the rest, but the food was delicious. No lines, and the ambiance was laid back. Kind of a jazz lounge feel, with a down home southern comfort food quality.. I really felt comfortable. I ordered the chix and waffles that came with two pieces of lightly fried, flavorful chicken (choice of light or dark meat). The waffles were double stacked and served with real maple syrup. There was a slight undertone of coconut in the waffles, deeelicious! I will be back for more!

4CrRKGVcyxKoBvoWW_ZIRg.review_text: I had such a hard time deciding what to order! I went with the Southern Comfort because I wanted fried chicken but something other than waffles. Unfortunately my chicken was dry and the mac and cheese was mushy. The collards were good but I've had better elsewhere. My bf didn't think his chicken was dry, but his was smothered in gravy. Fortunately, service was very good. Our server was friendly but I'm not sure I'd return.

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: I love how a few jazz clubs and the African American Art and Culture Complex has turned the Fillmore into a micro-neighborhood for soul food.  The main selling point of Gussie's is that you can follow your cultural experience with Harlem-style chicken & waffles until midnight (on the weekend).  For late night food it is pretty good, but it doesn't really compete with the more well known soul food places that close up shop much earlier.  Huge portions so take leftovers or get obese!  Fried Chicken: Thin breading.  The dark meat was fine, but the breast was a little dry.  Perfectly enjoyable when it's covered in some combination of syrup, butter, Crystal hot sauce and/or gravy.  Waffles: Thin and made to order.  Looks like large eggos.  None of that highfalutin Belgian wafel nonsense.  Also tasty when doused with sauces.  Gravy: A bit overpowering so don't dip all of your chicken in this.  Probably amazing with a biscuit.  Use sparingly so you don't hide the sweet side of things coming from other flavors.  Baked Mac & Cheese: Not baked to order, probably take from a large tray in the kitchen.  Lots of cheddar cheese chunks.  Hard to compete with all the artisan mac & cheese around town, but comforting.

8e0KSGo7VYQmFfB7w9TaBQ.review_text: This was my second visit. On the first visit, I had the chicken and waffles (Fillmore Classic), which is comprised of 3 chicken wings, eggs any style and a waffle. It was a solid performance with crispy chicken, which was good, but nothing really exciting as to the chicken fried crust. The chicken wasn't particularly moist, but these are wings, so I thought I should try again later. The waffle was a thin waffle, and again, it was good, but not great. The wait staff were very good that night, getting me to a seat, serving up a drink and food.  On my second visit, I tried the "Taste of the South" which was (in clockwise order) one quarter of a chicken, collard greens,  candied yams, mac and cheese and corn bread. I had the dark meat, which was a drumstick and thigh. I was somewhat surprised at how small the portion was. On the other hand, it was very tasty. Filling out the plate, though, were generous helpings of sides. The collards greens were excellent as were the candied yams. The mac and cheese was okay. Service was friendly and good. I think they were training someone so it was a little slow.  I'd go again.

M4PhaT5t6zZaeV66z_5Jmg.review_text: Pleasantly surprised by the REALLY great waffles.  Chicken was hot, crispy and not  greasy at all.  Bit of a wait to get our order taken, but once done, service was great.

WAhFYE-k9Snv6Gk8dTgj9g.review_text: Lunch Buffet for $12?? Done!  +/-Fried Chicken: crisp (not oily) outside, moist meat, but flavor a little lacking + Rotisserie/baked chicken: delish! + Mac n' cheese: YES PLEASE (I wish my stomach didn't have a full capacity) + Meatloaf: never had rice in my meatloaf, SO tasty! Good sauce :9 + Sides: Candied yams, green beans, fresh salad, pickled lettuce - Sides: gravy, stuffing (mostly because it was sort of bland)  Went a weekday afternoon and it's wasn't very busy (so no need to worry about people looking at you funny for going for 3rds or 4ths ;)  Kind laid-back service too :)

v_phwmv6fky4cq9dF1WyhA.review_text: 4 stars for buffet still but I would drop to 3 stars for the regular dinner. We had the 1/2 chicken and waffles, which comes with a choice of dark or white meat. The white comes with 1 breast and 3 large wings (yelp.com/biz_photos/guss…). The chicken is, as stated in my previous review of the buffet, tender but not quite seasoned well enough to cover up that gamey chicken flavor. The waffles were very soft to begin with which means they quickly became soggy with the addition of butter and brown sugar sauce. But oh my lord. The brown sugar sauce - this stuff is heaven!! My sister commented on how I'd disproportionately devoured almost the whole portion given to us, it tasted good on everything! We also had the sweet potato tots which came out piping hot and savory with a chipotle dipping sauce, though I can't say they were anything special. Honestly, the presence of sweet potatoes and that brown sugar sauce just made me long wistfully for Gussie's candied yams... Bottom line? The buffet is most worth it because 1) you get your full fix of fried chicken 2) the sides (candied yams and beans in particular) are that good. You won't miss much skipping the waffles.

WAi3hAAnBk98PKR8IpwLMQ.review_text: Very good chicken and waffles. Waffles are lightly browned and delicious, although I thought the syrup was watery. Great service, but marking it down slightly due to the overwhelming stench of cigar smoke in the mens restroom.

NQPOzdOCwFnt8CJ1HUz7vg.review_text: OMG....! This place is soul food heaven.   My husband and I was staying in the city because that night we were going to see Smokey Robinson in concert at the Warfield.   We ordered to go, bcuz we were kind of in a rush to get ready. So we get back to our room and now I'm really anxious bcuz the smell coming out of the bag is so fragrant, I just knew it was going to be Delicious.  Oh by the way, we ordered "A taste of the south" it consist of two piece's of fried chicken, collard green's, candid yams, macaroni & cheese and corn bread...I recommend trying this meal!  So now I get my food out of the bag and automatically taste the collard greens w/ crystal hot sauce of course and a bite of the corn bread....wow! then I start on the chicken and the chicken is so juicy and tender and full of flavor. The mac & cheese is also very good and the candid yams are soft and sweet. Overall I give this plate a 10+ !  The staff is wonderful as well.   We have been back since then and ordered the the same meal, but this time while we were waiting for our food we ordered sweet potato fries and they were very good as well.  I never ate sweet potato fries before, it was different but good.  I ate mine with ranch and combined with the sweetness from the fries was very good!  Next I will try the sweet potato waffles, can't wait!   Okay, so I highly recommend Gussie's chicken & waffles to everyone! it is kind of expensive but well worth it....you won't be disappointed.

OxA53Gl8WNUbCEgFyGWgdg.review_text: The closest spot we have in SF to the famous "Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles"   Have dinner on Flash Back Fridays, they have a DJ spinning great music.  $10 buffet, you cant go wrong unlimited chicken. Sever told us "you can eat till you sleep." LOL

22zQf5lsDeNGOc4rsA24pQ.review_text: Random finds are the best finds.  My friend from Savannah/ATL thought this place was much better than Gladys Knight's Chicken and Waffles in Atlanta, GA.  WOW!!  I must say, 2 things disappointed me: 1)  The Louisiana hot sauce was NOT hot but(!) it was damn good.  I emptied that bottle!   2) The syrup was not as thick and it had a buttery taste to it.  My friend loved it but I wanted the traditional maple taste.  (Enter the hot sauce as my 'syrup' so I was happy either way).  The price was not bad at all.  I paid $12.00 which included 1 breast, 1 waffle, water, and the tip.    Chicken was ABSOLUTELY fabulous.  Mine was so crunchy.  Great location to be sitting outside enjoying some chicken and waffles.  Servers (especially Pia) and the busboys were VERY nice...A great thing to have on Sunday morning.

pgHydP7mJBryEw5_Ldp36Q.review_text: It's a 2.5 star rating.  I've only had their fried chicken & sweet potato waffles and to call themselves Gussie's Chicken & Waffles....my expectation was sky high!  The fried chicken you add to your waffle is those drums+wing+tip piece which is very tiny and there's hardly any meat on it. There is no flavor, not crunchy, super dry and boring. For the fried chicken, it is a 1 star rating.   However, the sweet potato waffle was suprisingly delicious, it is on the thin and soggy side but the sweet potato flavor really shines. This would've been a 3 stars review if it didn't cost $15. But consider the size of their restaurant, their rent must be crazy expensive.   I might come back just to get their waffles.

uT2usa_yxcnx0Fl3TQ1Sgw.review_text: I miss this place! It's usually super busy during peak meal times, so try to get here during an off hour if possible. The first time I ordered the One Quarter Southern Fried Chicken and 2 Waffles, which was WAY too much food but I ate the entire thing because I have no self control in the presence of delicious food. The chicken was really tender and juicy (even though I hate that word), and the waffles were yummy!  The second time I didn't feel like dealing with the bone (huge mistake) and ordered chicken tenders instead, which weren't as tender : / ... Definitely get chicken bone-in! Anyway, the place has a really jazzy 20's vibe and the staff is extremely kind and accommodating!

i9l8TT6Bz63W-PZl8ph53w.review_text: "Fried chicken, fly vixen Give me heart disease but need you in my kitchen"  "Mrs. Fried Chicken you was my addiction Dripping with hot cholest-"  "Trapping me; You and your friend mac' and cheese Candy yams, collard greens; but you knocking me to my knees."  --Nas  Fried chicken fried chicken! Pair it with some mac n cheese, some collard greens -- no wonder I don't fit in my jeans! Throw in some waffles and gravy? No one can save me!!   Really though, ever since Roscoe's I've been obsessed. So how happy was I when I heard that Gussie's was opening? So what better way to spend my birthday then going to Gussie's on their scheduled opening day!!? So how bummed was I to find out that they weren't open yet. After three more MISERABLE FAILED attempts to go eat there, I finally made it.   Gussie's has a nice interior, a bit fancier than I had expected. We came during their happy hour (4pm-7:30pm M-F), which mean cheaper drinks and half off appetizers! We ordered the 1/2 chicken with dark meat and two waffles, fried chicken livers, and fried cheese grits. Fried chicken livers tasted like fried chicken livers...if you're a fan of liver, it's pretty tasty. The fried cheese grits were like..fried polenta. I kind of wish they had regular grits on their menu instead. The 1/2 chicken with dark meat came out with one leg and one breast. What?? Breast isn't dark meat. Apparently, despite the menu saying you can choose between dark and white meat, the 1/2 chicken can only come with both. Luckily, our waiter was nice and gave me a couple complimentary fried chicken legs.The chicken was...disappointing. Even the dark meat was dry and reminded me very much of white meat and why I tend not to like white meat. The waffle was soft and a little sweet even without syrup on it. Dipping the chicken in the side of gravy we ordered was a necessity. Maybe I went on an off night, since I've heard compliments for their chicken, but when I need a fried chicken fix, it probably won't be here. Even my love of fried chicken with waffles won't save them.

eRC6yy5Ji9I30tMxR_ygFg.review_text: I live close by. Sometimes, the food is good. Sometimes, the food is bad. But the service -is ALWAYS bad. I go here because I have hope for new businesses & new culture. & when the right person is cooking and the food hasn't been sitting it is a delight.   The other day I went there our waitress took our order almost immediately, we knew what we wanted. We always get the something "Fillmore Classic" -three wings, one or two waffles , with two eggs. We ordered our good at 1:04. As 20 minutes went by I asked a short black women " hey excuse me, it's been 20 mins" she said " I'm sure it's coming right out" she didn't check with the back. & when she did go to the back she never came bk to the table to assure us the food was coming. Another 11 mins went by & they brought out eggs out ... Very small portion it looked like 1 egg & mounds of cheese. A min or two later the rest of our food came out. My waffle was burnt, being that the food took so long I just ate it. The eggs weren't edible it was way too much cheese, so I kindly told her could she just give my little sister eggs with no cheese & she had the biggest attitude , & just took the eggs without apologizing or even looking at me. As soon as we were done , she got a boost of energy and was smiling and being polite, obviously because it was time for her tip. I live within walking distance and probably will never return

yG002rouE9uVYJWpPHcC9g.review_text: Can Catch-22's exist around something so positive as Gussie's? I mean, does an embarrassment of riches really present a rock-and-a-hard-place situation? Like my current dilemma with Gussie'ss: I'd love to include more people in on the fun so that we can share some items and then maybe we'd get to actually save room for dessert and try the red velvet cake. But that means I'd have less chicken, waffles and sides in my belly...  I'm going to blame life for this one, for making the human stomach so ill-equipped to handle obscene amounts of Gussie's grub. Because this connundrum isn't from a lack of trying. Y. and I packed it down, tried our best to eat as much as humanly possible. Ordered a half-chicken, two-waffle combo with none of the fancy fixin's (no sweet potato waffle, no real maple syrup-- just brown sugar and vanillin will do for us, thanks much) and a side sampler of mac-n-cheese, collard greens, candied yams and corn. And with relish (the feeling, not the condiment; I know chicken and waffles embodies the sweet-and-savory feeling but that would just have been over the top) we did.  And what genius came up with such a resplendent idea? Though I was disappointed with my first experience at a Roscoe's about five years ago, I still had faith in the idea because how could a marriage between a chicken and breakfast batter not make sense to a dirty food heathen like me? The chicken was juicy, the coating crisp. The chicken wasn't as deviled as the Colonel would do and so the flavors weren't as assertive as I would have liked against the sweetness of the syrupy waffle, but the meat was tender and palatable.   I know most would be completely satisfied with two pieces of chicken and a waffle, but you'd be committing a sin against the self if you didn't get some of their offerings on the side. Candied yams were toothache/coma-inducing sweet, but had the warm flavorings of cinnamon and clove to still make it endearing. The sweetness was toned down when paired with the greens, which are cooked to tender perfection with whole leaves staying intact and so complex in its tangy, bitter flavor. If I had to choose between the greens and the mac-n-cheese, I'd be Sophie all up in here because the mac-n-cheese is the best I've ever tried of its kind. It's simple and you can really taste the pasta and the milky mildness of the cheese, which striiiiiiiiings when you try to lift up a forkful from the bowl.  The only negative that wasn't self-inflicted (damn stomach and its capacity) was the service. Our server was snarky and inattentive, never refilling the waters or stopping by to check in. Which is actually not that big of a deal-- it would have been embarrassing to expose someone to the ravenous wolfing and moaning that was going on at our table. But the fool had the audacity to recommend corn to us, advice that we in turn foolishly followed, only to meet a bowl of boiled corn, unseasoned, unadorned (actually tasted like reversal of seasoning with the flavor of the corn extracted out in the cooking process) with any flavor except for some finely-diced red bell peppers. Come on, dude. steamed. corn? I'm getting the black-eyed peas next time.

gqKEY-YU0MWKiD6HGEK53A.review_text: This place was probably my worst dining experience ever, and I really don't say that lightly.   Two hour wait from being seated to being served food. We ordered a round of hurricanes for the three of us. After an hour, he brought out two. Not three. The third one never appeared, though we asked about it three times.   When our food finally arrived, my order was wrong, but at that point I was afraid to send it back. The chicken looked like it had been sitting out awhile. Our biscuits never came. The portions of mac and cheese were small. And all around, the food was not worth the wait.  The waiter never checked in on us, or volunteered explanations about what was happening. When we inquired, he claimed that our drinks were late because they ran out of glasses (perhaps plausible), and that our food was late because they didn't have enough waffle irons. I hear they sell those at Target. Maybe pick up a few, seeing as how the name of the restaurant includes the word "waffles".  And then, at the end of the night, I asked them to break a 20, and they claimed they were unable to. They had been open all night, but still had no change at all? I will never, ever come back here. I wish I could rate them lower.

Lehu9ZVrCD1NovG0lQ6YhQ.review_text: Came here recently and was very pleased.  I ordered 1 fried chicken breast and a biscuit w/ bacon & mushroom gravy (get the biscuit - it is cheap and to die for!!) for breakfast and I was more than sated.  It was a nice combo because I was definitely full but not to the point of feeling gross.  Our waitress was fast and attentive and everything everyone else ordered looked delicious.  You can even order vegan buckwheat pancakes!  and their syrup is delicious.  I definitely recommend this for the next time I need chicken & waffles or even just a nice brunch in the city.

8fqk8Dmk2BvFN7oGEjgxvA.review_text: Tried it twice then tried it again came up with the same answer never again really like to support black owned businesses but I also enjoy real soul food

avxD6r3_MquP6xBbiaUHNw.review_text: My husband's favorite food is fried chicken, so he loves that the 'chicken and waffles' concept allows him to eat it for breakfast...nothing like some good ol' fried chicken to get your morning started!  After the quality of Little Skillet's waffles went downhill, we wanted to give Gussie's Chicken & Waffles a try...  Unfortunately, their waffles weren't very good either. They were soft and limp, like they had been sitting out for a while. (The hubby got the sweet potato waffles, which were a lot better). However, the fried chicken was excellent - delicious crisp skin and nice, salty flavor. Finger lickin' good!   I have a soft spot for biscuits and gravy, so we also got an order to share. The gravy was tasty with bits of ham, but the biscuits were too doughy.   Overall, the restaurant was ok, but not good enough for me to want to come back.

nAbwXrHgJx5BshmOcCRCZQ.review_text: I only went cause my dad won't eat anywhere else these days.  He is in love with the fried catfish and banana pudding.  Only complaint: they never have the cobbler - but it's always on the menu.   I had a piece of chicken and a waffle - a lot of food but I ate it all.  I noticed people really clean their bones here but they don't always finish their waffles.  Salad is good too and the menu is pretty extensive.  This is a cool 1st date spot - I think.

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: There's a new playa in town for southern cooking. This place has potential. Great location, good food, and a helluva a deal. They are very close to being a five star restaurant that they deserve to be. They still need to get some kinks out of the way. They need to ease up on the salt with the collard greens, refill the waters periodically, check up on us every now and then, and maybe lower the price a tad and this will be IT. The ideal restaurant in the FILL MO!!!   I've been to many soul food restaurants and this place definitely have soul............I am a Chinese guy telling you!!!......... that this place have soul. I can feel you!!!   Everything is great about this place. They just need to get the new appliances broken in before you get that brown, crisp seasoned brown waffle fries, or that seasoned chicken wings/thighs/breast. They will have it soon..........I promise you that. You just need time to marinade that deep fat fryer and all of that love will come out. I would probably give them another 1 to 2 months before they come out with some quality food in which I know they can.   Their corn bread is fantastic, candy yams are good and not too sweet, mac and cheese...........will be great if they only bake them a little bit longer to get that crisp layer on top. Waffles are great........they just need to get that crispy, crunchy texture to it and this place will rock. The fried catfish and fried okra were good.  I am not a fan of the fried okra but they were actually ok.  If only the fryer was just a little more "seasoned" both the fried catfish and okra would have that perfect color and texture.  Chicken and waffles...............you guys are so money that you don't even know how good you guys are. Work on the kinks ....fix it.......and when I come back...............you guys are definitely getting a 5 star review.

P0g2RdVyP11FESY8puUCrg.review_text: Solid food. I've definitely had better but not too bad. I had the taste of the south, dark meat with collared greens, mac n cheese and candied yams. I also had a side of their special waffles (red velvet). The red velvet waffles was pretty dam good. A bit chewy but it was like eating a cake in a waffle form.  The dark fried chicken wasn't top bad either. Nice and crispy and with a splash of crystal hot sauce; delicious! The collared greens was a bit over salted but still good. They had a solid mac n cheese even though I've had better elsewhere. The candied yams were very flavorful.   The service isn't too bad. The server was super nice and gave great suggestions. Overall a solid place to eat.  I've been here 2 times already and it's a pretty good place for groups to eat out too. Great for brunch! The price point Is decent as well. My entire bill was under $25 not including tip. Not too shabby :)

E8z40nIghchINTwbBpPRiw.review_text: Sunday Din with @JaRue2011 & niecy over some southern soul food eats around the corner from Yoshi's SF at Gussie's Chicken & Waffles yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… Sunday, 8/26/12 6:30pm-ish ** RSVP only taken by OpenTable ** Rating is really 3.5, but I'm ok rounding up GROUPON: Cashed in our $20 for $40 Deal, & would gladly return without any deal ^_^ LOCATION: Garage parking across the street (forgot how much), else street parking. Restaurant is just a few meters from the corner intersection of Eddy St & Fillmore St, you can't miss it yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… RESTAURANT: Outdoor seating with heat lamps available, although no patrons opted for this on this breezy Sunday evening. Spacious & clean indoor dinning for parties of 2 to larger groups. Overall friendly with babies/kids, various shapes/sizes, handicap, & disabled. A diverse group of ppl walk through their doors to eat (love it). Soulful R&B music playing in the background throughout. My grandma would've gotten mad at us singing/humming at the table, but they were playing some good tunes (sorry grandma). CUST SVC: Overall nice, friendly, & patient. In my OpenTable RSVP, I requested to by the window, & they accommodated! Had to flag our waiter down a few times, but the place was honestly crowded. EATS: Our Vanilla Shake which was runny & not thick 'cuz it was the bottom of the barrel & for some reason, staff thought it be ok to serve (HA). We'll we brought it up to our waiter & he quickly waived ^_^ (thanks!) With the exception of the shake, EVERYTHING was scrum-didly-umptous! Food was served hot, fresh, nicely seasoned, not overly battered, & not overcooked. Simply a lovely southern treat to all our taste buds. $13.79 2-Sweet Potato Waffles & 2-Drumsticks  yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… $14.99 Taste of The South  yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… $9.29 Fried Chicken Breast Sandwich w/ waffle fries yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… $3.99 "disappointing" Vanilla Shake yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… FORKS DOWN: After our Groupon deduction, extra costs was $1.69 (pls tip on full value folks) yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… We helped the cleaning staff out...left nothing on our plates to throw away or take home. Such good eats! If you're going to a performance at Yoshi's SF, we/I'd recommend dinning here as an option ;-)

mDtU-w5zZE1svx3Nb4GuiQ.review_text: NEVER AGAIN! Seriously, I've never been so motivated to write a review! This place is on my list for worst restaurants I've ever been to in terms of service. Okay, so I came here with a group of ten people for dinner. The hostess told us that since there was already a big group inside, we would have to wait until they're done. So we waited for almost and an hour, but she told us that they just added a few people to their table. We figured that since we've already wasted that hour waiting, might as well wait some more. We even told her that if it was easier, she can just split us up in different tables. That didn't happen. We still had to wait. After a FRICKIN HOUR AN A HALF we were FINALLY seated. And let me tell you what frustrated me most. The room was a fairly big size. There were many many open tables and the place was not at all busy! I don't understand why they had to make us wait SO LONG for one group, when they can just pull other tables together and arrange the seating in another area. It really is doable considering the space and amount of table they had. Ghhrr It just made me mad thinking about how long we waited! The food didn't even make up for it either.  The portions were small and weren't worth the price. I ordered the Fillmore which included chicken wings, waffles, and eggs. It was okay. There was nothing special about it at all.   In terms of the waiter's service, there was nothing spectacular about it either. He was hard to get a hold of whenever we needed him. They all didn't look that motivated or enthusiastic, it seems.   Environment wise, they had loud live music playing which was very unpleasant.  Honestly, I wanted to tip them .01 cent to show how much I didn't like the service and the place, but they charged for gratuity. I know it's the rule but to make us wait THAT long AND charge for gratuity seems unjust. They could have compensated us at the very least. Now I know where in SF to never go again.

4slxBUw4gqvUpMynoUN6dg.review_text: So freaking delicious!  I had bought a groupon and my boyfriend and I were in town, so we stopped by after touring Golden Gate Park.  Before this trip, we had never had chicken and waffles, but had heard people rave about it.  We were seated quickly at a table/booth near the kitchen.  It is an alright-looking place, the bathroom is kinda seedy, but the restaurant looks down to earth (kinda like something I'd expect to see at home in a mom/pop restaurant).    Of course we both got chicken and waffles- the fried chicken is the BEST fried chicken I'd ever had, better than any mom or grandma in Kentucky/Ohio could make!  And the brown sugar syrup, are you trying to kill me??? I ate every last bite on my plate and never looked back.  Mouthwatering, juicy, sweet, savory, coma-inducing... No regrets!

iCos25g_O3Z5Am9K4383WA.review_text: First impression of Gussie's: an upscale Roscoe's serving up more than just chicken and waffles.   This was our first visit here so natch we felt the need to sample different items on the menu. The Taste of the South is a good way to try everything and it's easily good enough for two people to share. It comes with 1/4 fried chicken, honey cornbread, candied yams, and collard greens. I'm not big on greens so I asked to sub even more carbs - smothered potatoes. I would rate everything on this plate 3.5 stars. While everything was pretty tasty, the gravy on the potatoes was a little too salty as was the fried chicken. The candied yams were good too but a little on the sweet side since it was covered in syrup. We also ordered a fried chicken and waffle plate. Same with the fried chicken and the waffle was a bit soggy. It came with scrambled eggs which we never received.   A southern meal would not be complete without sweet tea. Gussie's isn't bad but I kept tasting a plastic after taste. Not sure if it was because it was sitting in plastic containers in the back or maybe that was just their syrup that they use to sweeten it.   This review would really be 3.5 stars since the saltiness of the food was a little overbearing. But I'm going to round up because the star at Gussie's isn't the chicken or the waffles. It's the Cheddar Cheese Grit Cakes. This might be the sole reason I dine here again. These cakes are delicious! Combining the softness of the grits, crunch of the breading, slight tang of the cheese, added flavor of the green onion, and savoriness of the dipping sauce, this appetizer is a sure fire winner!  Overall, I'd probably dine here again but stick to the grit cakes and maybe a side of something else.

UePtQzNzTptHLwpkyZLQRg.review_text: After 4 attempts to dine here, we finally got served.  Our waitress was personable in the beginning but when there was a problem - she never returned to the table.  The hostress stopped by to see if anyone had come back to the table and nope!  Our food was inadvertently sent to a couple of other tables.  By the time it arrived at our table it was cold.  I was aprehensive about consuming it having seen it go to 2 other tables and then watch it get sent back to the kitchen for another 3 minutes.   I requested it get heated and I made the best of it.   I was so hoping to have a great experience because I stopped in 2 times on Saturday - no food/no serivce; 1 time on Sunday and tried again on Monday - closed for training.    Tuesday I thought would be a "make-good" on all the mixups, disappointments etc.    It was just ok.  I'd give it another try well down the road.

DCZDwTs2Cxd2kZVokH7cFQ.review_text: Went for late lunch on Friday, so the place was not at all crowded. I think there were a total of 3 tables.   I like the space and location - pretty convenient to buses and the decor is very homey and casual. The servers were friendly (all two of them) and I really wanted to like this place.  Alas...the food. As a southerner, I do have some expectations for fried chicken. And this was fine. Not delicious, not incredible, not special just...fine. The waffle aspect was a little odd too. While mildly sweet, it reminded me more of a crepe with waffle hash marks. It didn't have the thickness of a typical Belgian waffle, and I'm used to the latter with my chicken 'n waffles.  Had a side of mac...again, adequate. Not great, not tasty, just okay.  Maybe I'll give it another go, one day, but probably not going out of my way to go there.

g47wExbG_R9w4g22N8SeOA.review_text: Had dinner here several times, and had a great experience. If you like authentic chicken and waffles you'll love this place! The staff is super friendly and nice and the food is incredible. I recommend the Sweet Potato Waffles or the Chicken Strips with special syrup. Don't forget ordering a side of their delicious Home Fries.

krYfPBzVaTkKQAQglDbNKw.review_text: I met the cook (Don) and he was super cool and personally checked on me and my family to make sure our food was ok.  Waffles was tasty and the Chicken was crispy.  I would go back again based on my personal interaction with the super cool cook.

FgqUiiG2NTAq1lciyCxf6g.review_text: This place definitely has the yummiest waffles! They were warm, a bit crunchy, and super buttery. Our meal came out a bit slow (about 45 mins to be exact) when they were not overly busy. When we asked the waiter for an update on our food, she advised us that our chicken was ready, they were just waiting for the waffles. So that means they make the waffles per each order. I did want to try their red velvet waffles but they were out of the cream cheese butter.. :(  I had a Gilt City offer for this place and it was super worth it. Overall this place has yummy soul food in SF.  We got: -Quarter fired chicken & 2 waffles (dark meat) -Fillmore Classic: 3 fried chicken wings & a waffle

ZkPzTJMhRsMC4-isp-hJJQ.review_text: So I just ordered from Gussie's and wow, it beats my worst expectations.  Now please note it was delivery- the food may be better if I had eaten it at Gussie's but it does not excuse the fact that my order was smashed completely when I opened the bag.  Smashed like a person SAT on the order to the point that I had a hard time opening the containers.    Now for a place that serves fried food, I would highly suggest not using tight plastic containers to hold food so that everything ends up soggy (smashed or not smashed).  Fried food needs to be able to breathe.    On a last note, they even got my order wrong.  Charged me for $5 delivery fee and dinner was essentially thrown out.  It was first time at Gussie's and likely my last.  Highly do not recommend.

aj5dqQXFkzh_Ub2sX6sxGA.review_text: We really enjoyed the food and thought it was priced just about right. In addition, the service was fantastic. I had just left and completely forgot about leaving my iPad mini on the table. Before I even realized it the clean up guy ran out and gave it to me! Definitely A+!

204pVFDT04PJyU8NgXhsQA.review_text: Had the Uptown Special.  Chicken breast was slightly overdone but flavorful.  Will probably go with a dark meat next time (ie: wings / thighs).  Waffles are good.. My partner had the "Two's Company" ,   Chicken wings and home fries are excellent.  Will be back to try some of the dishes they are more known for such as the potato waffles.

0utAyzOIttwTcOGVY_838g.review_text: If I don't like I place I don't even leave a review. This place deserves 5 stars all the way. I love chicken and waffles! I love soul food! This place is the place to get all of it at once. Chicken and waffles were amazing! Collard Greens over the top! The only thing wrong was my eggs were scrambled not over easy. But they at least scrambled them over easy. I will be coming back often.

9YXx_m-WYuUltfOJc6kmBQ.review_text: My quest for good chicken and waffles in Norther California has ended. I'll just make em at home. The end.  Oh wait, what? I have to write a review? What do I look, Ernest... uh... Criton... way...? Fine...  Let's say that you don't FEEL like making chicken and waffles at home. Decent waffle makers are only about $20 (like the nifty one I got from Bed, Bath, & Beyond), but you can't be bothered with measuring flour and dosing out the log cabin fake maple syrup yourself. Nor do you want to fry your own chicken (or alternatively hitting up Popeye's for a 2 piece.) Okay, I get that. You want convenience. Savory, sweet, gut-busting convenience. If you're in the San Francisco bay are, I would tell you to hit up Gussie's... and also Hard Knox's, but that'll be a seperate review...  Anyhow, these people got it right! The waffles and chicken here, in my opinion, is the closest you'll get to the same goodness you can get at Roscoe's down in socal. The waffles have the same rich, sweet, just right sort of consistency/mouthfeel. They just melt in your mouth. And oh goodness, please PLEASE order the sweet potato waffle. I'm not quite sure how they make it, but it is DIVINE. Their homemade brown sugar syrup just takes the cake. The fried chicken itself is just on point. Crispy and with just enough flavor. Oh so good when it's still hot. I like mine smothered with the gravy and some Crystal hot sauce. Oh man, these are some next level eats for sure.  The service? It's great. Servers are more than friendly and super helpful. They get your orders out with no muss and no fuss. Absolutely no complaints about the service here. They've got that down pack.  After being disappointed in the chicken in waffles in Oakland, i'm happy to say that there is yet still a place you can head to here in the bay for awesome chicken and waffles. Gussie's man, I love this place.

NCFLZQnlQOhcmDK3cAI29g.review_text: The Fillmore is a charming neighborhood and Gussie's makes the perfect place to stop and have a bite to eat before continuing one's saunter. I recommend a trek to Alamo Square to walk off the calories you consume here.  I think to alleviate the complaints about the service, Gussie's has started offering a $10 buffet at lunch. You can serve yourself and not have to wait for the staff.  The chicken is moist and tender and tasty; the sweet potato waffle is very tasty and it comes with a big scoop of real butter. Butter, one of my main food groups. The biscuit and gravy is also excellent, this said by someone who has a long line of biscuits and gravy in her pedigree.

aUkAPL1X0Ng-5GilullzLg.review_text: Ehh .. I don't know! I had my birthday party here a few days ago and I expected much better. Being a restaurant owner, I feel this place is very poorly managed! Food was subpar, party host was super nice but the servers were horrible. I never been to a place where I have to do everything myself ... Very misleading menu! ... Want to say I'll give them another shot but I really can't. The grits cake and corn bread was very good though. 1 star for the grits cake and 1 for the host.

bFhi7iyR7b-7sNmlWqTc5A.review_text: As of 11/29/2014, this place is closed and they are dismantling the kitchen.  They had not been answering their phones but heck this was Thanksgiving week, so we walked down to the business and sadly found it CLOSED.  They say they closed because of continued flooding probs and plan to reopen in Oakland.  Alas not an option for us.  Too bad.  I loved their taste of the south.    I must say that I was irritated that they neither updated their website nor their answering machine message with the change of events.  Furthermore I saw that before Thanksgiving someone had posted a review.  If I knew they were even considering closing I would have gotten one last Taste of the South in.

wCniTSmbsn8lXQNSlZE0PA.review_text: The people and the atmosphere were nice, but the service was TERRIBLE! They are significantly understaffed for how many people come here and the food was not that great. We got there at 6:15 and didn't have our food until like 8. I personally wouldn't recommend it. However, the waiter gave us drinks on him.

JSLjmywvDizsRDw7i2xFEw.review_text: Decently good stuff, waffles are not crunchy so be prepared.  The chicken is good, but can be dry so soak it in hot sauce.  The staff is hit and miss, I've had decent service when it's crowded, but when its slow for some reason you can't get a refill on your water or coffee.  I was one of 5 people in the whole restaurant and had to wave down a busser for a refill and he did not look happy that I waved him down.  It's too bad, you lose a lot in tips with service like that.  The sweet potato waffles are bomb, but they need to crisp them up.

jRO5X3FaKQHM3aeBFLo7lQ.review_text: Good southern food I have to say. the price a but high but understandable because of the building up keeps. Collard greens barely any flavor. The cornbread was sure yummy. chicken was just like any other friend chicken nothing special I don't think.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Finally made it to Gussies after hearing all about it on yelp and from my friends. The yelp reviews were very discouraging so I went in thinking hmm not going to expect much. I got the sweet potato waffles, 2 pieces of chicken wings, and fish nuggets. The nuggets were coated with cornmeal it looked like, very lightly coated I must add which was good. The fish was tender and steamy in the middle, good stuff! The waffles were good at the beginning then toward the end I understood what people were saying by being a bit chewy. The chewy part didn't bother me too much it was the overwellming sweetness in the batter and nutmeg? Some spice was very strong in it. Chicken was good to me, with some hotsauce it was all good! I saw my friend's white meat and it looked dry, but she said it was very tasty. I will go back, but next time no waffle for me. I want to try the fried grits and uhh I saw waffle fries!! One more thing, the servers are very nice but our server, you really need to learn to stay in the front of the place and STOP hanging in the back. He was never around when I wanted a refill and what was up with bringing only one appetizer plate when there are the 2 of us? I don't get it.

Mbt4xnW-f_p-iwS_-16SxQ.review_text: If you know me, you know I LOVE soul food. I loved the collard greens here, mmm. I forgot what I ordered but it was BOMB.com! The service is excellent here.  Next time I might have to try the red velvet waffles ;)

9OvhmrCTN76k01nnTOxN-Q.review_text: Oh man! A 7 minute ride away from the Metreon :) Being that we came on the night of Halloween and the World Series Giant's parade, I'm glad we made it!  Upon arrival, it's a bit dim outside, we were afraid that it was closed out of it's ordinary schedule, luckily it was open!  There were a few items we'd love to have tried if there's another opportunity that we're in the area again.  I had the Uptown, with my choice of either thigh or legs for my dark meat. With an upgrade $2 for red velvet pancakes. Now I've never been here before, we when I got my plate, I thought the cream piled on my waffle was butter, I had to ask for maple syrup. Our waiter looked at us, and asked with bulging eyes, 'you want syrup too?!" BEWARE! That pile of cream, is actually frosting. LOL we spread it on, and then poured syrup on top of it. Thankfully I went light on the syrup, or else it would've just been dessert. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. Whooo! Not just your regular buttermilk milk chicken tossed in some flour and fried.  I also order the Mac & Cheese. Totally recommended! It goes well with the chicken!  No room for dessert, next time, I'm saving room for some :)

qTPakuKyJVgsPMoTgtFYrw.review_text: Went there today expecting hot fried chicken with southern trimmings! What a disappointment! The choices were buffet or order off the menu. Some of us had the buffet, which was horrible. The fried chicken, fish, mac'n' cheese, rice, beans was cold, dried and left way too long on the buffet table. The rest of our party ordered off the menu and enjoyed the waffles, fresh hot fried chicken, and gumbo. The place wasn't busy enough to serve both menu and buffet. The buffet never got refilled because not enough people, and I think the food was sitting there since it opened and we didn't come in until 1:30!  I think Gussies is good for ordering off the menu, but don't eat the buffet, I was very disappointed and left hungry!

FCBGcmYOvN9LVI3CwMQiKg.review_text: Man i really want to love this place! Its so convenient and it easily quenches my southern born craving for fried everything! However- no matter how much fried yumminess is present.. customer service is always tops in my book. That being said... Lets get down to it.   Service:: Maybe they were just super busy.. (but it didnt look like it) and it was past brunch time on a Sunday. Im not sure who our server was.. it appeared to be a team effort situation. The problem with that: there was a lot of miscommunication. I never received something I ordered- after asking two different people for it. The check took forever to come, to go, and to return. Maybe ive been out of the south too long.. i know life is a lot slower down there.. but this was a bit much.   Ambiance:: This place is not exactly SanFrancisco chic. But for me.. that can be a good thing. It reminds me of the places back home in the south. Its clean and the food is good. Aint nobody got time to worry about ambiance.   Food:: Well.. the food gets all the stars at Gussie's. Lets be honest- everything is fried and everything fried is good. The chicken is perfect (white or dark), the waffles are damn good (they better be, right?) and all the sides we tried were authentic and southern (homefries, collard greens, mac and cheese). Southern comfort with a side of homefries- thats whats up.  I will definitely go back- because the food is legit. But I probably wont be back on a Sunday.

RPYjDKJjF96EQ9Vekzz1pw.review_text: My daughter, sisters, and their SOs went there on Friday night and were seated in about 10-15 minutes.  This was about 9:00 PM.  We ordered and received our drinks promptly.  One of our appetizers came about 10 minutes, the fried catfish, and it was pretty good.  However, we waited, waited, and waited some more for our entrees.  Approximately 20 minutes into our wait for the entrees, the waitress stopped by to let us know that our orders would arrive shortly.  As we waited some more it was approaching 10:30 PM.  By that time we were starving.  I tried to flag a waiter for the check for our drinks and the catfish, but 3 waiters just stared at me with a 'deer in the headlights' look.  Our waitress was nowhere to be found.  Another 10 minutes go by and I tried to flag 2 other waiters but got the same blank stare.  We could wait no longer and had to leave to find something to eat elsewhere.  So almost 2 hours there and never got our meal.  9:00 PM: Arrive 9:10-15 PM: Seated 9:25 PM: Got drinks 9:35 PM: Appetizer 9:55-10:00 PM: Server checked on us 10:35 PM: Tried to flag down waiter for check 10:45 PM: Tried profusely  to flag down waiter for check 10:46 PM: Sorry, but had to leave to get some food  10:55 PM: Arrive at Arang Korean 11:05 PM: Food arrives 11:05-11:40 PM: Stuff our faces (ordered too much food due to starvation) 11:40-11:50 PM: Marinating, and paid check.

R2RKZCoNWTY9cNhxdOvxfw.review_text: Chicken & Waffles were delicious! I was hesitant on trying it at first, but I am glad I changed my mind. We'll definitely be back for more. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was that service could have been a tiny bit better. We waited longer then needed to order our food, as well as when it came to someone picking up our check.

xuC869l1jvE1Jje4zqs-og.review_text: I went to Gussie's twice now with some friends and enjoyed it. The first trip was decent dinner and the food ever so delicious. The second time was for lunch. They were crowded, but three people assured us they would help find us a place since we had a fairly large party After some personal effort from the staff we got seated quickly and the food arrived in decent time. It was delicious! The only thing keeping me from giving them 5 stars is that both times the waiter confused what teas we were drinking and they didn't keep track well on who ordered what, but hey, we did order a lot of food and I definitely recommend coming back.

-VrlgXvSIhlz4vw4bDOQLw.review_text: Ugh Soooo much food So full. Sweet potato everything is delicious, you'll be satisfied. There are options for vegetarians , meat eaters, and brunch people alike.

GlSNtoXs8fJ_xYtLZ0Hzrg.review_text: I put off giving this spot a good review after the first couple times I ate here due to procrastination. So sadly for Gussies, now that I finally found time, my review will be based off the horrible service we received today. It was packed today given it was a weekend and also a holiday but they only had what seemed to be just 2-3 waitresses on the floor. Our waitress sat us down and didn't bother to ask us if we wanted drinks and didn't return to check on us til about 15 minutes later--not that big a deal to me but I'm just getting started. After taking our orders without writing it down (don't know how she'd be able to remember that many orders with a packed house) she came back with just 2 out of the 3 coffees we ordered. She said they were making a new pot--that's understandable but with no cream or spoons given, we just sat there watching our coffees get cold. It took about another 10-15 minutes before we were able to get a hold of a different waitress to help us. Another 5 minutes passed and yet no 3rd cup of coffee was brought to us.  Then I overheard a table next to us complain to what seemed to be the supervisor that their food came out cold and something else unclear and she sincerely apologized. That's when I decided we weren't going to wait anymore. After 40 minutes of waiting, all we got was 2 cups of coffee and she never bothered to come back and check on us. As we got up to leave, I wanted to at least be courteous and let the waitress know that we were leaving so she could cancel our orders but she saw us get up and put our jackets on and just looked away like she couldn't care less so we left 5 bucks on the table and left without saying anything.  I've never had to do that before and I never want to have to do that again.  I love Gussies for their location, cleanliness, and of course, their food. Gussies food is worth at least 4 stars. The fried chicken and waffle are absolutely delicious. I love their moist and flavorful chicken and crisp waffle served with warmed syrup. Their "taste of the south" dish is what I would recommend--fried chicken served with collard greens, baked mac'n'cheese, and cornbread. Their chicken gumbo which is not always available is also a must-try. The quality of their food seems to stay consistent but I can't say the same for the wait staff. I'd have to rate their service at average a 2.   If you do plan on coming here, I do suggest going on a slow night as in during the weekdays and def not on a holiday.  I really wanted to love you Gussies but I won't be coming back until you guys clean up your wait staff.

UkrneyVGUwv3t9P7rVXGZw.review_text: If you're going to have the words, "Chicken and Waffle" in the title, you had better well have some delicious fried chicken.   We order the Fried Chicken dinner with potato salad and biscuits. The fried chicken was super tough dry, and the breading was bland. The potato salad was okay, same with the biscuits. It seemed like everything needed more salt... just more flavor in general.   It was definitely a lot of food for our money, but it just wasn't delicious, and I'm pretty sure I'll end up putting these leftovers on the street.

bnpWy-sYnUaiycuUrlkm-Q.review_text: Good food. Fried chicken and grits are very good. Catering food is good also.

muWo0gd3xEZHpq7Xty1-Dw.review_text: so i'd hate to beat a dead horse, but the golden standard is roscoe's and this isn't close.    comparison-wise, the waffles are similar to roscoe's, but the chicken isn't much to talk about.  in fact, when we were eating there, my friend and i commented that we might be happier grabbing some popeye's and eating 'em with gussies waffles.  overall, its actually not bad at all, but a little overpriced.

LVYKSXXM6KkxznxBJsqc4w.review_text: I think I almost try everything from the menu. - Fried chicken : dried... Not good enough so  i can control myself and eat only 1 piece.  - buttery grits : not good - potatoes : not so good. - red velvet: dried - cornbread: not impressive at all since it is dried.  - mac and cheese: this is the only thing I like here since they put cornbread in my mac and cheese which make it taste pretty good!  If I want some fried chicken, I won't come here. But if I want some mac and cheese. I will think about it

yV1PN-KG7vMKV9xyM4JToQ.review_text: I have never had chicken&waffles before and I decided to take my girl for her birthday today. ** Happy Birthday P **  What a good find indeed...I bought the groupon online. Their chicken was fried to perfection. Not too greasy. It was definately good. OH EM GEE...let me tell you about their waffles. It was so good that I had to order an extra one. I was worried about their syrup because it was so watery but it was gooood.   My only complaint is that I asked for my eggs to be over-medium and they were slightly too well done. I like my yolks runny and it wasn't running. Other than that ...I'm bringing my sistah here!

fayTEUalXbsWP3ybDEu3tA.review_text: Not what I expected. Chicken was alright... nothing special. Powell's chicken, which use to be there...was REALLY good

C1ccV5ednpSJSL5NKibCOw.review_text: 2.5 Stars First strike = 4:30 in the afternoon and no one at the counter to greet guests. People would walk in and wonder WTF? Guy at the counter was spending more time in the back doing who knows what.  Second strike = sad mushy waffles. Both their regular and sweet potato waffles had the texture of pancakes. What is the point then? Just serve me chicken 'n pancakes! You add some syrup and these waffles are just a soggy mess.  Luckily, the batter on their fried chicken is tasty. Yes, I would but it slightly above Popeye's, since the syrup here is also very good with strong sweet potato flavor.

brjIUwpjbr8bdVurUwAC9w.review_text: We were first introduced to Gussie's by our friends and we've loved it ever since! The best chicken and waffles I have ever had! It's a family run restaurant, everything is fresh, hot, and deliciously! The manager recognizes my family every time we go in there! The chicken is juicy and the sweet potatoes waffles will blow your mind! The candied yams are AMAZING along with their homemade cornbread! Parking does really suck but it's good enough to park and walk! They are closed on Monday's though so make sure you don't make the journey all the way there and it be closed! Great place to go though, highly recommend it!

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Just because a place advertises chicken and waffles doesn't mean that they can really do "Chicken and Waffles". I mean I can go to Popeye's, buy some fried chicken without the sides, and then head over to Safeway to get a box of Eggos and a bottle of Aunt Jemima. There ya go... "Chicken and Waffles". Gussie does a little better job than that, although don't knock Popeye's...it isn't that bad an alternative before a deafening concert at the Fillmore. Just don't stand downwind from me, while I do the "Reflex" with Duran Duran. However, on the pantheon of great Chicken and Waffles establishments, Gussie's is really just on the waiting list without a reservation. For those of you who have been lucky enough to try Sylvia's in Harlem (yelp.com/biz/sylvias-res…) or just sauntered across the bay to Tanya Holland's Brown Sugar Kitchen (yelp.com/biz/brown-sugar…) will probably feel the same way I do...a big, resounding meh. I went for the $12.59 Country Cornmeal Waffles with 2-Pieces of Fried Chicken (see my photo) for the express purpose of comparing Gussie's cornmeal waffle with the exceptional one I just had at Brown Sugar Kitchen. Gussie's consisted of two rounds that looked like they came right out of a Proctor-Silex waffle iron bought at Costco. The texture was pure Eggo - chewy and not quite hot enough even with the slab of butter melting on top - and the portion just too much for the amount of carbs on the plate already. The fried chicken was decent, but since I went for a leg and thigh, kinda paltry for a serving. Jamie W. had a similarly lackluster response to his combo, though he was smart enough to go for a breast. We shared a $3.50 side of the Country Fried Okra which came with a red pepper remoulade (see my photo). Again, it tasted like it was machine-cut and dumped in an industrial-sized fryer. I was looking for something more rustic, more Gussie-like, but found something closer to packaged. I have no complaints about the attentive service, although the IHOP vibe made me feel I was part of the suburban sprawl. Gussie's took over where Powell's Place was between closures, so she continues the Southern-fried spirit of the food here. It certainly feels like the right neighborhood for Chicken and Waffles, but I just wish I wanted to come running to Gussie like that awful "Bodyguard" video where Whitney Houston is jogging in the clouds in her toga. FOOD - 3 stars...chicken and waffles, not CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! AMBIANCE - 3 stars...IHOP...where's the six-pack of syrups? SERVICE - 4 stars...very friendly...this part they do right TOTAL - 3 stars...if Brown Sugar Kitchen is closed and you aren't flying to NYC soon for Sylvia's, well, here you go

EM6VabmAsSc4U5f5jyvUgw.review_text: People don't seem to be diggin Gussie's. But I can dig them for sure! Mostly because I have the ideal dream southern meal and here's what's in it: mac n' cheese, collard greens, sweet potatoes (candied yams), cornbread and a meat (either fried chicken or fried catfish).   To date, Gussie's is the first soul food restaurant I've found that serves this exact combination without having to add any extra sides. It's perfect. It's called the "Taste of the South". I think my excitement about the fact that this combo-made-in-heaven existed may have clouded my judgment, but overall, it was a tasty meal and I was super full when I left.   Granted, there were a few strange things that happened at Gussie's. The floors were slippery and our waiter(s) were a little strange and there were frames on the wall with no art in them, but hey, we're judging food here and Gussie's gets that right! Four stars, final answer! I can dig it!

pchaBRxWsblTwdVqj-gPiw.review_text: Southern style dining in SF...who knew? Was in San Fran for business and wanted a change from the Union Square tourist offerings. I remembered that my college classmate opened this restaurant. Make sure you try "A taste of the south" - Mac n cheese, greens, yams, fried chicken. Delish!  Keep doing your thing Michelle!

TlphV6gUvMJbC74pktHVFg.review_text: I have never had Chicken and Waffles anywhere else so I don't have much of a comparison. However, it is sort of hard to beat this magical combination so I do find myself going back from time to time (especially since I live just down the street).  I always get the Uptown Special ($9.49) - one honkin' big chicken breast and one waffle. My favorite thing is the gigantic ball of butter on the waffle. The brown sugar syrup is tasty. The chicken tends to be a bit dry but strangely, I sort of like it that way (my friend keeps telling me to eat the chicken, waffle and syrup all together in one bite but like a two year old, I like my foods separate). The waffle is thin but I also like that well enough. I've been to their two dollar Tuesdays - two big wings for $2 - and that's pretty good too. The seasoning on the chicken is what's really great - nice and crispy and salty. We tried the sweet potato fries and they were crispy on the outside, soft on the outside, though not as sweet-potatoey as Harry's, but still good, and cut in fun mini-waffle shapes.  I've never had collard greens before so thought I would give them a try. Egads. Is this what collard greens taste like? They were horrible, but maybe I just don't like the taste of this particular vegetable.   The service is passable (she brought out two chicken and waffle plates when we only ordered one to share - we sent the second one back; the sweet potato fries didn't arrive till we were done everything else - but this was on a very busy night during a neighborhood event). I don't usually get too bothered by service unless it's REALLY bad, which it is not here.  Yup - Gussie's. I'll be back soon for their strangely addicting chicken.

RsEhRiEMbP9EX4BB770oGA.review_text: We went for lunch and I ordered the "Taste of the South" meal which included a "one-quarter" chicken.  I asked the waitress (who seemed new since she got a blank look on her face) for white meat.  When my meal came, I got a wing and a piece of chicken breast that was about 2" x 2" in diameter.  No kidding.....I ordered one of the most expensive meals on the menu and didn't even get a full chicken breast.   My daughter ordered the "Southern Comfort" , which came with 2 pieces of chicken, she asked for white meat and got a normal size breast with her meal.  My boyfriend ordered the "juicy grilled chicken sandwich" and his meal came 10 minutes after the rest of our meals (there was 6 of us).  I really feel the waitress should have comp'd his meal.  We were all well into our meals by the time his sandwich arrived.  I thought the macaroni and cheese was very good, the collard greens were too sweet, didn't care for them and the candied yams were just ok.   I just still can't get over the size of the breast I got with my meal....at this point, don't think I will go back to this restaurant. I would also like to add they mention "validated parking" on their website so we parked in the garage across the street.  When I asked to have my ticket validated I was told they were not set up yet to validate parking tickets..nice.

swmrfBnaqU0nyJ3pFBfNgQ.review_text: We didn't dine at the restaurant, but they had a food stall at the Fillmore St. Jazz Festival & there was a long line.  Some interesting items - Fried Kool Aid, didn't try it but she told me it was Kool-Aid mixed into batter and fried, sounds like funnel cake to me.   The 6 pieces of wings and drumsticks for $7 was delicous. Moist and tasty with great seasoning and a thin, battered crust.  Puts the nearby Popeye's fried chicken to shame.  If I wasn't so full (yes, I did share w/hubby) from the seafood gumbo I had earlier from another food vendor, I would've eaten more.  Married with a healthy sprinkling of hot sauce (they have it on the table by the napkins), the flavor of the chicken expoded.   We also shared sweet potato fries, $5.  It was cross-cut, lattice style sweet potato chips. Very good but I still prefer regular, white fried potatoes. So, if you're heading to the jazz festival tomorrow, skip the other food vendors and stroll down further pass Popeye's and you'll find the Gussie's chicken & waffles (they didnt' serve waffles) stall or walk further to the restaurant.  Looking forward to visiting the restaurant for some soul food.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 02.12.10 Chicken and waffles have been long in the making.  I had my first taste in Pasadena and have been obsessed ever since.  I was ecstatic when these started popping up in SF. We got in Friday night and sat ourselves.  It took a while for our (very beaten down) menus to arrive.  Then a few more moments for water and drinks.  Then, a very long time for our server to take our order.  And even longer for our waiter to understand our order. The Fillmore Classic: three wings, two waffles, two eggs any style, $12.79.  [yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… [yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L…. The Half Southern Fried Chicken and Two Waffles.  Dark meat.  Sweet Potato Waffle substitute.  $15.59 + $1.50.  [yelp.com/biz_photos/vD1L… Please note the sweet potato waffles were actually on the other plate with the Fillmore Classic. Time elapsed between order taken and order arrival: 40 minutes. I was starving.  I had finished my beer.  I was already thinking about dessert. This is one fancy (check website if you don't believe me) chicken and waffle place I do not plan on going back to. Thank you, Living Social Deal, for $15 off my meal.

H1YXtj4sj2G5VTv0sSrb-Q.review_text: Horrible delivery experience.  Ordered the fried catfish and waffle fries, the fish was soggy, soft, and soaking wet.  The fried chicken that I ordered was rock hard and the collard greens were not delivered with the meal.  If chicken is in your name, I would think that you can cook it well.  If you offer delivery, you should figure out a way that the food is at least almost as good as if people ordered it inside the restaurant.  After notifying the restaurant of the condition the fish and fries were in, the restaurant offered a 15% discount.  What a joke, the food was thrown in the trash and they gave me back $1.50.  Actually almost the whole order was thrown in the trash, since the chicken was so overly cooked.  I was only able to eat the mac and cheese.  Save yourself a lot of money and just go to Popeye's just a few blocked down the street, at least they are able to make juicy chicken and crunchy fries.

vouxbeTYUx5sQg1doXBZ2w.review_text: Waffles were fabulous, service was friendly and attentive, fried chicken was a disappointment. Others have commented "dry" and I concur. I expected chicken more juicy and flavorful. I'd go back again to try other dishes, but the chicken was not what I hoped for from a "chicken and waffles" establishment.

ZQu4Pw0NtxmQUdwT-DUJNQ.review_text: Meh. I gave this restaurant 2 stars because its menu doesn't really give you a lot of options. I tried the sweet tea and had the cup of gumbo with rice. I have definitely tasted better Gumbo indeed. this place is located right on the corner of Eddy and fillmore st., they had a few vegan and vegetarian options too, which included waffles mainly. I tried the macaroni and cheese also which was good. thats about it.

nNl_L448qbPSB15wkvYvQw.review_text: Unfortunately, for a restaurant that has alot of potential, Gussies get an F from me. Tonight marks the 4th time I've been in the establishment waiting to be seated but I'm ignored by the Latino chick in the front of the house who is totally engrossed in texting on her phone. The time before,  whenever she bothered to acknowledge my presence, she actually took my to-go order without writing anything down, eventually forgot my order altogether, and I sat there for almost hour unattended with no food. This employee should be fired. If she's done it to me,  surely she's done it to other customers. How rude!?! Now onto the waitress who routinely walks around walking on the backs of her shoes with dirty clothes on taking orders. She is nice enough,  but it looks as if no effort was put into her dress. The chicken,  while good, is mostly hit or miss, as is much of the other food on the menu. There is so much potential in this  establishment but I'm afraid with fair competition, Gussies will fail miserably.

tRRcuNcY6jaYEo82l1Ojdg.review_text: not bad at all. prices for sides are a little on the steep side, but still not a horrible deal if you + 1 wanna share a plate and add a side of chicken.   portions are way more than enough for even 3 people sharing. but the fry on the chicken is yumm- barely breaded so you still get that fried skin action. moist cornbread mmm. tasty home fries with tasty gravy. OH and the sweeeet tea.. is sweet, like Bojangles sweet mmmhmm!   why 1 star shy of 5: the set up/feng shui of the restaurant was a little distracting plus the overpriciness of some of the items.  definitely satisfies though

gmEiakW1YdDDqOPJGSatIg.review_text: I've been going to this spot for awhile now and still a fan!!! No need to wait for our LA trips to hit up Roscoes Chicken... Gussies is it!!! Must try when you're in the area!!!

xQSNfyCncvdUcdT5CMRtTg.review_text: They are ok, really just ok.  The food is edible, but nothing to write home about.  The waffles are kind of L'Eggo My Eggo like.  The service is good, the restaurant is clean and roomy, and in most other areas of the country they would probably get a higher rating on the food, but here in the Bay Area we are blessed with such Fabulous Food, that you need to be just a little bit better than Meh... to stand out.

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: I love the lobster chowder, it was sooooo good!!! place is a little cold but it takes care of my soul food fix when in the area.

kMw5m9HOTjMTsxplx96Nxg.review_text: Gussie sorry to slam you like this but I was utterly disappointed in my food, I had the breakfast special which consisted of turkey apple sausages, toast, grits  n  eggs. First, the waiter took entirely too long to take our orders it seemed she forgot we where there our food took about 30 mins to come out  Im not exaggerating  and when it did it lacked seasoning, and was luke warm. Umm yuck Gussie Im NO Fan!!!

xsq_bpGYLoPpuzUTDbifDw.review_text: Had the chicken and waffles, which was OK, but definitely not stellar.  I think I could do better at home on both accounts.  The waffles were pretty thin (but maybe that's intentional), and the chicken was somewhat dry and flavorless.  Servers were nice, but food arrival time was quite slow.

Fucuc-tc7pcZozN_bJ9pmQ.review_text: Love it!!! I've been there several times and will go there many more times!!

hherGYlklmE-vyRUmYNPPw.review_text: I cant believe this place gets such low marks, its better than average.  Not the best, and not Roscoes, but where else are you going to get Fried chicken and waffles at 1am in SF?  At Mels Drive In?  Yuck.  Youll find me at Gussies.  Love that they are open late on the weekends, there are so few late night eateries in SF.  Parking can be a bitcxx even at midnight.  This place is really filling and one entree can fill up 2 people really.

sDS2DFgAapj7gJ83P425Fg.review_text: Lunch time!  Groupon time!  Please wait to be seated . . .  sports channel at the express bar just behind the podium, main room to the left of that, natural lighting, old nostalgia photos on the wall, "patio dining" avaiiable, booming take out, yada.  -pleasantly surprised that we walked into Lunch BUFFET $12.50, which precluded the necessity of reading the menu!  But to be fair, we also ordered the waffle & wings, sweet potato waffles!  -and seconds on the 7 course buffet!  -not screamin', but not awful . . . but definitely bountiful!
