Where's the okra?  Where's the 'tater pie?  Where's the hot links?  Long story short, food = A-, service = C-.  It was too casual a pace for lunchtime- We could not stay another 45 minutes for dessert.  It's the Fillmore Street experience.  jason g. has some very salient suggestions.

R1Be4mB4AexoUYtglHtUng.review_text: I ordered the Uptown special (TO-GO ORDER) - this comes with one very large waffle, and one piece of a gigantic chicken breast. The waffle is GREAT. The syrup that they give you is super thin and tastes like sweet potato cinnamon. The chicken breast, on the otherhand, was TOO dry. I was actually really sad because I was looking forward to a nice juicy piece of chicken, and I received everything BUT. Maybe next time, since I work around the area, I'll opt for the smaller pieces of chicken wings instead. I also ordered two pieces of corn bread, and my total came up to about $13. Not too shabby.

tIcgopS0NL_ipW_nlJcrgA.review_text: Very expensive I did online ordering and the only thing that came out great we're the green. I the chicken wings had no seasoning it seemed. I won't waste my money there anymore better off cooking at home for myself .

7x_9ffMEOfhypi9VESSm-w.review_text: I've been waiting for a place in SF. to open a chicken and waffles place, so when I heard about Gussie's I was really excited. I can't complain about the service they were fast and friendly.  The fried chicken livers were my absolute favorite and they come with this yummy thick gravy. The collard greens were on my top list as well, they had a lil tangy twist to them.  I also had ordered the sweet potato waffles with the fried chicken and as I loved the chicken and the taste of the sweet potato, my waffles were not as crunchy as I liked. But I would still come back to get my chicken and waffles fix.

exygIMUwWiMg8HU4L_lNIw.review_text: Good, friendly service, delicious simple foods. I went here with my brother from out of town and a couple of local friends and we decided to go the full on chicken and waffle combo. Mine came with 2 eggs, 4 gigantic fried wings, and a huge waffle. Everything was good. The waffle is very tasty, and the fried chicken is crispy, meaty and not greasy. The service was good and very friendly in a souther hospitality kind of way. For $12 they have a crazy big all you can eat buffet but it doesn't have any waffles on it :)

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Just peachy.  Two smart moves on my first visit. Third smart move was deciding to return.  Known for fried chicken and waffles. Should be known for grilled chicken and peaches.  Former arrived as a sandwich with a taste that leaves you wondering what magic seasoning they used to make it so flavorful. Easily one of the best in recent memory.  Served with a side. Get your waffle fry fix. Or a generous side salad.  Latter is their signature cobbler. Peaches. Brown sugar. Nutmeg. Vanilla. Wonderful.  Next smart move is all yours.

qQa9J0fXA6E-3JSFNsF7TA.review_text: This is quite possibly the closest thing to Roscoes up North. The "uptown special" is the equivalent to the "Carol C special" I always get when in Socal (one chicken breast + one waffle). I was a little disappointed there wasn't a sunrise/sunset variant on the menu but the sweet tea w/ lemon was damn good. The maple syrup was very much on the cinammon side - the verdict is still out on that one. My friend ordered a side of fries expecting a smidgen of tators but instead got a serving and a half of the waffle cut kind (which I absolutely hogged on, oh well). The waffle itself had the same thin and soft/fluffy consistency as Roscoes. But the true test is taking a bite of it naked, ie no butter, no syrup. This is where Roscoes sets itself apart from others. There, I can devour an entire waffle butt booty naked but at Gussies it was a bit bland and definitely needed the assistance of syrup.   They are open til midnight on weekends which was nice since we didn't show up til 11.   All in all, very good but not quite the Big "R". But this beats driving 300 miles that's for sure.

IEIwg63dwF04l-iqmthwAg.review_text: =T i like waffles. i like fried chicken.  maybe i just don't care for fried chicken and waffles? idk...  wouldn't go back.

a4fma5-4yorAgCRCFZbc2g.review_text: My go-to place for southern style fried chicken. You know it's good when the church ladies are around.

3lAWNEEejSRbyh7SqCKBFw.review_text: I loved the fried okra here.  I thought it was excellent.  I also enjoyed the fried grit cakes.  The food was decent. Something about the way they seasoned the red beans I wasn't too big a fan.  The service here needs improvement.  The servers seemed really flustered and honestly there weren't too many people in the place.  If you're headed to Yoshi's and want a bit of southern cooking, it is a convenient spot to stop by.

RPjrY4yITY9sztKgUmmGNA.review_text: -I went on Fat Tuesday, there were lots of people there and they were short on menus. - they gave us small cups, everyone around us had regular sized cups - service was almost non-existent, tables around us had left - waffles were nothing special and chicken was small - waffle fries were undercooked and lacked flavor, it was like eating raw potatoes  would not recommend to anyone.  Now, I normally don't write reviews but I just had to tell people not to go to this place.  Go to HardKnox instead.

ZIzrqi2DMM1MlUE7jf_nWw.review_text: I'd been craving chicken & waffles for the past three weeks since my vacation in LA, and I FINALLY had some last Friday night at Gussie's.  Dare I say, I like the chicken better here than what I had at Roscoe's? Yes. Yes, I do.  I had drum sticks with my waffles, and they were cooked perfectly.  The meat wasn't dry as mentioned in other reviews; my taste buds were oh-so-pleased by how juicy and tasty the chicken was.  A perfect compliment with the waffles.  What was even better was that they had a DJ spinnin, and he was bringin back jams from the 90s before the blatant use of autotune! Oh man...eating chicken & waffles & sweet potato tots + good ass music? I was in sensory heaven!  The staff was helpful and the atmosphere was really laid back and welcoming.  It's a spot I'd definitely hit up again when I head back out to the city.

hr5TAXxc3Tb0OPsDgc37_w.review_text: My friend had never had chicken and waffles before so we decided to try this place on a Sunday afternoon. Ordered the cornmeal and sweet potato waffles with friend chicken. It was pretty good. The cornmeal waffles had a nice crunch to them and the sweet potato waffles were very fluffy and moist. I thought the chicken could have been better.   Our waitress was very attentive. Service was a bit slow, but its a Sunday afternoon, I'd operate at ~50%. The place is clean, simple, and has a nice homey feel to it.

ablP0Bmv3loYwwJaWgqxLw.review_text: I waited 30 minutes for my food and it really wasnt even that busy. My friend had asked the hostess  how much longer for our food and she replied, we had to ask the server. Im not too sure why she couldnt take a second to go in the back and ask for us.  It wasn't until I asked to speak to the owner someone finally came and checked in on me. When my food arrived, my chicken was still bleeding. It was an awful dining experience and I am definitely not coming back.

-BLCnU5DzxeXUOFo9_diNg.review_text: Finally got myself to dine at Gussie's and I was a little unsure of what to expect from this experience. I was pleasantly surprised that it had a very inviting environment and a DJ on-site! I, later, found out that the DJ comes on Fridays for their Friday night buffet from 7pm to 11pm. $10 for the buffet and cocktails; pretty good deal!  Well, we didn't go for the buffet, but my party and I went for their entrees. I went for their Southern Fried Chicken and Grits. Grits are something that I'm getting a liking of and Gussie's does them well! By itself, the grits are creamy and buttery! With the chicken, it's amazing good! It was definitely helpful in balancing the flavors from the crispy chicken. The only thing that I would change in my order is to opt for dark meat versus light. The chicken breast that I got was dry and the grits didn't help with the dryness. Everyone else got something similar with fried chicken and I got a taste of their waffles, which was good especially with the chicken! Sweet and salty goodness!  The overall experience was great and the DJ played some great tunes to keep the mood going! It might have been a little loud, but that would have been an issue if you were to be seated close to the speakers. Other than that, it was fun! The waiting staff was great and kept everyone's glasses full and our server had great recommendations for our drinks! Great place for chicken and waffles in a comfortable and fun environment!

EM8Q9QkTEDQbq9g4bPeBlA.review_text: I was trying to go to Dosa, but didn't realize that place was so fancy, so I just started walking around on Fillmore looking for a place to eat.  I walked to Yoshi's, but they were having some company event that I cold not attend, and when I was just about to go and eat some delicious Panda Express, I saw a sign for chicken and waffles!  My only other chicken and waffle experience is from Rosco's in Oakland.  That place is kinda crazy because it's always really busy, especially at the wee hours of the night.  That is what I was expecting when I came here, but I came and was pleasantly surprised to see it fairly empty.    Had the Fillmore classic.  Chicken + waffles + eggs = YES! :)  The food was really tasty.   They also had catfish nuggets that my friend ordered that looked really good, but I was trying to control myself.  Some negatives about the place is the cleanliness.  The ketchup and hot sauce bottles were a bit nasty around the edges.  It looked like they had been around for decades.  Also, I am pretty sure they forgot one of our orders and it took an extra long time.  Still fun and I would go back.

4BBINgdDn_XLAjJp_gCnnA.review_text: If you are looking for great chicken & waffles.. this is not the place. The waffles are bleh, I've had way better. The chicken is just o.k., far from the best fried chicken I've had. If you want grub in a rush then it'll do, but don't expect much.  btw their delivery sucks. ordered twice and they always forget the damn syrup. how can you serve waffles or eat them w/o syrup?! ridiculous.

OGYkBU5yil7uyLleDv2MNw.review_text: This is a great place to grub!!! We ordered the sweet potato waffles & the taste of the south plate & we shared.  The taste of the south came with fried chicken, corn bread, mac n' cheese, greens & yams. You can't be dainty with fried chicken, you need to use your fingers & most importantly enjoy...And that we did!!! The chicken was scrumptious and the sweet potato waffles were so delicious!!!  The food was AWESOME & the service was great!!! Our waiter was on point and we had a great experience. I can't wait to return for the buffet they have during the week!!!

QbGc-6M77thaayr8WnAkGg.review_text: I ordered delivery and had never ordered from here before..... what a happy surprise! The waffles are beautiful and perfect, the chicken tenders were perfectly battered and seasoned and juicy and in no way badly fried, Really light. Whenever I decide to order take out my mind will definitely be wondering over to Gussie;s....

20MYzKfiZDCzDsL7vAVALg.review_text: Went on a beautiful Sunday morning with friends before going to a Giants game. Chicken and waffles are always a crowd favorite right?!   Well, yess... the chicken was much better than I had anticipated, but also much larger. We were so amazed at how large one piece of fried chicken could be! Plus for being tasty!   We all ordered different items off the chicken and waffle menu - Downtown Special, Fillmore, Southern Comfort... everyone was happy with their choices. The waffle is a bit different though. Very thin and well, not as satisfying. And the maple syrup is a bit different too. Very watery and well, weird.   Service was ok. It took a while to get seated and took a while to have our orders taken and served. But a football game was on in the "waiting area" that we were somewhat able to see from our seats in the dining area.   All in all, very filling and a nice change from eating at Merritt Bakery in Oakland.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: OMG, I've never had chicken and waffles together before but now I can't believe I didn't.    The chicken was amazing- the perfect amount of crispness, and perfect amount of juiciness! Paired up with the perfect sized waffle that was perfectly cooked and so good it almost didn't even need any syrup other than the fact that I just love syrup.............The portions were a good size and I was full halfway but I kept on eating, because it was too good to stop really.  In addition, the grits were good, as were the fried catfish!!!  And the soju cocktail shots were really quite flavorful, but be careful as a few of those and you won't be able to drive home!   Service is great, the staff is super friendly and nice, and even on a midweek evening, the place is busy, despite the current economy which tells you something especially about a new restaurant.

_YCi6y4vd4AkAPzxQM32VQ.review_text: Decided I wanted to try chicken and waffles.  Since I am in SF every other Saturday, I chose Gussies.  I ordered the Uptown Special as I prefer breast meat over dark meat when eating fried chicken.  First off, the chicken: big piece of breast meat fried to perfection, lightly breaded and juicy. Perfect!! The waffle: just ok. Not as fluffy as I expected it to be.  I have a recipe for sourdough waffles that is the most amazing, so maybe I am a bit biased there.  But then there is the syrup, the brown sugar syrup, that brings it all together.  I used the syrup on the chicken and the waffle.  The syrup is definitely addictive.  Had a good strawberry lemonade to wash it all down.  Reasonable priced too, for under $10, perfect meal for breakfast or lunch. First time I went was in April, been there 3-4 times since.  Always get the same thing, so I can't comment on other parts of the menu. But if you are seeking chicken and waffles, come here. You will be happy.  Metered is parking always available near bye.  So no excuse not to try this place.

eeiglYpiISW0VtFSVXDDdg.review_text: Got a groupon for this place and OMG it was so good. I loved the waffles!! I'm not so much of a chicken fan, but they were so good-better than popeyes!! Definitely coming back again!

gTDp5QNtHKeAE5LcCs2zFg.review_text: Gussies is authentic. Juicy and crunchy chicken. A large selection of waffles. Some of the best biscuits and gravy around. All very reasonably priced. Definitely a must if your in the area. The cornbread could use some butter or something to moisten them but the flavor is spot on. The mac and cheese is also flavored perfectly, although I'm used to a bit more al dente and crunchy cheese. Thats not enough to have an issue.   The staff is quick and very nice and accommodating.   Overall: this is a great outfit. Well worth your appetite

UagwGNmjQNWCQWFYSj6XUw.review_text: Came here one weekend with some friends after strolling thru the local farmers market.. my friend had a Groupon. I'm not a huge fan of Chicken and Waffles, unlike my other friend who is. Service and staff were great, nice and accommodating.  Food was good,, however I think I would prefer Hard Knox though..

k4qXvZleJhY14JhsOQANjg.review_text: Service is slow but the food is amazing.  Wait staff is super friendly and attentive.  They had to move us to a different table but offered us free dessert to make up for it.  Overall a great experience and I'll be back.

cCTUFH4DKPuSuFhbIIcbzw.review_text: i dont remember what else I got, or the service, or anything else for that matter.. but the RED VELVET WAFFLES were SO F'in GOOD! Ill be back justtt for that! =)  (actually i do remember that for special occasions, such as mothers day, they have a buffet.. It sounded really good and I wanted to come back and try it)

UXGlno5B0H05ZhUU3g9ZAA.review_text: Worst food I've had in a while. Went with my boyfriend on a Friday night and we were starving. The mac n' cheese was ok, and the sweet potato waffles were tasty (but soggy, which is common/normal?) The greens were nasty and sweet, both types of gravy were pretty gross and the white was totally broken too (I wouldn't have cared if it tasted any good!) The chicken I made sure to order dark meat- and I have to say, it takes I don't know what kind of @$$hole to overcook dark meat so bad that it's dryer than gilf pussy. That aside, the coating wasn't very good in itself either. The fried okra was pretty tasty but my bf said it was overcooked/stringy and the fried grits weren't too bad either but the red beans and rice were horrilbe- tasted almost like canned chili with some rice. I don't know why this place still exists really.

-akUbNjW7KlixhIgZOAu8Q.review_text: Gussies is wonderful.  Gussies is in the Fillmore.  Since the change in culture it is called NOPA or even the Western Addition, but to us who grew up there it is still the MO. So any way back to Gussies.  I love Soul Food it is my culture.  I know how to cook it and I know what it should taste like.  Gussies is one of the best Soul Food restaurants available.  Remember Gators in San Mateo well Gussies is just as good but it is the other end of the Soul Food spectrum.  Gators was upscale, a twist on the traditional.  Gussies is not a twist, it is old fashioned soul food at its' best.    I have been there three times in the last month and it has not disappointed.  I have enjoyed all most everything.  The only thing I did not care for were the biscuits.  I like a lighter fluffier biscuit.  Gussies biscuits are dense.  They only do chicken and fish.  I am not a fried chicken fan but I tried it and it was good.  The fish is fried to perfection and oh yeah the portions are good.  I had enough food to ask for a take home box each time.   Grits, eggs, fried fish, and a waffle, what more can you ask for.   The decor is nice.  I like the music and the soft colors on the walls.  I believe a bathroom is an indicator of cleanliness.  Gussies bathrooms are clean.  However they need to put the plunger in a case made for plungers and put a small garbage can by the door.  Most people don't touch doorknobs and it would be nice to have somewhere to throw the tissue.

6ODieNljbP7Z-EZG45Tefg.review_text: WHERE IS MY PLATE???   It's a buffet style dining but you have to ask and wait for your new plates...so technically, what is this....you just wait for us to get full and then give us the plates....sigh.  there are limited selections in the buffet and the lights are broken so you can't even see what you are picking up until it is on your plate.   I mean, their chicken was descent, though I can't tell the difference from KFC....they served lukewarm cornbread and waffles.  Are they trying to go out of business?  It's kinda working!  If it wasn't for my buddy who goes here religiously (and brings people to eat here...or should I say forces people to eat here), this place would be long gone.    I always thought a good dining was all about good food.  But today, i realized after waiting 20min to even get a plate to grab a chicken that wasn't even that good, a good dining is all about a good company.  I enjoyed this lunch because I had a fun time with the people I ate with.  Gussie's, this dining experience was so bad that I actually didn't want to tip for once.  That rarely happens (unlike a good friend I have)...

O5UWPHIktSfDlEkME18vYQ.review_text: Went here twice. The first time, I ordered waffles and chicken. I did not understand the sweet and savory combo, but liked the experience. I didn't like their candied yams, it tasted like warm and mushy pumpkins with lots of cinnamon.Our waitress was friendly though.  Second time: I also ordered waffles and chicken. This time I was careful to avoid any syrup on my chicken. I liked the food the second time. However, the service was spotty. It felt rushed to take orders and nonexistent after that. Granted, they had a full house so that's understandable.   Note: I believe the southern fried chicken to be more dry than the other style. Or was it just that particular day?

3_kRJZgAwtgK2UcVI19RUA.review_text: Don't know if it's new management or what but they've gotten a lot better about the orders being correct. Haven't had to contact them for a refund on a missing item or a wrong item in a while. Glad they got it together, because their food is really good!

o9U_UvLKEbTJDaS4zNmfuA.review_text: Sweet potato waffle was very good.  A little sweet, but that was expected.  Fried okra just ok and not seasoned well.  I didn't care for the red pepper remoulade that comes with the okra... not much taste/flavor.  Nothing hot sauce won't fix.  I also didn't think the fried chicken was that good.  They must be re-using the oil too much.  Plus, it wasn't well seasoned.  My family is from the south... I grew up on southern food, especially fried chicken so I was a bit disappointed.  I didn't try the sides.  Prices were too high for the food (almost $10 for a thigh and 1 waffle?), but maybe that's because I know how to cook this type of food for $3 a dish.  Drinks were priced well for San Francisco so extra star for that.  I had to wait a while to get seated.  Servers were all nice though.

m7Jqb30k-MOQi7aJOT68MA.review_text: Thanks to this place - I'm totally off my love of chicken and waffles for awhile.  We were sitting waiting for our food...the husband pointed something out and we all followed his gaze.  Scurrying across the floor was - you guessed it - a furry little mouse.  When my husband alerted two of the waitstaff, they BOTH seemed nonchalant and not at all surprised. A piece of lint on the glass? I can handle that.  A mouse in the house?  Unacceptable.

ofZzcj1oiHS64f7jbGCXxQ.review_text: Not sure if this place is actually closed or not, but my company just catered lunch from here..  I've definitely had much much better chicken and waffles. I'm not sure if it's just because our food was catered, but it was pretty disappointing.  ====================  -FRIED CHICKEN - 2/5 Honestly, I think KFC's fried chicken is better than Gussie's. Their chicken had too much batter and was overly fried. The inside was okay, but the outside was more chewy than crispy.  -WAFFLES - 1/5 Um.. these were just plain sad. I've never had waffles that were so thin, soft and flimsy. And completely tasteless.  -MAC AND CHEESE - 2.5/5 Just okay, nothing special.  -HONEY CORNBREAD - 4.5/5 Pretty much the only saving grace. These were SO GOOD. Super moist and sweet. Definitely really buttery but I couldn't stop eating them!  -SWEET POTATO TOTS - 3/5 I love sweet potato tots, but these were rather disappointing. They tasted fine, but they were really soft. No crunch or crispness to the outside at all. Still okay though.  -COUNTRY FRIED OKRA - 1.5/5 Like the sweet potato tots, these had no crispness. Basically just soft okra coated in a soft, greasy layer of batter.

p8TncisH43gY1jNcj_9Rtg.review_text: I want it to be better.  The Wait was weird.  The service was half mediocre bordering on impolite from one server, to actually quite pleasant from another server that wasn't even for our table.  I was pleased by the flavor of the waffles, but they came out cool after a very long wait, the flavors of the syrup and other ingredients just didn't hold up to my hopes.  collard greens, and mac 'n cheese were weird.  I've lived where chicken and waffles were fresh, delicious, and hot.  I might go back to try it again because maybe it was a fluke.  I hope so.

BoNbRffFMN4YDtDGVJIvuw.review_text: Came here to redeem a Groupon. Flashback Friday Buffet is to die for and the waffles put eggos to shame. The place isn't too shabby and is quite clean and the staff is lively and willing to help out. My pal and I waited to be seated for 20 minutes, but well worth the wait. Also, parties of 6 are to reserved in advance.

bLLpAJ5ia_Bq170E0jZdOQ.review_text: Gussie's food is quite ok and tasty. I ordered the fried catfish with Okra and only was slightly disappointed with the bland seasoning.  However, the yams were off the hook and quite yummy.   Gussie's has a reputation for slow service, and although I didn't see that first hand, the place does have the "air' of slowness in the kitchen. lol   As a matter of fact, don't get your heart set on what you see on the menu. Often we were told the by the waitstaff that certain items on the menu were not available.   We were completely blindsided when we ordered the RED VELVET cake for dessert and were told it was not avaiable becausethe cook JUST put the cake into the oven!?!?!?   WTF?!?!?   That's like going to Dreyers Ice Cream in the middle of the day and having them tell you they don't have any ice cream because they just started making it. LOL

ttauTXuRemnMf1SDhMgQZQ.review_text: I had a groupon for Gussie's Chicken and Waffles.  Initially, I wanted the buffet because how can you go wrong with AYCE?  So we walked in and decided to check out the buffet. First of all, it was around 1:30-2pm in the afternoon and the lighting was poor. We could barely see the food in the buffet, it was dark. I couldn't tell what it was. We just had to seat ourselves and once we were seated, someone came back with our menus. We decided not to do the buffet.  We just ordered off the menu. We wanted to try the red velvet waffles and fried chicken, so your typical chicken and waffles but instead of the simple plain waffles, we asked for red velvet waffles! You can do a chicken and waffle, and substitute red velvet waffles instead for a little extra charge. We also wanted to try some sides, so we tried the mac and cheese, collard greens, smothered potatoes, and beans and rice. We also had a side of honey corn bread.   The chicken and waffles came, and we asked for a side of syrup. They charge you extra for maple syrup, but we just got brown sugar syrup. It's still delicious and sweet! I really LOVE the cream cheese butter, it's so good. It reminds me of cream cheese frosting but obviously, not as fluffy as frosting. I love the flavor. When you smothered the waffle in the butter, it's good! However, the red velvet flavor in the waffle was very subtle and not obvious. I think the fried chicken was crispy and not too salty or anything. It was good.  Out of all the sides, I really like the collard greens and mac and cheese. The honey corn bread was so good. Whenever you put honey on corn bread, it melts in your mouth - full of yummy flavors. I wasn't a big fan of the smothered potatoes, it was just gravy and potatoes, and it seemed bleh to me.   One thing that stood out to me about this place was the appearance on the outside. It looked a LOT nicer than I expected for some reason, I thought it'll be more of a hole in the wall. It looks nice and professional outside, it doesn't look like a mom and pop shop.

lfZkl13MIK06LmkeFkdedw.review_text: A group of us converged on Gussie's Chicken & Waffles on Friday night and were fairly pleased with our meal.    First of all, the service was VERY attentive and friendly.  Three of us ordered chicken and waffles, and he gave us extra cornbread since there would be a wait for the waffles.   Two of us ordered the sweet potato waffles with fried chicken.  The sweet potato waffles were soft, but I think this is normal due to the batter.  They tasted amazing, spiced and sweetened just right.  The fried chicken was juicy, with a light crispy skin on the outside. A little of the brown sugar syrup went a long way.    Since we came in with a Groupon, we decided to spend some extra $ and get dessert.  The dessert is why they don't get 5 stars.  We ordered the peach cobbler, described in the menu as "baked in its own skillet."  It was the most expensive item on the dessert list, and had the most exciting description, so you can imagine expectations were running high.  When we got it, though, it was only somewhat warm, and the peaches tasted like canned peaches (with the super sweet/metallic taste).  We also ordered the banana pudding, which was a clear winner over the peach cobbler.  I'd probably return again, after resting my arteries.

w3HfQxcj_XkubBpmml71xA.review_text: I came here for lunch with my sister because she had a groupon deal and we both share a love for chicken and waffles. I had the country cornmeal waffles. My sister ordered the red velvet waffles and a drumstick + a side of mac and cheese. We also ordered a vanilla milkshake to split. 10 minutes after I ordered the waitress comes out and asked if I wanted the three piece wing or the two piece leg and thigh.   After half an hour of waiting .. we still had no food and no shake. We figured if we have no food at least give us our shake .. but nope .. we got nothing. When the waitress checked in on us to tell us that our food will be out any minute, we asked about our shake. She said she thought we got it .. .. so she went to check. Minutes later the waitress said they were having problems with our waffles and that she has her milkshake expert whipping up our drinks.   When our food finally arrives ...  it was my sister's one drumstick and our tiny mac and cheese.  After we literally killed the chicken and side the rest of our food gets here. Now it wasn't all bad .. the mac and cheese was good .. but a tad too oily. My waffles were okay, nothing to rave about. The chicken was the same, decent. By this time we've been here for an hour .. I wish I was joking. My sister's red velvet waffles were yummy. We got our shakes after we finished eating.   That was seriously unacceptable .. they tried to compensate by making us two vanilla shakes instead of one to split. By this time we were already full, tired of waiting/cranky, and my sister was late for work.   A quick food recap. The red velvet waffles were good. Country cornmeal waffles and chicken were okay. Mac and cheese side was small, oily, but good. The vanilla milkshake was good but this meal was not worth the wait.

ctU-R89nKL2-A8ze9I-6AA.review_text: So um, this place is literally 50 yards from my house. I've even been on the roof of this joint drinking beer since it is just about built into The Fillmore Center. Strangely enough, I don't go there that often. It's not a bad place or anything. The staff is friendly, one time they messed up my order I called them on it and they gave me the sandwich I wanted plus let me keep the messed up one for free (FYI, it did not reheat well). The prices are a tad high for what they serve, but the portions make up for it. For me the kicker is that  it seems as though they have selective hearing on somethings; namely whenever I want cheese on something, I will get charged for cheese but I won't get cheese. They have a cool outdoor section and also space for live music. So yeah, if you love chicken, waffles, or chicken & waffles check this place out.

UdGows31OnUBz_7yDlvNJA.review_text: My wife and I (hey, Laura S.!) find ourselves at Gussie's about once a month. It's one of our go-to places for a reliable meal.  Reliable in that it's always delicious. Reliable in that the service is always attentive and friendly. Reliable in that we always leave with a smile on our faces.  I never waver from the chicken and waffles. The chicken is not over seasoned and I'm not sure what people mean when they say it's dry. I've had countless drumsticks and they are always piping hot and juicy. The chicken is done in a classic southern style. No muss. No fuss. No secret ingredients. Crispy on the outside, moist and delicious on the inside. Gussie's lets the chicken speak for itself.  The waffle is a thinner, classic style. I'm pretty sure they're delicious but honestly, they only last about 20 seconds on my plate before they're gone. That must mean something.  My wife has favored the chowder recently and tells me it's awesome. I believe she also had an oxtail special one time that was equally awesome. Just pointing out that no matter what you order, you will be getting something good.  We wandered in here for dinner for the first time this past Friday, where a DJ was spinnin' bits with some classic soul tunes mixed with modern beats. Not usually my style but it fits at Gussies. Had a great time and will make a point to go back for dinner on the weekends more often.  I also enjoy going here for Sunday lunch after everyone gets out of church. Love seeing the 80 year old men dressed in their best suits and hats, wolfing down some chicken. Classic!

dmAdqsoBuiRG0zKYLbrGCg.review_text: I live in the neighborhood & really, really wanted to love this place.  With farmerbrown, Little Skillet, Front Porch & other awesome fried chicken contenders in town, the SF bar is set pretty high. Unfortunately, the fried chicken & waffles at Gussie's didn't even come close.  We ordered the fried catfish & okra appetizers to start. The okra was decent, the catfish somewhat dry and flavorless. We were a large group of 7 so between us ordered a wide range of entrees from the daily special to the 1/2 chicken to the huge Taste of the South.  I ordered the chicken drumstick with honey cornbread and shared my husband's 1/2 chicken with sweet potato waffles and a side of mac 'n' cheese.   The chicken was dry, the waffles thin and floppy, the mac 'n' cheese smothered with cheese but otherwise unremarkable. What really stood out was the honey cornbread - absolutely delicious and full of rich flavors.  For dessert the table tried the peach cobbler, red velvet cake, banana pudding and pecan pie. The red velvet cake was dry; the banana pudding didn't have enough truly ripe bananas in it & the cake tasted as if it hadn't soaked in the pudding long enough; and the pecan pie was cloyingly sweet. The only winner was the peach cobbler, fresh from the oven and served in its own skillet. Delicious!  The ambiance is somewhat like a Denny's - bright and loud. Our waiter seemed new and unfamiliar with the menu options, like when I inquired about gravy options and he never got back to me. Initially, he came to the table to check on us & interact, but as the restaurant got busier we didn't see much of him at all.   The food came out in a normal amount of time, but there were two orders at our table of 7 that had chicken mix-ups, with the server (or kitchen staff?) unable to differentiate between white and dark meat. One plate had to be sent back twice before they got it right.  All in all, this restaurant was a 2.8 for me. We went there as part of our monthly Supper Club. It seems more suited to happily buzzed & ravenous people getting out of Yoshi shows or clubs rather than people looking for a really great dining experience.  We did see former SF Mayor Willie Brown with yet another lovely young lady on his arm as we were seated last night. Too bad the food wasn't as interesting as the buzz around him.   With so many amazing fried chicken options in the city, I won't be back.

F01W6lQHtdoUwBVSaoZtFw.review_text: So let me begin by saying I am not an expert on chicken and waffles, but I do eat a lot of chicken and I can tell a good waffle from a bad one.  The food here is not why they received 1 star, well kind of.  I ordered off grub hub and recieved a phone call and hour and half later telling me they were behind and that they were throwing in a free peach cobbler.  I was annoyed but quickly got over it when being told about the pie.  After waiting another 45 minutes I called the restuarant and no one picked up, I called again and still nothing.  Finally the food came and the delivery girl had the nerve to ask me "wheres my tip? Its says its gonna be in cash."  Are you serious!!  Two and half hours late.  The funny thing was that I had planned on giving a tip regardless, but the rudeness and unprofessionalism I recieved from the restaurant was awful.  Oh yes, and everything was ice cold and NO PIE!  I will never go back to say the least.

s_4K91_NDQEB6dGwhAiRqA.review_text: My glass was never empty.  I had heard about their grand opening some time ago, and finally had a chance to visit.  The location was tucked away from the tourist stricken areas of SF, which is always good. The decor has a contemporary feel that is much nicer than the other Soul Food joints I've been to.  It was a Saturday afternoon; the wait for the 5 of us was about 15minutes. Our server, Terence, was a nice guy who made sure our drinks were never empty.  I ordered the "Taste of the South." My goodness, the portions were HUGE. The chicken was great, lightly breaded and fresh. The candied yams were fantastic; I could have ordered a plate of those and would have been a happy camper. The cornbread was light and fluffy, the perfect addition. The mac n' cheese was just okay, nothing special. The collard greens, on the other hand, were responsible for the loss of stars; they were over the top salty. I usually clean my plate, even with portions that big, but I couldn't finish the greens.  I also had a bite of their "Signature Sweet Potato Waffles," a plate of those and a side of their candied yams, and I would be set. I'll be back just for that.  Tip: Try to come with a party of 4 or less. They only have a few tables for parties of 5 and above. We would have been sat almost immediately if we had one less.

dasxQe5zVeI-mX09OWMyTQ.review_text: I have been anticipating the opening of Gussies since I found out about it when I was 8 months pregnant and craving fried chicken!  Unfortunately for me they did not open until I was 1 month post pardum and needing to be on a diet but oh well, I went anyway!   I went with my girlfriends and the first thing we wanted was alcohol, but they had their liquor license suspended which was a major bummer..but I know they are new so shit happens.  The food made up for it.  I got the uptown special which was fried breasts with a waffle but if I ever go back I'm getting the sweet potato waffles which are SO yummy!  Grits were good, I could feel myself getting fatter as I ate them.  Cornbread was a little dry so pass on that.  Then we got the banana pudding for dessert which was so freaking good!  I really do have a thing for bananas though.   So all in all I would say this place is pretty good.  Next time I go they better have their liquor license though!  I think that food would taste even better drunk!

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: I was on my way home one night and noticed Gussie's was still open. The hostess was really friendly and offered a warm greeting. I ordered  to go a side of chicken livers and a side order of fried chicken leg and thigh. The wait was quick. I had my brown bag and I was on my way. The chicken was delicious and juicy. The spice and seasoning was mouthwatering. The chicken livers were ok. About half of the order was slightly overcooked. The fried onions tasted fantastic. It was a fried food fantasy come true.

r8zX05SrYRrUiy3nawcUwA.review_text: Terrible service! We waited over an hour at the "bar" and they completely forgot about us. The food was not good! It's overpriced & not good, so not worth the $70 bill.

vp3IbIA8wVTmW1wVEtnyjw.review_text: My last review was a 1 star in 2009.  I have to upgrade to 4 stars since my last two visits have been consistently good.  I don't know if they changed management, hired Tabitha from BRAVO's "Tabitha Takes Over" or what, but the food is real southern style yummy comfort food.  The service is still super slow - but on my last two visits the staff was doing a great job of having a good time and smiling.  A smile is easy and free and it can make even a mediocre salad slightly good.     So the food is a 5 star but the service is about a 3.  I guess that makes Gussie's a solid 4 stars. I'll keep going back. But not too often or I'll have to buy new jeans.  If the wait for food, beverages, check, etc. wasn't delayed, I'd rate these guys 5 stars.

my36mJlxoSwNoA_rgLkLAQ.review_text: Wanted to eat Chicken and Waffles for Mother's Day..came in and the lady said there was no where to sit except the bar. And the only thing you could order is the Mother's Day Buffet which was $33. Are you kidding? That's seafood buffet in Vegas style! And you want my kid to sit at a bar? No thanks..taking it to Hard Knocks!

yB_XGeC5v74Y7x507ep8xw.review_text: I wanted to like this place, especially since it's less than a block away from me. But, let's be honest here. Wait is terribly long even if you're the only customers eating there - it's really ridiculous. I've tried their waffle, chicken, corn bread and mash potatoes. The only things that I liked was the corn bread and potatoes. The chicken was over cooked, dry and tasteless (well, you'll taste something if you douse it with lots of hot sauce... it'll taste like hot sauce). It had no seasoning that you can taste of. I've grown up eating real soul food (goulash, turkey neck, gumbo, etc.) which includes the best fried chicken ever, but this is such a sad, depressing place and doesn't deserve to even be considered to be placed under soul food. It really surprises me when I see people with 4 or 5 stars for this establishment. I've come here only once and that was my last visit. I'd rather walk 4 blocks to KFC (spicy dark meat please!), in the rain and hail if I'm craving fried chicken than cross the street to Gussie's. They're pretty much an epic FAIL.   Come here if you want bad service, have 3 hours to kill and love disappointing fried chicken.

rLmjHupXGsDfDsD6ErwOVg.review_text: I've heard of Gussies but never been until a friend invited us to come eat dinner there.  I was impressed - loved it!  The chicken was better than 1300 in my opinion and the waffles were so delish, not too sweet, went perfectly with the chicken.  Since that first visit I've been back a few times.  Last time I went, we came on Flashback Fridays where they have the $10 buffett and a DJ!    From reading fellow Yelpers review Gussies, I learned I need to be eating my chicken with the waffle so I can't wait to go back and try it!  Tip for everyone - the apartments across the street have parking!  No more trying to squeeze your car between Un-Safeway and the police station!

3VGsxY6-3tjnul_bIFgjvA.review_text: went here with my better half and two other couples on a Sunday morning.  out of five people there were 4 different plates and everyone of us loved each of our plates. the grits are incredible, the black beans and rice is great and yes the fried chicken excellent as well.  i had the catfish which i thought was cooked perfect and breaded just as i like it.  the service was not the fastest but on a Sunday morning who the hell cares. our server was super sweet and got our order perfect her busboys were super nice as well.  oh and bring your appetite because the portions are huge.

pc64IPjU7gcD81HstUHWMg.review_text: Simply the ONLY place to eat grits in San Francisco. And ditto for fried chicken livers! DEElicious!  Our regular Tuesday Koffee Klatch has had a get-together here twice. We start when they are barely opening for the day, and hang out drinking gallons of hot cofffee (the wait staff brings a carafe!) for a couple of hours, and have tried several things on the menu. The staff is cordial. The coffee's hot.   As in any restaurant, the regionalism of the chef's understanding affects the interpretation of its menu. So, not my favorite cornbread, and I would skip the home fries and the breakfast gravy. But the fried chicken is wonderful, however it is written on the menu!

oXazw_LinJFjw52au0-Q2A.review_text: Went here for dinner and order the southern plate. This food was delicious the yams were sweet, the greens were flavored, Mac and cheese was cheesy and the chicken was seasoned to perfection. Parking lot is 24 hours not a lot of people on the night I went service was awesome and friendly

6NSTfqxjM6EYNnDvsZGWlw.review_text: Okay, I have been to Gussies a half dozen times and always eat there when we are in town but I always order the same thing - Sweet Potato Waffle with sweet potato syrup and fried chicken strips.  Truthfully, the chicken strips at Chicken and Waffles in Oakland are probably a little better but that waffle!    My dining companions have always been happy with their various offerings as well: fried chicken, catfish, greens, mac n cheez...

Wh2Y4k8MPPvBAGoRu4WCNw.review_text: From the outside, you can see there's a small patio area in front for outdoor seating. The inside is very clean and modern. I liked the look of this place. We seated ourselves in a booth and a server brought us menus right away. He said there was a buffet and pointed towards the buffet. At first I didn't understand what he said but after we ordered and saw other people getting food from the buffet, we realized what he meant. I don't know how much the buffet cost but the menu says on Fridays it's $10. We were there on a Tuesday, however. Regardless, the servers were all very smiley and attentive. They checked on us often.   This is what we ordered: Uptown Special (1 chicken breast & 1 waffle) $9.29 Fried Catfish Nuggets $7.79 Macaroni and Cheese (side) $4.29  I didn't particularly like my food. The baked mac n cheese tasted like it has been sitting there for a while. Perhaps it was scooped from the buffet. The layer of cheese on top was really dry. The chicken was fine. My friend had the catfish nuggets and basically, he's had better. Seemed like there was too much batter on them. So the food was okay and for 50% off (via Scout Mob), it was really worth it.   If I were to come back, I think I'd do the buffet because that's what everyone else seemed to be doing.

S1rK27NJ2T8_PnlRS_DY_Q.review_text: OH MY GOD -- YOU HAVE TO GET THE FRIED OKRA!  This is the real sh*t! They know southern cooking. I haven't had fried okra this good since my grandmother cooked it (probably in bacon grease).   Are you eating a hamburger now while you read this? Are you eating a burrito? DROP THEM! POSTHASTE! Go get some fried okra at Gussie's! If you've never had okra, or only had it picked or boiled, you need to forget that and start over with it fried.   RUN! RUN TO THE OKRA!   You won't be sorry!

9X44kGYXpIdG0Lcm9h6bXw.review_text: hands down the best tasting candy yams in the bay area...everett + jones is a close second! not sure why this place is ranked around a 3.5 rating, but it deserves higher!!  check out the red velvet waffles. its on their secret menu!! the taste is similar to cheesecake factory's red velvet cheesecake!

17EFNxfzao_GkLtiuQkKOQ.review_text: OMG their sweet potato waffle is bomb.com !

OpfoLsKst7_CC7rt1Vz-GQ.review_text: I have no idea how anyone would give this place 5 stars. The one given is solely for the fact I saw a friend I haven't seen in years.   Straight to it, they need more staff the wait for tables (not crowded) ,water and to order are all bad the hostess is the initial waitress and refills water.  My table was leaning, no stars for decor. There was an attempt to make me pay an extra $2.for the specialty when clear as day on the menu they're the same price, not having it! So I have one sweet potato waffle (flavor not bad but the fact that it was too thin and rubbery blew it, not too mention my waffle wasn't its full size guess they didn't have enough mix to fill the maker) a chicken thigh( that was fried like they were making a second attempt at killing the chicken was pretty flavorless). So we ordered the sides sampler just to see what they like, they blacked eyed peas where pretty tasty not the best but compared to the other three at least it had flavor. The cornbread was yummy. The collard greens, yams, and macaroni and cheese all yuck!   As if that wasn't bad enough their closing waiter etiquette was just all wrong I'm too embarrassed for him to even give the particulars. So at the end of the day I will NEVER go back and advise you not to make this one of your top 100 options!

gz1aizk0jCyzBq5t9RXXMg.review_text: Came on a Saturday night. I love me some soul food, and have eaten a lot of it in the south.  Got the Tour of the South plate and added a waffle on the side. Which I saw on the bill later, was a $5 per waffle. If this was a thick, golden, delicious waffle, I wouldn't mind, but these waffles were small, limp, and tasteless.  Chicken--okay Yams--Amazing Mac and Cheese--Meh Cornbread--Amazing Waffle--Yuck  The server was very attentive and helped my husband and I decide which plate would be best for us considering the amount of portions and what we wanted. I really appreciated that.

C7yNwMR__q6IQQ0yJ7Nj9g.review_text: I ordered the Two's Company (homefries, chicken wings, 2 eggs, biscuit) My boyfriend ordered the Downtown special (One thigh, one waffle)  I was really hungry for breakfast & decided to come here. First of all, the area reminds me of L.A. I hadn't been in this area before so it was a little new.  The inside of the place was AWESOME! Very family/group/couple friendly...even if you want to eat by yourself..It looks very elegant inside.  Now on to the food...  My plate: I liked it! The wings were great! The homefries tasted better with ketchup which was slightly disappointing (I think they were missing a lil more salt?) The eggs were a little dry as well as the biscuit...but honestly, I came out pretty satisfied. The plate was around $8 for all of this. My bf's plate: He said he was disappointed with the syrup and he prefers Auntie April's waffles and for a $9 dollar plate, he was not full.   So in conclusion, I would regularly give them a 3/5, but because the place was so nice and the customer service was fast & super sweet...I gave them a 4/5.

hI9NMVs2hUhzzL7Ik45XRw.review_text: Took advantage of a special they had on Groupon for this place not too long ago. Based on the reviews I was fairly iffy, but considering the deal was very good and I'm a big soul food fan I gave it a try!   Food:  Pleasantly surprised.  The chicken was very tasty and tender along with the waffles.  I had the regular buttermilk while my friend tried the sweet potato and we were both pleased!  Servings were a good size and my tummy was not disappointed.  In comparison to Hard Knox or the infamous Roscoes, I'd say Gussie's holds it own.  I'd go back.    Setting:  The restaurant was a good size and we were seated right away.  I don't think anything in particular stands out in terms of ambiance or country setting, but the restaurant in general was all in all ok.    Service: Both times I had great friendly service along with quick food turnaround.  Both of our servers were quite helpful and pleasant.    All in All:  I would go back, but considering the comfort food status, not something I could eat every week lol

MQL--4J9A4gQ-7lkwxAfcA.review_text: Usually a place with service this bad has great food that makes it totally worth it. Food was okay but not great. Our waiter was very polite, but some of our food never made it out and we were brought the wrong check twice. Chicken was dry, grits were rubbery. Corn bread, mac and cheese, and waffles were good. Glad I tried it, but as desperate as I am for a taste of the South, I won't be going back.

mvK1pv-x0Z5rP4Hz9cWBWw.review_text: **DISAPPOINTED WITH CHICKEN AND PORTIONS**  We were starving before a Yoshi's show, so we decided to grab a few food items beforehand.  As many of you know, as a NOLA native, I am particular with my fried chicken and soul food.  For $7.49, Gussie's provided a weak-ass piece of fried thigh and a side of pile-high grits.  Yes, we were hungry, but the tiny piece of chicken was not fulfilling nor was it as good as Popeye's.   SAD.  The batter of the chicken was not spicy or authentic enough to pass in my book.  As for the grits, I wanted BUTTER in it already and not on the side.  Ryan liked his chicken and waffles, but I didn't care for my chicken and grits.  Generous three stars since it was not terrible, but would not NOT RECOMMEND.

_3lLgTnK_oLvT7r9VNv3ug.review_text: Great food, hidden gem in the city

UyIY70WUem0Ka3o0Hjqtqw.review_text: I give the food 3 stars and added an additional star for the friendly service.  The wait staff were nice and always filled our water glass before it was empty. And, the manager walked around and made sure we were doing okay.  Now, to the food...I got the cornmeal waffles and chicken and my friend got the sweet potato waffles and chicken.  I can say that the waffles were better than the chicken.  The cornmeal was alittle more hearty and was good.  My drumstick felt it was sitting out under a heat lamp for awhile as I part of it was really dry and had to peel off the top layer.  The thigh ones were fine tho.  It was good and would go back.  I think Knox is still the better chicken and waffle in the bay so far that I have tasted..chicken came up hot and huge.    If someone asked me to eat here, sure..there are other things on the menu I would try.

iLPMrRaJZAeMnMdg1gpR-A.review_text: What do you think about when you hear "chicken and waffles?"  Thick, brown, crunchy and hot waffles with savory large pieces of crispy hot chicken.  What do you get at Gussie's?  Thin, under-cooked, cold and soggy waffles with season-less and col chickenlets.  And the cornbread?  Please, I think I can get a tastier, more moist piece by buying those powder mixes at Safeway and making it myself.  The space is fantastic, but the food does not compliment it.  A very huge disappointment.

su1NFuVFeYO8CblyRrV_vw.review_text: I went here for the chicke and waffles.  My fiance and I are determined to find consistently good chicken and waffles here in the bay area. I am from Oakland so I figured I would venture out to San Francisco to check this place out.  I ordered th special sweet potatoe waffles and added chicken to it.  The waffles are amazing and nice and crispy.  The cicken had lots of flavor and was really good.  The restuarant is up to date and nice.  Only complaint that I had was I look up a the ceiling fans and they are dusty and dirty as hell.  Not very appetizing when you look up from the table that you are eating at right.  The service kind of sucks too.  They are slow, we didn't get water refills, etc.  The sides are kind of small also.  We ordered the rice and gravy and got shot glass of rice with a little bit of gravy.  Gravy is cheap isn't it??  Food is good.  I would go again if I am in there area but not worth the drive and parking headache for me.

fZxazDhgaQMHeV4Xsb-h_w.review_text: Came in for dinner as there was a huge hankering for fried chicken, but came out disappointed after eating room temperature food.  I'll go to Hard Knox, Brenda's, or SF Fried next time. :/

U3sCAJc4_E3MGC1jGi19gQ.review_text: Went on a Sunday expecting the all-you-can-eat brunch but was disappointed to hear that it's only on the last or second to last Sunday of the month. Booooo! Anyways I came to eat and eat I did! Our party of three (me, BIG AS HELL, and my wife and a friend, both small and petite) ordered up a feast!   Sweet potater tots Biscuit & gravy Me: 3 pc + 2 waffles Wife: ?? don't remember Friend: 2 pc + 1 waffle  MMMMmmmm Good! The chicken was so moist! The waffles were good, could have been more crispy. But the gravy... OMG... the gravy! Everything in life should be served with gravy.... breakfast, lunch, dinner, desserts, subpeonas, etc...

O44yvKPSe0ZplOy3Y3iVgQ.review_text: I had to give a try. Two of my favorite food COMBINED! I ordered the uptown special which consist of a chicken breast and a warm waffle. I also order the honey cornbread. yummmm. Everything was delicious! Its worth giving a try.

s9OJpyhZMrpqvII3f94wpA.review_text: Incredibly disappointing! I ordered an original waffle and a banana pecan waffle.  Both came out soggy. In my opinion a great waffle should be crispy.  There was not even a bit of crisp anywhere on the waffles. The banana pecan waffle says it comes with pecans, sliced bananas and whipped cream. When I got it, it only had pecans. No bananas to be found. I was looking forward to the banana pecan mix. Also there was no whipped cream.  I didn't want the whipped cream, but I forget to tell them not to put it on, they left it off on their own.  I will never be spending my money at this establishment again.

mR28gOekBWx8X7V-YIKBmw.review_text: I went for the basics: the Downtown Special that includes one lusciously chewy yet soft waffle topped with butter and an evenly cooked golden brown-skinned piece of thigh & a side of leg that actually was 2 pieces. Marcus, the server noticed that my thigh piece was slightly undersized (I didn't really mind) and returned with another thigh. Even the host approached me a few times to see if everything was okay as another server refilled my drink. Friendly service and better than expected food at a bargain (yes I read the negative Yelp reviews) warrant another visit.

KzDdqmFfU3hKo3tFnR6uVQ.review_text: I have been dying for this place to open for months. I have never had Chicken and Waffles but I hear it is quintessential southern style food. So right off the bus from work we head over to Gussie's.   This review I am not ready to write in its entirety. there are so many things I love about his place; community, friendly owners, great waitress (Gina) and great patrons but we walked in just minutes from the official opening. Many things can go wrong during the opening hours of a much anticipated neighborhood restaurant but what did happen will not keep me from coming back.    The seasoning on the friend chicken was delicious. The combination of friend chicken and sweet waffles is like peanut butter and chocolate or chocolate covered pretzels. The sweet and salty was so good and the crunch factor was amazing. The soju cocktails were yummy too and they serve a nice variety of tap beers including a Gussie's brew.    I recommend taking it easy on them until they work the kinks out but other than that its nice that we were some of their first customers!

iahSkAI_Jk9aDI3edc2EwQ.review_text: This place was awesome.  The waffles were amazing not to mention the fried chicken was probably some of the best fried chicken I have ever had.  I will say the service wasnt all that great, but as soon as the food came out I forgot all about how long it took.  I will definitelt return

0W2GpAT-Q0WMthWW1OqFgg.review_text: Stopped by again since we were in SF. This time had to wait 10 min to take our order & 30 min to get our food (I timed it since I was curious).  Overall take on the food this time was just OK - not as memorable as first time. Waffles were a bit undercooked & chicken smallish & lacking taste.   We had the same server as 1st time, so I'm assuming kitchen staff have not figured out things. Serving times were very inconsistent - folks after us got food super fast & folks before us waiting 30 min - talk about reaction time!  Probably done with this place for a while - will probably stop by Farmer Browns Little Skillet if I really want chicken & waffle fix in SF.

4GSnJSiWMWTpSAsLv3qR2g.review_text: Me and the bf got the Filmore specials 2 wings, 1 waffle,  and eggs for like $11. The scrambled eggs were just that scrambled eggs, can't mess that up. The waffle, very tough or their knives are very dull. The chicken VERY BLAND and  the syrup was VERY watery. For the price I was expecting a delicious meal, instead I just got a bland meal. If you want a good chicken and waffle meal then head over to House of Chicken and Waffles in Jack London Square in Oakland.

juaCEvADuosJOpfAAfJxVQ.review_text: I can't even say I'll give them a star. I bought a groupon for this place. I love Groupon, it's the best. But honestly I would never even bother to come here ever after the ordeal I had. I live in Oakland and when my hubby and I decided to eat here for the first time. We drove for our dinner date on a Saturday. I checked the website and it stated that they closed at 12am. We drove and paid toll to get there. We got lost a couple of times and by the time we arrived it was 10:35. 1hr an half before they closed. We knew we were cutting it close but we had plenty of time. When we finally go there it was CLOSED at 10:35pm. I then proceed to check the website again and it clearly stated 12. I went to check yelp and they stated open to 4pm-10pm. I was I confused. Wouldn't a restaurant that is advertising their business have the correct information?? I located the website via Grupon. shouldn't they as business owners be responsible to make sure information is correctly advertised?? I wasted my time, my gas and not to mention the inconvenience it was. I then decided to call the following day to see what time they closed. Not to mention I received a completely different answer than from Yelp and their website. It closed at 11pm. Which I was very confused. 10, 11, 12??? Which one was it. I then explained to the person on the phone what ha happened an hoe they should fix it on their website. The very not nice but rude $&@?$ stated "and how can I help you ? " we'll duh you can help emerged by telling your boss. Because Atleast for me it's easier to check things and for information to be accurate. I haven't even tried their food but their customer service is shitty. And excuse my language. Do not waste  your  time coming here.

gtTBIMMpGz2Cbqrl-aUwsg.review_text: I recently relocated to the bay area from Los Angeles and have been going through Roscoe's withdrawl. After feeling let down by House of Waffles in Oakland a few months ago, I bought a Groupon for Gussie's and hoped for the best. I will say that it's no Roscoe's but it's not bad either. Minus one point for the waiter taking FOREVER to come take our orders. It wasn't super busy and it still took way too long. Seems like they're understaffed. The ambiance was nice and there was a DJ spinning old school hip-hop favs which we enjoyed. On to the food, the chicken was juicy with crispy skin and was pretty flavorful. The meat of the chicken was however a little bland (maybe Roscoe's uses a brine or something but the meat of their chicken seems to be much tastier than Gussie's).  The waffle, however, left much to be desired. I got sweet potato waffles and they were tasty but a little too sweet when combined with syrup. They were also too soggy in the middle and a little underdone. The regular waffle was kind of dry and tasteless. Cornbread, chicken omelette, and fried cheese grits were yummy. It's cool that they have a bar and a buffet and stay open late. Overall, I wasn't impressed but wasn't disappointed either. I'll return for the chicken and to try a few other dishes. Just had to post this for my fellow So. Cal natives :)

5-LDJ6a9mZl08mLj2rXZ_A.review_text: It wouldn't make sense to compare my burgers to those of In-n-Out, so I won't compare Gussie's to Roscoe's.   With that said, the food at Gussie's definitely reminds me of home cooking, not of the bombdiggety variety, but of the meh, I'll keep eating  cuz it ain't bad variety. Considering that I had both the buffet and option of eating all of my friends dishes, I think I got a pretty good idea of the menu items. Of maybe the 20 items I tried, only the cornbread and the mac-n-cheese stood out. They were deeelicious, simple and done right. But 2 great items out of 20 less than stellar options isn't a good ratio at all.   My real problem with Gussie's though, is if you're gonna live by a name "Chicken & Waffles" these two items should be your money maker. Well suffice it to say, I wasn't impressed at all. The chicken, on more than one occasion, had that freezer burn taste to it. I don't care how good your breading is, no amount of spices is gonna save that old carcass. And sadly the regular waffle tasted like a soggier version of Lego-my-Eggo. The sweet potato waffle had a better taste but even without syrup was simply too limp for my liking.   The staff, decor, and ambiance at Gussie's is what is saving this from a 2-star review. The servers did their job well. The contemporary look plus the Southern vibe added to the warmth and overall inviting layout of the restaurant.   There are other "soul food" restaurants around SF and the East Bay that serve better quality food at a similar price point. So it may be awhile before I'm back at Gussie's.

8Rr2s0DEyxOneJ2HaLmxsQ.review_text: I like the food it was good. Our waiter was great also. I tried some my girlfriend's peach cobbler. It was sweet, however it wasn't as hot as I thought it would be. Some say this isn't Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. Yes. I agree that is the standard, but the service at Roscoe cannot not compete with Gussie's. Also, Gussie's should update their menus. Giving out ripped up menus... Not cool. Despite that, I would come back.

8DNiwBb0__aB3WehK4JYCg.review_text: Chicken and waffles is a commitment type of meal. I say that because you have to be committed to eating something rich and filling, and you have to be prepared to suffer the potential sensory overload consequences for said meal consumption. Fortunately, at my most recent visit to Gussie's, my friend and I discovered the loophole: the vegetarian plate.  We split a 1/4 chicken and two waffles plate, decadent like you might expect, but then to "balance everything out," we got the veggie plate, which consisted of black-eyed peas, red beans, rice, potatoes, and greens. I think it was supposed to come with cornbread, which it didn't, but we had enough carbs on our plate (literally) so I'll let the slip slide. Anyway, this plate was so delicious, which is saying a lot since chicken and waffles is inherently delicious, that I'll never eat chicken and waffles without something like it again. The chicken and waffles this time around was tasty but not incredible; the waffles, light and fluffy but the chicken seemed like it wasn't as fresh as it could have been. We also ordered the red velvet cake, which was a bit of a dry, crumbly letdown, but the overall experience here is a great, no-frills, relatively gritty one. I noticed that one of the specials was red velvet waffles... I can only say that I hope they have it on the menu next time, and that I am fully prepared to handle it. Maybe I should order some greens on the side.

kyfXJvXZ_QlO-VDSoRiWpw.review_text: Gussies what happened?? . The first couple of times you had great food..it was such a nice alternative to similar places further away..  We went there a few days ago because my body demanded fried chicken and southern comfort. All I got was chewy chicken and indigestion .. Here is what happened -For one thing my wife and I were already suspicious since it took only 5 minutes for our order to be served. I ordered the Taste of the South combo meal. the chicken had no fried appearance, it was chewy and hard to swallow. No crunch to it. It was probably sitting in heat lamp already prepared waiting for someone to order. So it wasnt fresh for one thing,  The Mac and Cheese didnt look good, something a total amateur could whip up. It tasted okay but was lacking. The smothered potatoes was okay but it smothered everything on the plate. The collard greats were fine.  We ordered the biscuits because they looked good. OMG - it was like eating peanut butter or something that just wads up and sticks in your mouth. I swear I could have used it for plaster to fill up holes in the wall Just chew on their biscuit until youve got a thick ball in your mouth, spit it out and fill all the holes in your wall up with it.  It made KFCs biscuit look like the greatest thing in the world.  Yes it was that awful. I dont know what went wrong here, maybe we ate there too early. It might be better to go when its crowded and then they are forced to cook fresh food. We even ordered TOTS and get French fries instead, probably because the fries were just sitting there under the lamp ala McDonalds.. we did exchange them which meant the cook had to get off his ass and make something fresh. And they were. The dipping sauce was horrible though.. it looked like someone puked in the dipping cup. It was ugly to look at, smelled awful and just disgusting   Ive been kicking myself ever since that day because I could have spent less than 35.00 for a good meal and with dozens of places to eat around there including Japantown nearby, Ive had that guilty purchase feeling all weekend.  I dont know if Ill ever go back.. maybe a year or two.. but not in the immediate future.

qVqkPleqVmLFvktS_aw9cg.review_text: I love chicken and waffles. I used to live down the street from a Roscoe's, so my bar is set pretty high. From atmosphere and service to chicken and syrup, Gussie's is arguably better than Roscoe's.  Full disclaimer: I haven't tried the other food. Instead, I focused on the Uptown Special:  *One perfectly cooked chicken breast, not too crispy and still juicy; *One waffle, slightly sweet (cinnamon?) and not too heavy or thick; *Amazingly full-bodied maple syrup *Pitch perfect sweet tea  My best friend and I debated which element really made the meal, so we tried another chicken and waffle place - nearby Bar Johnny, with its odd hot sauce and below-average chicken - and decided to return to Gussie's three days later. Yup, it's the chicken and the syrup.  Both times the waitstaff was courteous and friendly. The food took about 10 minutes, even when we went during a particularly busy evening.   Highly recommended.

vkfOYXo9yJ5WSq4hgOeU4A.review_text: THIS IS WHERE YOU WILL FIND THE BEST CHICKEN AND WAFFLES IN THE CITY! I love their thin waffles- they're a wonderful blend of vanilla, a touch of cinnamon and buttery goodness with lots of pockets for syrup. Their chicken is fried to perfection, and they must brine it because it is always super tender, moist and properly seasoned.

5rK8eYZHUvugbVoAjvUX0g.review_text: Been twice, one great and one "interesting" experience.  the first time the wait was so long we sat at the bar, our food was outstanding... stick to you ribs full all day food. Other then my boyfriends, this is the best chicken and waffles ever and will be where i come for it. corn bread, red beans n rice, and fried chicken breast all on one plate.. sign me up.  the second time... wow, where to begin. we were there for almost 3.5 hours. In the waiting room for 45 minutes, at the table waiting to order for 20 minutes, waiting for our food for over an hour, then when our food came they forgot one of our 5 orders... so half of us ate cold food because we waited for the last order, and half had to feel rude eating because they were starving and could not wait. after 20 minutes of waiting for the lost dish, the waitress came with a bowl of assorted fried chicken and said the sweet potato waffle and sides he ordered would take to long but they would bring him regular pancakes to go... how that makes up for it i could not tell you. Finally for this pancake to come and for us to get the bill it was an additional 30 minutes or so. all in all a terrible time, we were all starving and crancy, and to kill time we drank beer which lead to having to much beer on an empty stomach... never going back on a sunday again.

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 1 1/2 stars only  I was excited to eat here since there is no real place that serves chicken in waffles as a signature in the city. Sad to say I was not impressed... we ordered 3 things, the fried catfish nuggets, southern comfort and the uptown special.   The wait for food was lil bit longer then I expected, I thought that it mite be due to the place being new and still trying to get into its groove which I strugged off thinking the food would speak for itself. Sadly again when the food came out it was not very good impressed, struggled to cut the waffle with the flimsy fork and blunt knife given, waffles not so good, no flavor just large and thin in size. The chicken was bland, no taste, I kinda felt cheated like i could of ran to popeyes or kfc to make up for what i paid. I know that is bad to say but it was true. Those days when you feel for something fast maybe for lunch or dinner if you do not want to cook and get enough for a group kfc or popeyes usually hits the spot since u know what your getting and wut your paying for. The fried catfish nibblers with homemade tartar sauce is the only thing I really liked at this place, catfish yes, sauce did not taste any different from any store bought sauce, the catfish was fluffy and tender and taste was good, I don't like fish but they did do justice to there catfish. also if you have a sweet tooth try there southern tea it is supersweet for me it is perfect other people may think it is too sweet.  The service was kinda wierd, when seating the hostess in front seemed to be distracted she tried to call on a secondary hostess to seat and it seemed like both were out of place if not confused, the waiteress we had was nice but she was not very attentive, never asked if we wanted or needed a refill of water or tea, never came back to offer more napkins, never to asked if we needed our check, we had to flag another waitress if not a bus boy to get our waitress for our check, for desert I ordered the red velvet but they were out, it was a sunday afternoon maybe 1:20pm so they had to have opened maybe by 11am thought it was wierd that they were already out hmm not so sure if i will go back to this place due to the food and customer service sad really thought it would be a lil bit better.  customer service * 1/2 no refill, no attentiveness, almost non-existent food ** catfish made this place a 2 star the chicken and waffles is definite fail no stars for the signature meal.  cost $$ you will be probably spending $11 - $30 depending on your order

EwGnalP07e-ZVvZg-7couQ.review_text: I came to Gussie's because I had the Groupon deal and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is cute and the service is friendly.   I ordered the Taste of the South and my friend order the 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles meal. The portions were definitely generous! I liked that the chicken was lighty breaded and had a good taste. I wasn't particularly crazy about the greens, they had a weird after taste. The candied yams, the fried chicken, and the waffles were great!   I also have to agree that my soda was flat, I think that whomever is serving the soda needs to do a better job. No biggie. Overall, for 2 meals and 2 sodas it came out to $35. An ok price for the type of food you are getting. I would definitely recommend it and will come back only for the chicken and waffles!

nLEmRPtgHoumkdvTfNHfTg.review_text: Dear Mr. Gussie... I don't appreciate your lack of beer, ice cream, AND pie...and what you did give me was heinous.  The service was horrible, the waiter would ask us what drink we wanted and walk away while we were telling him.  The eggs we received were cold and the mac and cheese was a creature.  The only thing that was semi good was the corn bread and the lemonade, thanks Gussie.  You ruined my MLK holiday.

Mb-C2XLfzNSOnpUDVKnSGw.review_text: Chicken: Big and juicy, and NOT salty (a plus in my book) Portions: Giant. Waffles: Tasty, especially the Sweet Potato waffles.  I loved this place, especially considering their hours. It's a great place to grub after a concert.

K7xZtVLB7IwJOCE7IXWecw.review_text: The biggest pain point is how cool of a concept it can be but how it falls short in execution. I took my girlfriend there because she was craving some soul food and I personally wanted to check it out  Pros: Seemed busy. Warm atmosphere. Not too loud. Courteous server.  Cons: No host at entrance. Slow service. Worn-out menus. Forgotten items from order.  One of the more funny moments was when the food arrived. I wanted to be a little healthy and decide to order a salad. The salad was "so fresh" the tomato wedge still had the produce sticker on it. I guess not many people order the salad at Gussie's.  It was unfortunate. I wanted it to be a better experience, but it just couldn't deliver.

qwFYS8sQErrpBoUKBkeadA.review_text: IMO better priced, more tasty, and definitely easier to get into than Roscoe's in LA, the populist gold-standard of chicken and waffles (I'm not saying they're the best, but Roscoe's did pretty much establish and popularize the genre widely)...  Just back from dinner there. Liked it. Service was hit and miss, from way too much attention at the beginning (we were asked what we wanted as they were handing us our menus) to uneven (forgot the side dish), but if i expected crumb scrapers and fine-honed precision, i wouldn't have gone to a chicken and waffles place (that said, it's never  BAD to find precision and good service). Even with the small issues, all the staff were friendly and that went a long way toward making our meal a good one. We'll be back.  Menu -- decent selection of non-sucky but popular beers on tap, including Blue Moon... prices on the drink menu and the regular menu didn't match...   Watch for specials, including the $2 pints and $2/2 fried wings on Tuesdays.

oAlP03cHvPZrEgqWDdYAAw.review_text: I've been bugging my bf to take me here for the longest time. But he wouldn't take me cause of the location. I don't know bout y'all...but I grew up in the city. And this place is located right next to the Pro-jex! Just sayin'. =P  I ordered their "Uptown Special" ($9.29). It came with ONE waffle and ONE chicken breast.  When it came out, I was surprised at how HUGE the waffle was. I have to say, the waffle was just okay. I wish I ordered their sweet potato one instead. As for my chicken, I thought it was kinda dry and also okay. Couldn't even finish it! The uptown special was actually enough food for one person. Well, for me at least...   We also ordered one of their samplers: red beans & rice, candied yams, mac & cheese, and collard greens. I thought the red beans & rice were really good. Mac & cheese was pretty tasty. As for the yams....they were a little too sweet for me...greens were okay.  Service here was very nice.  Our server was great. Loved her!  They gave me a Chocolate Kahlua cake for my bday. The cake was very yummy. Dont think I can finish one whole cake to myself tho. Its good to dessert share.  To be honest with you, I thought this place was just OK. However, I enjoyed my meal only cause it was my birthday and I got to spend it with some of my favorite people.   3.5 stars rounded up

ubmbxYDfthzthk3RpjkvlA.review_text: tuesdays = 2 fried wings for $2 + waffle  both were delish, wings could have been more flavorful

eg9lRiZNnk1W2-E89ZTT7g.review_text: The worst service.  Period.  The hostess would do better working the window at a fast food joint than taking on a (trying to be) nice and authentic restaurant as Gussies.  She had no idea what service means - sat us at a dirty table and gave attitude when asked to clean it and the greasy prints on the seat left from the last patron. We never saw her again.  I ended up going to the front cash register and ordering as if it was take out - fast enough.  After I ordered I asked that it be sent to the table in the corner and pointed to it.  She was shocked but when I explained the situation she simple said ok with no apologies.  My guess is this wasn't the first time this had happened.    Once returning to our seat our server showed and things picked up from there.  Food roughly arrived 30 minutes after being ordered (thank God they have a beer selection).    Excellent -Waffles with lot's of butter and hot syrup - don't let it sit as they are not great cool/cold.
