Good -Chicken - especially when you have fresh pieces that haven't sat around soaking up oil.  I had one fresh and one piece that had been on stand by for too long -Red beans and rice -Mac and Cheese  OK -Collard greens - they are sweeter than I'd like and a little too over cooked.  Stewed greens works but mush is too far -Yams - ok if you're a huge fan but easy to pass if not  Being a 44 year old SF native I have tasted my share of AMAZING Soul Food in SF and  the bay area - sadly, unless the manager, GM or head chef addresses the issues at hand (here and on too many other posts) we will see this fall by the side of Powell's and many others.  I counted 6 disgruntled conversations during my dining experience and know that there will soon not be enough Groupons to entice the unknowing to giving you a try and the rest of us will be long gone.  We're on your side - that's why we show up. Be on our side - give us what we came and paid for.

0QoXWBrjH8w_HJYVWwdSyw.review_text: I have to say, I'm very disappointed with the food here. I ordered red velvet waffles and they didn't taste like red velvet at all. They were insipid, watered down batter with the addition of red dye waffles. Truly heinous. And rubbery!  Boyfriend had traditional chicken and waffles and was also not impressed. Everything was flavorless, the chicken was dry and it wasn't like the awesome crispy fried chicken from the south. His classic waffles were also super meh, also rubbery and lacking in flavor.  Both waffles were undercooked or something bc there is no reason for waffles to be so damn chewy like i shouldn't be able to pull out a piece of waffle from my mouth that i've been chewing on for more than 20 seconds. Just gross.  The service was great and that's the only reason this place isn't getting 1 star

Tm0XQCB-fQ_OmHGGQ9W3fQ.review_text: Decent food (lunch time all you can eat buffet), decent price $10.00, but poor service. Even though the waiters were cordial they seemed rushed.

LoGvkb6gEWOD6muZNA8OjQ.review_text: i went here cuz of a scoutmob offer, which was good. i think if i hadn't been getting the meal for half-off, i'd have been disappointed. the food was fine, but i wasn't nuts about the waffles - i tend to like mine rather crispy. the chicken was fine. on the way out, my bf and i noticed their health dept score of 80 which gave me pause. a cheerful woman - who i think may have been the owner - was extremely nice, and kept coming around to check on us. i probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but i wouldn't tell anyone to avoid it either

H5EY1CeIx4m_pNChKZkq7A.review_text: I've ate here once with 8 girls, and we ordered everything on the menu. The results wasn't what I expected. As we read the menu, our mouths watered! I guess everything tasted bland & greasy? food is cheap, so you get what you pay for.   Pictures are deceiving! the country fried okra was good! Check out out the pictures I took.

hxnzwc6LBdXA3hRLoAdIRg.review_text: Yesterday my Homie and I went to Gussies and it was delicious (like it usually is).  Now I've heard about some bad experiences here, but luckily my experiences have always been good.   I ordered the Fillmore Classic which includes 3 chicken wings, a choice of 1 or 2 waffles (depending how hungry I am, I sometimes order 2 lol) and scrambled eggs (I don't like their scrambled eggs, so I got the mac n cheese).   The fried chicken is tasty but it's greasy, I used about 3 napkins just to keep the grease off my hands! My waffle was delicious, it's tasty and the syrup makes it even better! I also love their mac n cheese!   My Homie ordered a Shock Top but was told they ran out and only had 2 beer options. Ummm I guess Shock Top is really popular lol.  The service was pretty good, sometimes I felt like our waiter forgot about us, but there was always another waiter around that was more than happy to help!  Overall, I enjoy Gussies and it hasn't given me a reason not to go back, so I should be back very soon!

JUStaFzFLVyqC1q1zucmFA.review_text: There service sucks I've been seated for 20mins already and still I'm waiting for someone to take my order they need to be more on top of things. And the place isn't packed so there shouldn't be a reason why it takes so long.

xU6a1p3FoBTBM2CV6qfBlg.review_text: I liked this place, I've never had chicken and waffles before so I have nothing to compare it to. I'm not a fan of dark meat so I really like the fact that they had fried chicken breast and waffles. The fried chicken and mac and cheese were very good. I would have to say better than Hard Knox. The service was decent, they checked back on us every now and then to see if we needed anything else. They even went out of their way to make my friend a cherry coke (grenadine/coke) even though they didn't have it. I would have to say minus the one star since the refills on the sweet tea weren't free. I don't think it takes that much effort to sweeten iced tea. Overall I would come back since they are opened late.

w-4nQ-PHW_U8CCR0S1jT_w.review_text: Ok, update time.  It's been exactly a month since I came to this joint and it has lived up to what I said was 4 star potential.  The chicken batter was spot on, the meat was tender and juicy, they had fried okra this time!  The sweet corn and red beans and rice were good old fashioned comfort foood, and the buttermilk biscuits were exactly what I wanted (could have used a little more milk in the batter or more butter brushed on top though, but nothing that couldn't be fixed by me spreading butter on top).  Mac n cheese was pretty good too :)  I skipped the waffles this time but my compatriot (same as last visit) went for the waffles and he ate every last piece.  Service kinks were definitely all worked out - our waitress was lovely.  I'll have to report on dessert on try #3...I was too full to even think about taking down a milkshake.

jC2o7gIqbwTMepV2GpV4eQ.review_text: Im from so cal, king of the chicken and waffles!  I must admit, this place blows Roscoe away!  Service was amazing and the waffles were the best I've ever tasted!  You must try the sweet potatoes and red velvet waffles!  Come see Pia!

46H5HeNQmC50UcFGe8VWEA.review_text: This place is underrated. Gussies easily deserves 4-5 stars for it's chicken and waffles. This was our first visit to Gussies, but it surpasses Little Skillet in overall experience.  We ordered for 2, sharing this:  1/2 chicken (mix of dark and white) with 2 waffles $15.59 Substituted 2 sweet potato waffles +$2 Side of gravy and onions +$.79 Honey cornbread +$.99  The half chicken included 4 pieces of chicken - breast ( large lots of white meat), leg, wing, and thigh. Nicely seasoned, good flavor, juicy enough especially with the gravy and syrup. Skin not as crispy as Roscoe's in LA, but very nice.  Waffles are thin as others have mentioned, however we preferred the thing sweet potato waffles to the thicker waffles you get in other joints. Light and flavorful, the sweet potato waffle is subtly sweet, and highly recommended.  The savory Gravy provides the subtle compliment to the chicken and sweet potato waffle that makes gussies' chicken and waffles sing. No drenching syrup needed (even though it's included), just a touch to add a touch more sweetness.  The honey cornbread with gravy was delicious too.   The only improvements could be better coordination among the waiters ( two waiters came by our table one after another asking us similar information two times during our meal).   Also, on the draft beer menu is a beer called "Gussies Back Porch". I was excited that gussies maqu have it's own microbrew which would have put this place over the top. However, I was disappointed to hear that in reality this "microbrew" was just another name for Gussies' house draft, Miller High Life. What the...?  All in all, despite small possible improvements, this is by far the best chicken and waffles experience I've had in San Fran. I prefer this to Little Skillet, and my woman prefers Gussies's gravy to Roscoe's.  4.6 stars.  Definitely recommended, and will be bringing others soon!

VvWyAw7ukxxDntoMcylJ0Q.review_text: Fantastic, better than I expected. Actually, I wasn't sure what I expected... as I'd never had Chicken and Waffles before. Well, not together. ;)  I went for the Uptown special or whatever, it was a Chicken Breast and Waffle, and my table split a side sampler.   Everything was soooooooo good. Excellent waffles, Delicious plump chicken breast, the sides we shared were out of this freaking world.   The price point wasn't bad either. 3 of us ate for about forty bucks. Not bad. Did I mention it was delicious too???? :)

GySf3tuKsgwBPhu_UyJZMw.review_text: Come hungry, something like roscoes chicken and waffles

qhLDa52-h5V1rPUSVMNxNA.review_text: it does the job when you're jonsing chicken and waffles.  it's not roscoe's, but then again who is.    the service was good and the food came in a timely manner.  the food was actually not bad.  i was only skeptical bc i love roscoe's in la.  would i visit gussies again...def yes!  i feel a chicken and waffle fix coming on.

ag76sHSqL7nal3OKiHQhIA.review_text: A coworker suggested this place for one of our lunch hour ventures and upon entering the establishment,  the vibe was cool and laid back. Like a friendly neighborhood chicken and waffles "Don't Fail Me Now" kind of place.  I must say, I'm a very satisfied customer!   I ordered the "Gussies Classic" that came with 3 chicken wings, one waffle and two eggs any style. It was filling and yes, I agree with what one other yelp-er said about the syrup. "The syrup doesn't taste like anything out of an Aunt Jemima bottle" but had a faint tropical twang to it? I could be wrong.     Over all, the people are pleasant and the chicken was-a- hummin and as long as it's good honey chile, Imma keep on commin!   Mmm Mmm MMMMM!!!!  *snap*

EI3X9c1vserzFzR9OoYj9w.review_text: This could have very easily been five stars for me but there were two grave errors, one very egregious one and for which I am deducting TWO STARS - They served my husband OLD CHICKEN.  ooh uh uh!!! We do not play that.  My chicken was delecious but he ordered a leg dinner (overpriced!) and an extra leg cost him 3.29!!! (outrageous pricing!) and then on top of that it was dried out and cold and chewy. Hell to the NAW! The greens and the yams are very good but 9 dollars for old chicken is not gonna cut it! I am also deducting a star for the ambience not matching the food.   Atmosphere is like a sports bar near a train depot  - for tourists, doesn't refelct menu, etc.  Even more for the waiters who have been reviewed quite accurately already, I would add it seemed our waiter was trying to lay on the 'hipness', the 'soul' and came off like he was from Utah.  Slow service can be okay if the food is good and the atmosphere warm, relaxing. So, I may give it another go but ooh wee, that one hurt.

teE3Y_ZuYh8lOttLcbN1DQ.review_text: Have to upgrade my rating a smidge...you can thank Cole & his exceptional (as usual, never had an issue with him) service this past Saturday...food was ordered correctly (small glitch with how the side waffles were ordered, but quickly rectified), cooked to order, & we didn't have to lift a hand to ask for anything. Thank you!!!

XSFC5ZBoKf0M9-bv2UtBHg.review_text: Food size was perrrrrfect! I was stuffed and had didn't have much of leftovers which is awesome.  Who wants to walk around the city all day with their car smelling like leftovers?  Although it is a delicious smell, I think after a while the grease wouldn't be as appealing. Service was great and they kept filling up my iced tea and bringing extra lemons(BIG PLUS FOR ME) Things to remember:   -order a side of gravy for your chicken, biscuits even the waffle tasted bomb.com in the gravy -get a side of the hommade biscuits but make sure you tell them you want it WITH your food or else its gonna get cold sitting there -dip the chicken with a piece of waffle INTO the gravy... u won't regret it -enjoy and make sure you got some comfy shoes to walk out of there in!

NMNauN3TXZapniWfQ6rYFw.review_text: I used open table to make a reservation here.. and didn't get any points from it :( That doesn't affect my feelings about this place at all, but just sayin!  Went here for brunch before I embarked on a hike in the Presidio. Pretty glad that i found this spot via yelp.  Had Two's Company. Saw someone else's waffles and they looked a little undercooked for my taste. The chicken wings were super delicious, albeit I wish they had been a little crispier. The flavor was great though.  I had grits on the side.. my first time trying them.. I wasn't sure what they were supposed to taste like. I've never had anything to compare them to.. but I don't think I'm a fan. They were okay when I stole some cheese from my friend's omelet and mixed it together, but besides that.. meh.  Cornbread was yuuuuuuummmmy. Definitely recommend this place!

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Lucky when my party and I arrived, we didn't need reservations.  So we were seated pretty quickly. Down side, is the credit card machine wasn't working and half the party had to get cash.  The place started getting packed when the buffet opened at 7pm? $10 all you can eat, minimum two drinks; alcoholic or non alcoholic.  Around 9pm on a Friday night, Gussie had a live DJ who came and played some old school music.  It turned out to be a memorable night.   We ordered straight from the menu, since most of us have never eaten there.   I had the 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles with a side of corn bread; add 99 cents, gravy add 79 cents and $4 for some potatoes. I only ate half a waffle!!   The chicken wasn't ALL that smancy nor was the waffles, but the price they charge was decent.  If I am in the area, I will be back for some take out, not sure if I will be dining in. Def worth a try, this was my first chicken and waffle restaurant. Can't wait to find more!

gFw5fMugGNx878ndbDhRoQ.review_text: Would give no stars honestly.. Bland chicken like chicken and flour and that's it. Bland eggs .. Just everything was bad but the ice water and the hot tea (which I made at the table lol) ...

btgZWY-IciTg4q61saeJ9Q.review_text: Meh. The service was really slow. The ice water tasted like melted plastic. We did an experiment and found out it was the ice and not the water itself that had this flavor. I hope they fixed it otherwise customers are ingesting plastic into their bodies...  The chicken + waffle had really dry waffles.  The only redeeming factor about this place is that there was not a very long wait and the cream of shrimp soup was A'OK.

UDFCWnHOvkENxbKGlEsLyg.review_text: chickens are so so so so gross.  for reals.  they are just dirty and fatty and have too many damn knuckles for a girl like me.    that being said, for some reason when you deep fry said animal parts and smother it with hot sauce and maple syrup... it becomes.... divine.  magical.  out.of.this.world.    the waffle part of the duo is not usually all that for me.  i usually eat half of it, and while i enjoy it, i don't find the need to eat the whole thing.  at gussie's, i ate my whole waffle.  i also used the whole allotment of butter they pre-decided i would need.  and asked for extra syrup.    that shit was damn good...

o8FrwBegKjm959oVKSeNeA.review_text: I've been here twice now, it's not bad but I most likely won't return.  Gussies is an upscale chicken and waffles place and that's the problem; chicken and waffles should never be upscale!  First time I went I had the catfish sandwich; it was just okay.  In all honesty it was glorified fast food at best.  I had a side of collards and a side of cheesy grits; the collards were okay but I prefer mine and the cheesy grits were really good but cheesy grits are so easy to make it seems silly paying so much for them.  The only reason I came back a second time was to try their Friday night buffet....  Second time:  I came specifically for the buffet; I wanted to try a few different things that would add up to a lot if I ordered from the regular menu.  The buffet is pretty sad; it's tucked away in a very dark corner and has a limited selection.  The time I was there they had fried chicken, plain rice, some sort of steamed cabbage, and macaroni and cheese.  THERE WERE NO WAFFLES IN THE BUFFET!  If you're a chicken and waffle place with a buffet shouldn't you have waffles in your buffet?  I skipped the buffet and ordered off their regular menu...  I split an order of fried chicken and the sweet potato waffles.  The fried chicken was really good but it's still just fried chicken; the sweet potato waffles were good but they were still just waffles and they cost $10 for just 2!  That's $5 a waffle!  Dinner for two quickly added up to $45 for what amounts to glorified fast food.  The first night there was live music; a keyboard player, a 5-string bass, and a drum machine.  The live musicians would have been good on their own but the drum machine just killed any chance of it being enjoyable.  The second time there was a DJ; the DJ played a good mix of '60s rnb and '90s hip hop but they could have gotten away with an Ipod on shuffle.  Overall the music could have been a nice touch but totally unnecessary.  Overall Gussie's has some pretty good food but it's priced out of it's league; why pay so much for glorified fast food when one can spend the same amount on something a little more upscale and not so easy to make at home?

S8DiK5g5oxyZuMLvAYAEGQ.review_text: I have been to this restaurant several times. I have thoroughly enjoyed everything I  ate; I have had the different  pieces of chicken  which were hot, juicy and moist. I enjoyed the macaroni and cheese and the peach cobbler is as delicious as Mom's.  I will be taking my family back to  this restaurant.

y-ggfas8M8u0qQbcVixbGg.review_text: So today my husband and I decided to try Gussie's after running too late to stop at Merritt's in Oakland.  I was really craving grits, yes at 4pm, and I must tell you that I was not disappointed. Creamy and buttery. The eggs were also delicious.  What did I order? The SF special. And my husband? The Southern Comfort.  Price: $26  I ordered our food to go and I was told 15 minutes and we did get our food in 15 minutes. The service was great. Thank you Kenneth!   And I found parking without circling the block 15 times.  So why only 2 stars you ask?  Well, the chicken was too salty and, as many stated, dry.  The waffles were cold and the batter was not to my liking. The syrup tasted like something out of my medicine cabinet. Yuck!

hBklKv-O1zmuQoe_U79GEA.review_text: This place was ok. I ordered the chicken breast and waffle and I have had better. They had a buffet going, but we passed and decided to order off the menu. The waffle was average, but I wasn't sure if they served it from the buffet table or cooked it fresh since it was a little on the soft side. I would have preferred a more crispy waffle. The chicken was ok, but nothing to rave about. It is also kind of pricey, but a nice looking restaurant. Staff was also friendly.

KOWl_ZhqhYqY33-CbaJubw.review_text: The restaurant was nearly empty and still had very slow service.  So I can imagine how it would be when they're really busy.    I was glad to see waffle fries and also fried chicken livers on the menu, and they weren't bad.  Their chicken was just average.....tasted decent if you like it on the salty side.  Their waffle, on the other hand, was not what I expected.  I definitely had better!  Didn't seem like it was freshly made.  Thank God for butter!

luI2rs8x5PUQ2Ly32nsidA.review_text: a friend & i needed a dinner spot near the boom boom room, and gussie's works great!  mmm...fried chicken & waffles. what i found on my second visit is you can get a specialty waffle for a nominal charge. i tried the red velvet - delish!  it's just enough food to fill you up without inducing lethargy. the only downside is i'm always too full to try any of their desserts.   it seems saturdays they have a band play. last night, one of the servers joined in on bass.   btw, they're on opentable.

Ci5aHpAdMGlhXpN_LI7qaw.review_text: The hubby and I had a craving the other weekend that involved 1) chicken and 2) waffles.  Our journey brought us to Gussie's Chicken and Waffles.  The variety at Gussie's is vast.  So much so that it takes you nearly halfway through the menu to locate the 'chicken and waffles' section.  Aside from their namesake they also serve platters, sandwiches, salads, and more.    Being as it was our first visit, we hadto try their signature dishes.  E. ordered the 1/4 Chicken and 2 Original Waffles, and I ordered a breast & substituted my original waffle for a Sweet Potato one.  You can easily swap out any waffle for one of their "specialty" waffles (e.g. sweet potato, red velvet, banana pecan).  I'm normally a fan of red velvet anything, but if you can believe, I was red velvet-ed out. In the past week I've had red velvet whoopie pies, cupcakes, cookies, and pancakes. But I digress.. The chicken & waffles hit the spot. Chicken breast was a ginormous piece and I was worried that it might be dry as chicken breasts can easily become.  I was pleasantly surprised how flavorful and moist the chicken was cooked.  It didn't need hot sauce (gasp!) or any other condiment to help it out.   Both types of waffles were tasty by their own right.  Good texture, not overly sweet.    The service was okay.  We had to call a couple of times to get refills on water.  Food came out fairly quickly considering how busy it was on a Saturday mid-afternoon.  We'll be back to try more and maybe venture into more than just chicken & waffles.. (or maybe not).

2Vla6FpLJ6-sjN12Nt1Nfg.review_text: Tried this place out today cuz I had a $20 Groupon. And just cuz I was hungry and cravin me some Fried Chicken & Mac n Cheese!   We ordered the "Taste of South" which included a 2-piece thigh n leg ( I requested for all dark meat ), collard greens, candied yams, mac n cheese and corn bread. All this for $14.99.  Chicken was pretty good. Juicy n tender but the skin was not as crispy as I would like it to be. It probably got soggy from sitting in the liquid from the yams or collard greens. Mac n Cheese was decent but I wish the cheese was creamier. Collard greens was a really salty - I will skip this next time. Corn bread was standard...I've had a lot better.   We also ordered the Smothered Pork Chop with choice of 2 sides for $13.99 or $14.99 - can't remember.   Pork chop was juicy and good with tons of gravy smothered over it.  Sides were just OK...we got the potatoes which is similar to the home style potatoes you get at breakfast joints and collard greens which was too salty as mentioned.   Service was pretty bad.  Our server was very nice, but he was slow.  It was not too busy, only 5-6 tables tops.  And you seat yourself.  We got menus right away but it took our server 10-15 min to take our order (had to flag him down) and another 10-15 min for food to come out.  And then we flagged him down for the check when we were ready to go.    Would I come back? Probably if I am in the area.  I want to try their waffles next time!

lkbtoy2GdxwoOhqiSOK3AQ.review_text: I heard about Gussie's from a friend on FB! I've always wanted to try it so when I tried it I fell in love w/ it. Not only are the hostesses and waiters/waitresses are nice but they took good care of me.   2nd visit, I took my husband to try it and at first he was hesitant because he didn't think that chicken and waffles would be a good combo but when I took him here he started recommending it to our friends and even guaranteed their money back if they didn't like it. I love the varities they have. It may be just a tad bit pricey but what they charge is completely worth it because they give you a huge serving!!! Free drink refills, $12 soul food buffet on weekdays $10 buffet on Friday nights w/ live dj, happy hour... I HIGHLY RECOMMEND GUSSIE'S, SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY AND GREAT FOOD!!!

ReQdzKqmWB00pkQvSnXkBQ.review_text: Omggg I went to Gussie's for lunch today and I'm still recuperating from a massive food coma. While I melt away in my seat, I figure I might as well Yelp the place.  Gussie's was good food. Came here because we had the Groupon and we ordered the 1/2 Southern fried chicken with 2 waffles. The serving was generous and the chicken was adequately tasteful. Ordering dark meat, my chicken was tender and for the most part flavorful.  The prices for Gussie's are a bit higher than what I would have liked though. Chicken plates are mostly over $10, with some plates reaching $15+. Moreover, my soda was really flat, which kinda killed part of my lunch experience.  Thanks for the food baby Gussie's. 3.5 stars.

frFgM9DQbewbeMznT8FofA.review_text: Chicken and Waffles. DECADENT chicken and waffles even. NOM.  I ordered somewhat off-menu, but Pia (our hostess and server) was nothing but all smiles and got me exactly what I wanted: 2 drumsticks, red velvet waffle with cream cheese frosting dollop, pecans and syrup. :-o  I told you it was decadent.  Coffee stayed full, everyone was super friendly and my food was delicious. Only four stars because there really isn't much in the way of atmosphere, but it was dreary and cold today and we didn't sit outside. I think this place might even be better if I can sit on the patio and scarf down my tasty tasty cal-o-rifc breakfast.  I'll be back!

3ce6ZJYFM7tkDDFQVHsIcw.review_text: gussie's is new and there  are a lot of kinks to fix....all i can say is TYRON....YOU ROCKED....it was your first night and had to deal with 11 of us...great job....

OB7cku1TKxo1mYr9pFSuiQ.review_text: Best Soul Food in the city by Farrrr! if you like real soul food come to gussies chicken and waffles

Fb8eXv1GxrBy2hJbC_IJYw.review_text: This place barely gets three stars, but it does get them.    The Food: As a genuine southerner I found it ranging from aight to good.  Nothing blew my socks off.  I was glad that they served chicken livers (Almost impossible to find in the Bay Area prepared correctly -- Alas these weren't either.  I ordered two pieces of fried chicken (Small and anemic looking, but very tasty).  Eggs over easy (Meh). Waffle quite tasty but I agree with the other reviewer that said it reminded them of Eggo's! and a sampler of the sides (Mac & Cheese, Collard Greens, and black eyed peas).  The mac & cheese was a little dry but comforting.  Black eyed peas were watery and served over rice, which I'd never seen before, but weren't bad.  Collard Greens were excellent and almost made up for everything else.   Banana pudding for desert, delicious but with store-bought whip cream.  Service: Very friendly but ridiculously bad.  I had to ask the server on 3 occasions to bus our plates, everyone waited forever for their second round of drinks and the Chicken liver appetizers arrived after the entree's were coming out!  Mandatory 16% tip (Parties of 6 or More :)  To summarize; even though my experience there was only so so, I give them points for having a southern themed restaurant.   That being said they need to step up the food quality and have either more waitstaff or give them less tables until they can get a rhythm down.

8qHjTWbhe7B1G6o4DQlu_A.review_text: I'd like to be able to review the food, but we never got it after waiting 1hr 20mins. Completely unbelievable. Looking around the restaurant there were many groups that were not getting their food.  We were informed by the staff that they were short a cook and the food would take longer. They also said that many people showed up at once.  If you're going to be short staffed in the kitchen, don't sit as many people as you can. There were still a lot of people waiting outside.  We were apologized too many times and told our food would come out soon but it never arrived. At one point some one from the kitchen told us it would be 5 minutes. Well 20 minutes later we still had no food. At this point we got up and told them we were leaving.  Terrible service. We will not be going back.

xHihWhff6AU_ggXfqkgw6A.review_text: That's what I get for trying a place the first week it opens...  The restaurant itself is a lot bigger than I had expected... very spacious and inviting.  I walked in at 7pm expecting a half hour wait for a table for 9 (they don't take reservations) and was pleasantly surprised when the hostess apologetically said it'd be about 10 minutes.  As promised, 10 minutes later, we were led toward the back of the restaurant, where they had long tables that could accomodate a large group. We ordered a couple appetizers for the table to share and various combos of chicken and waffles (1/4 chicken, breast, thigh, wings, etc.) individually. Someone was there to promptly take our order, and then we were left to wait.  Luckily, the company was great and we barely noticed at first... but 20 minutes later, the waiter came and told us our food would be out shortly.  Not thinking anything of it, we kept talking amongst ourselves.  10 minutes later, our appetizers came out.  We got the fried okra (this was pretty good) and fried catfish nuggests (may be a bit salty for some people, but I love salt and really enjoyed these). We were all hungry by then, and the portions were small (the waiter had warned us of this ahead of time), so we devoured those appetizers fairly quickly.  Another 20 minutes passed before we realized that when they originally said our food would be out shortly, that they had only been referring to our appetizers.  By then my stomach was growling... and finally 10 minutes later, our plates came out.  I got the filmore classic (1 waffle, 3 chicken wings, and eggs).  The waffles were already cold when I got them, and there was barely any meat on the wings. And the wings were TINY... and dry.  I think another review desribed them as looking like rejects that hadn't turned out right.  Those weren't rejects - that's just how they are.  The syrup was good... very light and had a watery consistency... so it wasn't overpowering like normal maple syrup can be. I think the waffles had a hint of cinnamon in them, which was nice... and complemented the savoriness of the chicken.   We also got an order of the sweet potato waffles for the table to try. Maybe I just don't know how they're supposed to taste, but it had a sour aftertaste to it, like there was plum in it? I won't be ordering it again.  Other people at the table got different parts of the chicken... and weren't all that impressed either.  The staff was really nice though, which makes me feel bad for giving it only 2 stars.  However, I feel worse for bringing my friends to try this place...  maybe I'll take them all to LA for some real chicken and waffles.  =P

iuD0M_M_CUnqP2R5eYgRgw.review_text: Love this place. Haven't found better fried chicken in sf than over here- waffles are great, all their sides perfect. Soul food when your feelin empty.  I like that it's very reasonably priced and it is casual yet it's a very nice place. Oh yeah their sandwiches are excellent as well!

7eQDRyNhLd00uv1FnjvGsQ.review_text: Ok, I ate here and ordered some chicken and waffles. I ordered the Southern Comfort or something like that. The chicken was good, crispy on the outside, moist on the inside and good flavor. The one disappointment? The Waffles. It was like I was eating a slice of white bread that had been soaked in water! Like a big soggy sponge with no crispiness. How can someone screw a waffle up?? Even my favorite slophouse diner can churn out a good waffle. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and assume it was because I got it To-Go and that the chicken was so good. Maybe next time I'll sit down and eat there.

0avGtdLupNQXG1OM6VbuDw.review_text: The community feel was great! It seemed like a lot of people knew each other and although I didn't, I felt very welcome.  Everything we ate was good, the chicken was crispy and moist, waffle delicious.  (combo is actually not southern, originated in Harlem). I'm hoping the following was because they just opened and are overwhelmed: -  out of all beer on tap -  out of most desserts -  brought me the wrong order ( it was good though)  Worth giving another chance, but in a few months when they work out the kinks.

FnHKd73q6jjGkx8aU5v4dg.review_text: A place to consider, if you have not had chicken-n-waffles before and you are in the area, check it out.  The food is decent, I ordered the Gussie's signature sweet potato waffles ($9.79) with 2 pieces of fried chicken wings for additional $3. I think the overall experience was diminished by the fact that there was a lack of wholesomeness on my plate, 2 waffles, 2 pieces of chicken, and a small pot of hot maple syrup. Sure that's what I ordered, but it's a bit hard to justify the cost of the soggy waffle for $5 a piece (oh I forgot butter, it must have been $1). It certainly was delicious but not perfect. A few of my buddies have ordered the Taste Of The South ($14.99) was definitely a party plate with one-quarter fried chicken, baked macaroni and cheese, fresh collard greens, candied yams & honey cornbread, the overall taste is above average and you get lots of varieties compare to their waffle options.  Bottomline: I am thankful for the restaurant to accommodate the 17 of us, so I can't complain about the speed of service, we all had a pretty good fill sharing different dishes, which are generally generous, that we have ordered. The party had a decent time at this casual and charming joint despite the fact that the food wasn't the best I've had.  Cheers.

HiZGg29YdMJ7-GB4jepRIw.review_text: So.  I have four words for you people with the 2 and 3 stars. Don't. Get. It. Twisted. I have gone to Gussies twice over the past few weeks, and it keeps getting better and better. Sure, they are going through their "soft opening" and continue in this phase as they work out the last few kinks in their operations. So calm down already.  The first time we went, it was on the Sunday after they first opened. The place was packed, so of course I was prepared to wait longer for the food. Which we did, but by the time it arrived, I had already had the corn (yum), gumbo (yum), mac n' cheese (YUM). I ordered the Uptown, which is the standard chicken breast and waffle. Duh-li-cious. (Please note: I was a HUGE Roscoes fan when I lived down in LA, so I know my chicken and waffles- check yourself Ed). Plus, are you really going to argue with a black woman about chicken and waffles? Didn't think so.  Second time I went, I brought my friend from LA, who is also a regular of Roscoes and grew up in the rural south- couldn't have more of a qualified critic than that right? I was actually nervous to hear his feedback. He had the downtown, and once again, I had the uptown (if it ain't broke don't fix it right?) Needless to say, he cleaned his plate, as did I, and the service had improved ten fold. The people there are all so nice, as if it needed to be said again, and now I have the recommendation to try the sweet potato waffles next time, which I am looking forward to!

W_MuoJIhSJYCXJ3q6TkyWA.review_text: I really enjoy coming to Gussie's.  Their staff is friendly, but sometimes can be slow.  I'm never in a rush, so I don't mind if I have to wait a little longer.  I always get their chicken and waffles.  I believe it is the Filmore classic and it comes with 1 or 2 waffles, 3 chicken legs, and eggs.  The one thing that distinguishes this place from others is their syrup.  I believe it is brown sugar maple syrup, which is delicious.

iki4Cs4e3zJty11p4T37-Q.review_text: On a scale of 5 stars, this place should be 11!!  Chicken is sooo good.  Crispy skin and not greasy.  You can tell the meat has been marinated.  Sides are true soul food. greens, mac and cheese, okra.  No other restrauant I go to puts me in a happy place like this.

vd323xigOB0qKly3PUGrvQ.review_text: Great first impression of the place: friendly staff, mouth-watering food, and great atmosphere.  Came here on a Friday evening around 6pm and we got seated right away.  The nice waiter took our order and we got our food in a reasonable amount of time.  I got the standard chicken and waffles and it. was. delicious.  By the time we left around 7:30pm, the DJ was spinning and the buffet had opened - will have to come back for that next time =D

gwiGnfRc88htvkyIRyCsIQ.review_text: I am a chicken and waffles convert.  While I love fried chicken, I have been hearing about this combo for years and how I must go to Roscoe's in LA, but with a Groupon, we visited on a wet Sunday.  It wasn't busy @ 9:30 but by the time we left, people started arriving.    The establishment is big and extremely clean with plenty of room for a simple sit or a big group meal.  Our hostess/servers were friendly, explained things on the menu (it's kind of a confusing menu 1/4 chicken vs 2 pieces, which is the same thing) and made recommendations.  I decided on the fried chicken breast on an original waffle and my pal got the two piece with two waffles & two eggs.  While the coffee was sub-par, the food sent me into the stratosphere.  The juxtaposition of the tender but crispy golden fried breast against the cinnamon waffle and maple syrup sang.  I was thankful for some leftovers to repeat the process again later in the day for an early dinner.  Although it's something I couldn't eat weekly, chicken and waffles is something I'd aspire to for special occasions.  So glad for a new food combo within the City and with decent service too.  Amen.

kjdC0Dzyh1ADUZ0_1Orr6Q.review_text: Love this place, enuff said! This is what i call food for the soul!   4 stars...sometimes the waiters can be slow during lunch cos they get busy and they tend to forget to either refill ur glass or dessert order.

qmD_-iDl8JBf_k4yMOmxOg.review_text: I love this place.  Its great atmosphere, friendly, knowledgeable service. Food is all ways remarkable. Go for it! And its not a fortune. 2 people, 2 mimosas, one chicken with waffles to share and four sides...$35!!! Okay? You hear me?

Plpeqe9p0dsjM_opaO5n4Q.review_text: Waiters are nice. Food plain as hell. Didn't even put butter on the cornbread. I got the sampler and tilapia. My lady got the taste of the south and it was not anywhere near south. I'm from LA. We eat roscoes and M&M's also my rice and gravy was semi cold. So either the rice was old. or the gravy. I'm done.

G-1uSi0c5ZdvZBZJBZVCiA.review_text: Honestly, I wasn't blown away by the chicken and waffles here. The waffles were nice. The chicken was just okay. Pretty average, and I've had better in the bay area at several places.  Someone on yelp raved about their red velvet cake, but when I had it, it wasn't that good. Quite a disappointment, actually.  The people working were nice, so they got a plus for service.

P0kW4jdYxi70sWpPeyj2Zw.review_text: Really guys only three stars!? This place is better than "A-OK" I've taken 5 different friends/parties here and they all have been impressed! Nice fancy digs with sinful menu. Perfect for hangovers, midwest out-of-towners or after intense exercise. Staff and people I have always wanted to take home. it's clean. Music is fun and never annoying. I am shocked this place isn't blowing up.

xDJRriqJAPDap3E2scDRJw.review_text: Well well well...what a surprise this was. We got a Gilt City deal and took a chance on it because the prospect of delicious food was too great. Gilt City recommended reservations but we really didn't need it. They actually seemed surprised we had one. Nevertheless, the tastefully decorated and spacious dining room was about half full of happy people.  Everyone talks about Roscoe's as being the best at chicken and waffles- sure it's good...I just didn't think it is THIS good. Not only is the menu far more varied, but customer service was excellent (not sullen like at every Roscoe's I've EVER been to). I was really happy to see just how clean the silverware and glasses were. Crystal hot sauce on the table and great music playing the entire time made this a meal seemingly sent from the gods.   I had the "Two's Company:" two eggs any style (scrambled with cheese), two chicken wings, and grits. Hey- if I'm going to compare to Roscoe's- I might as well get the same thing! Hubby had the half chicken (dark meat, of course!) with two waffles. Naturally, I sampled the waffles- super yummy! As I reminisce on the deliciousness of this meal, I remembered how amazing their syrup was. I checked out the website and now I know why- it's HOMEMADE brown sugar syrup! I've never heard of such but clearly I've been missing out my entire life.   Finally, a huge test of a restaurant for me is how clean the bathroom was. Their restroom was immaculate AND it had an Ernie Barnes painting in there.   Neighborhood was a bit sketch but the only parking we found was the structure directly across the street. Ah well. Will def make this a repeat visit.

J2PP_iPrReY3v9yPc5TwKA.review_text: I love this place! I've been here twice now. The food is great.  I highly recommend the sweet potato tot and the fried cheese grits. Just writing this review is making my mouth water!!!

zpRQE7FhwO4dBGJ3k_CJlw.review_text: Finished a Marathon and a group of six of us decided to eat at this restaurant (I was actual just along for the ride). The decor is simple but and great for comfort.

JiBWEr0FIiTKI25GBtWpww.review_text: This is all its worth... and I think this is being nice.  I drove up from the South Bay and I was not impressed at all.  First of all, I am not a fan of seating yourself, especially when 1/2 of the tables in the place are left with dirty dishes.  On top of that, I don't like sitting at the table waiting to be acknowledged by the waitress to finally get some menus.  I think if you are going to have people get their own tables, you should have the menus already on the table.  When the waitress finally arrived with them, she sounded really tired as if she was having a bad day.  And then there were the menus.... would it hurt if you could buy a laminator instead of having your specials on a paper placed in an old, ripped and dirty plastic sleeve cover??  The food was decent.  My husband and I love soul food, and their's is ok.  We opted for the buffet.  You would think a buffet would include a variety of desserts or cornbreads, etc, but that was all separate.  All you get in the buffet are chicken- fried & baked, catfish, yams, mac n cheese,beans & rice and green beans.  Just the basics for $12.  My hubby had a better experience his first time here and he loves the red velvet cake.  The chicken was ok.  I think the flavor was decent, but the baked chicken seemed dry. Catfish tasted a little boring.  Yams were good.  The decor is nice... but... on every table there is a "serving dish" that holds the ketchup, salt/pepper, hot sauce and sugar.  Well, if the dish has enough holes to carry multiple condiments, why fill it with only 2??  Why not get rid of it and save the table space?   And the sugar holder... it had 3 packets of Equal and previous garbage of straw halves.  And idk if the rap music complemented the decor... I'm just saying.

Mfsb1ugPV2Ixfy6i1pxOXg.review_text: Moving from LA, I was very excited to try another chicken and waffle spot as we have Roscoes Chicken and Waffles. The exterior was welcoming and pleasant and their was a couple of families waitiing to be seated as we entered the restaurant. The atmosphere was overwhelming, crammed, and loud. The waitress/hostess very unorganized and it seemed like they were understaffed as the same person who greeted us is the same person who was supposedly "serving us".     We waited over 40 minutes to get our drinks (bottomless mimosa and one beer) and the food took over an hour to get.    I ordered the southern comfort menu item, the chicken was bland but since I had been so hungry from the 1hr wait I doused it in hot sauce and made due.    The waffles were a joke. They were so rubbery and cold that I couldn't even eat them. I knew  if I asked for them to bring me out hot waffles, they would just go put the waflfles in the microwave to be heated but I didnt want to be bothered at this point.  The eggs scramble was disgustingly runny and cold.   The server came by to us after 15 minutes to ask us how the food was but we couldn't eat anything nor were we going to ask for her to make us a new plate.  Considering the ridiculous wait it took.  They sat more people than they could feed and blamed the kitchen for their errors.  I hate nothing more than a server who points the finger at the cooks in the back that can't defend themselves.  They crammed so many chairs and half tables side by side that there was no elbow room.  Our table literally was the back of someone's chair. When we asked politely to a table that wasn't in the middle of an isle.  We were denied although there were 2 other tables that were available for 2 people.    This establishment only cares about getting as many orders as they can rather than satisfying the customers they have.  We should not have been sat in the middle of the isle where their sloppy serving skills interfered with our comfort and enjoyment of the establishment.    We spent Muni fare and 2 hours of our day to have the most disgusting food and the worst service ever.    The server's performance was inadequate and we weren't pleased with the food.  We come from restaurant backgrounds and usually tip 20% or better depending on the service.  We didn't tip this server due to the very unpleasant experience she gave us and she followed us out of the restaurant to make a remark about "black people" and "this is why" you cant do business with BLACK PEOPLE. Are you serious???!! Because I heard that predominantly black people run this establishment is one of the reasons I came from San Mateo county and TRIED to support your establishment    She blamed the cooks for the cold food when if she just delivered it on time we would've had lukewarm plates and stereotyped her own race as being bad tippers rather than looking at the performance she gave and realizing the flaws lie on her.     This was my first stiff and I would normally feel bad about it.  I don't . She gave everyone else attention and eye-contact and blew us off as if we were second rate. The was rude, the food was gross, and the place was a waste of our Sunday afternoon. This was by far the WORST restaurant experience since moving to San Francisco.

Bzbna6x9SSYXd3RZem7Lbg.review_text: I have a theory based on the reviews I have read and now being able to actually go and eat at Gussie's Chicken and Waffles. They are having some soft opening blues for sure.  Most people are picking apart the service which is yes slow (due to the kitchen), but I personally loved my waitress, loved the decor which is very urban with earth tones throughout and the food was off the hook!  Great mac and cheese, the chicken was moist and fried perfectly (people we are not talking KFC - this is soul food so please don't get it twisted) and my waffle was thin and crispy!  If you ever have had soul food this is authentic!  The price was not bad - we ended up getting our desert of peach cobbler on the house due to kitchen issues which I thought was very nice of them and I would for sure come back in 6 months when the kinks have all been worked out!  Great spot for brunch on the weekends or a foggy night where you need some comfort food!  Gussie's needs some more time for sure but it's not due to bad food...

QK29EAAOVWNXJUGEulGJrA.review_text: I'm not a huge fan of this place...yet.  They're still working out the kinks (hopefully) and so you should really take all these reviews with a grain of salt.  Although the server was nice and promptly took our order and came back out with our food, quickly it was hard to flag him down for any other requests we had.  The food was meh.  I had the chicken, collard greens, candied yams and the baked mac n cheese dish with cornbread.  The cornbread was extremely dry, the collard greens were a little too "smoky" for me, the candied yams were ok, and the chicken was soggy and a bit too oily (it actually reminded me of the "fried chicken" that I was served in the cafeteria in elementary school).    The mac n' cheese though was really really good!!!  I'll come back again sometime in the future when they have their stuff all together but they still have a bunch of kinks to work out.

SA-ozIdvfH7Al9M409IaNw.review_text: The candied yams were to die for, especially along side the Mac and cheese. They taste home made and boy oh boy do I want more. I was scared to order the greens as usually they are cooked with pork, but not here. These not too spicy greens are cooked with turkey!!  I was disappointed in three things, however. Their peach cobbler was just dreadfully sweat peaches and sauce with no crust. Also, they were out of chicken breast (which I ordered to go with my red velvet waffle) which was cold and obviously cooked before the rest of my meal. I was so disappointed, especially because it seemed of the waffle was hot/warm is was going to be the bomb. It comes with nuts and cream cheese frosting. I'll order that again and request they make it once all the side dishes and such are almost finished. Despite the short comings, I'd definitely order again (with slight adjustments) because there food is great! Let's just hope next time at 12:45, they are not already out of chicken breast. Soul food at its best!  One more thing, due to its location, parking is horrid. My husband double parked while I ran in, this is probably your best bet unless your dining in, in which case, come early and keep circling.

Nolj9ZpXeNlz1aOzuxGaBg.review_text: Sat for 20 minutes never even had a server come by and take a drink order. The place was half full on a Sunday morning! Finally just got up and left. Sucks because I was really hungry for some chicken and waffles!!!

ZYsqQ1yTCETL7Fym1Wk4bQ.review_text: I give them 2 stars just b/c the person on the phone taking my order was sweet. I ordered the buttermilk chicken too sweet.. potato salad was to sweet and it looks like they jus threw it on my plate. The mac & cheese HORRIBLE my cheese was all stuck together and not very tasteful, there prices are overpriced for the food they provide. They need better cooks, I prefer Cafe Hard Knox. Sorry.

ObdEx0uci1jRa4dDM73AYg.review_text: We went here on a Friday night. They have a buffet for $10 with a 2 drink minimum. My friends went with that, but I decided to order a la carte since the fried chicken in the buffet looked like they were only wing pieces and not that meaty. I had the uptown special with a side of mac n' cheese. The waffle with the honey butter was delicious and the chicken breast was perfectly cooked. The mac n' cheese was okay, but nothing special. I will definitely come back to try more of their other sides.

ZlvGMQ3xfvIz0bI9pahGAA.review_text: Gussies was my second time trying Chicken and Waffles ever. The first was Frisco Fried in Bayview. I've had Gussies twice. The first time delivered. The second time, i'm not so sure. I had the Uptown Special and the second time I had the Southern Comfort.   Although the food was good, two buddies of mine and I ordered the same thing and I can't trust that their consistency is the same. The SoCo comes with a leg and thigh, and one of my friend's thighs were substantially bigger than ours. I don't know if ours was burnt, but it looked like a scale model of my friends.  The service is good, food comes out in adequate time, but the ambiance sucks. it's pretty dark inside. I can barely see my food. I don't know if they are imitating some sort of Southern thing, but it ain't charming. At least not to me.  Also tried the catfish nuggets (still catfishy, muddy taste) which suggests it isnt fresh but who knows, and the gravy biscuits which were a waste of money.   I'd go back again..but then i don't know. There has been a craze for chicken and waffles lately, especially with the Lay's chips coming out. I'm not going to lie, but it sparked my interest in trying C&W for the first time.  This place delivers tasty food for rookies. but once I got over the novelty of eating C&W, I realized that it's not all that it's cracked up to be. Not to say Gussie's is bad, because it's not, but the prices don't warrant the quality of the food for me, especially when you'll serve me and my friend a leg that's bigger than the thigh, which is the size of a chicken tender. Then serve my other friend a full size thigh.  I'm over it.

W5spiZ9GhAJDtdiYbnBN4g.review_text: Maybe I'm just not a chicken and waffles person cuz I didn't find the combo amazing.    Chicken alone was good.  Skin was crispy enough to be eaten.  I'm picky and normally don't eat chicken skin.  Waffles were okay.  Nothing special.    Service was good.  Waiter was very attentive and asked if we wanted our waters refilled multiple times throughout the night.  Restaurant was nicely decorated.    I wouldn't be the one to suggest coming back, but I wouldn't mind if someone I was hanging out with wanted to come here.

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: Afraid I am not a fan of Gussie's. We arrived about 8:20am and, driving by, came to the conclusion they were not yet open. I had a damned coupon I had purchased so I jumped out to see what the hours were and, lo and behold, the door was unlocked. A guy on the phone yelled from the back, "Just sit where you want." In their defense, I'm okay with all that; my low rating is for the food. If chicken and waffles is in your name, I don't think an over sized, very thin Eggo makes a good impression. I didn't taste the chicken, although the wings looked like they were from a farm next to a nuclear power plant - they were gigantic. My friend said it tasted fine, but then he makes chili in a toaster oven at home. My eggs and grits were okay, a bit cold (and again, we were the only customers in the place). Granted, I am a bit jaded by the farmerbrown/Little Skillet and Brenda's breakfast options, but Gussie's in no way lived up to expectations. Maybe later on with a bit of a crowd it may have been a bit more acceptable, but the feeling on the whole was a poorly-run Denny's on a bad day. Sorry, Gussie. (Did I mention the orange juice that tasted like it came out of a homeless person's shoe?)

ucvTVzBMSGkLjzHqPdCM9A.review_text: Decided to give this place a try on a Sunday afternoon. We found parking on the street right across from the restaurant -- score! Upon walking in, we were greeted and seated by a very nice lady -- Deanna (sorry if I spelled your name wrong). She took our drink orders -- two of us tried their orange/strawberry soda mix and it was just perfect.   After much debating (so many great-sounding items on both the menu and specials of the day list), I went with the Fillmore special which if I recall, is 3 wings, a waffle, and eggs. I also got a side of their smothered potatoes (how does that NOT sound appetizing?). We didn't wait long before the food came out and already based on appearance alone, the food looked outstanding. My eggs over-hard were the best I had EVER seen -- and they tasted delicious too! The smothered potatoes were a dream come true -- slightly mashed potatoes with gravy and chilies -- oh my! The waffle was something I wanted to stand up and applaud for. This isn't your typically flavorless waffle -- it reminded me of the one's at Roscoe's (sorry to compare but honestly, that is a compliment considering that place is legendary) -- it had a sweet sugar and cinnamon taste to it, it was slightly crunchy, and with the syrup poured over, I almost melted into a pool of pure satisfaction. As some have said, yes, their syrup is runny -- is that really a problem? It TASTES incredible -- isn't that what matters? Now, the chicken was very well cooked -- moist with a crunchy skin -- my only complaint was that it didn't have too much seasoning -- but it's a small complaint!  Our server came back several times to check on us -- something I love -- and overall, she was just very attentive and polite. The check didn't come out to that much for the three of us -- I mean, for THAT kind of food, I expect to pay quite the dime. I HIGHLY recommend you come and check this place out. The three of us WILL be back and we'll try new things the next few times as the entire menu sounds very appetizing. Thanks, Gussie's!

2pSz4JN_HvOC9U8OtfVD5w.review_text: Went to go see a movie at kabuki and saw this near where I parked. Went in and saw the sign that says wait to be seated. So we stood there til an old man, who we totally weren't sure if he was the owner or a customer told us to go in and sit where ever. When we sat down, we kind of just looked around wondering if anyone knows we're here....  But after a while someone finally came.  I think I got the Fillmore with 1 waffle, 2 eggs and 3 wings. I was really excited for my food to come.   The waffle was like any other waffle what I thought made it different was the syrup. I don't know what was in there but it made the waffle so much better. It was runnier than usual and it tasted a bit different in a good way than what I'm used to. Just thinking about makes me crave waffles.  As for the chicken was moist and crispy but nothing really special about it...  Besides the initial service the rest of the service was pretty good.  Definitely would want to come back and try the happy hour and the sweet potato waffle.

OWrUeak_gc51fSEmvnjcOw.review_text: I'm going to say this. The reason I give them 2 stars is because of the service ! You will sit there for 20mins without being asked anything like would you like a menu or even some water.  I see a great overturn in servers because they have no sense in CUSTOMER SERVICE. rude as hell. There is one sista WHO does not know how to talk to customers but she can sure stand in the back and run her mouth. Yelling at other employees like she's the boss.  I was trying to get a refill on my sweet tea and kept having to say excuse me, excuse me. It was making me feel less appreciated and mad I even support this business. Then she walks to the back to chop it up some more. And I'm still sitting there by this time holding up my glass and shaking the ice like im a homeless man shaking my cup for spare change. and she still cant hear me . Ummm aren't you suppose to be working???? I hope the owner does something about this customer service soon because that's what's dragging her business down. Hiring people who can't talk to customers and who doesn't pay attention to the people. Smh come on my black nation do better.

AOu9ILG0fyXdNns0NDWlBg.review_text: Great everything. The best soul food in the bay! However, its been a while since I have been here and the chicken seemed salty to me. I don't know whats going on, it just may be a new cook, because usually it taste really good. I would say it was good but, have been better.

Jj4IwAMx4iEhoZsKlqi60g.review_text: So I finally tried this place out. My Groupon was about to expire, so it was  about time I used it.  I went after work to see how much food I could order for $30. Answer: LOTS!  I ordered the half chicken and waffles; the chicken was good, but could use some more or better seasoning. The white meat was dry at times. The waffles could have been a little crispier. Syrup and butter was good The Sampler Plate: Mac and Cheese was the best of the dish. The Greens were bland. Candied Yams were way too sweet. Cornbread was nothing special. Pecan Pie: The best of what I had ordered, but i've had better.  Overall, a decent meal with large portions. The restaurant was clean and very decorative. And the wait staff was excellent and friendly.

6iQF02aNgeOk8s8dougtKA.review_text: What do you get when you add smothered chicken+ potato salad + rice & beans + chicken fingers+ sweet tea+ red velvet waffles??? Two happy people!  It was my friend's first time and I wanted her to love this place. She did. We went on Saturday around 2pm, the ideal time because not too many folks there. The music is always great! ALWAYS! So is the food. I love that it's open from 8am-midnight( that's a lotta fried chicken). I'll be back next weekend.

qGA59ne-MgQgcQ2C02AE1A.review_text: As a South Carolina native in San Francisco, I've been unimpressed with most of the "Southern" food in the Bay Area. I was skeptical when Gussie's was announced, but I have been pleasantly surprised by the quality. Two words; sweet tea. Any restaurant that does not brew it's own sweet tea should not be allowed to call itself "Southern", and Gussie's is a great 1 1/2 cup brew.  First off, this is not the greasy hole-in-the-wall you might expect from a restaurant called "Chicken and Waffles". It's a clean, casual space with an atmosphere that I would feel comfortable bringing anyone.   About the main dishes, the fried chicken and waffles, they're good, but they may not blow your mind (although the home-made syrup is incredible). What Gussie's excels are the secondary basics of Southern food. Their cornbread is awesome; warm, moist, and a hint of honey. Their mac 'n cheese is better and more traditional than I've had anywhere else in the Bay Area. In fact, I've been impressed with all their side dishes. It reminds me of the "meat and 2 veggie" places I'm used to back in the South.   The desserts are also very good. I LOVE the banana pudding. This idea probably reminds many people of the big vats that you would get in a cafeteria, but Gussie's pudding is whipped so light and creamy, it's absolute heaven! I will say that the red velvet cake could be a little more moist, but the icing is really good. And they just introduced fresh mini-cakes (like cupcakes) and these are to die for. If you do nothing else, stop in a buy a half dozen of these.

wI795B7EQTjkSL1eiYpMhw.review_text: you know what? i eat a lot of chicken and waffles. more than most people. you might not believe me, but you should. did you know that there is a whole other dish called chicken and waffles which doesn't involve frying the chicken? and i'm not talking about smothered chicken next to a syruped waffle, either. the pennsylvania dutch make a thick gravy with chicken and pour it over the waffle. no butter or syrup involved at all.   i'm a connoisseur of all the varieties of chicken and waffles there are. my winter hat is from roscoe's. and i think gussie's is getting a bad rap. the sweet potato waffle was really good. sweet, not under or over cooked. the chicken wasn't farmer brown's little skillet or nothing but you know what? farmer brown's little skillet doesn't have chairs and plates and tables either so maybe it evens out. i can only enjoy a meal so much that i bend plastic ware trying to get to inside a box.   friendly service and no major complaints from no one about nothing. certainly had worse that got better marks. worth a try and i'm willing to go back and try some non chicken and waffle dishes, too.

jraAKkNxFggkfwO33bJW0w.review_text: Favorite Chicken and Waffles in Nor Cal so far, only been to one other in Oakland, I dont really prefer the Red Velvet waffles because they are way to sweet haha :) Some like the super sweet flavor but its a little bit too much for me but if you order an original plate with waffles and chicken you will be satisfied. A bit pricey and I wish their servings were larger but mmm good :)

irmmwg3HwJMH4JGXZ-ZL-A.review_text: Never ever had a bad experience here. Anything on the menu is good for anytime of the day

HdrR743oX9qddxhjO6JdGA.review_text: Sunday brunch, came with a Groupon and left with a smile. Tried this place on the last day of a four night mini city vacay. Wish I had come the first day because I would have ate every meal here. Fried chicken was the best I ever had and being from Texas with a country grandmother that's saying a lot. At first bite the peppered batter reminded me of my late grandmother's southern fried chicken. The waffles were good too. Gussies certainly did not disappoint.

885RrJm3FlTslcsykuz7Rw.review_text: I'm on a tour de Chicken n Waffle and Gussie's was recommended y one of C&W partners in crime.   W snagged a parking spot in front and when we strolled in we were quickly seated and had our drink orders taken.  My friend suggested upgrade to the cornmeal waffle instead of he regular and we quickly placed 3 orders and one sweet potato waffle with chicken.  Just about the time I started wondering why the food was taking so long, a large platter appeared before our table and we began digging in. The cornmeal waffle was pretty good, nothing spectacular and I would have like it a bit more crispy. I tried the sweet potato waffle  i was very oood but served with a weird ,molasses sauce none of us cared for.  The chicken wasn't too inspiring and upon biting into a leg i was quickly searching fr the salt shaker. After  failing to locate some salt I dumped some hot sauce and syrup on and got some flavor.  As we finished our meal we notice that the restaurant was about 70% percent full an there was stil only one waitress. After collecting our plates we easily waited 20-30 minutes for or chicken and noticed that people who cam in while STARTED eating hadn't even had their orders taken yet.  In addition tot he waitress, there was a busboy hustling to keep up with drink orders and an older woman that walked around in a zombie-like trance- sitting here, walking there.; We flagged down the waitress and she took our card but we had to wait another 10-15 minutes to get the receipt back..   This place doesn't have that good of food to warrant  the wait and i don't think ill be coming back in the near future.

WcX1Vna_WIDONKXDlGAbxA.review_text: Been wanting to try this place and finally went. The service was a bit slow at first but when the server did come around, he was great. Just a bit understaffed which I understand. The tables were a bit too close to each other that I can hear the conversation the two women were having even if I wasn't trying to listen. I had to squeeze in between the tables in order for me to go to the restroom, that's how close it was. Anyway, let's get to the good part which is the food. I ordered the Taste of the South which came with chicken, mac and cheese, greens, cornbread and yams. All the things I absolutely love in one plate. Everything was delicious and the quantity of the food was a substantial amount. I'm a girl who can eat but I had leftovers which worked out great cuz I had it for lunch the next day. I'll try their chicken and waffles next time I go.

rWDZ20zpA6S5MmfZ2gVuiA.review_text: Okay so this place is super convenient and very tempting for me cuz I live right down the block from them... Otherwise, the staff is friendly and were willing to accommodate substitutions on the orders (yes, we were THAT table), but I was really disappointed in the chicken. It was super super tiny. I took a look at it expecting the waiter to go, "Just kidding!" while holding my real meal. Their candied yams though... don't even get me started. They are so damn good. I'm drooling just thinking of them. Mac and Cheese.... horrible. It was dry both times I tried it, and flavorless... it actually had a weird texture to it too... like it was spongey or something. Don't ask. The corn bread... it was okay. I could've made better. It was a little dry though. Everything was alittle dry. Like it had sat under the heat lamps too long but they decided to say "fuck it" and serve it anyways instead of tossing it out. All in all, its overpriced, and its okay. But the portions of the sides are good sized and those damn candied yams are like mouth orgasms. So try it for them alone.

wgaIbazh-8gr-sqf_JrDYw.review_text: This place is five star all the way. Great service, and the food is amazing.

r9mEdstfODufwolRWvRqbA.review_text: Plain and simple people need a hug these days. This spot has hospitable staff and decent pricing for delicious food. The waffles are perfect. What more can you ask for right in the heart of the "Fillmo"? People Please stop hatin! Damn! Lol, but really me and my girl appreciated the food after a show at Yoshi's. "Cant we sll just get along??

DocvFR6Hd4Vg7VKmRTsdlg.review_text: One of the worst southern experiences ever.  The waiter was overwhelmed, and our service was mediocre.  In terms of the food, it appears that they were out of seasonings.  The fried chicken was overcooked, lacked seasoning, and tasted like cardboard.  Black eyed peas were terrible, and well as the vegetarian platter.  In addition, they simply pored a bland gravy over the fried unseasoned chicken, and the grits were cold and lacked cheese in which they advertised.  Perhaps more detail should be directed at actually cooking the food properly, customer service, as well as proper seasoning.  What a waste of 120$.  It you are looking to donate your money to an unworthy experience stay at home.  Never again.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: The back story of Gussie's is fantastic. For that alone, I encourage people to eat there at least once. The owner's grandmother, Gussie, graduated from high school in Georgia decades ago at a time when this wasn't common. She subsequently moved to New Jersey but kept making Southern food. And now you're eating her recipe(s)!  I ate here after buying a used print-out ticket to a show at the Fillmore. (I know, I know, rookie move. Make sure the person goes to the door with you.) Regardless, the service turned my night around the chicken and waffles helped me leave with a smile on my face.

1URITYS1xhRXpZM0KMXPVQ.review_text: Never done the Chicken and Waffle thing but have always wanted to try it. So when my friend texted me an hour before I was to get off from work and said he made dinner reservations for a place I was like "Heck yeah!" He picked me up and off to San Francisco we went. We arrived about an hour later, found a place to park and walked into the restaurant.  I liked the atmosphere of the place. Very relaxing, with good music playing lightly in the background. The staff was very friendly to us.  We started off with an appetizer of Cheddar Cheese Grit Cakes. They were more cube looking than cake like. Very good! My friend ordered a side of Biscuit and Gravy. Of course I had to have a bite or two of his dish. The gravy was awesome. If they sold it by the gallon I'd buy it and use it like Frank's Hot Sauce and put that $h!t on everything! For dinner we both did the fried chicken and waffle meal. I thought the waffle was perfect and loved the maple syrup. The chicken was nice and crispy. It was, however, a tad over cooked in my opinion which made the chicken a little dry.  For dessert we shared a piece of Red Velvet Cake. It was just eh. The cream cheese frosting was on the thin side with very little taste of cream cheese. The cake itself was a little undercooked and slightly raw in the middle. I really wanted the Pecan Pie but sadly they were out. Overall, I did enjoy my meal and the place itself. I gave them 3 stars because of the over cooked chicken. Would I go there again? Yes I would. Think next time I would try their chicken strips with some hush puppies and fried okra!

nGU73wf5sqFPDGvwWuikLg.review_text: I was very excited when I heard about this place but I was disappointed when I ate their food... well, I didn't like their fried chicken, side dishes like collard greens, black-eye peas, yams...  pretty much everything.

opSbHEfHYfCZvfff7vKvYA.review_text: I heard about Gussies from a friend and finally got to go this past week and use a $10 for $20 groupon before it expired. My boyfriend and I came in on Wednesday night at about 6pm. We circled a few times for parking and luckily found a spot just 2 blocks away. The restaurant was pretty much empty so we got to seat ourselves once we walked in. Note: careful when you sit down at a booth, that bench is pretty hard lol.   We ended up sharing the Southern Comfort with a side of gravy and mac and cheese. I especially enjoyed the crispy skin of the fried chicken. When the check came we just had to pay a total of $.66 plus tip. Not bad!   I'm so glad we have a chicken and waffles spot in the city. I would recommend coming on a weeknight for dinner to avoid the weekend crowd.

1AEZst7IjiYbwBuB4Smfow.review_text: We arrived a few minutes after 7pm on Friday 10/26/12 and the place was full aside from two tables. My husband and I had been there before and wanted to take the kids since we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was pretty good. The hostess seated us right away at the table nearest the door and a busboy brought out water for everyone.   That was the last time anyone spoke to us. At 7:30pm, with three starving children and no one having asked us to order or even acknowledging our presence, we decided that no one would likely be helping us, so we left to go find some food elsewhere. The restaurant was busy but even a simple quick would have sufficed.  That was the worst service we've ever experienced. I haven't reviewed many places but this one I feel that I need to for the way it made all of us feel like second class citizens. We would have gladly spent the $15+ for the chicken and waffles plates that are overpriced, but we couldn't even get our order in.

2L4gZfU8yQEqwlRIzaAH_Q.review_text: Decided on a Sunday night dinner with chicken and waffles and wanted to check out this place. I mean, what a great combination. I decided to wikipedia the origin of C&W - one version has Thomas Jefferson bringing a waffle iron back from France. Great stuff.   Anyways, we get there and are seated fairly quickly. There was one waiter serving the whole area. I got the combo with fried chicken, waffles, and scrambled eggs (w/green onions and cheddar). GF got a similar dish but with sweet potato waffles.   Fried chicken - pretty good. Nice crispy skin and juicy. Some Crystal's on it and we're good to go.   Waffles - this is where I was disappointed. The waffles came out soggy and just weren't all that good. Had to drench it with some syrup to make it bearable. Sweet potato waffles had good flavor but also a bit soggy.  Scrambled eggs - by far the easiest dish and pretty good - but hard to mess these up.   Sweet tea - average, really sweet.   Decent service, takes credit card, street parking and some Zapp & Roger playing.   Overall - OK food. Might come back for fried chicken dinner with other comfort foods.

bXicFheHiZnqwzPKV8s67A.review_text: Although the service is spotty at some times the food is amazing. Best waffles, best chicken and tons of things to choose from. Also great desserts.

PKcLJyrK_jggMPFV_UF-ug.review_text: Visiting from Sacramento and thoroughly enjoyed my Uptown meal with a drumstick and the best waffle this side of the U.S. Watch out Roscoe's because Gussie's is coming for ya! Great and simple customer service with a smile. Githerdone!  Thanks and I can't wait to come back!

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: I enjoyed this place. had a nice brunch here. piece of chicken and a waffle. I'm not sure it was anything special but its definitely somewhere i would return if i were in the area and really hungry.

OB95ZES9zPQbGgS-Cqa92Q.review_text: OMG I remember when this joint  was Powell's.The wait staff there was horrible too. Picture this ... the place is EMPTY  and  Shenaenae is sitting in a corner doing NOTHING.I am waiting for her to come over and give me some water at least.After 10 min she comes over and takes my order. Food does not take long but I never see miss thang again until its time to deliver the check.How come i received the same service at Gussies ? The wait staff must have come with the building.Good gracious ! I will go back cause I the food was pretty good.

ImRGxX39NqmGLN4-3xw42Q.review_text: It's all about the chicken.  Outstanding spices, flavor, very moist and not greasy.  The waffles are also flavorful but could be a little more done. Avoid the syrup that comes with the waffles as it's bad. They do offer maple syrup for an extra cost which I will try the next time.  Forget the gravy. It's horrible.  Over powering flavor of green peppers and celery.  It's missing the soul of the chicken.  Hopefully they will improve it.  I need to try the other side dishes as they looked great as did the deserts the next time I'm there.  Once they have time to work the kinks out from being new I hope this will be a regular haunt.  The above was written back on my first visit when they just opened.  Well today a couple of months later I decided to try it again.  First off the wait staff is poorly trained even after about 10 weeks open.  I was dropped off at a dirty table.  The hostess barely bothered to take the dirty wine glass away from the previous patron.  I ordered 2 waffles to start as my appetizer and then 2 chicken breast and a side of mac & cheese.  It took a half an hour for the waffles.  Still the same horrible syrup.  I could make better syrup from brown sugar and water.  The waffles are still underdone.  My chicken & mac and cheese arrived another 20 minutes later both were good, not great.  The mac & cheese was tepid but the thought of waiting around for them to heat it up sent shivers up my spine.  I could of been there until closing.    It was time to collect my bill.  First they double charged me for my single iced tea.  But the craziest was the $9.98 charge for the two underdone waffles.  I'm sorry but that is ridiculous especially with their nasty syrup.  Over all I'd say save your money.  It's hard to believe that without tip my bill was $30.00.  This is absurd in the Fillmore neighborhood this restaurant is in.  The median income is somewhere between unemployed or on food stamps.  They have their nerve charging the neighborhood the prices they are charging.  For $30.00 I could of fried up 3 chickens and made a casserole of mac and cheese to feed 6-8 people not just one.  You'd be better off sticking with Popeye's.

nXAim6q8uIr7plVuwmIaZw.review_text: I hate to say I only gave them a 3 star, I do think they could be a little better but it wasn't over the top good. It was good, but not oh my God this place is great kinda good. The mac and cheese was great. I cook great southern food so I am hard to please. The waffle had great flavor but a . little limp. the Catfish was excellent. I had the buffet so there was enough good food there for me to come back and give them another try. Let's face it for a buffet it was very good, My sister had an omelet it was really good. So give them a try and tell me what you think,.

VUBO_0vSuatlHwaxV7azdw.review_text: Came here for my first chicken and waffles experience and was underwhelmed. The waffles were fine (who can really eff up waffles though?) and the chicken was crispy but these chickens must have been anorexic because from what I can remember, my wings barely had any meat!  The service was slow. I came here with a large group but it took over 30 minutes to get our food out. i would assume something as simple as chicken and waffles wouldn't take that long considering it doesn't take much prep or cooking time especially if you're just gonna toss it in a deep fryer.   I don't know. This place makes me feel kind of indifferent about the whole chicken and waffles craze. But 2 stars expresses what I feel for this place: MEH.

P_ePcCxh81KURpC6Q0z2WA.review_text: Our first time in this restaurant tonight, but we will be back soon. Atmosphere is low-key but clean and comfortable. The music is a steady play of blues and soul, perfectly complementing the down-home menu. Service was impeccable, not only from our attentive and friendly waitress, but the entire staff. Even the chef came out to say goodnight to us. But that's not why we choose a restaurant, is it? It's the food.
