Every single dish we ordered was excellent to spectacular, from the deep fried okra, candied yams, greens, and creamy mac'n'cheese, to the waffles (thin and crispy, flavorful and complementary to the chicken) to the chicken itself, tender and nicely seasoned. Portions were generous to a fault. Sad to say we ran out of steam before dessert; more reason for us to go back again! Even something as simple as the lemonade tasted fresh, tart and home-made.

8Hy9l6WQWaCdhWe5KYNgEQ.review_text: I've had the catfish, greens, waffles and chicken so far. I wasn't a fan of the catfish but everything else was good. The chicken was flavorful and crispy. The waffle was perfect and reminded me of Roscoe's. The staff was nice and the prices are on point for what you get. It's a cozy restaurant right off Fillmore and the service is quick.

1TgdIxSSbB2Vyb-UKeTDZg.review_text: Went on a Friday late night for some much craved for chicken and waffles (C&W). They had the Friday buffet going, but I had been craving some C&W for months. MONTHS!   Had an awesome waitress, Naj. Awesome... no wait - PHENOMENAL! I wasn't altogether there when she came by to take our order. So I said some pretty stupidly obvious things - like ordering water when a glass was sitting in front of me. She was cool. Rolled with the punches, laughed with us, made sure our orders were correct, checked in on us, and was efficient in every aspect of her job! It was also sweet of her to come by and apologize for the annoying drunk Filipino girl (isn't there always one who can't seem to hold her liquor?) screaming in the restaurant. Of course this is now an afterthought, but I wish I had told her manager how awesome she was and proves that great customer service still exists in restaurants.   By the way, ordered the Country Cornmeal Waffles and my friend had the Fillmore Special. Both were really good. Chicken wasn't overly greasy, like I've had at some other establishments. The waffles were tender and fluffy. Definitely my place for C&W!

eXAJZ7ejGLZB_QfY0cvCEw.review_text: I just had the worst fried chicken ever.  Two very small ,dried out, over cooked pieces with sweet potato waffles that were like rubber.  There were some black pieces of something on the waffles.  Not very appetizing.  My husband had the Southern Sampler.  His chicken pieces were larger than mine but the only side that he liked was the mac and cheese.  The service was fine but not exceptional.  Don't think I will be back.

hj0eXS0TgWtS8aYw7TXdsA.review_text: Unfortunately you only get one star. We brought a large group last minute to have dinner. We didn't have reservations but told them that on the past about once a month when we dine here, we often do make them ahead, and it isn't out first time bringing a large group there. They didn't even come greet us we had to search around for staff. And they explained being understaffed, 2 cooks 3 waiters and one buss plus a cashier at the bar., and we said it's ok we are patient we can wait. We did not get any type of response except were trying to get a hold of our Manager. Then we got we will ask our cook. So again we asked if they would kindly accommodate us etc. We even went as far as saying that we could even set up ourselves, help clean the tables. They did not have the common courtesy most places do to come out, and outright say we can't help you sorry. Instead 20 min later they said we can seat you, but we have NO chicken........We have catfish and it will take a while to seat you then take your order and serve you. So for being unprepared in your business, and a bad host in a hosting industry you get one star. If it were a toy store, and they didn't have the key ingredient which  toys.... How would you rate them. We walked up the street to Bruno's, pizza without a reservation and helped the one waitress they had and two cooks put tables together and serve pitchers of beer wine etc. What's more our large crowd attracted more folks walking in to order, it got about another 20 patrons while we were there. we were hungry patient and polite. They had less staff than the folks here. So from now on they loose about 5k In annual revenue from our group. Not a lot but certainly not more, and bad reviews all around by word of mouth and Yelp.

XQMaAvF3YUslCD-0tZY1xg.review_text: Came in on Saturday November 5th, 2011 - to a 1/3 filled restaurant and waited about 5 minutes to be sat. After being handed our menus - it took about 10 minutes for a server to come by - who took our food and beverage order.   We ordered the cheddar cheese grit cakes, uptown special, taste of the south, and and two beers. They ran out of Sam Adams, however, they immediately corrected the situation. Our server - while being overworked was an extremely nice guy who seemed to care about his job and corrected .  As for the food - the cheddar cheese grit cakes were not my favorite - they appeared flavorless unlike other grits i have eaten before; the uptown special for some reason never arrived, and the taste of the south was quite tasty. This arrived at the same time as the entree.  The Taste of the South - had excellent fried chicken (two large pieces) and candied yams. The candied yams may have been some of the best I have had in my life -I could eat an entire plate of these. The macaroni and cheese, collared greens, and cornbread were ok - but nothing out of the ordinary.  I felt the experience could have been improved if you ordered at a counter and then they ran your food out  like at other nearby restaurants. Otherwise I recommend ordering take out until they can fix some of the smaller issues.

hLtCyRQgboaBdIdH1bU1SA.review_text: Went here and tried the SF special with a side of mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese was the best part of the meal. Chicken was alright a little to dry for my taste. Corn bread wasn't as good as i as expecting,not a fan of soft flaky corn bread. Waffles were great.    I would recommend coming here if your somewhere near the area to try it out a few times.

1I1Zr6yuTkyPRiqe8qD5Ow.review_text: I love fried chicken wings and I love waffles, but I had never had them together. All I can say is what a combo. Three wings, a waffle and two eggs - delicious. Their chicken is great and the waffle was so good, I want one now. I really didn't need the eggs but they were cooked perfectly so I ate them. If anyone finds a better waffle in San Francisco, I'll be happy to go test it out..... Until then I'll be at Gussie's.

ZLlLw7dyVGF2PZ57IpUp9A.review_text: First, i'll give you the positive part of our visit: I ordered the plate with grits, eggs, biscuit & chicken hot link.  The food was great but the biscuit was undercooked in the middle (dry flour was flaking out of the middle).  This was my second visit and the 'uptown' plate i had before was GREAT (great chicken breast and waffle). The staff was also very friendly and everything was nice and clean. Now the negatives: For some reason, service was SO SLOW it was unbelievable! It was about 5pm on a Monday (MLK day) so there was only another party (3 people) and the four of us. There were two waiters who, again, were VERY nice but were just walking around.  We were there for 3 hours! We were in no rush to leave but...come on! Don't try the mimosas...they tasted like spoiled OJ (no fizz, just nasty).  We also decided to try the peach cobbler (the waiter insisted) and not only did it take him about 20 minutes to bring it over but it was in a paper cup and tasted a little like tar (yes, tar). There was a tiny bit of crust on the bottom but it was raw. uuummm...what the hec was that??!! So, savory food=very good;  peach cobbler=terrible; mimosas=horrible; Service=SLOOOWWW; attitude of staff=very nice. I guess...don't go here if you're in a rush. OH and take a jacket...both times i've been here, it's chilly in this restaurant.

TZ72l2zL7T7EH_wu8v_b4w.review_text: This place is bomb.  I had the works meal which came with 2 pieces of chicken, macaroni, sweet potato yams, cornbread and collard greens.  PLUS i ordered a waffle on the side!    I only ate like a 1/3 of my food because there was so much, but I loved it.  The chicken has a really good crunch and great flavor.  The waffle was bomb, I wish it was a bit thicker but it was still very good.    My sister had the boneless chicken breast sandwich that was major juicy and crispy...there was no dryness about this breast.  I secretly wanted to snatch it out of her hands but I'm a lady so i didn't.  in SF so far..... I found that Gussies and The Front Porch have the best fried chicken.

Eh_ak8vo3NHO8pew9cEMbA.review_text: yum! chicken and waffles in san francisco - their yams and mac and cheese is great too!!

JZfhVkNljM4H8WbsEpWzHg.review_text: How can you beat Chicken and Waffles? I'm a big Chicken and Waffle fan. Ever since living in Long Beach during my college days I'd hit Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles on Broadway and just enjoy the whole concept of Chicken and Waffles. Gussie's Chicken & Waffles is located in the heart of The Fillmore District in San Francisco.   After hanging out in the Fillmore one beautiful Sunday afternoon I was quite delighted to notice Gussie's Chicken & Waffles which is literally right across the street from 1300 Fillmore (Great Lounge with awesome bar by the way). After being seated promptly I noticed the decor was real subtle with a southern feel. I ordered the "Fillmore Classic" which consists of three golden crispy chicken wings, one waffle and two eggs. The chicken was crispy and succulent while not being overcooked. I had my eggs prepared in the scrambled form and they were ok.  What really took the meal over the top was the waffle. The waffle was delicious. I'm not sure if it was the homemade brown sugar infused syrup or the waffle itself. But the combo of the two made the waffle very enjoyable.  In conclusion, I would definitely come back to Gussie's Chicken & Waffle if you just want to enjoy something different. Don't get me wrong it's not the healthiest of choices, it's southern comfort food that will make you feel like your dining down south.

WRw2L6e9j_0tuMCFhqS1gw.review_text: Service here is excellent. The red velvet waffles are great. But one knows that batches can get wonky once in a while. It's usually really good, but once, the flavor was a bit off. I explained the taste to the server and before I could finish my sentence, she knew exactly what had happened. She promptly ordered a new batch made and the ensuing waffles were, as usual, amazing.   Dishes that are really good here: Grilled catfish and tilapia (fried is also good, not a thick batter so it's light on the breading and oil) Red velvet waffles with delish butter Cornbread is yummy Fried chicken is very good here but I always forget to bring my cholula sauce Sweet potato waffles are also good Yams are sweet if you like that, as I do! Pork chops are yummy  Enjoy!

jnPzL5HcavSbLoBwLiih5w.review_text: I wanted to like it, but was underwhelmed. It hurts me to write this but, I think Gussie's needs to figure out what kind of place it wants to be  I think I ended up paying like 15 bucks for 2 pieces of chicken, and a waffle. The chicken was great, though the portion could have been more generous. The waffle, I didn't care for. I am not from the South, but I am pretty sure that waffles aren't supposed to taste sour?   I think this restaurant ended up in a sort of awkward in between: it provides neither the culinary experience of a higher end restaurant, nor the value of well prepared comfort food.  Recommendations:  For the experience of a nice restaurant serving excellent fried chicken, I would try Farmer Brown's. For the experience of having excellent fried chicken / comfort food for a good price, I would try Farmer Brown's Little Skillet.  For a somewhat mediocre experience, you could go to Gussies.

guMPLt9MSchA38_zax_NVQ.review_text: The customer service was not good at all. I understand a person may not know how to do something but when three people do not either it is a problem. I believe the owner was their also - and she did not assist with the problem. And I feel as though all people should be treated the same way, customer service should be good to everyone especially people from the neighborhood who are trying to support the business.   The food is ok but the prices are somewhat high. I had the fried chicken and greens - yummy  Moms had the catfish- yummy   I will just keep going to Hard Knox's on 3rd Street.  This was my second time going. The first time I went they did not have any gumbo and guess what they did not have any today either. Why have something on your menu that you seem to never have.

8qhMB7cHwrEYI69LVz2Yvg.review_text: Get the Chicken and Waffles, obviously.  I'm a fan.

HgbEH3f2A0Y5ltBcRGzwJw.review_text: If you want it all, do the buffet. Make sure you are hungry before you go. You will get stuffed because everything is soooo good.

cO7c5TXiPyiZw-vX0mFZGQ.review_text: It's true!! The sweet potato waffle so AMAZZING!!!! My bf and I are definetly coming back. Service is ok. No complaints and nothing to brag about.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: I was craving chicken and waffles and decided to check out Gussies on a random Thursday night. I read the other reviews about the wait, but to my surprise, there was no one there at 8pm. No one. We were obviously quickly seated and was greeted by the nicest guy, Tyrone (?) (hard worker and a really polite gentleman). We grabbed a few beers and ordered the Uptown and Downtown specials. The wait for the food was a little bit long. We didn't mind it as much since we had time to chat. When we received our food, I was quite pleasantly surprised. The waffle was warm and perfect to the touch. Not soggy. Not over done. My breast was ginormous. I mean if this chicken had fake boobs, I was eating them. I would definitely come back when I have the craving but later in the evening to avoid the wait.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: Try as I might, the whole chicken and waffles thing is lost on me. I mean, I like both just fine ... but how they wound up in bed together is something I cannot seem to wrap my head around. Regardless, Gussie's turned out to be a pretty good weekend brunch option for the bustling (lower) Fillmore area. While I'm not Southern, hushpuppies I fully understand. They seem such a rarity in California, that I squealed with delight and started with them. My buddy went the whole chicken and waffles route (and dug it), while I opted for boneless strips. Poultry aside, I think Miss Pearl's Banana Pudding was the star of the show for me. But cockadoodledoo, I'd probably come back and try it again.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: Came to Gussie's on Sunday for a really late lunch. I heard all the hype and I love fried chicken and waffles....   We arrived and were promptly seated. Looking over the menu we decided on:   -Cheese grit cakes appetizer  -Downtown meal  -Fillmore classic  -cornbread   Our waitress took about 15 min to come greet us after we were seated. She apologized and took our order. Immediately upon ordering she thought they were out of the cheese grit cakes so she'd check and let us know. Unfortunately they were out (boo!) so we added a mac and cheese side.   So from other yelpers, I noted that it should take about 15 min for you to get your food. We waited patiently and at 15 min our server arrived with food. YAAY! But wait, its WRONG... well more like it was our neighbors food and not ours. So we kindly passed the food over to the people next door and watched them eat. Our server came by and apologized and checked our order and it was mixed up or something. So we waited.. and waited. Our server came by and gave us a couple corn breads to eat while waiting. And waiting. Finally, she comes back with our food. Now mind you I'm STARVING at this point. I dove into the chicken immediately. It was hot, crispy, thin coat of battering...but.. but... there really wasn't that much flavor. Meh..okay so I try the waffle, its not really crisp but its pretty tasty with the hot syrup.   Anyways, we ate everything (we were starving mind you) and when the bill arrived our server had comped the mac n cheese and corn breads which was totally nice of her.   Gussie's was just alright to me; I'm sure as time progresses the service will get a little better. The crowd and vibe was definitely welcoming and pleasant. If I come back I will update.

IhyAnRL3InAAG7KXcE-SJw.review_text: Never got to eat!!!  Order never came...after an hour and fifteen minutes!  We walked out...

3J23cQ96HWCCdP7N7IPfhw.review_text: I really would like a 4.5 since this is a go to spot for us.  The food is good and very filling.  We have never had a bad experience here.  Always come into a greeting and quick service.  First order sweet tea or arnold palmner  which has always been a winner to me.  The food on most if not all of the occassions have been made to order and hot. I only found the chicken to be a bit drier more than usual during the buffett, not during regular service. The staff is more than helpful and pays attention to the customers.

HorQ90eiUPfnesQlIraaJA.review_text: Hells YES!  when I first heard about this place opening (a few years ago) I was REALLY excited - then I followed the Yelp reviews and they were not exactly inspiring.  I even did not buy Groupons for this place (since when is half price bad food a good deal?).  Either they figured it out or all you negative yelpers in the past two years have been dead wrong.  We ordered strategically - if you SPLIT a 1/2 chicken and 2 waffles then it is way cheaper then 2 1/4 chicken dinners with 1 waffle each.  We up-charged (a whole $0.79 for the onion gravy) AND we ordered 2 biscuits (I am trying to find a GREAT biscuit) AND - pigs that we are -  we ordered 2 over easy eggs as well. The eggs never arrived  but frankly that was a good thing since we obviously over-ordered.  We also up-charged to the REAL maple syrup. The waitress wanted us to try the syrup they make there, so she brought that too and it was delish. The waffle flavor we chose was sweet potato and while they were not thick and crispy they were thin and soft and very yummy.  I was thinking they should offer a "waffle sampler" on their menu - i regular, 1 sweet potato, 1 red velvet.  I would order that, yes I would.  It all came to $22 bucks and we were stuffed. I will go back.  (The chicken fried steak at the table next to us looked great)

xR3Eyi4FEt1uFhu93xTpgg.review_text: This place wins for slowest and most inefficient service paired with the most mediocre food I've experienced in my 2 years of living and dining out in SF- that was probably the only remarkable part of our time here.   Sides didn't come out until the meal was nearly over and completely over. My friend ordered a side of eggs that didn't come out until he had finished the rest of his meal - and we'd already waited a long time for the mains to come out. We then had to take the corn bread to go - it wasn't ready until after our bills came.   Chicken was dry and lacked flavor, and that's probably a generous description since I was famished after running that morning and waited a good 40 minutes for a piece of fried chicken on a salad. Our long awaited cornbread (that we took home, since we didn't receive it until after the waitress had taken our bills) was fluffy but lacked corn taste and was overly sweet.   My dining companion ordered the Downtown Special that includes 1 thigh and 1 waffle. The thigh that came out on her plate was the size of a small wing. My other friend who ordered the same thing received a hefty looking thigh. Anyone in the kitchen with eyes could have seen the lack of any chicken worth mentioning on the plate, but instead of sending out a bigger piece or 2 smaller thighs, my friend had to ask the waitress if they'd brought her a wing instead. The waitress then apologized for the small size of the thigh and brought out a 2nd tiny thigh for her after another 15 minute wait.   It seemed that any request we made took at least 15 to 20 minutes to complete. We had to flag down someone who wasn't our waitress to run our cards because our server disappeared after giving us the bill.  Would be better off braving the wilds of Oakland, or even going to Popeye's (down the street) for fried chicken instead.

iY6kcazlSZKYxOvDbJ652w.review_text: I am a big fan of soul food, so I am picky when it comes to restaurants who serve it. That said - Gussie's is all that and a bag of chips! The chicken and waffles were definitely good, albeit I prefer my chicken a little more seasoned, but it was juicy and hot so not too bad. The sweet potato waffles on the other hand were off the hook! I was expecting to just have a hint of sweet potato flavor in them, but they actually put sweetened pieces of them throughout the whole waffle. The sides were very tasty as well, and the peach cobbler was steaming hot (sadly they were out of ice cream so no a la mode, but it was late), scrumptious and HUGE! I will be sure at least a couple others are willing to put in some work to help me finish this when I come back again. All in all a great soul food/chicken spot.

kH8U9G5ntTTWT-wLjaEv1Q.review_text: Sooo good! I came here with my boyfriend, who is very critical of soul food because he grew up eating it. So I was a bit hesitant to see his reaction to the taste of the food. It was a little busy, but we sat ourselves and were immediately given waters and menus. My boyfriend got the Southern Plate, which consisted of greens, mac n cheese, fried chicken, corn bread and yams. The yams! They literally melt in your mouth. I've never been too big on yams, but these are delicious. My boyfriend didn't let me pick anything else off his plate because he devoured it. He LOVED their mac n cheese, and the greens. I got the chicken and waffles, oh and it wad good too. The waffles were big and fluffy, almost like a pancake. The fried chicken was cripsy and seasoned so well that the flavor ran through the whole piece of chicken. Every single bite had flavoring. We also shared some catfish nuggets, which had the best breading I've ever eaten. Overall this place is awesome, and I have been recommending it to all my friends.

-hglmyO39C8DLxBgt798kA.review_text: I've only been once & enjoyed the food very much ! I ordered the chicken omelet, homestyle waffle (I think that's the name), & a strawberry milkshake. The waffle was to die for & I absolutely loved the omelet & milkshake.. Plan on going back soon ! Love it !

sxzi_lSDZfYT3K8c83MTiA.review_text: Probably the most decadent breakfast I've had since moving to the city.  The Downtown- two chicken thighs and a waffle - was excellent and reasonably priced.  This is a quality neighborhood spot offering exactly what's in its name.  It was quiet when I went in and the service was good.

oQhZez4nAwXH0kutnpULfg.review_text: I usually make a stop at Gussie's on Tuesday since they have the 2 for $2 deal plus it's literally a stop before my apartment.  The fried chicken wings is usually all I get here since they are cheap (2 big wings for $2 bucks) and I'll wash it down with the Gussie's Backyard Special (Miller High Life). I have to say, the wings are awesome and they taste even better with a little Crystal hot sauce that's conveniently on every table. The staff are all very friendly and there's usually a game on the TV in the small bar area.

lvTDfYZPIFXFDvT6ndhplQ.review_text: Came here with a groupon, and got the Sweet potato waffles w fried chicken (well, of course).  So freaking delicious. Their biscuits were great and their waffles weren't too sweet, and just pristine.  Would come again....I think I saw a recent groupon for this...

GzkYuc453MSS-BKSCDwYiA.review_text: Went there for Mother celebration with my mother-in-law on 5-12-2013 .  When we sat down, they told us it would only be brunch buffet. We got there at 10.30.am We They are suppose to be famous for their fried chicken and waffles (hence their restaurant name)  but  the fried chicken which was dry, the grilled chicken with rice was good, everything else was so so.... edible not remarkably good.  What really irritated us the most was that brunch was $28.00 per person, $10 per child, we had 4 adults, there was no way we even came close to a $28.00 value, unless you can eat $28.00 worth of fried chicken. AND the waffles was MIA meaning they didn't have it as part of the buffet, instead when we asked about it, it was an additional $4.99 per order. Drinks are not included in the buffet (which they didn't tell us either), for that kind of gauging, they should have thrown in the waffles and drinks and omitted something else from the buffet selection.   Service was okay, servers were nice. But the overall feeling was that we were being nickel and dime and needless to say we're extremely disappointed and would never recommend them ever.

pznaaB3gyEeky-NUDeEpDA.review_text: My brother Kiko is visiting California for the first time, so I'm showing him all around SF. On his second morning here, I decided to take him to Gussie's, which a good friend had told me was really great. And I *REALLY LOVE* fried chicken. What can be better than some fried chicken with a waffle for breakfast?  After walking past the "Painted Ladies" in Alamo Square, we meandered down to Eddy and Fillmore. Found the place and though it was pretty empty at 9:40 am, there were two tables occupied with happy customers. It started to get much busier when we were done eating.  The menu has a nice variety of breakfast items, sandwiches, salads and, of course, waffles with chicken. My brother got the special with eggs and spicy sausage, which I tried and liked. My waffle and chicken (I chose to get thighs) was just scrumptious.  With all that, some very friendly service and very reasonable prices, Gussie's gets five stars from me. Now I want to go back and bring my partner next time. Yum!

OaDB5jnfhIcRSQzSrAUdBA.review_text: We came here before going to a concert based on a recommendation from a friend.  We ordered the grit cakes and everyone had some portion of chicken and waffles.  I must say that the wait for food was really long (party of 3), which was worse given that we were all hungry.  This made us frustrated, but was also forgotten after we got our chicken and waffles.  This was my second time having a dish like this and I must say that I would go back.  They werent the BEST waffles I ever had, but a combination of chicken, syrup and waffle in every bite was definitely tasty.  Regarding the service, it was great, which we especially considered due to long wait time.

uYMqqMZ8KiWi0LtJ2gie0g.review_text: I went in for breakfast on Sunday and was very happy with the experience. The food was tasty and the portions were large. I brought home leftovers that I ate a couple hours later. The service was excellent. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful with suggestions on what was best to order. I will defintiely come back. Perfect hangover food!

lKYm3FSl_OrODg21SAL5mw.review_text: nice clean place for brunch!    ordered the cornmeal waffle with fried chicken.  not sure if they gave me the cornmeal waffle; didn't get the nutty texture.  the waffle was very good and aromatic from the butter when it was warm though.  chicken was seasoned well; got the leg and thigh.  thigh was a bit dry but the leg was super moist.  also tried the "taste of the south" was ok; sides was nothing  spectacular.  didn't really care for the greens and the sweet potato was way too sweet for my liking.    overall, i would come here for my comfort fixing.  they have many options and looking forward to try their red velvet waffle!

ptRB8cVAcfQshuBpz0x8HA.review_text: I may be inside of this chicken and waffle paradise, this palace of poultry and floury vacillation right now sampling said savory bonne bouche or as the French say feeling le pain.  So until the twentieth when the doors open and I am found here passed out covered in flour and syrup lightly dusted with desperate ambition for being "third to review!"  may I just say to my potential detractors and admirers  Vous êtes une poulet avec le visage d'un gaufre  and I love you.

Tmth83IGTTxKyxtLBGnMAA.review_text: It's a really mediocre place for Chicken and Waffles. Chicken was crispy but lacking on flavor. It's interesting they have Sweet Potato Waffles but I really can't tell the difference between that and their regular waffle! My date had a sweet tea and it wasn't overly sweet which was nice for a change.

PIr6TcL4NY5RGH5xKLPfag.review_text: The only reason they didnt get 5 stars is because I was only able to go for breakfast. If I had their dinner sides ( greens and  mac n cheese) Then I couldve formed a more rounded opinion. Lets start with those wings. They were not greasy (Thank you lord) Seasoned but not too seasoned. And cooked perfectly. Next, the grits. This is a deal breaker for me. If you cant cook grits then you cant cook soul food. I didnt have to do anything at all to my grits. They came out of the pot just right... Thank you ladies, you are a blessing : ) Oh yes my hubbie had the chicken and waffles. I wasnt even thinking about chicken and waffles but when I tried his waffles I got jealous. They were great. They had a little extra flavor to them. No offense Gladys K. But I think you can take notes from Gussie's.They put soul into their waffles. Thank you so much Ladies. It was hard to find good simple food in such a lovely city but when I did... perfection.

SnW3DwEKu_LWeuYnS1AMaw.review_text: Parking- got lucky, some one was leaving as I was circling the block ( street parking, feed quarters)- $1.25 for first hr. Not the best area in town  Service- we were early, not a problem, not too busy...  Food- must try the chicken and waffle Chicken lack flavor in the batter, but the wing look like they were on steroids Waffle wasn't bad, a little thin, but the syrup was yummy- home made I heard Home fries, we're pretty tasty Yes the 'downtown' on the menu, lack the piece of chicken, the thigh was tiny and I think they were out of chicken leg, so she had to get thigh? Sorry forgot to take pics...

-ofNePOSDZNWAfxiwz2lJA.review_text: Friday night, 7 pm, dinner for two we were seated immediately. We ordered right away, although our appetizer arrived at the same time as our entrees.  I guess I'm not surprised since the restaurant is only a couple of weeks old.  The service was good and our waiter was pretty attentive.  There was a couple sitting next to us and it seemed like they were waiting forever for their food, only to find out that "we're all out of ....., sorry."  Well, at least they comped them on some alcohol!  We ordered the catfish nuggets, which were really salty even for my taste (and I like salt!).  I was slightly disappointed with the sweet potato waffles.  It was way too soft and might as well have been a pancake.  The sweet potato flavor along with cinnamon and nutmeg was nice, but a tad bit overpowering.  The homemade warm brown sugar syrup was a nice touch though.  The fried chicken was probably the highlight of the meal, although the wings aren't as good as J's Pots of Soul.    I think we'll be back and let the restaurant marinate a bit.  Hopefully by our next visit they've read up on all the yelp reviews and I can at least re-review and add another star.

YqjPLqcO2__HBGh3qE_hxw.review_text: I know from good soulfood and service.  This place rocks, and wil become my new Sunday staple.  We arrived on a Sunday around 1pm, and only waited 5 minutes for a table to open up for us.  The waitstaff was welcoming and warm, the food well flavored and great portions. The decor was also impressive.   Having been raised in a family originally from Hattiesburg, MS, I have high expectations for what good sould food should taste like, how the seasonings should blend, etc.  This is the first time since moving to SF 10 years ago that I was not disappointed by the food at a sould food restaurant.  I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants soul food the way it's meant to be done.  Can't wait for my return next Sunday.

aYtU2rIsPZ1v63T66EGqIQ.review_text: The fried chicken was good, crispy skin that was not overdone or too oily & the meat was juicy. The sides were ok but the greens were way too salty for me. The chicken deserves 3 stars but the service was a diners nightmare. We sat at a table without any recognition for a loooong time. We didn't get drinks until after our food was there & after asking twice for drinks. They didn't give us the cornbread that came with our meals until we asked for it twice, the 2nd time we asked for it in a box to go & it arrived on a plate, we finally got a box & got out of that disappointing mess.

sOKGlPSdwcYHL_mpJJxN0A.review_text: The food is usually good. However, the fish wasn't cooked all the way. I ordered the fried catfish and grits. They brought out a fresh piece and the fish still wasn't done. Terribly disappointed.  The waffle was hella good. Also, my hubby said his piece of chicken tasted okd like fish grease. Not good.

W5d-Nx2T2OtOECRBNUbqqA.review_text: i read a few reviews and am agreeing with a few points here:  1. waffles are soggy 2. syrup is watery  but, i feel, this sogginess is just part of how Gussie's does their food. I'm not saying what a waffle should or shouldn't taste like. To me, there is nothing wrong with a soggy waffle. if you want it less soggy, use less syrup.  so soggy it is. and delicious it also is.  watery syrup - fork out an extra washington and get the real stuff.  i had the sweet potato waffle w/ chicken, side of egg overeasy and a biscuit smothered in grav.  4 stars, all levels satisfied

8Rxyfu4f0rY790QaO9hAgg.review_text: Came here craving some fried chicken for breakfast.  Didn't want KFC and wasn't in the mood for Hard Knox, so came here.  My second time here.  First time was forgettable, so I figured I'd give this place a second chance.  I had the Gussie's SF special  - came with a HUGE chicken breast and a drum stick, 2 eggs, home fries and corn bread.  The first bite of skin from the breast was great!  Flavorful and COOKED.  Key word is COOKED.  After that, it was all downhill.  This HUGE breast was not cooked on the inside.  Second bite was chewy and required a spit out.  As I cut deeper, I noticed the inside was red and uncooked.  Not cool Gussie.  Not cool at all.  I told the waitress who was happy to take the plate away and give me a brand new plate with all new food.  That was fine except the damage was already done.  Even though the replacement plate was fine, I could not get past the fact that my first breast was uncooked.    That said, the cornbread was average.  The homefries were average.  The drumstick was average.  The Diet Coke was above average, but simply because I used it to wash the uncooked taste out.  Overall, I expected more.  Service was great, however.  My server was very nice, attentive and willing to make things right.  I wish that the service was able to make up for the food, but alas, it did not.  Wish I had KFC instead.

RFuMyqihKYlTKx8SNAjrVw.review_text: I can't believe I forgot to Yelp Gussie's.  I wonder if that's a bad thing...  Overall, not a bad start from this lively little joint. I thoroughly enjoyed my dish, which was the cornmeal waffles with 2 pieces of dark. There was quite a wait for our food (40 minutes, I think, by companion Noah's timing) but I won't hold that against them since they were just starting out when I ate there. To make up for the wait, our server comp'd us free drinks and an order of the cheesy grits cakes, which were very tasty.   Overall, the waffles were a bit tough, but tasty, and the chicken well-seasoned and moist.

Au0Gom7T-OhvGzmfL_uLXA.review_text: Sweet potato waffles! Fried cheese grits! Cornmeal waffles! All great and the service was excellent. I can't give it 5 starts because the prices are out of line with what they serve. Doesn't mean I won't be back, I will. However, my fellow yelpers, be aware of the prices before you go.  And I have to say; you should go at least once, even if the prices keep you from returning.

oVNRKqULENBLMel45oHwig.review_text: Oh, wow. After much fuss about where to go to breakfast, we finally landed here. One of the boys was having a terrible weekend and it was only 9am Saturday. So M and I slowly make our way out the door and to the 31 and our friend hops on a couple stops later. I was a little leery, I wanted to go to my usual place and get french toast and bacon, no bus required. But, I was so glad we went there. I inhaled my banana pecan waffles. My mouth is watering as I write this. M had two's company, perfect scramble, awesome home-fries, and I was denied a piece of his fried chicken. Our buddy got Southern Comfort, he was sososo happy, glad we "trekked" over for him. We'll be back.

yeQEg3jzLEDKJhsQGJrKTw.review_text: they must have new cooks because the food wasn't the same like it was in 2012  catfish- too salty mac and cheese- bland and dry chicken thigh- small banana pudding- was white???  idk whats going on but please get better cooks, i love this place and i was highly disapointed and came all the way from sacramento to eat dry bland salty small food.

Wmh9vK9LX-sxeuTb6vzM2A.review_text: I'm from Atlanta, so I'm always down for Chicken and Waffles and this place does it pretty well. The chicken is fried perfectly, the waffles were a bit soft but really tasty. We also got the side sampler, super cheesy mac & cheese, super sweet yams and collard greens.  The potato salad I could leave.    Service was great (although we did go at an odd time, around 4:30 on a Sunday) and I would definitely go back!

LRTC_Gl63vsOjnhJtPyZXQ.review_text: We tried this restaurant because we got a Groupon and also because we like Southern food.  The service is friendly.  We did not waited long for ordering, food, or check.  They filled the drinks often.  The food is good.  Everything seems good.  We had chicken, waffle, scramble egg, fried liver, fried fish nugget.  All are good but nothing spectacular.  I was jokingly comparing the chicken with KFC and my kids things that they are comparable, but I think that their fried chicken is a little better than KFC.  The only thing is the restaurant feels "old" or a bit "dirty".  It is just not the upbeat ambient.  I can't pinpoint the problem but just something is not right.

UWDGFn3hbDRL34Q3GaOodA.review_text: So....I work for a fitness company which shall be unnamed. While sitting at our table, waiting for our order to be taken, who do I see? A coworker! She wasn't sitting at a table close to mine...she was a server! I see her everyday, yet she has neglected to tell me she works here. Small world?  I ordered the 2 piece dark meat special with waffles, gravy on the side. The chicken is good, skin is crispy. The waffles with butter were delish. The butter melted through the first waffle, right through the second waffle, leaving a puddle of butter on the plate. Yum. The gravy on the other hand, had too much of a seasoning...can't point my finger on it. But, I would have liked a more simple gravy to complement the spices in the fried chicken.   I'd definitely come back again, but this time I want to try the cornmeal waffles.

ddX-WlnqPRny43OrtSKoCw.review_text: just 3 stars for the food +   1 FATTY STAR for the DJ spinning solid 80s/90s/early 2000s groovy RnB & hip-hop.  girl, i was swaying around with chicken in my mouth.  my table ordered:  fried okra chicken livers 1/4 chicken with OG waffles 2-piece chicken with sweet potato waffles 2-piece chicken with red velvet waffles  the fried okra came out late (they gave ours by accident to another table), and was taken off the bill. that was a real nice gesture, methinks. it was slimy, as expected, and lacking in flavor, which was disappointing. the accompanying dipping sauce didn't do much to help this appetizer. meh.  chicken livers - i could've devoured this all on my own. and then some. i just love me some chicken liver.  the fried chicken was good, although not exactly crazy amazing. definitely could've been better. big pieces of chicken though, so that's a plus point.  OG waffles were alright, sweet potato waffles left me sad, and the red velvet waffles made me sadder. maybe i just had stupid high expectations, who knows. i wanted to  be mind-blown by the sweet potato waffles. i expected the red velvet waffles to be orgasmic. we all finished our food, more or less. i happily consumed the extra waffles forked on to my plate, but it was imma pig, moar food moar food type happy, instead of HOLY SWEET MOTHER OF ALL WAFFLE THINGS, THIS IS LOVE IN MY MOUTH type happy.  oh well. bumping tunes, perfectly fried livers, and decent chicken. it goes.

SH3ADE35aTdm-t24h3aTrA.review_text: It was a great place for some chicken and waffle satisfying those soul food cravings!!! The place is new so everything was nice and clean, which was very nice!!! The price of their food very economical for the amount you get, so that's a plus for me =)

s6CngB4BzBQiS_v_IWEf2g.review_text: This place gets packed, busy, and food can take a while to arrive. That being said, the food is alright - but I've never had the chicken. I've ordered the fried catfish platter and their vegetarian combo plate. A bit pricey for my liking, but only because the food didn't par. Collards were more sour than I prefer.  IF you do come here, get the Red Velvet Cake. That is worth the trip to Gussie's.

QBR3sHbFZE18SIS8DisUlQ.review_text: I was really excited for this experience because I never had Chicken and Waffles before, but I was let down.  I made a reservation online and thought it would be breezy to get our seats when we got there. However, we had an additional guest on that day with our group and though the staff was nice enough to try to accommodate us, we still had to wait half an hour for our seats which I thought was okay since we had one more person than stated on the reservation.  Then it went down hill; after ordering, we had to wait another half an hour to get our food. During the whole time, our server didn't even bother to refill our water. When we finally received our order, we had somehow got another Macaroni and Cheese and was billed for it too (we tried getting our servers attention but she was nowhere to be found). The food was also not very warm, but it was pretty good aside from the chicken being slightly salty. The waffles were delicious (but not as good as Belgium Waffles) and big while their side orders were good but very small.  I wish I had a better experience.

KcqGPO71V-e4hEz_w7xjYQ.review_text: Service was ok.. BUT food was AMAZING!!!!!! I wish I lived closer.. I would be there more often!!!

9ZdOmO3di8kTWjjnOvQdiA.review_text: Ordered through eat24. Chocolate Kahlua cake =)

lBEY7JNJUdRwhlIMxcBNvg.review_text: I'm going to make this quick. Ive been here twice. The first time, i thought well the Chicken was descent ill try them once more - BAD MISTAKE. Do not come here unless you have lots of time to just WAIT. Wait to be seated, wait to order, wait for your food tome, wait to get a refill, wait to pay. Its absolutely awful. I could see if the food was screaming good... nah i couldn't. Even if the food was the best, I would never come back here again. The sides, mac-n-cheese, red beans, greens, and sweet potatoes are terrible tasting, like my little niece cooked them. The chicken is descent, but you may get one warm piece and one cold piece. The sweet potato pancakes.. well I cook them better than they do, and i use a box! The catfish fritters, well those were actually very tasty, but not worth coming back for. I rather eat at McDonald's. Oh... did i mention they not clean either... Sorry Gussie, you have been CUT!

hBWjzWqUVEVv0BL-TVQZdQ.review_text: I'm an overall satisfied customer... I only had one issue when I was pregnant... I continue to go back cuz they have Groupons... I'm an avid Grouponer!!! I was just made aware on Sunday that my Groupon is good any day and time of the week except Sundays before 4pm.... Food is pretty good otherwise...

bst8N1OKxwhdRoskSoZYxA.review_text: I'm all for chicken and waffles and enjoy trying restaurants that serve the combo, but when your restaurant's specialty is this, I have great expectations and unfortunately Gussie's did not have me wanting to come back for more.  Met with some colleagues at the restaurant for lunch. Surprised of the short staff, especially with it being the lunch peak, but I guess since they also serve an all-you-can-eat buffet, the need to have more staff on hand was not needed.  I disagree because they still offer ordering off the menu.  I ordered the thigh and 1 waffle.  Was brought a drumstick with my plate, but was brought a thigh 10 minutes later.  Now I give the chicken 5 stars; it was juicy and fried to perfection.  The waffle on the other hand..  I give 1 star.  It was so flat, it looked like a pancake and no special taste to it, so was pretty disappointed.   Overall, I'd say if you do planning on eating here and you're looking for good, fast service for lunch, go for the buffet and stick to the chicken.

fgkJ6KUlrmbKyLDQervxsw.review_text: What's better than chicken and waffles? Chicken and sweet potato waffles. That sweet potato waffle had the perfect amount of spice, brown sugar, and Southern love. There needs to be a better option to accompany the waffles than just two tiny fried chicken wings. Take a pass on the baked macaroni and cheese, which seemed like it had been sitting out for a while. The service during lunch was abysmal. There was just one waitress and one busboy working a section of the restaurant. They forgot our honey cornbread and left us waiting both for a menu and to pay our check. If you can look past the service, the sweet potato waffle (perhaps with a breast, thigh or leg) is worth checking out.

M4OZcoLHydGc-M5TTE5Qpg.review_text: I like the gumbo soup, and I like that this restaurant uplifts the corner of Fillmore and Eddy streets.  It's on the pricey side - especially for the waffles, which don't seem that much better than Eggos.  But this place is cute, neighborhoody, and unique.  The red velvet cupcakes look amazing - I plan to go back to try one.

5fig_7-xRejtb6feMDPcjw.review_text: I expected a lot more from this place. I gave it three stars because the service was good, but we were the only people there haha! They were nice and very on top of refilling our drinks. However, the food was not what I expected. I ordered the Filmore Classic that came with three wings, two eggs, and two waffles (should've just gotten one waffle). The wings were crispy, fairly moist, but very bland. I'm not a great cook, but I could make better fried chicken. The eggs weren't anything spectacular, nothing you can't whip up in two minutes at home, and the waffles as well. The waffles were pretty big, but that's the only good thing about them. Just wanted to see what they were about, and now I know.

Nlphx7eTuAsIwAq56l42ZQ.review_text: walked in, sign says please wait to be seated. person taht works there looks at me and sees i am there but says nothing. i stand there for about 5 minutes before asking her if we can be seated. then she seats us. news flash, you work there so if you see a customer walking in SEAT THEM. DUHHH  Sit down. noone comes over for water or to greet us. This goes on for about 10mins. Finally wave the same girl down that sat us down tehre and ask if there is a server. She says she will get one. Someone comes. I thinking to myself, do not understand the simple element of greeting people and serving them?  waiting for food: takes forever. FOREVER. again, have to ask when the food is going to be up. Finally comes....  cleaniness: place is not very clean. watch your glasses. I was served a glass with someone elses lip print on it and didn't know this until it was too late! how gross.   food: actually really good.   I would never come back until they CLEAN up their act, literally and proverbially.

MnY8gGqLdlcN2kLHdyQbhg.review_text: Went on a Tues. @ 5:30 PM. Nobody there because it was 2 for 1 at Popeye's. Ordered the $1 pint of beer, and $1 wings. Also the chicken liver appetizer $6.99, and sides of collard greens, baked mac and cheese, potato salad, and candied sweet potatoes - all about $4. The chicken was crispy and tender. The sides were just good - with the collard greens being the highlight. Beer was cold. The chicken livers were awesome - fresh, tender, and full of flavor with thinly sliced onion rings on top. Huge portion of about 12-14 livers - DEAL! Service was friendly and the clientele was diverse - nice vibe.

RaX-wfAdxxHsEyqtGQXN7g.review_text: Food - 2.5 stars. Service/management - 1.  Had a groupon so decided to come here on a Friday night with a friend. Party of 2 so didn't think it would be a problem. Got there around 7pm and there was no one in front of us and a couple of tables leaving/getting cleaned up. Good thing right? WRONG. A party of three came in about 15 minutes after us and got seated BEFORE us! Host told us they didn't have a table for 2 and gave away a table to a party with ONE additional person. What if we were ordering/eating for three?! That was definitely a first for me. Pretty ridiculous. We ended up having to wait for a good half hour to be seated in the corner BY THE BATHROOM. It looked like they improvised and just shoved a table there. We were joking that they would forget about us, but they totally did. The waitress said so herself when she first came by. Lucky us.The waitress was super nice when she did come around though..so kudos to her, I guess. The table right next to us was pretty unhappy as well. One person's order was forgotten and they demanded to see the mgr. After a long debacle, I think they got some of their dishes comped, but I am sure they would agree that the management and service definitely needs lots improvement.  Food was okay. We got the Taste of the South and the CK & sweet potato waffles. The collard greens were pretty good but the ratio of greens and mac&cheese to candied yams was off. Way oo much candied yams and it wasn't separated, so everything on the plate was basically sweet and soggy. The waffles were super thin and pretty soggy. Reviews said they were fluffy so maybe we got a bad batch? I don't know. I think my over experience there was just a bad one. Would probably try other places before ever considering coming back here. Been to a few other spots, including Roscoe's and this was by far my least favorite. Maybe in a year or so, when my first time here becomes a little fuzzy. I'm sure the food here is pretty good, but definitely not worth the lack of service and inefficiency.   SORRY FOR THE RANT.

BfPrx-qMPgbbhTPox6kMkg.review_text: Sigh.  After passing by this place hundreds of times in the past year, I was finally able to satiate my cravings for southern food.  Being a die-hard fan of Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles (in Southern California), I was concerned that my dining experience would be disappointing at a new, unfamiliar place like Gussie's.   This spacious and inviting restaurant stands out in the somewhat sketchy Western Addition neighborhood.  As much as I wanted to love Gussie's, my concern was justified.    I had the Fillmore Classic -- which came with 3 chicken wings, 1 waffle, and 2 eggs.  Everything on my plate pretty much lacked flavor.  I was desperately looking for a CRUNCH when taking a bite out of the wings, but cringed when there was no CRUNCH to be found.  Not only was the waffle soggy, but it didn't help that the syrup was too watery.  Syrup is at its best when it's thick with adequate sweetness.  My recommendation?  If you have the time, cross the bridge and try House of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland.  It's no Roscoe's, but it's a star better than Gussie's.

UDhBFdmebdXuuHBLm4uXFg.review_text: the food here is really not very good.

lcHQhRbBij1y2tpKJ7SBNw.review_text: Support black owned businesses.. there aren't many left! Get the Country Style Breakfast!

-M4ZqHZDsA9vOt7UscVRpQ.review_text: Somehow I managed to go here twice in one week.  I came here the first time for dinner.  We ordered a bunch of sides to try and then we also ordered chicken and waffles.    The waffles were nothing special, but my friend had the sweet potato waffle and that was fantastic.  I also really liked the candied yams and the mac and cheese.  The chicken was good, but I like the chicken at House of Chicken and Waffles (and also Roscoe's) better.  However, neither HCW or Roscoe's is in SF so I think Gussie's wins for mere proximity.  For the not so good: I didn't love the collard greens or the grits.  I also thought the cornbread was just ok.  But those were mere blips on the landscape of an otherwise great dining experience.  The second time I came here, I went for brunch.  I got a free mimosa...already this is looking up! I had the chicken lovers omelet with the sweet potato waffles.  I basically inhaled the entire plate.  It was so good.  I brought my mom with me and she also liked her food.  Which is a good sign since she's a picky little lady.  I will be back to Gussie's.  For any meal.  It's nice to know that they also have vegan options as well for my animal loving friends.  However, I'll be over here eating the chicken and whatever else I can find.

PKPt-PE4BMQ0ZHuGnXulAQ.review_text: Sweet potatoe tater tots! WEE O WEEEEE! DELISH!!!

06VPkhNbac6QAbJ87_2irA.review_text: Alright so in all fairness I have to let you all know that when I ate there they had only been open for a week so maybe they have gotten better since. Sounding good already right?   Alright where to start....... oh yes the negative. Their famous fried chicken was really dry, the gravy was bland (tasted like water and corn starch mixture with no seasoning), and the waffles were thin and dry. They were pretty unorganized as well. There were six of us and our entrees came 3 at a time with about a ten minute gap between each. I mean our server was really nice and the cocktails were good which made up for it a little bit but the experience there was just ok at best.   I've never had fried chicken and waffles before but I know when food isn't that good. It's one of those places that you'll just have to try to say that you've been before but don't expect phenomenal food or service.

8xTNOC9L5ZXwGCMNYY-pdQ.review_text: So, I decided to have a visit to San Francisco recently to see a bunch of friends and they decided to go to Gussie's Chicken and Waffles for dinner.  This is the 2nd place I've been to which carries chicken and waffles after Roscoe's down south.  While this place will not beat going to my mom for chicken, it does carry enough high points to impress me.  From what I remembered, the service was great.  Now, because I ate out the 3 days prior, I tried what I could to really limit my spending here.  Thank goodness I did not go over my limit thought of $20. (I stopped at around $15 if I remember correctly.)  I kind of wish that they didn't bring out water cups right from the get-go because while I wanted mine without ice, there was ice in mine, and since it's San Francisco, I didn't want my water to be that cold.  So, I ended up with lemonade minus the cubes.  Figuring that I should get a vegetable, I started with the home fries and it's good that there are bits of onions because having just straight out potatoes would have soured the experience a real good amount personally.  After that, I got the Downtown Special.  While the waffle's buttermilk perfection for me, the chicken, as decent as it is, felt a bit over cooked.  If you like chicken and waffles, Gussie's is pretty ideal.  My friends and I were treated well and the food for the most part was good.  The place does have inconsistencies, but it's a place in which I can say I'm a fan of.  +: There's the great service and the food for the most part is great.  -: The inconsistencies like the chicken are problematic.

6ZCJiMYkUQqiLlCMEcX6WA.review_text: Gussie's (named after the owner's Grandmother) has lots of tasty pork-free southern style side dishes. We had the collard greens, beans 'n rice, smothered potatoes & macaroni 'n cheese (skip the mac 'n cheese, was my least fav). Waffle was excellent (I had red velvet/Hubby had plain) could have done w/out fried chicken - wasn't the worst we've had, but far from the best.    Place could definitely use some updating & a hot rag.   Parking is difficult - street/metered, even on Sundays.

rS4OEY7fWDZG_JuJjR9HWg.review_text: I never ate chicken and waffles before I came to Gussie's. Actually, I haven't been much of a fried chicken eater since I grew up and moved away from home. So I can't say I'm a good judge of this particular cuisine, but I definitely enjoyed my meal here... I had the Fillmore Special, which is one classic waffle with three fried chicken wings and scrambled eggs. The waffle was great; their home-made brown sugar syrup can kick Aunt Jemima to the curb... Actually, I like it better than the organic Maple Syrup I get from the Farmer's Market, it's that good. The chicken is awesome, not too greasy, nice texture and crunch but succulent and juicy on the inside.  I'm not sure whether I'm happy that this place is around the corner from my house, it could become an addiction!

nNmu18mfl-NJAKaB085oxQ.review_text: Yes yes yes and more yes.....!!!! Gussies is I believe, our new favorite southern joint in SF.  Those Collar Greens were in my dream last night I think.. Dancing around with sweet candied yams AND GUMBO!  Places like Gussie's remind me that life is Grand.   A little on the pricy side... But damn if it's not worth it. Next time I will have to try the Buckwheat Waffle.

LKcFo8BfF0EyrhP6wb5Uow.review_text: Ok, we were worried about the wait, since so many were complaining. We sat ourselves since the sign said to do it.  We got our menu right away.  Our order was taken in uder 5-7 minutes.  Our  food came out in about 15-17 minutes our appetizers came out in 7-10. ..... maybe beacuse we had "YELP REVIEWS"  in plain view on our mobile devices?????  Our waiter apologized for taking too long with a smile.... no complaints from us...  I did notice a couple next to us were almost forgotten... I noticed it took A LONG TIME for everything... The very same waiter who took our order pretty much forgot about them and another table looked like they they were looking around for their waiter and looked irritated!  Anyways we got lucky.  The waiters did stick out ALOT... it really does look like they have ZERO experience in waiting tables.  SUPER very nice people though.  They were talking amongst themselves trying to figure out things.  They were also taking to friends (customers)... giving hugs..etc This ruins the flow of the business.    Now to the food... WE LIKED IT!!!  We devoured pretty much everything.  The gravy.. at least for me was the key.. I dipped everything into it.  We will definately come back.. have our YELP APP  out reading reviews:D  Honestly they should just hire one or two experienced energetic waitresses.. there's plenty in SF who can keep the service in "rythm"...  A good example of this is HARD KNOX (kinda similar food) on Clement.. they have two or three EXPERIENCED waitresses... place is packed and things are moving..    BTW... the live music was enjoyable.

P3usQcIegPCl-cdH4IDirg.review_text: I lived in LA for years, and loved Roscoe's. I mean, LOVED Roscoe's. So this seemed like a legit local option.  But it was just so-so in every area. The food was okay, I enjoyed it, but it didn't knock my socks off. The music playing was bizarre, Top 40 music in a soul food restaurant just seems, somehow off.  And I'm not sure what I was expecting, but considering the type of food, it was weird that too-cool-for-school mustacheoed twentysomething white hipsters were the only employees here. But then again, it IS San Francisco.

0CaycNoMFFXZSnSr1p3rRg.review_text: FINALLY OPEN! I ate from here tonight! I got the 1/2 fried chicken with two waffles to go. As I walked home eating a waffle and a chicken wing, I tried to remember to be mindful of not eating the entire meal because the SO was waiting for his share.   The waffle is soft and crepe-like and the fried chicken was fantastic. The chicken coating was crunchy and the flesh was moist and delicious. It would have been nice if it came with biscuits or fries or something, but 1/2 fried chicken and two waffles ($18) was enough for two people.   One thing to be aware of is that they just opened and the place is a madhouse because everyone is really excited to eat here. The staff is nice and efficient, but they are still figuring things out. Have patience and you will be rewarded.

vn8nPLA7J_GkHEiW5vEmbA.review_text: Remember that Sunday when the 49ers were playing the Saints?  It was a beautiful Sunday morning.  The BF, Marina and her BF made plans to meet up at a sports/dive bar.  We would bring the food, they were to squat on a table.  We tentatively agreed on BBQ with lots of fixings.  And we bought said BBQ.  But was that enough for me?  No.  Since the BBQ place was in the area, we took a little walk while waiting.  We walked right around the corner and into Gussies!  There was a decent amount of people in here having brunch.  It was a bit dressy.  The host was wearing his Sunday best beige and tan outfit with reflective sunglasses.  It reminded me a little bit of Paris Hilton circa 2003.    We ordered two pieces of chicken and two biscuits.  Again, the BF is not a morning person (at noon) because even though the cashier and I repeated "breast and thigh" back and forth several times, he thought he heard "wing and thigh."  The fried chicken was seasoned very well.  It had some spice, savory salt, very delicate breading and no more skin than necessary.  I saw a Man vs. Food episode where some fried chicken places took the effort to remove excess fat and skin.  This attention to detail helps elevate a good piece of fried chicken into a delectable morsel of sin-inducing protein.  The chicken peeled off the bone easily.  The crust was beautifully golden tan with flecks of spice on the surface.  The chicken was not greasy.  This indicates that the frying oil temperature was meticulously maintained during the hot oil bath.  Small batches.  Or huge tub of oil.    Was it tenderized in a buttermilk bath overnight?  Was it touched by an angel with high cholesterol?  The world may never know.

Xa8zPgWV5DKO0n4i8w5qEA.review_text: This was my second visit to Gussie's.  Why did it take me so long to come back? This place is so goooooood!   After reading the reviews I came across their red velvet waffles. I ordered a side waffle and my friend and I immediately feel in love with it. The cream cheese butter and pecans just added a special touch to these perfect waffles.   My friend ordered the fried pork chops and before we left she wanted to go back in the kitchen and slap the cook. The food was that good!    They offer mimosas in different flavor for $6. I went for the Pomosa which is champagne (really sparkling wine) pomegranate juice and orange juice.   Our server was very attentive and friendly. Service was on point. The place wasn't really packed  at the time. But you got the feeling that everyone was enjoying their food and company.

8l3_ADt0hNAW3yEoorjQrA.review_text: Good food.  Kinda pricey.  They serve High Life!  I came here during a moment of weakness.  I was starving after a workout at the Fillmore Club One across the street, and friends tweets of Chicken and Waffles from Vegas made me focus in on Gussie's.    It wasn't very busy inside, and I was able to seat myself right away.  It took quite a while for somebody to finally come and take my order, but service improved from there.  I went with the two piece chicken (thigh and leg) and cornmeal waffles.  I also asked what their Gussie's Back Porch Brew was like, and my waiter gave me a giant smile and said "It's like Miller High Life."  Who makes their own version of High Life??  It turns out that probably no one does, and it was actually Miller High Life itself.  Luckily I like it, and I ordered one.  I also ordered a side of Mac n Cheese.  I got my food all piping hot.  I tried the mac n cheese first, and wasn't disappointed.  Fresh, cheesy, with plenty of pepper, which is a rarity for me.  Good stuff.  The chicken was fried perfectly, with plenty of spices in the skin, crunchy, while still maintaining some juiciness on the inside.  The waffles were a bit on the thin side, but there were two of them ,with plenty of butter and syrup.  They aren't nearly as good as the cornmeal waffles at Brown Sugar Kitchen, but thats a whole different ballgame as over there that's one of their big specialties.  I also asked for a side of gravy for my chicken, and it came free of charge, but it wasn't very good.  It had a bit of onion in it, but not enough, and the flavor mostly came from salt.  =/  The food came with decent portions, and I still had the drumstick and some waffle to take home, as well as a bit of mac n cheese.  I enjoyed my meal, but it was pretty pricey.  With tip, my bill for just me was around $25.   I might come back again, but probably not for a while.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: This place is better than the last place Powells.  The fried chicken is ok.  The waffle here is the star.  Farmer brown little skillet has the better fried chicken but gussies has the better waffle.  The need have chicken and waffle sex to make the ultimate chicken and waffle combo.

9oAk1mL3fzC_2ixGcSkp3g.review_text: I have never been a believer in breakfast food should be eaten in the morning, dinner food should be eaten in the evening, and mixing the two would be a sin against God. To me, good food is like good sex, it's good pretty much anytime, anywhere. So when I came to Gussies, having smothered liver and fried chicken with sweet potato waffles, Mac & Cheese, biscuits & gravy, and grits & eggs made perfect sense. That being said, I enjoyed having a mix of salty, sweet, buttery, cheesy goodness all on the table at the same time. I knew I wouldn't be walking out of the restaurant.. I'd be rolling out of there. A nice place to go in the jazzy neighborhood of Fillmore district.

pabyMQFTaKbNGMlB4TD9uw.review_text: I been here several times and the food is always great. It's always the same guy who helps us too I don't know his name but he is a real gentleman and made sure to check up on us constantly. I really like the red velvet waffles soooo good. Today I ordered something different, fried catfish, collard greens and Mac and cheese. The collard greens were to die for. I loved it. The Mac and cheese was previously cooked but still okay. The catfish was fresh and delicious. My boyfriend ordered the chicken wings with red beans and rice, pretty tasteful. The only complaint I had was the sweet tea and lemonade we ordered had a funny strong taste to it so we just changed it to sprite lol. Not a big deal though. The food is great and big portions for reasonable pricing!

sAb47uEcSjK3uQcylhkhPw.review_text: Am I the only one that doesn't think highly of chicken and waffles?  I love waffles and I love fried chicken; just never together.  I wanted to check out this place hoping that it would be better than Roscoe's.  I thought it was just Roscoe's itself that I wasn't a big fan of, but after my visit here, I came to realize that I'm just not a fan of chicken and waffles.  I got Gussie's famous "Sweet Potato Waffles" and my boyfriend got the "Taste of the South."  Both entrees were huge in portions.  The chicken was lightly breaded and it was pretty good.  The mac & cheese was "eh" but the candied yams was deliciously sweet.  The biscuit wasn't fluffy or flaky but rather dry; however, I love their cornbread.  It was soft and moist.  Also, the OJ was really good - freshly squeezed.  As for the waffles, I couldn't taste the sweet potato.  It tasted like any regular waffles but the only difference was that it was darker in color.  I came to the conclusion that the reason I don't like chicken and waffles was solely due to waffles.  I'm very particular about my waffles - I want them big, thick, crispy and Belgium!  Both Gussie's and Roscoe's could not deliver that.  Although I was disappointed with my waffle, the food was okay overall.  I saw that they had "Southern Style Red Velvet Cake" so I ordered it.  I was even more disappointed.  It was bland, dry and tasted nothing like cake or red velvet.  I'll definitely won't order it again.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again, but only for the chicken and I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.  P.S.  My friend Linda N. ordered Sprite and it was flat.  Plus, this place looks pretty upscale for a chicken and waffle place.

Q74P631IYeOccxGQwPY43A.review_text: Really tasty food that is reasonably priced. Staff is friendly and the wait times are generally long. They often have fun promotions and nice buffets.

n0hvaX-zSSuODQ9XOCSq9g.review_text: I am a fan.  I love this place.  Great service, nice comfy decor, and oh so yummy food.  I got the Downtown Special (chicken thigh and waffle) with a side of candied yams.  The chicken was juicy, crisp, and not greasy.  The waffle was thin and crisp.  The yams were almost too sweet, but still great.  I also tried the sweet potato waffle and that was really good.  I'll be back, oh yes.

GiPnLT13MNM3w1YRD-uOGg.review_text: food was good especially the syrup for the waffles was delicious. service was mediocre. will go again.

-wre4QAjL7k2dcdKMkemtw.review_text: I found out about Gussie's a few months ago while doing a web search for chicken and waffles. After a couple minutes of poking around on their website, I knew I'd have to check out their food. I am so glad I finally did. I walked in at 8am on a Sunday and was seated right away. My waitress was courteous and attentive (for the most part - there was a short period where I could have used more coffee, but whatever) and very helpful with the menu and specials. I ordered the Southern Comfort which is comprised of 2 waffles, 1 drumstick, 1 thigh & 2 scrambled eggs with cheddar and green onions. My order took a little while to land on the table but that should come as no surprise -- fresh fried chicken is not something to be rushed -- I'd rather have it done right than done quickly. After loading my waffles up with their whipped butter and brown sugar syrup I made my move on the drumstick. The chicken was fantastic! The lightly battered chicken was crispy on the outside and moist, tender and delicious on the inside. The waffles were lightly crunchy, sweet and super yummy. The combination of chicken and waffles was as close to perfect as possible.  All in all, my first Gussie's experience was totally positive and it certainly will not be my last.

MppPWYfLv7n5OoWDy22K4g.review_text: Gussies, I really wanted to like you because I am a huge fan of Southern and Soul food but you really just missed the mark.  I ordered the Chicken & Waffles, which should be the standard by which any southern soul food restaurant is judged by. The chicken was pretty dry unfortunately, I had to doctor it up with a great deal of hot sauce. The waffles weren't bad though!  Actually, the best dish me and my friend ordered was the fried catfish - it was awesome. Mac n cheese is good.  But was it enough? Not really. Most of the Roscoe's I been down south in SoCal do better. House of Chicken n' Waffles in Jack London Square does a better job. There's another newer "hipster" joint that does the chicken and waffles that does a great 4 star job too.  The value just isn't here. I'd eat here more often it were a bit cheaper because it ain't bad - just out of the way and pricey for what you get.  Guess the thirst for awesome chicken n' waffles continues.

x1D-rXKPVJcx9hZivLDcbg.review_text: talk about long wait for the food to arrive! we sat down 15 minutes before happy hour ends, but waiter doesnt get to us until 5 minutes after happy hour is over...   We tried the cheesey grits which was very very good =) but it took a while to get of course.   The waffles with the maple syrup was super delicious (dont know if the 1 hr wait for it to get to us was a factor but I will give them the benefit of the doubt).  waffles were very tasty! syrup: made everything taste good toO!  Now the chicken..... TINY!!! we had all 4 of us order the downtown special and the chicken was beyond dinky!! IT was dry?! Oily definitely isnt a problem but maybe a little wouldve helped.  The skin itself was delicious but so little of it! So much potential but... ehhh  The corn bread was decent , but the biscuit was not worth the trouble.  I am reading the other reviews, and it seems that Gussies' is still working out the consistency because now i am jus disappointed that I got shortchanged on my chicken. =(

yZxRl6Wp2ZSLv0Eeu9favA.review_text: It's OK. The food is noticeably better at Auntie April's, but Gussie's has much friendly staff.

5Mrhp45gnH4vSRBRxWNqpQ.review_text: Took my boo here on a date, and he was ready to leave me for Gussie! The food is always amazing, my favorite is the mac and cheese as well as the waffles. Although it took awhile for someone to check on us or even provide us with water, I still give 5 stars because the friendliness of the waiter. Coming from Georgia, I fell in love with soul food and will continue to visit Gussies

lKUy2aJhDSN_BHr3bAaMvQ.review_text: This place is very close to where our friends live. We ended up coming here to grab a quick dinner.   I have to admit that I was buzzed when we got here so I'm not sure if everything we ate was good because I actually enjoyed the flavors OR if I was just buzzed.  The chicken was good. Nice and tender and lightly battered. I don't like overly fried chicken. I had corn with my meal. The corn was a little on the dry side. The cornbread was good.   We also ordered the catfish nuggets. Those were really good. They also were lightly battered with tender catfish. Not to mention the grits cake. That was also pretty yummy as well.   Great place for having greasy food after alcohol :) I still don't know which is better... Roscoe's or Gussie's. It's been awhile since I've had Roscoe's.

LdyVNZyPl6vR0THDPw5zIQ.review_text: So my roommates and I agreed that this is a 3.5 place; we've gone to the ones out in SoMA and in Hunters Point but this place was a bit...bourgeoisie if you will. A hostess? Fancy tables? A diverse waitstaff? An all Michael Jackson place list? Almost $9 for one chicken and one waffle?   Not really used to all that...  The wait was a bit too long and our service was a bit sloppy.And she kept calling me darlin, and that is NOT okay. You are what, a year older than me!? You cannot pull off the old endearing waitress at the fatty foods restaurant, especially when you look like when your shift ends here your shift at Hooters starts. The food is pretty damn tasty but I would be a whole lot more excited if it wasn't so damn expensive. I paid like $17 for 2 pieces of small chicken, 2 waffles and macaroni and cheese. Given I have paid $5 for 2 pieces of large chicken and a waffle- this is kind of ridiculous.   Good food, weird vibe, bad prices.

H1wuEzWt0_mOi6Hn6mB8xQ.review_text: I came here and had a rather unfortunate experience. Coming in on a Sunday I expect a place to be busier than a Tuesday, but the amount of waiting which I had to do was really unexpected. The waiting began at the door when my friends and I weren't greeted for a few minutes as the host talked with what looked to be another customer. The host eventually glanced over at us and said hi and continued talking with the woman. Eventually, after a few minutes of waiting and no one else coming up to help us, the customer left and the host apologized for the wait. Then she took some menus and turned the corner to discover that the place was pretty full so she said it may be a few more minutes. As we were waiting she said we could sit at the bar if we liked. Given that we were all very hungry and are quite agreeable and easy going people, we took it. The host woman sort of acted as our server. We asked for a round of waters, and also ordered a few drinks. Over five minutes later the two drinks show up, no water. The server/host woman then sort of goes "the water" and then a few minutes later a busser brings one water to the person who didn't order a drink. We ask him for two more, they show up in seconds. The busser was the only person who seemed to do things in a reasonable manner of time. Eventually we order our food with an appetizer to start, since we were extremely hungry at this point. The appetizer never showed. When the food finally came, we didn't even have settings at the table. They forgot my friends eggs, the syrup container. Our table was never cleaned. TERRIBLE. NEVER GOING BACK.

P4oWkoyFgvFbApH7bTWytg.review_text: I like their chicken because they go easy on the batter and its seasoned well. The skin gets crispy and some of the fat renders out, a little reminiscent of the naked fried chicken you can get at a lot of Chinese restaurants. My only gripe would be that the breast was a little dry.

_yEwm5IBtpl0v8Qtaronrw.review_text: I really wanted to like this place.  I love the area and a avid fan of Yoshi's. I heard about this place and I took my staff there on a Thursday afternoon. Despite it being in the middle of the lunch hour, It wasn't busy (maybe that was an ominous sigh).  We decided to order a number of dishes that we experienced before from other places and recommendations from our fellow yelp reviewers. First off, service was bad. There was one server and a bus person, which could have been a bad thing except there was only 3 tables with 5 people sitting. The wait was not long. How was the food? Very Disappointed. The chicken was dry, Grits were soggy. Waffles were undercooked and the cobbler uneatable. House of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland is better.

QqC2q6uf-502krpgacaARg.review_text: Mrs. N and I found ourselves in the Fillmore late on a Saturday, and starving, after a cocktail party nearby.  Chicken and Waffles?  OK!  I had the "uptown" or something like that, which was a waffle with a whole fried chicken breast.  Missus N. had half a fried chicken with cheesy grits and cornbread, and I got the leg from that too!  Fried chicken was near perfect - hot, juicy, and well fried (under fried is gross).  Mixed in with melted butter and brown sugar syrup from the waffle - AWESOME!  Quite inexpensive, and the staff is very nice.

lEeQGOPZXTQUs9z8z2G-eg.review_text: I went to this spot for the first time last night and was thoroughly impressed.  I will only give it 4 stars only because I only had one meal, but it was at 5 star caliber.  I plan on frequenting Gussie's to support the new establishment and help it remain in business for years to come.  The chicken was fried to perfection.  The skin was super crisp and the chicken was tender and juicy.  That's the way fried chicken should be done.  The waffles were also executed to perfection.  Can't go wrong here.  I did ask for a cherry coke, which they did not have, but was made for me with some grenadine.  That's what I call customer service.  I plan on going here several times a month to try other items they bring to the table.  If everything else is at the caliber demonstrated by the chicken and waffles, I will surely change my rating to a 5 stars.

T1rP9rqslOh_72KI0IW7rQ.review_text: Came here two weekends ago with a friend because I'd purchased a Groupon deal. We came in the afternoon when it was mostly empty, so there was no wait. The inside is a nice, clean, sit-down restaurant.  They were out of catfish, but the waiter said the chicken was better anyway, so we both got the Uptown Special -- 1 breast + 1 waffle ($9.29).
