Our food arrived really quickly, which was great because we were starving. The waffle was fine. The outside of the chicken was crispy, but the inside was lukewarm and super dry -- so it seems like it'd been sitting out for a while, which explains why it came out so fast. It probably would've been fresher if we came when it was crowded. The breast also had the giant piece of bone in it, which was surprising, and made it really hard to eat.   The service was really good, and there was definitely a lot of chicken, but overall the quality was just lacking. I kind of want to try the catfish, and see if the chicken gets any better, but only if a friend really wants to come. 900 Grayson really needs to come across the Bay to San Francisco.

ZR23y3w8J8kBiLMEv8dv_w.review_text: mac n cheese was excellent. so were the catfish nuggets. yum yum, but waffles were rubbery and chicken was average. would return for that but the other stuff i mentioned was really good. services was friendly, they didnt get the order quite right though. expensive for what they served i thought.

YKgrNyT29bfbMKMvQnhxVQ.review_text: Yum! My date and I split our dishes and I have to say the chicken gumbo left little to be desired after it was put next to the sampler platter of a big juicy chicken breast, candied yams, collard greens and mac and cheese!  My taste buds threw a little party and I'm sure yours will too!

oKrct4Hc8hZNMYXecitLCw.review_text: I made the $10 All-You-Can-Eat Lunch hour special during the weekday as I had business nearby.  The Mac & Cheese is to die for. There was a good and wide variety selection of soul food dishes offered.  Fried Chicken and Catfish. Red Beans & Rice. Salad. Green Beans. Candied Yams. Oh yeah straight to the hips.  Since it was the middle of the day the service was not as bad as other folks. I want to come back for the brunch to try the waffles. Wish me luck.

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: First, the food. We decided that splitting one of the larger meals and ordering sides between two people was best for us, so we got the half fried chicken with 2 waffles, 2 wings (for $2 on Tuesdays), and sides of fries, honey cornbread, and rice and beans. I liked that you can specify if you want the half chicken to be all white or dark meat. The chicken was... ok.  It was decently tasty, although the seasoning didn't really stand out. It was pretty dry, which was disappointing. I found the drumsticks to be standard size but agree with others that the thighs were smaller than mutant supermarket chicken - however, the wings were substantially larger than what I'm used to. Yeah, the waffles aren't Belgian, which is fine, and they're better than eggos... but not all that much better. They seemed to have a hint of nutmeg, which was nice. I was a bit confused about the portions of the sides. The bowl of french fries was enormous and more than enough for two people, while the rice and beans came out in this tiny cup (the beans were fine but the rice below was bad - too wet and reminiscent of minute rice!). The honey cornbread was probably the best value - three large chunks of pretty tasty cornbread for $0.99! In an unexpected note, the apple juice is actually quite good.  We received outstanding service from the moment we stepped in the restaurant, when we were promptly seated, until we left (at our leisure, after the host had stopped by and chatted with us about how everything was). Our waitress stopped by very frequently and was quite polite about how long we took to order. My soda was refilled constantly, and our orders were taken down with no errors (which obviously I expect, but I'm just adding given that others have not had the same experience). Now, we were there when the restaurant was only a quarter full, so I don't know what it would be like when it's crowded.  I found this place to be immensely convenient for a pre-Yoshi's dinner, but the food was bordering on mediocre. I might go back before another show there, but otherwise probably wouldn't.

HJGq8K9MrcrjnzLlPGZsDw.review_text: The food was "average".  The service was "good".  The prices are "average/expensive".    Not complaining.  Just could had being better.

xdbm8yK3iUoAiKnZXmxzZg.review_text: I was very excited about a chicken and waffles joint opening in the city as this is the one thing san francisco seemed to lack and driving to oakland everytime you have a craving is a bit much.  I visited this place about a week after they opened and the visit was absolutely horrible.  Slow, unorganized, unfriendly and the food was not very good.  Very dissappointing!    Needless to say we decided to give it another shot, they had just opened after all.  I'm really glad we did.  The staff seems to have changed a bit and they are all very pleasant and personable.  Well at least the hostess, the host, the busboy and our waitress were.  The service is still a bit slow, but the food today certainly made up for it.  The catfish nuggets are a real treat!  Waffles were awesome and the fried chicken was nicely cooked.    I'm sure this place will need another couple of months to really get it down and when they do, I'll still be there waiting to upgrade my review to five stars!

YxG7Pg1vifo7qCjg42smew.review_text: It's very hard to find a real authentic soul food restaurant in the heart of San Francisco but gussies chicken and waffles at one point was that location to go to, and still has a potential to be that once again.  Nestled in the heart of the ever-changing Fillmore District gussies has been a cornerstone of that Community for authentic & classic soul food cuisines. Everything that you would love about soul food is here. From chicken waffles, (which happens to be a very popular item on the menu), too collard greens, catfish, red beans and rice, and even some of the best desserts. here's another wonderful surprise, if you went during the lunchtime hour, which was from 12 PM to 2 PM, you were fortunate to take part in the all-you-can-eat soul food buffet. There wasn't any restaurants in San Francisco that had an all-you-can-eat Soul food buffet. In my mind that's what put Gussies over the top and made it one of the best. But unfortunately ever since the mid part of the year 2013, the food and the quality of that food has gone down tremendously.   The first thing that stands out is the fact that they no longer offer the all-you-can-eat buffet for the lunchtime crowd. The catfish was way too salty, the red beans and rice tasted like mush flavored with beans. My favorite and most popular dish was the mac & cheese and unfortunately it's now dry and not as fresh & cheesy as it once was. Even catching deals off of the popular app Groupon, hasn't helped it to recover and go back to its once popular and glorious status.  I could've just gone in on an off day but in my head this place isn't what it used to be. Don't get me wrong the service is still great the atmosphere is still pleasant but if you're going to a soul food restaurant you want the food to stand out. And unfortunately it no longer does at gussies chicken & waffles.

rnRHFIxML6U1euZmN8UekQ.review_text: Another great find in the Fillmore area.  I love this place.  My husband and I hit this place for the first time last week. We were greeted and seated right away by a very friendly hostess.  We first ordered coffee and OJ. They were training someone new that day, and our drinks were slow in coming.  The hostess noticed this and our drinks were brought out right away, along with complimentary biscuits. These were some of the BEST biscuits I have ever had.  The hubs isn't really a bread person but he was scarfing those biscuits down too!  We both ordered the chicken wings and waffles, and wow.  The wings are seasoned all the way through - not just on the coating like a lot of places.  The wings are big too.  And the waffle was delicious.  I'd forgotten what it was like to have a regular waffle instead of the Belgium kind.  I couldn't quite place the spice that was that was in the waffle but whatever it was it was great. I will definitely be back!

ehdrFZwh1XRxzqR-6Kbg9A.review_text: I love this place.  They have some seriously great chicken.  I did not get these, but they have red velvet waffles...haha.  The normal waffles are great, and the scrambled eggs are fluffy.  The mac and cheese is also tasty. The collards are great, and my litmus test for a good place like this are the collards.  I think that was a weird sentence.  Anyway, there are some gross collards out there in the world.  Believe me.    Yum!    They also play good music in here.  I heard Curtis Mayfield and Rare Earth among other grooves.  You cannot go wrong with that.  This is why I give 5 stars.  The service is also great.

7T57z2rPCr7r49m8gI5UyQ.review_text: We were craving chicken and waffles but didn't want to venture out to the Bayview so we settled on this place. Our bored waitress could barely muster a smile when she came by to take our order and to check on us. Perhaps she was having a bad day, so I'll move on to the food. The sweet potato fries lacked sweetness on the inside along with seasoning and crispness on the outside. Our waffles were sad and thin looking. Mine even had a slight wave on the edges. If you're looking for a thick golden waffle, this is not the place! My single drumstick that accompanied said waffle was crispy on the outside but a little dry on the inside. The syrup was disappointingly thin and watery. They should have just called it sugar water instead! Had I known, I would have payed the extra cost for the maple syrup. Since I was starving, I drizzled the "syrup" all over my waffle and proceeded to chow down. The one positive aspect about a thin waffle is that the syrup soaks right through and saturates the whole thing so I can spend more time eating and less time dipping. I also noticed that my waffle had a hint of cinnamon to it which I liked. However, the next time I'm craving chicken and waffles, I'll be heading elsewhere.

GHZdMggvuYk1fsVWcyy0JQ.review_text: The good: The food here is awesome! The chicken is deliciously moist and flavorful and the waffles were yummy (not thick like Belgian waffles, but whoever heard of Belgian waffles in the South?!). The collard greens were also good (the soupiness someone else mentioned is the pot liquor, a lot of people from the south like to drink it as a special treat, or at least that's what my Southern relatives tell me).  The bad: The silverware is airplane silverware. It cuts absolutely nothing and you can barely cut your waffle with it. Even though my waffle was slathered with butter and syrup, I was tempted to pick it up with my hands because the silverware is so ridiculously unsharp. Please, please, please purchase some real knives. Did you inherit them from Powell's Place? Was IKEA having a sale on ineffective silverware? WTF?! Seriously, the safety scissors I had in preschool were sharper than Gussie's knives.  The ugly: Our server, while friendly and apologetic (name withheld since he was so nice), managed to mess up on almost every aspect of our meal. He came to take our drink orders ten seconds after we sat down. I was still taking my jacket off when he came over. Um, give us a chance to look at the menu...  Fast forward to our ordering. I suspect that he only wrote down half of what we said. I ordered an Uptown Special with a sweet tea and a side of collard greens. My friend ordered the Fillmore Classic with a side order of drumsticks. Our food arrives after a bit of a wait, I get receive the Downtown Special instead of the Uptown Special (essentially drumstick and thigh instead of a breast piece) a very obvious mistake that he should have caught when picking up the order. My friend got her order fairly perfectly but did not get her side of drumsticks until asked. Then we realize that I have butter for my waffle but she does not, and neither of us has any syrup. A little while later, I realize that I still don't have the sweet tea I ordered. He fixed all mistakes with a smile and an apology and remedied each as quickly as possible. But they're such basic mistakes. When 90% of your menu consists of waffles you should train the staff to bring the syrup out with every table order, because the chances of there being a party in which no one needed syrup would be fairly small.   Lastly, although the syrup is delicious, it is a little thin, both my dining companion and I were mislead into expecting it to be thicker and therefore pour more slowly. I ended up pouring slightly more than I would have liked, while she over poured by a lot, spilling syrup on the table. If the syrup isn't standard thickness, I think it should be served in the little metal sauce cups and be dipped rather than poured.  In conclusion, great food, bring your own silverware and don't expect good (or even average) service. Would I go back? Definitely. I wonder if they offer takeout... Food: 5 stars, Service: 2 stars.

m9MDdbP1GFVzq3qcahHSiQ.review_text: So, my hubby and I ventured out to this place while visiting the Bay Area and because we had a groupon. We arrived on a Saturday around 5pm. The restaurant had a few patrons but wasn't too packed and we decided to sit near the bar area to catch a baseball game on television. It took the guy/waiter behind the register about 12 mins to acknowledge us but the food came out really fast. Please don't ask me for the waiter's name because he didn't provide it. Now on to the food. I ordered the FilMore classic (3 fried chicken wings, waffle and two scrambled eggs). The food was less than mediocre. For starters, the waiter did not supply us with utensils prior to bringing the food out, the chicken was barely room temperature and seemed to have been sitting out for a while, the waffle was a bit spongy and the eggs were soggy! It was by far the worst meal of my entire 4.5 day vacation and we definitely won't be back! On a better note, the hubby said the fish and grits were "okay". This spot was nothing like the soul food/chicken and waffles we are accustomed too down south (New Orleans and Atlanta)

6C64f5wIUk4h9em27cL3bQ.review_text: So much of the "southern" food around here does not depict it accurately... but this place is good!! It made me miss south carolina! The grits were amazing with the bacon and eggs mixed in.

JWavPnlU6hXsXulRR45nkA.review_text: It was my first visit here, and based on other folks' reviews, I was expecting slow service and became concerned about getting to other places on time after our lunch. I was, however, pleasantly surprised at how promptly our waitress arrived to take our order after we were seated.  She was so sweet and courteous, inviting us to check out the buffet, which BTW looked scrumptious, before we decide.  Since we were short on time, and didn't actually bring a big appetite, we ordered ala carte, which actually arrived again very promptly, contrary to what some have experienced.  And the food was SO good!  The fried chicken was not greasy or overly spiced, the greens were cooked to perfection, and my favorite were the cornbread and mac n' cheese.  I really wanted to try their famous waffles, so I am really looking forward to returning for the real chicken n' waffles experience next.  Thumbs up to Gussie's!

l1goWg0qPWq2XdcDw5CIhg.review_text: Went for my boyfriend's birthday on a Sunday night around 9pm. The place was completely empty and it looked like they were trying to clean up and get out early. Thankfully they sat us and we ended up with great service from our waiter, Leo.  The food was good but obviously heavy. The catfish sliders were amazing! And I really enjoyed the 1/4 fried chicken and two waffles we shared. The red beans and rice side was pretty good but i didn't love the collard greens. Surprisingly we ended up stuffed and with leftovers. Gussie's is a little more expensive then my usual favorites but it was definitely a treat! Recommended!

OnjkIs_mK8utnpCeV6iS_g.review_text: Having just moved here from Connecticut, I have been on a mission to find a good soul food restaurant that might hearken back to my East coast upbringing. I'm so glad that my search is over, and that's all thanks to Gussie's!  My experience this afternoon was just divine. Starting with the fried cheese grits bites, with the delectable jalapeno dipping sauce right on down to the "Taste of the South" entrée. The yams were wonderfully sweet and earthy, complimented by a deliciously cheesy mac & cheese and collard greens that were dripping with flavor -- literally! The fried chicken was just superb! Initially, I thought to give a four star ranking, solely on the basis of the portion size, as I thought the sides were a tad too small, but then I had that ranch dressing! Sweet baby Jesus that dressing SLAYED me! As a self proclaimed ranch dressing connoisseur, I know a good ranch dressing when I taste it!   Don't walk, yet run, swiftly to Gussie's!

KOV-7eQchJHDWcT_3pFtOQ.review_text: The first time I ever had chicken & waffles was at the infamous Roscoe Chicken & Waffles in southern California, so I was excited to try this place that was a little bit closer to home.  I got the downtown special (1 thigh+1 drumstick & a waffle); it was good, but not extraordinary. I shared the macaroni and cheese, and that was amazing!   The only thing I remember most about this place, though, was that their metal forks were so flimsy; they bended every time I used it to pick something up.

PYzWU5txGNFQpBTsNu3pRA.review_text: hmm. i really wanted to love this place after what i had heard from friends and such, but... i didn't. i liked it, but definitely didn't love it.    i ordered the sweet potato waffles and 2 fried chicken wings. i really appreciated how much and well seasoned the wings were. Definitely an A+ given my roomie's comment that the fried breast was dry. As for the waffles, they were good - nothing blow your mind away amazing, but solid.   So with the above, you're probably thinking... um... why not 4 stars. well i docked one star off for the service. Now, the people who work there are definitely nice and you feel like you are at your homegirl's spot for post-church brunch. the problem lies in the speed and attentiveness of service. every step of our dining experience was just unjustifiably slow (the place was maybe 1/3rd full) -- from ordering, to checking up on us, giving us the bill, giving us to go boxes, etc... kind of annoying. furthermore, i just don't think the wait staff was very attentive. they got two orders at my table wrong. roomie 1 ordered a coke, and it never came, yet it was on the final bill -____-. roomie 2 ordered chicken strips and waffle fries, which was supposed to come with honey mustard dipping sauce... that also never came. we wanted dessert to share, so agreed on peach cobbler with a scoop of ice cream on top. you guessed it... the dish came out with no ice cream and only one spoon. oh .... thanks.   so yea... lackluster service and standard food. i do want to try these red velvet waffles, so will probably be back though i'm inclined to get it to go next time.

tlmv_89ARqCtJhqt0_6dAQ.review_text: I had friends visiting over the weekend from San Diego we happened upon Gussies, it was awesome.  Excellent food, great service I am so excited to know it is here in the city.  I don't have to cross the bridge to get great soul food. Mac and Cheese, yum, greens(fab), red beans and rice (lovely) yams (I am yours) Bravo

c4yOW49oQUeKs6KUU2Pblw.review_text: I forget the exact name of the dish I ordered... southern sampler or something like that. The food was good overall. I would give the food 3.5-4 out of 5 stars. I would give the service 2-3 stars. our waiter was a nice guy, when he was there. Which was to take our order and then show up and ask us if we wanted to buy desert. That was it. Never came to see if we needed anything, if we liked our food, didn't even wander by in case. I hoped he would come by because I needed a little butter. I had to ask the drink server. A more attentive waiter would have earned his tip. This guy basically got charity. Also, not impressed with the cleanliness of the bathroom. Not the worst, but not the best. I'll try somewhere else next time. Because there's going to be good food elsewhere but I'm not settling for mediocre service.

K0uWQEQMusBFFA6Z2waoCw.review_text: Good food  Fast Friendly Service. Never a disappointment.

BLeZu2pUCMqZHoGk_GjRfA.review_text: I would give this place 2.5 stars if I could, and 3 is being too nice.  I gave this place 5 stars for the first couple times I went, but it really has just gone down hill. After the water damage, they reopened with a new menu, items, etc. I would MUCH rather have the food the way it was before. I usually get the Fillmore Classic, 3 wings and a waffle. Fortunately they gave me 4 wings, but they were puny and didn't taste like much. Waffle was crispy and good. I tried their bacon gravy for the first time because the server recommended it, but the regular gravy that I used to get is better in my opinion. Bf got the Sunday's best and chose Mac n cheese and smothered potatoes. It also came with corn bread, all of which were pretty good! I also ordered an extra waffle for him. 20 minutes later our food finalllllly arrives, but not that extra waffle. We had to share my one waffle while waiting for the other one to come out. After 10 minutes, I ask for the waffle because she probably forgot. Then it took ANOTHER 10 minutes for the waffle... Just one waffle!! We almost finished our food by then. Paying was another waiting game. I asked one of the gentlemen for the check and also said I had a groupon to use, he says ok he'll tell the server. 10 minutes pass, I'm looking around for them and he comes back to the table, and I have to remind him I have a group on. He THEN tells the server and she finally comes over after a little while.  Food - 3.5ish stars Service 1.5 stars, being nice.

Ea_fdwYd13brdwrJXy7UkA.review_text: I would like to give this place higher reviews, being that much of the staff were friendly and I'm all about supporting local enterprises, however the price to food ratio really just threw me off and the two star "Meh. I've experienced better" is pretty fitting.  The menu is pretty diverse,  with 1/3 of it being dedicated to different permutations of chicken and waffles (one small drumstick one waffle $8) however the don't come with any sides and the sides are expensive as fuck. I ordered the baked Mac n Cheese which, to be fair, was awesome, but it was $5 for an amount the side of a really small scoop of ice cream, in my opinion not really worth it.  The interior design is totally akward and non-fitting, with marble counter tops and blown glass sculptures, it seems like someone just mismanaged their start up capital and are trying to offset it by charging $14 for a waffle and some chicken.  BRING ROSCOS TO THE BAY

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: Had lunch here yesterday after shopping at BKc in Fillmore so I took ninj with me to finally try Gussie's. We were excited to try their fried chicken and waffles. We parked across the street and dined in. Ninj had their lunch buffet for $10 and since he planned to take a few trips to the buffet table, then I ordered the chicken gumbo and their cajun corn on the side. I did try their fried chicken and it was okay. I was hoping it to be crispy and delicious but  sadly, I had better elsewhere (ie. Farmerbrown and 1300 Fillmore). I liked their half lemonade/half iced tea. Our lunch was more of an afterthought than memorable. I really wanted to like this place. Our server was not friendly at all, she did give me a bit of an attitude though. That's just a hell no, for me. Strike.

oSGijN6WJ3_bS99HaTk2Pg.review_text: Yeah, the chicken's good, and so are the waffles. But the gumbo was to die for. And so were the catfish sliders, the candied yams, the macaroni & cheese, and the rice and beans. The peach cobbler was amazing, too. Tons of amazingness here. All o' yous raving about the chicken and waffles need to try some more o' the menu!

teYQXnmdZyNdTb3H-56shA.review_text: I really like this place...the food was great, waffle was awesome and that hot syrup makes it even more yummy. What also made the experience good too was the server Piya I think that's how you spell her name. she was very nice and attentive. My roommate and I always go there for bottomless mimosa and chicken and waffle.

8Io3kh3e22akC6MsuMMPWQ.review_text: Underwhelmed by the chicken; I think part of it could have been the timing though (my two friends and I went a couple hours before closing). Chicken breast was enormous and made me think of steroids and GMOs but my friend says the fried pieces of chicken thigh were good. I'm glad I tried this place out but will not try to go again; the syrup and waffles were the best part for me.

ig3Gp02V3eGtZZAOajVfTQ.review_text: I'm giving it 5 stars because the service was great. However, my eggs were a little under cooked for my taste. Also, the potatoes were seasoned with way too much garlic.

eEOEaaWNbB_yV20u_4CwdA.review_text: Unless you like furry friends do not try to eat here! Went here to eat some good chicken and waffles and ended up having to leave after seeing a huge rat while using the restroom. The Health department should really do an investigation here. If you don't mind the thought of rodents around your food then by all means grab a waffle or some chicken. My personal thoughts is never again, they need to call an exterminator.

MRpRQ_CvwospIxfNZazATw.review_text: The chicken was BLAND. Although, the waffle was "okay". Each bite I took, I kept thinking about how it was in no comparison to Roscoes in LA. I think this place was a bit over-rated. Enough said.  The service was not that great--had to request for water and napkins multiple times. And it wasn't even busy!

WPogoTfrSuvzFFbeFKlCdA.review_text: I had a wonderful experience working with Gussies staff in planning a birthday party. They were willing to help out and accommodate a party of 15 and make the night special.   The wait staff was very prompt and the good was "southernly" fantastic.  We had a variety of menu items with no complaints. I personally had the uptown special with a side sampler - delicious!

imAYOsKEkHW5WOwttyp-FQ.review_text: 5 STARS for COLE and the food! When my sister and I got to Gussie's yesterday it was not that crowded so I thought we had came at the right time . We sat down I went to the bathroom, came back and asked my sister did anyone come by yet she said no just the guy with water. There were literally 4 tables including ours, with 2-3 people at each and 3 waiters and we still had not been served . We waited for about 15 minutes , trying to make eye contact with all the waiters but yet we still got passed. I'm not sure if because we were young (older than 21 younger than 25) that the waiters were worried that we would not tip or something but we were clearly being avoided.   Thank GOD for COLE!!!!!!!! He came and attended to us and was just one of the best servers I've ever had. By the end of this DELICIOUS meal (the food is always good, by the way!!!) I had forgotten the shunning we received earlier.   Thank you Cole!!!   I know waiters have set areas but just for your reference...when we sat down the table behind us was empty then 10 minutes later  a couple sat down and maybe a minute in a waiter came and took their order and brought drinks about 5 min after their order.  I will acknowledge that this is my opinion and feelings, of course I know the staff may not feel like there was no age discrimination in play and that's ok. It was just my experience .  P.S. We did in fact leave a tip for Cole! My only tip to the waiters at Gussies is : Don't assume you know the customer you never know what could happen.

D1DtY25nPkLfWq8dlJE91Q.review_text: I love waffles!!!! And Gussie's sweet potato waffles with sweet potato syrup rarely lets me down. Sometimes it comes out a bit soggy than preferred but the flavor is still delicious. I also love the mac and cheese which I smother with Crystal hot sauce.  Service is super friendly and there is one waitress I love each time but they all can be extremely slow. They need to work on better management when it comes to welcoming people in front during busy hours because the hostess does not always catch and write down everyone that's waiting and some people waiting before can get skipped and then really upset (Not me though! =D)

O57CSa4pf-mZtkAyQBviqg.review_text: Food was ok. I have had better friend chicken. Service was horrible and for the reason alone, I would never go back there.   Waitress kept her tip money out of our change? Seriously! Guess she figured she would have gotten a terrible tip otherwise.   Save yourselves and go eat somewhere else. Who needs southern food when you are in SF?????

HfTtthnkzXG-CtV_Q3fjAg.review_text: Love their chicken and waffels and great customer service

Kd5pU-2A7EcQ_PcNP-p0aA.review_text: "Chicken and Waffles" joins a long lineage of amazing hybrid breakfast vitals such as "Steak and Eggs" and "Slice of Bologna on Bowl of Kix". The food is good, the service is OK, but the deal it all becomes with the Scoutmob app is soild. I don't care how long it takes to bring my check or that a homeless guy was tapping the glass while I eat if I can get $5 off.

eztmB3ftKkwwvJiZJINihQ.review_text: If you are a hungry lil bunny, then Gussie's is for you.  Don't come here if you are on a diet, ok?  Because then you'll just feel bad that you're not eating what the rest of the people are eating and that, my friend, is good hearty fried food.  I ordered the chicken (sort of mandatory) and some black eyed peas and southern corn AND cornbread.  The chicken breast looked like a half of a big chicken.  It was crispy and delicious, albeit a little dry.  Not surprising for a breast the size of....well, a small ham.  The corn was off the hook for some reason and I'm not even a fan of corn.  And the sweet tea got the endorsement of my friend from Hotlanta.  So, kudos.  I forgot to order the banana pudding but I've had it before and basically, move over ambrosia, that is truly the food of the gods.

V4YpJFq6HIQX1Fq25lMgag.review_text: I had a great inner city experience near Japan Town. Plenty of street parking.  I had a leg and thigh fried chicken and two waffles with scrambled eggs. The chicken was a bit too crunchy and the waffles could of been more fluffy. Prompt service and friendly service. I will be trying it again.

ANuPj15hsfHW0fJbxOGIYg.review_text: So, we wandered into Gussie's while walking the pups and looking for a place to hide from the Bay to Breakers Idiots. Gussie's has a large patio (by SF standards for breakfast) where we could sit with the pups and enjoy an nice breakfast, so they get big props for that! The inside of this place is huge, and actually very nice (it looks quite plain from the outside....just goes to show you that what matters is on the INSIDE.).  I thought I would never find a great waffle in San Francisco, but I was wrong. The perfect waffle is crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside, and smothered in real butter. Gussie's waffles rock my world!!!!   Next time, we come in to try the biscuits and gravy....and we might even have a date night on a Friday when they have live music and a huge buffet!!!

smFG65PgG64rNEbnY66VAA.review_text: I love this place. Yummy food, good service. I've used the banquet room too. Great place!

ZMocFA2lNMJeiKjguUKu7g.review_text: 3 months ago..... Came here because I had a Groupon for $20.00.  Sketchy area. Mediocre fried chicken. Waffles that tasted like they came out of a box.   I'll never understand why people love this place so much.  Popeye's serves better chicken. IHOP serves better waffles.  Is it because they serve both chicken and waffles in one location that people love this so much?  I just don't get it...

zBuLi3gxNffQDSEbpvJdEA.review_text: I was excited to find a chicken & waffles joint while on vacation.  I've never run across one in Seattle so I was amped.  Too bad the food wasn't all that great.    The chicken tasted like it was out of a freezer and then probably re-heated in an oven and then forgot about because it was too crunchy and my friend's was pretty much burnt.  The waffle, however, was delicious, but in an over-hyped eggo kind of way.  Maybe it was just all that butter!  The waiter was a sweet young thing, but nothing extraordinary.  No fault of his, it was just a quick meal.  I thought it was interesting that the other guy who seemed to be "running the show" was all out of sorts and running around all stressed out when the dinner rush hadn't even hit yet.  I couldn't imagine how this place would run during a true dinner rush since we were early.  Also, they let a small dog in the restaurant with his family.  That's kinda gross in my opinion.  For the price, I think we could have gone to Safeway and had a better meal.

jySPFxHYB5PdxSgcXCybuQ.review_text: The food was tasty and quick.  The service was charming however...... Not exactly a professional environment.

FAEvvq_cBmR9_yyR41tCBg.review_text: I love the waffles here. LOVE THEM. But the last 2 times I tried to go here, they had closed early. The first time was 1/2 an hour early on a Sunday, which is understandable, but annoying. The second time was a full hour early on a Saturday. What the f***. I took public transit 30 mins just to get out this place and they can't keep the doors open during listed business hours. Disappointment doesn't begin to describe my feels.

pwJHxCfOU04HhMAkPLUJ2A.review_text: This place gets a solid 3 stars. I had the catfish & grits + a waffle on the side. The fish was good, but not spectacular, my grits were lukewarm, the biscuit was powdery + doughy (if that's possible), and my waffle on the side was rubbery with too much nutmeg.  Now I'm comparing this place to Roscoe's which is basically the standard, and it could be just as good once they work out the kinks. One thing they do have over Roscoe's is the service. Our server (wish I had gotten her name) was great. I hope they keep that up.   I love that they offer more than just chicken which i don't eat anymore, plus they have desserts! Red velvet, banana pudding, peach cobbler (!!!!), oh my. Didn't have those but I'm definitely enticed to come back.

smSZx0GnTUx_gEU0tCmkbQ.review_text: it's not that bad since i've eaten here more than once.   my first dining experience: it was a weeknight and it was pretty empty. we are to seat ourselves and instantly received service. they have sweet tea that is really, really sweet.  i enjoyed it, but don't order it if you don't like your tea that sweet. our order was quick! the waffle is delish, the chicken is crispy, the syrup is liquidy [which doesn't bother me, like other people].  my second dining experience: another regular weeknight and it was packed! we sat ourselves, received our menus. the service was slower this time around, but i don't blame them; the place was full, plus there was a large party they also tended to. i got the usual: one waffle with one piece of chicken.   the sides are pretty overpriced, about $5ish for a small bowl of whatever you choose. i like the collard greens and mac&cheese.   *PLEASE GET THE BANANA PUDDING!*  both dining experiences have left me stuffed and satisfied. the staff is really nice and i'd probably come here again.

TimjDLdufaQEtvVeuynuNA.review_text: If you're not on a diet & like good old fashioned soul food, you'll love it!  I frequent the place and have found that, though there are MANY things they could improve upon, the food is almost always fabulous.  Here are the downsides that, to me, actually kinda add to its charm...  It has a strip mall restaurant kind of feel with cheesy decor.  It's not dirty, but it's not clean (i.e. the floors are just a little greasy).  No full bar.  Service tends to be slow (sometimes due to employees being high, which also makes them nice;)  They're not the most organized & are more often than they should be, out of staples (like mac n cheese, which btw is soooo good).

iktNvqCFDbAm6TLWHvnIbQ.review_text: I love the sweet potato waffle and chicken with a side of smothered potato. Everything was Delicious!!! Our server Smokey was thee best! The mood was really chill and relaxed so I will be back

540B_QwH9sbouyaLfaGofw.review_text: It was great, my motherinlaw, and auntie had an awesome time. The host really knew how to treat seniors too which made their visit wonderful.

rxW48eRDb2JYIgxXjLJE4g.review_text: The waffles here are amazing. The chicken is also good. It has a nice atmosphere and the staff is great.

sgMLJl42drVCfBBK9-cZig.review_text: hold on, why does this place have 3 stars? You people are crazy. Not only is fried chicken one of my most favorite things and guilty pleasures, I'm a huge critic when it comes to my chicken, and when I was introduced to this place, it was so good that we got it to go and ate it in the car before even getting to our destination. Pretty ridiculous. Then the next time I went, with a huge group of friends, I got introduced to the banana pudding and sweet tea, wow. I didn't even think I liked banana pudding until I had this. Amazing. So in short, probably one of the best fried chicken and waffles places I've ever been to, and the sweet tea and banana pudding are necessary when you go. Changed my life.   And for you losers complaining about the service, relax, it's a soul food family spot, you can't rush a good thing, just appreciate the damn good food when it comes to you and stop bitching.

FBpe0FZHCWiqZ9fGOkhnvA.review_text: Being a SoCal native, I was extremely apprehensive when someone told me Gussie's could go toe-to-toe with Roscoe's. Craving soul food, I recently took a friend who is from LB and familiar with Roscoe's out to try this place. Two words: food coma. Their biscuits and gravy were top notch. I got the chicken and waffle while my friend got a sampler. Their honey cornbread is one of the best cornbreads I've ever had. Their yams and greens were on point as well. We ended the dinner with their soft crust peach cobbler. I've never had a soft crust cobbler before, but this was amazing.

ML375bqniJ0yyPl8wI9pYQ.review_text: Dunno what the fuss is about with this place.  Didn't have great service, and we were there for a birthday party and rented the private room.  Food was served buffet style, and they charged extra for waffles that were a bit stale. Only thing I liked there was the atmosphere, but the food was mediocre.

wCGqLnUpzQxdqkTkxAVlkg.review_text: when i walked in the place seemed nice...i ordered to go and came back in ten minutes to pick up my food. when i came back to sit and wait to get my food i watched the kitchen in the back...disappointing! they were very unsanitary back there! they had the cut up yams sitting next to the trash can!!! i still took my food the greens were too tart (too much vinegar) everything was flavorless! and then to top it all off i bit into the chicken and it was still raw...i immediately went back and refunded my money...first and last time.... :(

CSfjaTVpxugpRNEd0RtsxQ.review_text: I am in my Southern and Soul food craze so I was in search for Chicken and Waffles and this place was close to me.  I got the Uptown Special, which was a chicken breast and one original waffle.  I didn't want too get too much since I wanted to save some space for sides. Heaven the taste bud tantalizing intermingling of sweet and savory flavors that comes with pairing fried chicken and waffles. Delicious! The waffle was still crispy served with sweet cream whipped butter and warm homemade brown sugar syrup. For an additional $1.00, one can get pure maple syrup, get the pure stuff.  The chicken was super tender on the inside and nicely seasoned and crisp on the exterior. Supremely good.  What southern meal would be complete without cornbread..ooohhh the Honey Cornbread was fluffy and divine! The Mac n Cheese was on the dry side and had a pasty gooey texture but surprisingly it tasted good! Yum! Loved the hush puppies with the jalapeno artichoke remoulade was a good combination. The restaurant was homey and clean.  It was a pleasant dining experience! Thumbs up!

-JV_oFXKowWrDVANADJxqg.review_text: Groupon almost expiring, had to jam over here with an old friend to try some fried chicken and waffles. Ordered a bowl of gumbo, the Southern Comfort, and the Taste of the South.  We made a couple substitutions, on the Southern Comfort, I had asked for over easy eggs instead of scrambled with the cheddar cheese and onions on top and to substitute one waffle for the red velvet waffle. With the Taste of the South, we had asked for the candied yams to be substituted with corn. When the order came out the substitutions came out with one mistake, the over easy eggs were over well and there was no cheddar cheese or onions. No worries, I'm watching my physique anyways. No not really, I wanted cheddar cheese and onions on top or else I wouldn't have requested that they be there in the first place!  The food itself was pretty standard but a few disappointments. The fried chicken was dry and flavorless. I rather walk around the corner and hit up Popeye's for their chicken. The mac and cheese had a hard burnt layer of cheese on top. And to top it off, their tap water wasn't even iced. Hooray for luke warm water!  Service wasn't thaaat bad, it took 10 mins to get the check and another 10 to get the change with the place being half full. Good thing I came here with an old friend and we were busy catching up or else the wait would have been a problem.

-X9G39EQRfj4ECDx_eNr3A.review_text: The other night my family decided to have Sunday dinner at Gussie's and the food was delicious!!!!!!!!! We all had different items from the menu (I had the taste of the south with red snapper) and it was great!  I haven't had soul food that good outside of my mother's kitchen ever.  Another great dish that one of my family member's had was the chicken and waffles (which I got to taste and must add that was off the hook too!)    The music in this place is awesome!  Classic R&B/Soul can NEVER go wrong and they kept playing hits after hits.....  The service we had was great and a big shout out goes to MELVIN for keeping our glasses full providing us with friendly, patient, and polite service.  It was super cold that night and he even put a portable heater next to our table to give us extra warmth!    Overall a great experience!  I must admit, I heard a lot of negative feed back about this place but I'm glad I decided to dismiss the naysayers and check it out for myself because it was well worth the experience!  I definitely plan to come back....thanks Gussie's for filling me up with a TERRIFIC meal and service!

Vbw00juOJ9ErwaCVbT-jTw.review_text: I was very excited to come and try out this place.  I read the previous reviews and thought  that I should give them a week to organize their service better.  I also went at lunch thinking it might be a little slower...well let me tell you it was like being on an episode of kitchen nightmares!  Staff seemed confused about what they were doing.  When we entered the restaurant we were not greeted by the host.  We stood their for a few minutes, then the host walked past us and decided to seat two people who came in behind us.  Staff were wondering around with plates of food, not knowing where to deliver them.  Customers were complaining loudly about having to wait for over an hour for their food.  My food however did not take long and it was ok.  Nothing special but it hit the spot.  I ordered Chicken and waffles but it me flagging down someone to get my syrup for the waffles.  The menu stated that the syrup is homemade but when I looked at the server station their was a bottle of name brand syrup on the counter...Hmmm.  I have had way better fried chicken but the waflle was good.  Due to the terrible service I will not be going out of my way to come back anytime soon.

xb96nicot4avgYpscvlCyA.review_text: Man not sure why the low ratings for Gussie's. Are people drinking 32oz Haterades before coming to dinner here? I'm just going to keep this real simple.   One, the service is very friendly. Even when our order was accidentally, screwed up, they left the food they brought so that we wouldnt be hungry and later brought out what we actually ordered. Additionally, the order was only screwed up because the waiter graciously allowed us to make changes to the combo a member of the party order without charging us extra. That is good service.  Two, the food is great! the chicken was fresh and very crispy. And the sweet potato waffles are the business, and a must have. Desert portions are tremendous. We ordered a slice of the peach cobbler and it could feed at least 3 people! I damn near think they brought the whole pie out but it was just a slice.  Three, Gussie's isnt super expensive. Dishes are around $10-12 bucks which is great.  Four, location, location, location. Gussie's is about a 30 sec walk from 1300 Filmore and Yoshi's. And a short walk from other Filmore spots like Sheba and the Kabuki. If you have a night out on Filmore, Gussie's is a great place to start before moving onto a show or whatever.   How can you not be a fan of all that?

8gO5GPyZZgtpouv1pmPprA.review_text: Gussie's is interesting, it has the menu and attitude of a grungy chicken and waffles joint, but the decor and atmosphere is nothing like that. The inside is nice, very well put together. The food here is okay, it's average. There are several places in the bay that have better chicken and waffles, but for the area, I would say this is a good place to go and the prices are reasonable. We had a groupon, so it was a fantastic deal for us. I do think that their chicken is way better than their waffles. The chicken is tasty and their waffles are just kinda meh.

FHJUMm_rWsdEAZoZ4Q0ukA.review_text: IS MY MOMMA IN THE KITCHEN???? This is one of my fav soul food places! Greens  & MacCheese is really good! I also love their gumbo! Service is always professional will be back again!

OEnVUVDGamMbntTOZZVWfQ.review_text: I wish there was a way to give this place a rating less than one star...  Yeah, yeah, yeah...you'll probably read about this place otherwise...the food tastes good and it is one of the few chicken and waffle places in the bay area, so they probably got you by the balls.   I went on a Sunday, which I had never done before. I expected it to be crazy busy, no surprise there. When we entered the resturaunt, no one greated us or took our name so we just waited in line to be seated which took about 30 minutes. Finally seated in the corner and was not assigned a waiter or waitress. We had to ask someone for water after twenty minutes of waiting. Then, after another twenty minutes we finally decided to summon someone over to take our order. AN HOUR AND A HALF GOES BY and our food is still not out and no one has refilled our drinks or come by to apologize or just even check on us...by this point the resturaunt has thinned out and is not very busy. This is where it gets absolutely unacceptable....Finally I call someone over and ask how much longer and the male waiter says another thirty minutes. His excuse was that the one waffle iron was down and it would of been quicker if we ordered pancakes or something else. THANKS BRO, THAT EXPLANATION WOULD OF BEEN HELPFUL TWO HOURS AGO?!!! We decide to leave and without an apology or any sense or urgency from the Gussie's staff. It was, hands down, the worst experience I have ever had at any business.   I have gone to Gussie's when it was really slow and still received crap service but turned the other cheek because it is so delicious, but I won't take it anymore...there is no excuse for such blantantly, poor service.   I use to love you Gussie, but I think we should see other people...

nWF_MP7gqGk7IjUlVTfcIQ.review_text: Since the only time I can get some home cooked soul food is during holidays, I usually get random cravings during the month. Today just happened to be the day... I was craving all the usual items - fried chicken, mac n cheese, greens, sweet potatoes, corn bread and peach cobbler.   My friend decided to accompany me and we ended up at Gussies. Real southern looking spot and something about it just made me feel like I was with family (one half of it anyways).   Ordered the Taste of the South (~$14) which had EVERYTHING I was craving on one plate (without the peach cobbler). One huge chicken breast, one wing, mac n cheese, greens, sweet potatoes, and corn bread.   Fries chicken - not greasy at all which was a big plus, but the skin wasn't very crispy. Flavor was there, with the addition of some hot sauce, but what's chicken without it  Mac n cheese - my standards are so high when it comes to this. Baked mac n cheese gave it a good rating in my book, but it wasn't my fave. Nobody can beat my grandma's  Greens - heaven in my mouth. No pieces of bacon that I saw, but the flavor was definitely reminiscent of last Thanksgiving  Sweet potatoes - perfect! Soft and buttery and sweet, just how they should be  Corn bread - moist, but nothing to brag about, but much better than the one at Hard Knox though.   I did want to get the peach cobbler, but again, my standards would be raised so high that it'd be unfair.. Plus I didn't want to spend $6 but maybe next time!

e7B7IsZlRT8LbFj8FcY78w.review_text: I came here on Saturday in the late afternoon.  They are obviously still working things out here, but for opening week, they did really well, IMHO.  The fried chicken was done nicely, and in a city where fried chicken is either dirt cheap OR crazy expensive, this is a really nice cheaper, good quality option.    I got the Taste of the South, which was 1/4 fried chicken, honey cornbread, mac & cheese, candied yams, & collard greens.  Everything was delicious, with the real winner being the candied yams.  I was dipping the chicken and the mac & cheese in the yam sauce and giggling.   The only thing I didn't really like was the honey cornbread, which is weird because I almost always like honey cornbread.  It was a little too dense for me.   The table ordered the cheddar cheese grit cakes, and I would definitely say you should order some of these.  They are crispy on the side, and gooey in the middle.  Plus, it comes with a delicious dipping sauce.    I wouldn't say the chicken is at the same level as Hard Knox Cafe yet, but since they just opened their doors, I will come back and see how they improve after a couple of weeks.  Honestly, the menu had a bunch of things I wanted to try, and I'll gladly come back at these prices.

5KCp29E9QBN0fD0YP4Fi3Q.review_text: what i ordered... taste of the south (fried chicken, mac and cheese, collared greens, candied yam and cornbread)  i came on a weekend and the place was packed with waiting people but only half of the tables inside the restaurant were occupied and outside seating were empty. In short i waited over an hour for a table and onether less than an hour or so for the food. waiter was nice but was so busy, didn't check on us at all, just to say that my food was coming and she forgot an item with my order but was apologetic about it and gave me an extra.  fried chicken was ok, huge pieces but was tasteless and with chewy crunchy skin. mac and cheese=boiled mac topped with two kinds of cheese then baked. collared greens were ok but was so minerally in taste. candied yam=boiled yam doused with their pancake syrup. cornbread was good but minimal in size compared to same place i've been.  ambiance... ok (place was too dim for a chicken place) service... ok (i could had rated it as bad but they were so understaffed) cost... $$ (fair)

IdnbvI-jYalwwSdLldiw0w.review_text: Came with sister and bf here for Saturday lunch with a Groupon. Talk about fried food paradise. We shared 3 appetizers: fried okra, fried chicken liver, and grit cakes. I like that even though everything was fried, it didn't feel too greasy or over fried.  We all got variations of their chicken & waffles, and I liked my sweet potato waffles the most. Decent amount of meat on the wings, but I ended up with more waffle than meat left so would've liked some more chicken. Maybe a leg and thigh instead of wings, if they allow that, because my sister's leg was HUGE! Plus that's my favorite piece of the bird.  i haven't had chicken & waffels too many times, but this was one of the better experiences I've had. Chicken was juicy, and the sweet potato waffles were just the right sweet for that perfect sweet & salty combination. Great service too! Very friendly and makes you feel super welcome.

8J6h7PhCjcS-Hmzw4l6esg.review_text: Last night I dined at Gussies with 17 of my oldest and newest friends after a night of steam and sauna at Imperial Spa (See my review). Gussies was easily able to handle our group. Our table started with the Okra Appetizer which is breaded and deep fried and served with a spicy mayo dipping sauce. The order was generous and hot.  Since it was late I did not want to have a full dinner but I did want fried chicken so I ordered the Fried Chicken sandwich with a side of crinkled sweet potato fries. The sandwich is served on a roll with lettuce, tomato and onion; it's a large sandwich with a generous chicken breast but lacked flavor. It needed something, maybe a bbq sauce? I used the dipping sauce from the fried Okra which in my opinion made a good sandwich even better. I washed it down with a pint of Sam Adams on draught.  One of my table mates ordered the waffles to share with our table. I'm sorry to say the waffles were flat, quickly became soggy from the syrup and the syrup had a strange aftertaste that made me regret taking the first bite.   The Lower Fillmore which is where Gussies is located has a lot to offer with Cinema, live music, and Imperial Spa located near by, great little neighborhood that is served by several MUNI lines.

ptXFOu0IEh5vsMyI01btMw.review_text: Excellent food - can't go wrong with their chicken n waffle combos.  Live music on the weekend = pure gravy!

Vlab9b73R5qPLIv6tE4DJA.review_text: ...you had one job.  I love fried chicken. I love waffles. I love fried chicken and waffles, so when the opportunity came up for me to do a meet up at Gussie's I was super excited. Only one other person ended up showing up for the meet up (typical), but that was actually fine.   Fried Chicken and Sweet Potato Waffle The chicken was way over fried. Like fried hard. It wasn't horribly dried out but it also wasn't juicy and delicious. There didn't seem to be much spice in the dredging mix. The Sweet Potato Waffle was on point and I seriously considered making out with it.  Sweet Yams, Greens, Corn Bread, Mac N Cheese The Mac N Cheese was pretty darn good but other than that - meh.  Peach Cobbler Way too sweet and neither myself nor my dining companion wanted to take it home with us.  Service Fast and friendly.

yK8lb7eBwKI56hvyVmDUKA.review_text: Fore a new restaurant with some growing to do, it was good food =). I'll be back for sure to update my review, the staff was friendly, the food came out pretty quick for how many folks were in there... but, really, does it take 20 min to get a lemonade and a flat-ish coke ( i could see the lemonade jug from my table, i was tempted to do it myself)... I know you're new, and busy. but drinks are usually the easy part =). If thats my biggest gripe, i can tell, this place has lots of room to grow =)

Z0I5MJ_5YJqfaOD5y88blA.review_text: I'm astounded by how many people scoff at the notion of fried chicken and waffles complementing each other. My love affair with chicken and waffles dates back to the first time I had Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles in the early 90s. When I heard about Gussies opening in San Francisco, I was skeptical given the mediocrity of similar endeavors in the Bay Area. Hearing the owner of Roscoe's was behind Gussies was cause for higher expectations.  The quality of the two signature items were top notch. The waffles were fluffy with a crispness at its edges. The buckwheat waffles satisfy while the sweet potato waffles really knocked my palette on its proverbial backside. For a more decadent flavor, try a buckwheat waffle drizzled with sweet potato syrup. The flavorful chicken had a juicy center (I usually go with a breast and drumstick). As for other sides, the cornbread gets solid marks. The Soju cocktail menu is another unique offering from them.  The price points don't exactly scream "bargain", but there is a Happy Hour on Tuesdays afternoon for the budget-conscious. The decor/spacing isn't optimal either, but neither detracted from the bottom line: the food.  All told, Gussies has replaced Roscoe's as my favorite chicken and waffle joint. An impressive feat unto itself.

uWvE1C8tpvhTMgIVtHy72g.review_text: Not sure why this spot is only getting a 3.5 star, but I KNOW it deserves 5 and than some!! Came here last night with the BF for some good ol soul food and this place DID NOT disappoint!! I had the Downtown special which included 1 drumstick (a  HUGE drumstick btw) with 1 original waffle that I substituted for the red velvet waffle.  The drumstick was super crispy on the outside and moist in the middle.  The red velvet waffle was off the chain bomb.com!! The BF had the Taste of the South which had 1/4 fried chicken, mac and cheese, collard greens, candied yams, and honey cornbread.  We also ordered a side of the original waffle and 2 sweet teas.   I have to say the meal was sooooo good that we barely even spoke to each other.  I know my man is enjoying his food when he doesn't say one word!! haha.  Our waitress was very attentive which got her a well deserved 25% tip. The restaurant has a home feel to it which was also a plus.  It's good to know there is a good chicken and waffles spot here in SF.  WE WILL BE BACK!!

JdznZ8j0BQgT5Wgny4ekHg.review_text: Take out food doesn't resemble advertised food.  Order was mixed up.  Unprofessional management.    Wouldn't advise to order food from this place.

0QeJC2inz6P-OVzROU_LNw.review_text: One of the best fried chicken I've had; crispy and un-oily skin, moist and tender on the inside. What I ordered what was the Uptown Special ($9.29): one chicken breast and one waffle.  My sister got the Country Style Breakfast ($9.99).    Reservations accepted for parties of 6 or more.  I read that this place can get packed so I wanted to be prepared.  Instead of reservations, we came about 20 minutes prior to their opening time to ensure we have breakfast at a reasonable time before starting our food crawl.    My sister is the type that never ventures out by herself so I figured I should take her to a) try this place because I have a Groupon for it and b) to show her around.  I'm not a San Franciscan however, I go quite frequently and used to live there. Plus you can't go wrong w/ San Francisco as there are so many things to do, so many things to see, and so many things to eat.  This was stop #1.    A very modern and upscale restaurant but unfortunately it lacked service and speed.  We waited over 2 minutes to be greeted (it wasn't packed at the time), we waited over 5 minutes to have someone come to our table - I got up to ask for someone, and we waited forever for our to-go boxes and check.  The lady that took our order was very nice and very sincere and she did check on us once but we were left to fend for ourselves pretty much.  This experience would have been a 4 if service matched the taste and quality of the dishes.  I liked that the maple syrup was thinner than usual and had a hint of vanilla in it.  I liked what I ordered very much but I wouldn't come back.    It would be faster if I went to the store, prepped, and made the food myself...

GcvGjyNPvxYyIoRGV0U6BA.review_text: I went here with my best friend on Sunday February 9th.  We both ordered the Chicken and Waffles as I had heard that's what this place is known for.  I had the sweet potato waffles which were actually pretty good.  The syrup was a little thin but still good anyways.  Only thing is that when we came in, we weren't greeted by the hostess and she seemed like she was running around like they were short of workers.  All in all this is a great place to eat.  Next time I'm going here i'm going with a groupon though.

jntRt0kG_jk_hS78baaTnA.review_text: This is definitely a solid 4.5, but I'm rounding up since they just opened and everyone working there was so nice.  I was worried about long waits so we went at 5:30pm and the whole place was more or less empty.  By the time we left at 7:00pm the dining room was mostly full.  The hostess and waiter said they got swamped during the breakfast//brunch rush and they expect it to be just as busy right around 7:30pm.  If you want breakfast, the hostess recommended going between 7-9am.  Basically, go during off peak hours if you don't want a wait.    Now for the food, we started with cheddar cheese grit cakes and the fried okra.  The cheddar cheese grit cakes came with jalapeno butter and were great.  The fried okra was standard fried okra, but I wasn't amazed by it.  I doubt I'd order the fried okra again.  For entrees, we had taste of the south, 1/2 southern fried chicken and two waffles, fried chicken breast sandwich with a side of gravy, and two orders a la carte of sweet potato waffle + fried chicken breast.  I'd say that's one great thing, they have all these combination plates but you can also create your own creations by putting together a la carte items.  The fried chicken was great - one person said it's the best fried chicken he's had (personal preference I think).  I got mine smothered in gravy, but I think next time, I'll get the gravy on the side that way the chicken stays crispy, but I can still have gravy.  The waffles were also quite proper and the sweet potato waffles are a unique item on the menu (at least I've never seen it before).    All the food was on point, almost everyone finished everything on their plate (I couldn't quite finish the massive piece of fried chicken breast.) - don't get me wrong, the portions are quite generous, the food was just that tasty.  We were all discussing what we'd get on our next visit.      For dessert we had the banana pudding and red velvet cake.  We tried to get the peach cobbler, but they were all out so they comped us an order of red velvet cake (talk about wonderful service).  The banana pudding was good, but a little too sweet for my taste.  The red velvet cake was quite moist and done right with cream cheese frosting.  (On a side note - the sweet tea was great.)    I'll definitely be back to explore more of their menu.

jRVDBk_3GtaGl_Hflp1H4g.review_text: If you go, do get the sweet potato waffles with a side of chicken. And the sweet tea, even if they take 10 minutes to brew it. I like to drop by Gussie's late at night when there isn't a line - and believe me, I'm beyond thrilled to have a go-to place in my neighborhood with crave-worthy food open so late on weeknights. The place is designed for mass consumption with floors, tabletops and laminated menus made for being wiped clean. But it still manages to give off a down home vibe.

8eOJ6_eArB7ZHcwhdXoJjA.review_text: Gussies, one word: orgasmic.. If you want some amazing chicken and waffles this is the place to be. I would say that this is the Nor Cal of chicken of waffles, family owned business for over 20 years apparently. Don't get anything but chicken and waffles here, you would be missing out. Consistent, perfect fried chicken, great for hangovers and never disappointing. The only reason I am not rating this a 5 star, is the price of a meal which is somewhat higher than your normal breakfast/brunch.

3X7kBuccDZe1YDuZfT5HUw.review_text: Uh-oh. I came back.   I'm not sure if it was an off night or what (the waiter mentioned that they had a different chef than usual) but the food was a MESS. The chicken was weird and my favorite appetizer, the fried cheesy grits, was pretty much inedible. Even if it was just one bad night, they lose a star for such inconsistency!

IHFpYHxRaaBKvaB2zQLc9A.review_text: I had a wonderful time at Gussie's with a friend. The chicken was delicious, crispy and not greasy. The waffles are great and the syrup wasn't too sweet. It all went together deliciously well. The collard greens were good but not the best I've had. The peach cobbler was great and was served in a cast iron skillet.   Service was good. Our waiter was attentive and prompt with refills.  Overall I'm definitely going back there and soon.

pvg3Cok-C3jUzN7Dr5Hirg.review_text: the second i heard about gussie's chicken and waffles, i headed down there.  it's close to my work (well, close enough) and the thought of vegan waffles made me salivate profusely.  sorry.  i'm a mom now, so that stuff doesn't gross me out as much.  the buckwheat vegan waffles come with earth balance and the most delicious candy-sweet syrup in the world.  they are enormous.  we shared one order of waffles and one vegetarian plate, which comes with red beans and rice, black eyed peas, collards, potatoes and vegan cornbread.  oh, and of course an order of sweet potato fries.  yes, we were stuffed.  everything was excellent and the server was the most adorable thing in the world.  it wasn't the fastest service but it was super friendly--everyone from the server to the bus boy had enormous grins on their faces.  can't wait to go back for lunch.  but not on mondays!  they're closed.  i'll be at the plant that day.

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: It's all good, but I really enjoyed the fried chicken and okra! I happend to be in the area for the Fillmore Farmers' market and Juneteenth festival.  It was lunchtime so perfect, let's stop at Gussie's for some chicken and waffles as I've been wanting to try it.  I also ordered fried okra as I just couldn't resist, and it was yumm.  I got the fried chicken leg with my waffle (loved the chicken, the waffle was freshly made but it was not as crispy crunchy as I'd like).  And I also had some sweet tea - love sweet tea!  Service was friendly and smiling.

DEzG0nrWA7Xl9QolRApFFQ.review_text: Bad experience! I absolutely love chicken and waffles and was excited to try a new place that had really good reviews. We were really disappointed because the chicken and waffles were just average. The worst about the place was that it was slightly dirty, the extremely loud (bad) music and poor service. In a City with so many great restaurants I will most likely never be back.

7oqtGgi7G8WrWVRnfflFGw.review_text: I LOVE GUSSIE'S!  I came here last weekend and wanted a delicious homemade biscuit, and some chicken and waffles. I usually only eat chicken breast, and while it's off the bone. I looked on the menu to see if they made fried chicken breast off the bone. While I didn't see anything like it on the menu, I asked the server if they made anything like it. He was such a sweetheart, and he just told me of course they can make me fried chicken breast with no bone!  It was so moist, and juicy, and the seasoning was perfect. The waffle was huge! So warm, and it tasted amazing with the chicken and syrup. I also got a biscuit and it was the best biscuit I ever had. I practically licked my plate clean. Definitely going to make this my go to spot for Sunday brunch.

n6nsJXY-dSJEuVz6f7eUjQ.review_text: Food: okay, mind you I only had the chicken and waffles. Breast was almost dry but good flavor. Waffle was just that, a waffle. What makes me hesitate to come back is the atrocious service on a Saturday night and Muzak jazz band you can't get away from.

ZuCP8O71LHKl6tlXkS7Ziw.review_text: I've always heard a great about "chicken and waffles" but never got the chance to try it until I came here to Gussie's. It wasn't bad, but I wasn't exactly impressed either. I forgot the name of the combo I ordered, but it came with 2 pieces of fried chicken, one waffle, and 2 eggs (cooked any way you like) The chicken was like any other fried chicken, but it wasn't very greasy. I got my eggs completely fried and it was completely lacking in any taste, which I guess could be a good thing because it allows the eater to add as much/less salt as they want. The waffle was the most disappointing, it was thin and very mushy. I would love to have my waffles thick and crunchy.  I got to sample a few other things that other people had ordered. The potato salad was pretty good, and I'm not the biggest fan of cheese, but the part of the mac and cheese that wasn't overloaded with heavy cheese was good too. I also really liked the fried catfish with tartare sauce.  The catfish was lightly fried, so it wasn't too breaded or heavy, and the green tartare sauce seems to have some dill mixed in that provided a really nice flavor for dipping the fish in.  I also had one of the strawberry soju-tinis which I really liked and its fairly prices too. I wouldn't mind coming here for happy hour to try out the rest of the drinks.  We came here on a Wednesday so it wasn't packed at all. The food took awhile to come out and is slightly on the pricier side. I'm willing to try out more "chicken and waffles" but I don't think I would come here for that combination again.

TUVaya-VY5WmKHIsv0sx0Q.review_text: This place is litteraly in my building. I went here openeing weekend so my review may be a little tainted. We went for breakfast and our server apparently had no idea what whe was doing.  The food was good, but didn't wow me. I had the chicken, eggs and waffles, the standard breakfast fare. Large portions are nice. Lively atmosphere. Not too expensive.   I'm really happy this place is open for breakfast 7 days a week. We really needed a good breakfast place in this area.  The owners are super nice! and passionate. I'm sure my stars will go up at the place takes off.

v27Rcd0iqJNvIQ_3gtaD4A.review_text: MMM. How can you ever go wrong with chicken and waffles? When you can't make it down south for some real soul food, this place will do.   I got the Fillmore Special with three chicken wings and a waffle topped with a scoop of butter and syrup on the side - it was delicious and filling enough that I couldn't even finish my meal.   There were lots of servers so we had great service and were able to sit wherever we wanted. My friend and I came right after work on a Friday so the place wasn't crowded at all - it did start filling up as we were finishing up our meal.  Great food and service? I will definitely be back!

0T2Rx9W4KMDpIie1CqRWTg.review_text: Best service in SF! Incredibly refreshing. The sweet potato waffles are dancing in my head still. And the grit cakes too...actually they might be fighting over who was best...but we all know it was the waffle. Syrup always trumps ...well, anything.  Might be the best grilled chicken sandwich...ever. And yes, they did run out of the fish ...but who cares what they had was awesome.  The Arab and I were very satisfied with our meal!  Tummy happy. Mission accomplished.

m1yqi_ubMTy823JtUntBCA.review_text: Next time, I'm buying a Gussie's t-shirt!  Puts Chicken and Waffles in Oakland to shame!  After reading the most recent reviews, I COMPLETELY disagree with the 2-star raters. They trippen! My visits here have been during the evening hours. We never had to wait, but I could definitely understand the chaos of trying to get a table any time of the day because the food is straight up AWESOME. Duh...there will be a wait during lunchtime...Service was fine.... Drinks were filled in a timely manner. Great suggestions were made. Waiters were friendly and smiley, even during the later evening hours...No complaints whatsoever.  I often dream, daydream. and rave about two things at this joint:  #1 - Sweat Potato Waffles Succulent! Succulent! Succelent! The portion is huge -- plate huge. I ate each juicy bite with my eyes closed. The dish was about $13, but I would easily throw down a twamp for this! EASY. I recommend this dish to all my amigos.   #2 - Banana Pudding You get a volleyball-sized bowl of this. ITs HUGE. Easily can be split between 4 people. It's nice on the palette. Soft. Light. Just the right amount of sweet. It will definitely become your staple if you become a regular here.  I LOVE GUSSIE's. Can't wait to go back.  Atmosphere:  Kick back and comfortable. No prissies.  Downfalls:  I wish there were more locations and wish it was open 24 hours.

9LL989kf6pL44HpgCqXZyw.review_text: Went here for lunch with the Mrs. after finding it on Yelp, since we were in the city anyway. The place was easy to find and clean inside, not to crowded.   I had the "Taste of the South" which was two pieces of fried chicken, candied sweet potatoes, collard greens, baked mac n cheese and honey corn bread. Chicken was excellently cooked and tasty. The greens were great with a little bit of red pepper flake in them, the mac/cheese was good (though I wish the portion was a little bigger) and the potatoes were good too. The flavor of the corn bread was good, but it was a little dry so I didn't eat it.   Mrs. had the chicken strip salad with home made ranch dressing. The waitress said "we make it here" about the dressing. The salad was good size for a lunch portion and the strips were good. The ranch was AWESOME! When I asked the waitress about it, she said that they do not use any kind of powder mix or base.. it is buttermilk ranch from scratch!  We also shared a waffle (had to have it for my chicken of course) which was also very good and cooked perfectly.   FYI, they had a buffet going on for lunch but we did not look at it. Service was very friendly and average speed... not fast or slow.    We will definitely return here when we are anywhere nearby.

ul7BUIe1U7JnrX13C01JWw.review_text: I came here on a Sunday. It was showering like crazy, so by the time we arrived to Gussie's, we were soaked from head to toe. I heard about this place a year ago from some friends,  but never had the opportunity to try it.  According to them "This place was bomb." So a year later, I had to see what they were talking about.  I came with my bf and my sister and we got the:  Fillmore Classic- 3 crispy chicken wings and a waffle  Country Style Breakfast- Two eggs scrambled w/ cheese and onions, one chicken leg and thigh, and smothered potatoes  Chicken's Lover's Omelet-three eggs, chicken breast, green onions, cheddar and jack cheese and homefries  The fried chicken was just okay for me. I don't see what the big deal about chickens and waffle is. The chicken was a bit too dry for me. The Omelet was HUGE. I had enough to take home and eat for breakfast the next day, but I wouldn't get this dish again because the potatoes were too salty for me. I also like homefries with my omelet and not scalloped potatoes. The only thing mentionable at this place is their waffles. They were one of the best waffles I've ever tasted and I don't like waffles ( I'm a pancake fan). There must be something special about their batter. All three of us agreed that the waffles were the best part of the meal. If I were to come back, I'd skip the chicken and head for the waffles.   Service was great! The hostess kept reassuring that we were next and kept apologizing for the delay. The waitress accidentally gave me a biscuit instead cornbread. I didn't say anything because I knew they were busy, but three minutes later she came out with a cornbread and apologized for the mistake. I didn't even have to ask! =)....Overall food was okay, and service was great!

F7ul6CmRfr1gAFLYw6noEw.review_text: The words chicken and waffles should not even be in their name. If I could give zero stars I would. After seeing the photos I was worried I would not enjoy the waffles. I went anyway thinking the lower ratings were for bad service and because I got a word of mouth reference. The four and five star ratings need to stop.   My first encounter after walking in was rudeness from the MANAGER. I should have taken that as a sign but I stayed anyway. I ordered hush puppies to start and they were very hot. Then come the chicken and waffles. The chicken was no better than what you can expect from KFC, in fact, KFC might be better. The waffles were flat, soggy, gummy and just not good.  I waited forever for refills of my coffee and never got a refill on my water. The only person who was pleasant was the young hispanic woman bussing the tables. I wish she was my server because the one I had didn't care less about my dining experience. Bad service is only redeemed by good food and their's was no where near good enough.  If think waffle house is good, and not in an ironic hipster way, this place is for you.  NOTE: I lived in the south and have had real soul food. THIS IS NOT IT! I would rather go to cracker barrel than this place! With all the options we have in SF, this should be no one's first choice.

Z0xTRNV063P-un7_MC0paQ.review_text: Ordered delivery. After and hour and a half I contacted Eat 24. They talked with the restaurant and told me the driver was on his way. An hour later I contacted Eat 24 again and told them to cancel my order and refund me. Literally 2.5 hours and no food. The customer service at Eat 24 contacted the restaurant and they said that they didn't have any drivers.   Pathetic. I hope this place burns to the ground.

-2tJ7A886B1OnuSwPXcFRQ.review_text: In regards to customer service, the people who run this place are genuinely friendly and were sincerely apologetic when they didn't get my two orders of the Uptown Special correct twice. Things didn't go as planned when my carry-outs weren't ready. After waiting 20 minutes (and admiring the place's decor, vibe and atmosphere), I receive my take-outs and check for the requested substitutions (sweet potato and red velvet waffles for the original waffles) and sides (honey cornbread). They were missing but Gussie's had no qualms fixing it. So, I finally get my substituted waffles but they still forgot to pack the cornbread. The lady apologies, gives me the cornbread, and explains they were training new hirees. (Good for them!) To endear their customers, they didn't replace but gave me the original waffles at no charge in addition to the gourmet waffles. That alone deserves +1 star.  Now, onto the food. Depending on how large of a chicken breast you get, it can be either on the slightly drier or moister side. And depending on how famished you are (and the sensitivity of your taste buds), you might find the breast meat to be a bit bland or has just the right amount of flavor. They serve soft waffles and its texture and consistency reminded me of mochi or other similar glutinous rice flour products. I was disappointed how the original, sweet potato and red velvet waffles tasted practically the same, so I wouldn't recommend "upgrading" to these or the other varieties (corn meal, banana pecan, vegan buckwheat). Their sugar-free syrup isn't thick but has the right amount of sweetness and has a hint of citrus flavor. Their honey cornbread is really moist and delicious. Overall, the food that is their namesake wasn't bad but it didn't "WOW" me either, so I give it 3 stars.

ODAKkkRA3l-l5uz8UjZJZg.review_text: Love the 1/4 dark and two waffles.. How can you ever go wrong with that?

8XwZggy8l9x8lm6mCZFwGA.review_text: They would have gotten 5 stars in my book based just on the deliciousness of the food BUT everything else that could go wrong, went wrong.  1. Extremely long wait considering there were open tables ready to be bused and seated. The hostess sat us at the bar while we waited.........&& waited. We asked for waters and did not get them until we were seated at our table.....30 minutes later.  2. After we sat down our order was not taken until we had to ask someone to come take it......15 minutes later.  3.
