They brought out the wrong food for 3 of the people in our party & completely forgot to bring out one of the meals. After every one had finished their food they finally brought out the missing meal and it was incorrect.   4. The coffee we ordered didn't come until our food did. It was cold.  5. They tried to charge for the incorrect meals rather than what we ordered. When we complained they offered to take $2 off of the meal that didn't come out until the end. We asked to speak to someone else and they finally took that meal off of the bill completely but still charged for the incorrect meals and cold coffees.   All-in-all it was not worth it which is a major disappointment because the food was so good.

2qrGhalrni65mGT12igdYQ.review_text: Bought a Groupon to try this place. Me and a friend sat at the bar.   I ordered the 4pcs Chicken with Grits and biscuit. Also a side of Greens. The service here is slow. Friendly staff but too much standing around for a busy restaurant. Had to wait to get a refill on the ice tea and the place is not as clean. When I touched the ketchup, I got syrup all over my hands because they do not pay attention to details of being clean.   Food came out after I asked how long it would take for us to get our food. We waited about 40 minutes. When the food arrived I had to ask if a biscuit came with my meal and the response was I do not know! LOL!!! But was kind enough to get me one like it was owed to me. The fried chicken was not bad. It was tasty but almost dry. Wasn't too salty or greasy. Not a fan of their grits. There was clumps in my grits and overwhelming butter flavor. Now the GREENS, was my favorite. I will come back just for the Greens.  Also to try their waffles.  Here is the killer!!!! They had homemade Sangria sitting at the bar barely covered in room temperature. Sitting in a tub with no ice. Someone ordered a glass from the dining area and as soon as they lifted the cover, fruit FLIES flew out of it. My friend who is a liquor distributor saw that and later on mentioned it as we walked out.   That was a killer of the experience. But the staff are friendly........

ifrL9DZ30ibOWX5KfXxFDA.review_text: While it looks mouth watering, it could be better.  Service was fine, presentation, portion, and all that jazz was great but what happened to the  flavor?  Flavor was a bit on the bland side, I was expecting more kick to the chicken and a crusty /chewer waffle.    I had the Fillmore special, comes with 3 wings, 1 waffle, and 2 eggs $12.95...it was well...A-OK...

pAU1Wd7FthzR9yB5yOAXPg.review_text: This restaurant is located in a filthy street in the City.  It is a very clean restaurant and their waffles and syrup are great.  I asked the waiter if they used the same oil to fry the fish and the chicken.  He said "yes" and I could definitely taste the fish on my chicken.  At east he didn't lie about the oil.  That is why they get 2 stars.  The chicken at Popeye's is far better and they Do Not fry their chicken with fish.  That is gross!!  Popeye's tastes better and not fishy.  Save your money and don't go here.

s-LBWRdCHlNHW2mDUJ58Ig.review_text: Great cheese fried grits, fried chicken excellent, waffles good.  Forget the gravy, no real chicken taste and bell peppers?  What are they thinking.  Be sure and get the real syrup or you'll be disappointed, Aunt Jemima makes better syrup.   Service fair.

w900IKTp8rVn_2ak4BnB7A.review_text: I should have just ordered from KFC :(  Chicken is bland and collard greens were burnt.. Corn bread was the saving grace..

z1mY-0K-F6WlGnbQ0WYUEQ.review_text: Oh my goodness. Some of the best, authentic southern fried chicken I've had in the Bay Area lives at Gussie's. The chicken was juicy and perfectly fried, the sides were to die for, and the prices were definitely reasonable (at least for SF). I had the grits and all I could say while eating them was, "Ughhhh, these GRITS. SO GOOD." Over and over again.   I'm a bit of a fried chicken connoisseur, and if you're looking for great chicken without all of the flashiness and trying-too-hard vibe, Gussie's is your place.

celaMP9ZFrqnypwJr_YX8Q.review_text: The food is alright. It didn't wow me, especially after having Roscoe's in SoCal. The chicken didn't have too much flavor. The waffle was okay. It was a little soggy. I would have liked more crisp. The cornbread was fine, but I wish it was little drier. It seemed too moist for me. My biggest gripe about the place is the service. I don't know the logistics of it, but it didn't seem too busy for them to be as slow as they were. My friend and I arrived at 7pm on a Sunday night, and we didn't leave until 8:50. Ughh. It wasn't like we were even taking our time. We even just bounced after one of the staff members was taking too long to come back with a to-go packet of the maple syrup. I don't think I would recommend this place. Save your time and money.

CxWym0fas92zqv56UWJkoQ.review_text: I was so excited to try this place because I've been craving me some chicken and waffles. Me and the BF got the downtown special, I got gravy on the side because that's just how I roll. I'll have to say it was alright. The BF really liked the chicken, I say it was average. I was hoping this place would be more on par with Roscoes, however 'twas not. The service was so-so. The busboy was really nice and attentive. Our server was a bit awkward and really quiet, which isn't what you would really want a server to be. I'm thinking I'll give this place another shot sometime in the distant future.

fPniIkE-AHQv5AcJzaBHtA.review_text: In lieu of my search of the perfect Chicken and Waffles dish, I finally sauntered into Gussie's, hopeful to find "The One".  I hate to say it, but I didn't find it at Gussie's.  Can't a girl have the best of both worlds?  The Chicken was okay.  I liked that it wasn't too oily, but then that means it was a bit on the dry side.  On the other hand, I loved the waffles.  They were light and sweet, like the batter used for sweet crepes.  Yum!  I'll definitely come back for that!  I'm also a fan of Collard Greens and they do not disappoint at Gussie's!  We didn't try the desserts, but for sure, next time!  I heard amazing things about them!  The service was great, very friendly and prompt.  They didn't even fuss when I had a LivingSocial deal to use.  I definitely think this place is good but sadly, my search continues...

SkJXpIXU1YxQFFomrSJKvw.review_text: I've recently been on a fried chicken hunt. To the person who rated the chicken slightly better than Popeye's... I suppose a Corvette is only slightly faster than a VW bug.  Fried chicken was very good though the breast was just a tad overdone, wings excellent, sauces great,the fried fish and the fried cheesy grits very nice. The waffles were fine, but the syrup was definitely a notch above. The waitresses were also very nice.   We'll be back for sure.

CSeWID1TbPxeFwaLRATjfA.review_text: This is a casual, under-rated breakfast spot.  The fried chicken isn't my favorite but the sweet potato waffle was to die for!!!!  I had a groupon but i will go back anyways.

f1KOi_I2DKGasbhUrT5IfA.review_text: I loved it. Flavorable fried chicken!

zNxK2RrEAiFp1w-crOYoag.review_text: So I just walked out of this restaurant.   My party ordered a burger dish and 2 chicken and waffle dishes.   It took them about 7-10 minutes to take our order and the place was not crowded.  A party of 2 arrived after us and also ordered after us.   I don't really know how or why their food came first before ours, they seemed to order the same dishes as us sans the burger.   In our opinion, we were waiting for an unreasonable amount of time. By the time we just got up and left, that party of two were practically done with their meal.  I talked to the manager and said we were leaving because the food was taking too long.   She had an attitude and said that we've been only waiting for 20 minutes, which was a lie.   I was texting a friend after we ordered and the time stamp showed over 30 minutes.   She specifically said that it was the burger taking long to cook which is BS because how do burgers take longer than chicken to cook?  Either way, the manager did not apologize for the long wait and seriously had an attitude.   I don't understand how a business can be run so unprofessionally like that.   I mean, it was pretty clear that our food was taking long, and  it wasn't busy at all so at least give the courtesy of letting us know what the delay was.  Pretty sad because I was really looking forward to eating their food.

49n0zAbDjKJ5sqxvKnAbqQ.review_text: 02/24/12  First time ever coming to a chicken and waffles place since LA's Rosco's.  Though my friend had a GROUPON deal worth $20 for buffet and two cocktails, I did not think - had to get chicken and waffles with spicy shrimp chowder to start. I'm a fan of chowder, and the combination of shrimp with spicy sausage - was superb.  My friend sort of shared her meal as I waited for my chicken and waffles (it was busy and probably took 20 minutes to get to my table).  She had mac 'n' cheese, green beans, candied yams, and rice - the candied yams really got me wanting more (MMMMMM). I'll definitely come back to Gussie's in the future.  I'm giving one less star because our waiter didn't seem to know where the menus where or what the menu offered, not to mention that he thought we wanted COFFEE when we asked for the COCKTAIL menu.  MMMMM.

mowGolovKzs6HmiIjtL-gA.review_text: I didn't hate Gussie's at all, but I wasn't too impressed. I found the chicken a little bland and saw others salting theirs. The collards were not very good. Its tough to make collard taste good without meat but I would not order the collards here. I loved the red Velvet cake except they served it on a plate with caramel dripped on it. The whole point to me of black velvet is that its got this great flavor that usually isn't overly sweet, so to bathe it in caramel and add all that sweet back is just a bummer. The service was great though and the waffles are tasty indeed.

9hzVZmhRMpqNtnsy_KjCDg.review_text: Had brunch there on Sunday.  It was very busy but wait staff was attentive.  The fried chicken was very good - not greasy.  The waffles were good as well.  I thought the waffles would be crispier than they were.  Coke was warm with not much ice but wait staff brought more ice immediately.  We'll go back!

CYudliQYtElHDn0UdGvPBA.review_text: My girlfriend and I were in San Francisco for the weekend and ate here twice. We love their food! Sweet potato waffles were my favorite, but everything was delicious. Will be back.

0E3zMPX6TWMUJ1NKkJNNBA.review_text: I'm always looking for new Sunday brunch places to try.  I heard about the opening of Gussies from a friend who lived in the area.  Although they warned me that the service was slow, I only have A++ reviews for our server.  I wish I caught her name because hands down she would have proven all these reviews wrong about the service. It was a packed restaurant for 11am on a Sunday morning.    I ordered the chicken and waffles and others at my table had the grits, the chicken gumbo & the chicken sandwich.  Our favorite was a drink called the Whispering...something.  I forgot the name, but it had apple soju & elderberry flavors (find it hidden on the bottom of the page somewhere).

QwDF8Vdhd1u6srx_-vAmdQ.review_text: I love this place! the food is excellent especially the Chicken and sweet potato waffles, OMG! Sweet Tea with unlimited refills, WOW! Would have given this place 5 stars but the service is a little slow but the food is well worth the wait.

Hhi6HRwZ_Rtq8x7GXonwTw.review_text: TERRIBLE! Took 2 hours to get our food. They were very careless and did not apologize once for the inconvenience. So disappointed!!!!!!!!!

KBfCzD23iXLDyWajMpSHvw.review_text: OMG! I'm so surprised to see that Gussie's has 3 stars!!! Why, Oh Why? I love Gussie's! The food is "off the chain" and so delicious! I love the servers and some of them even know me by name! (Yes, that's how much I go to this resturant). The waffles are so good, and I love the smothered chicken! The peach cobbler makes me want to dance it's so good! And the sweet tea??? Don't even get me started on that! I want Gussie's right now, from just updating this review! Gussie's doesn't desrve 3 stars. It saddens me, that some of my fellow Yelpers didn't have good experiences. Because, I love Gussie's!

cpT2EnW37LXTgd5TduF-zg.review_text: Get the Uptown Chicken and red velvet waffles! they are amazing! also eating this while 2 people were playing the piano and bass made the place have a real cool vibe! Definitely going back here soon!

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: All I can say is that the West is getting hotter by the weekends with great food and entertainment.   I went to Gussie's for a birthday party and had amazing time! Minus my family being hella late. The Fam being late gave me a chance to speak with the manger and a few members of the family that owns Gussie's   The drink menu is great because sat at the mini bar and I bet once they decide to get a full bar and license I think Gussie's will off the wall!   But on to the fried chicken damn just like gran-mama use to make. Juicy on the inside and crispy on the inside. Kinda like that song right but we talking chicken. Before the chicken I had some cat fish bites that were another fried creation that was simply amazing with a little hot sauce.  I think I had some mac-n-cheese to and it was a hit too.  I would say the only thing that might need a little work is the waffle it lacked that crispy outside and the nice chewy bread on the inside. The waffle was just soft and chewy so it was just alright with room for improvement.  Overall I got to say Gussie's is a good look for sure

ItxM2SMn40Vmmsqa_8b4ZA.review_text: Soul food is a heart attack on a plate...Putting that aside its an orgasm in your mouth. This chicken and waffle joint was a perfect start to my Sunday afternoon, brunch kick off with a friend. I ordred a Southern Comfort, and golly gee every bite was southern goodness in my mouth and stomach. My friend didn't eat all her waffles, so I kindly helped her.  The chicken was fried, and I mean fried. Perfect so crispy and juicy.  Meaty thighs, and nice juicy long legs ;) and the Southern Comfort came with dark meat, they know so well!  This spot made me feel good and bad upon leaving. Good because my taste buds were still cheering F*CK YEA, BAD walking up the hill after devouring that greatness.  I highly recommend this place. Great spot for brunch especially after a night of prolonged drinking. Service is good. Food is bomb, would recommend.

pwKSlA3QR9Mj258Ax4WQcQ.review_text: LOCATION - in the Fillmore district a block away from the Fillmore Police station  PARKING - there's street parking and a parking garage directly across the street with reasonable rates  SEATING - there's ample seating outside and indoors; ideal for families, you might even be able to dine outside with your 4-legged pal. They have a small room inside for banquets or parties.  AMBIENCE - very comfortable, it's definitely NOT a "hole" in the wall. In fact it might be an upscale hole in the wall. The noise level was extremely loud at times probably because they were busting dishes near our table. There was music playing coupled with the loud dishes made it a little difficult to have a conversation.  PRICE - average plates range from $10-16  QUALITY - I had the chicken n waffle plate substituting 1 of the waffles for a specialy waffle (Red Velvet). I'm so glad I did. The substitutions are $1.25 extra but well worth it. The red velvet also had cream cheese butter. Waffles are served with hot syrup so it'll melt the butter.  My brother ordered the sweet potatoe waffle and it also is extremely good. If you like sweet potatoe, this is a must try and is also their signature waffle.  SERVICE - this one of the areas I thought could use some improvement. Our server was really nice however, we didn't see her too often and we kept having to ask for refills, napkins, etc.  Overall I had a great experience for my first time. I would definitely recommend this place if you love southern food.

99UXPkRVKhYkyG-FXm7dXw.review_text: i don't know what to say about Gussie's, when it's good it is very good but when it's bad it is terrible.  the chicken the greens and the macaroni & cheese are all very good, but some days i go and the food taste like it might be a few days old and warmed up in a microwave. the waffles are always on point but the service is sometimes sketchy.

FKFbjtQccsrJGnH2StStfg.review_text: Chicken & Waffles virgin. Decided to try out this spot from hearing all the buzz on Twitter and other SF eats sites. Came on Tuesday night around 9pm. I was afraid there may be a long line of anxious people waiting to get their chicken & waffles fix in SF. Surprisingly, no wait! I'm not going to nitpick at the little things (i.e., wait times), given the fact that it is a new restaurant and they're still working out details. I'll give 'em a little slack for that.  Now on to the food...Looking at the menu it was hard to decide! So many things to try, plus they had Soju cocktails! I decided on the Downtown Special (1pc. Chicken, 2 waffles) and lemonade. I figured I'd try their specialty especially since I've never had these two together. The chicken was delish! Just the right amount of seasonings and crispyness you'd expect from fried chicken. It left me wishing I had ordered more chicken! The waffle was a waffle. I was kind of sugared out by the homemade syrup, but that's just me. Next time I'll have to try the sugar free syrup. My friend had the Sweet Potato Waffles and Sweet Tea. I had a bite and couldn't tell the difference between my regular waffle and the sweet potato.   Our two dishes together came out to about $28 with tip. All in all it was a good first time experience. I can't wait to try out the other items on their menu: breakfast items, sandwiches and of course more chicken, but I'll wait a few till they get all their issues sorted out.

rPIIcvIvo-e4eaS8rGSATQ.review_text: Three of us had lunch here yesterday and were all disappointed. The waffles were rubbery, before putting syrup or butter on them. After adding syrup and butter they turned into globs. Perhaps they were undercooked. The chicken breast was ok but the thighs were terrible, almost inedible. The quality of the chicken itself seemed inferior, and they tasted like they'd been fried a day or two earlier, then re-fried before serving,..tough and nasty. The service was good but the food terrible. I'm sorry we didn't just go for the red velvet cake. What made it even worse was we had recently had the same meal at Biscuits in Napa and it was off the charts fabulous!

DEne4NSGx1yunoiekck2Qg.review_text: I found a deal on Groupon so I decided to take advantage of the deal. Came here on a Saturday after walking around Japantown with my family. We waited about 5 minutes for our table and even longer to have our orders taken. We got seated at around 5pm and there were only 1 server taking orders.. The place was pretty packed already and the poor guy was running around like a chicken without its head. His helper didn't arrive until around 7pm which seems a bit buzzard considering it's a weekend and dinner time.. but anyways, the service would be better if they have enough workers.    I ordered the half chicken with split with my mom. Though the size portion is pretty decent and definitely filling, it didn't taste that good. The chicken meat were pretty dry and tasteless if you aren't eating with hot sauce or something else to add taste.   I'll try other chicken & waffles places before coming back here again..

LJ_6Mdrd959hEwSnuSwsPQ.review_text: I'v been here a few times and the Fried Chicken is LEGIT. Yeah, apparently it's not like Roscoe's but FRAK YOU I'd rather drive thirty minutes to San Francisco than six hours to Socal. It's a few steps away from Yoshi's (saw May'n here a few months ago...mo-te-ke!) and there always seem to be ample seating when I'm there.   The staff was kind, courteous, food was brought out quickly, and drinks were refilled often. The first time I went I got the half chicken meal (which cost between $12 to $13 IIRC) which consisted of two wings and a HUGE BREAST. To be honest both were SUPERB but I liked the chicken more than the waffles...it was crispy, piping hot, and full of flavor. It's ever better if you get it with a side of ranch on the side, according to them it's home made. I wish their waffles were a bit crispier though. I'd rate their chicken a 4.5/5 and waffles a 4/5. The syrup was kinda average.   Definitely liked it more than Little Skillet.

f2_ORdto2MUlxp6-LlmKgg.review_text: I came here for dinner with a friend a while back and forget why I didn't write a review, maybe it wasn't too memorable...but I came again about a week ago and remembered why this place is one of my go-to restaurants for really nice homestyle meals in a city where almost every restaurant is trying to go with the curve of the new trend.   Gussie's doesn't stray far from authentic homestyle food with it's southern-fare menu. I had the a breast of chicken and two waffles, both of which were pretty damn good. Almost comparable to Roscoe's down in LA. The chicken could have been jucier, but any fried chicken afficionado knows that the breast is usually a tad dry in the middle anyway. It's a big piece of bird.  The waffles were great. They tasted fresh and made just for me, which I loved. I definitely felt some kind of love in them, for sure. The mac & cheese? KILL! It's was so good...and them candied yams warmed my heart, too.  All in all a great experience.

FZg9zeqMlmfsUQpVS23dQw.review_text: Gussies is being touted as a southern restaurant, well no southern person I know cooks like this...NO SEASONING, NOT FRIENDLY, & NOT FRESH!!!  We arrived just before opening, and was greeted with an ice box for a restaurant, its raining outside and the heater is not on but the doors are all open. We are a party of 6 so we immediately ask for hot chocolate and coffee to get warm. Can you believe the coffee was not hot. The coffee tasted as if they just ran old coffee through again or  tried to let it get hot on the warmer, the second cup of coffee was hotter than the first; how does that happen?  We came for C&W so we that's what we ordered in addition to a child's plate, grits and an omelet.   First: We appreciate the hot syrup. The waffles were just OK, nothing to write home about. The chicken was off, either the oil was not hot when they dropped them to cook or they were reheated in the oven. Too much GREASE and lacked seasoning  Second: THE GRITS WERE HORRIBLE!!! skip those on the menu, they were cold and not seasoned at all. You MUST salt the water before cooking grits or they taste just like the box they came out of  Third: The wait staff leaves a lot to be desired. Our food came out in phases and they still forgot some items.  Gussies is not good value for the money. Our bill was $2 south of $100 and we left feeling as if we had just gotten taken for a ride. Breakfast is supposed to be the most cheapest meal, but not here.   I can say with a 100% certainty we will NOT be back!

RTvNOu0BzNQ4ytMewQuSdw.review_text: My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out after getting a groupon for it, cause hey, who doesn't love fried chicken? The place was nice, we got seated almost immediately. Everything was off to a great start. We ordered fried chicken and Mac and cheese, cornbread and French fries. It took almost an hour for our food to get to our table. And when it arrived, all we got was the chicken. We had ordered two pieces of chicken each. I got 2 pieces, and my girlfriend received 3, even though she ordered two. We thought that was a plus, until our bill came and they charged us for the extra piece we didn't want. Then we had to remind our waitress, who I assumed was the owner, that she forgot the rest of our meal. And then, after only bringing us our French fries, had to remind her again that we ordered cornbread. 2 pieces. We were served one. Like c'mon?! I had to remind you three times!  The table next to us sat down after us, ate their food and paid before we got our food.  2 stars because the chicken was good! But how hard is it to mess up fried chicken? An overall subpar, overpriced dining experience. Save your money, go to Popeyes, you'll spend 30 dollars less.

ai0NO-5N-QGRKwGpNQjSLA.review_text: Let's start at the beginning.  Greeted by someone that looked like they had just come from the dishwashing room.  Sloppy with a nasty T-shirt on.  Even though we had reservations, she told us we couldn't sit at a booth (there were 4 of us).  I explained my hubby had a bad hip and would appreciate a booth.  Mini argument ensued "i don't make the rules, I just follow them."  Finally got a booth.  The assistant wait staff "no habla English". And our waiter had to be brought to translate "herbal tea".  And the food???? ANYBODY who says this chicken is good just has never had good fried chicken.  It is dry, bland and tasteless.    Waffles just ok.  Had better in a hundred other places.    Health department score is 80.    Will definitely wont be back......

ItlNc0Ac2Mf8FzQShnXRYg.review_text: I'm no chicken & waffles connoisseur but I know a good meal when it lands in front of me. We can go on and on about how Roscoe's is supposed to be the best....but now that I've tried Gussie's, I beg to differ. I was really impressed with my whole experience. From the service to the food, everything was great. My bf and I ordered the chicken and waffles of course. However, my waffles were extra special. Made with sweet potatoes. My fave! Our chicken was crispy and seasoned perfectly. We also had the sweet yams and mac & cheese. We truly enjoyed it. Can't wait to go back!!! I hope it will be as good as the first time.

VgrVrn2ulnvOfAJrwHem0g.review_text: OK, went last night and I was not impressed at all.  If I had waited I would have been upset!  It should be called Gussie's dried chicken and waffles.  My chicken was so dry and it had absolutely no flavor to it.  What saved the rating was the waffles.  Those were off the hook!  I've had better fried chicken at Powell's, Farmer Browns or even Merritt Bakery in Oakland.  They are new, so it may take them a while to get the hang of things.  It's a really great spot and I liked the ambiance.  But if it's a fried chicken joint, they got a lot of work to do!

Db95DoCZ4mfHugJU28_vwg.review_text: Former resident of Savannah, GA. Could get better soul food by way of dumpster diving decomposed leftovers from a KFC. I could go into details, but why bother when each facet of the experience was equally off-point? Horrible food. I was looking for a southern fix and I was bait and switched.

3xsmXxDysn5yqflq3AzWKQ.review_text: It's not necessarily a replacement for taking a trip to New Orleans, but you have to give it to Gussies for their creativity and effort for creating a chicken and waffles joint on the west coast.  They add some San Francisco flair to the menu (including vegan waffeles), and they aren't trying "too hard" to pretend to be something their not.  On my first visit, I got a plate of vegan waffles (good option for those of us who are lactose intolerant), and threw in a side of herb chicken and a bowl of black beans and rice.  Everything was quite good - the waffles were tasty and moist and the beans and rice were fantastic.  They had a couple good options for cold beer on tap and a friendly, helpful server to top everything off.  It may not be the Big Easy, but Gussies offers a type of cuisine that is not widespread in San Francisco and they pull it off.

wUgDYU7zou8uSd0P6-_TUg.review_text: I discovered Gussie's chicken from a friend..told me that I HAD to try it because I love fried chicken.  So on a Friday nite, I decided to take the husband and go give it a try...parking is a bit of a challenge and you definitely have to keep an eye out for the restaurant as you get closer.    So we got inside and the smell of sweet cinnamon was just all over the restaurant.. a waitress came up to us to sit us at a table right away.  It was a busy nite so that was a good sign.  We sat down and got water right away and our waitress asked if it was our first time and we told her yes..she welcomed us and gave us a run down of their menu and said she'll give us a minute and be right back. Very nice and attentive.  We both went for fried chicken with a side of sweet potato and waffle..the waffle and potato was good, but toooo bad I can't say the same for the chicken...it was over fried and really dried.  I thought it was just my chicken but my husband's chicken was also really dry.  But, maybe it was just that batch.   I'm not sure if I will come back since I have other places tha tI like to go too on my side of the bridge.  But I will say the service was really good!

QHH1nZrVqmqnDhdGV1UzrQ.review_text: First time to Gussie's on Friday. Wow! I was totally surprised by the quality of the food.  The service was great.  Waiting for the food took a bit longer than other places, but well worth it.  When there, order the Filmore Special:  3 wings and 2 waffles with 2 eggs.  You cant go wrong.  Not very crowded during lunch time.  This place tastes almost like Rosco's, if not better.

chMQuaCZW4seokswRqcf8w.review_text: I really liked this place!  The bar area is a little small, but the presentation is very nice if you're looking to enjoy a drink and watch some sports. The service is good, friendly and efficient. One thing that I like about this place is the simplicity of the menu. On top of that, the food was delicious. I had a "downtown special" which had a drumstick and one waffle. AWESOME! I followed up with a red velvet waffle, which was the perfect dessert.  All in all, I'd come here again. My girlfriend loves soul food, so this place will make a great date!   Also, Friday nights they have a buffet and a DJ, so check that out. :)

b1USvIQdm_iKto19mInkwA.review_text: Tried it for the first time on Sat 10/27. Purchased a Groupon. Food was average. Service was good though it was very apparent they were not professional servers. But i give them Kudos for the effort. I asked the waiter if the Catfish was fresh. His response was "oh yes we make it right away" I wanted to laugh. When I asked when was the fish purchased he did not have any idea what I was talking about. 3 minutes later a female cook came out and asked if I had any questions. She then clarified that the fish was indeed fresh. I still laugh when I think about it. The Mac and Cheese was very good....greens just ok....same with the Black eyed peas....corn bread was very good....I prefer mine sweet which is how they serve it. I asked for a coke and the waitress brought me a can of coke, I asked if they had fountain drinks and she could not understand english well enough to understand me. Another wait staff had to come to explain that they only had can coke but it was unlimited. Portions are large and they have a good selection. Overall I rate them a 2.5 would have given them a 3 but the communication of the staff needs great improvement. I much prefer Everet and Jones in Oakland

8-JCm3604FQoLLiQgFVr_A.review_text: Delicious soul food and the best sweet tea!  Not to mention the staff is super friendly.

6lDU9TQwEfYNRbtFxvXARQ.review_text: I had the chicken and waffle (how could I not?) and it was OK. I wasn't completely thrilled with the breading -- it was a little oily and not all that flavorful. The waffle was better, thin and crisp with brown sugar syrup. I was much more impressed with the cheddar cheese grit cakes and and fried catfish. I might have to come back to try the desserts and for happy hour.

DiiyWCoTG_urZBffTsvx-Q.review_text: 3 stars for the food, which was mostly okay, but zero stars for the service, which was friendly and totally incompetent.  Bring your most talkative friends, because you're in for a long, long conversation.  I went with a large party during peak hours and we planned to be there for at least an hour or two, but it turned out to more towards two and a half to three hours. Do not come here too hungry or with a schedule of any kind, because you're here for the duration.    First, the food story: our party ordered a variety of items, including a vegetarian plate, soup, several plates of regular chicken and waffles as well as some cornbread and sweet potato waffle sides.  No complaints were heard, except possibly that the chicken was a little dry (mine was on the edge -- it was fine, but if you took too big of a bite, you needed something to wash it down) and the plain waffles were a little too light and bland.  You really need that ball of butter and brown sugar syrup they serve them with. I would've paid extra for the real maple syrup in retrospect.  I would've ordered it right then, but I didn't trust Gussies to handle such a last minute thing since they served our sides of honey and cornbread to other tables nearby. The sweet potato waffles were better and I would order just those next time and bring a book, preferably an epic novel.  Now, let me tell you  the service story, which is very long and maddening. So we're seated with our menus and they take our drink orders. The drinks don't arrive for 30-40 minutes. No, I'm not kidding.  Mind you, we did not order fancy cocktails, of course. We ordered sodas, water, coffee and tea. Twenty minutes go by after we've ordered our meals and still no drinks. Then after another ten minutes, the guy in charge of bringing the drinks, brings them out one drink at a time with a glass of ice in one hand and a can in the other. I cannot make this stuff up.  Apparently, this one-drink-at-a-time process was not simple enough to avoid confusion because he still got some of the drinks wrong, forgot to bring the straws, then when he went back to get the straws didn't remember to put them all in once he got to the table, taking one back in his hand, which I'm sure, baffled him once he looked down and saw the straw (why is that there?).  I think the solution here is get this fellow a notebook, preferably one that you can lift the sheet to erase it so you can just keep making notes, because between the drink counter and our table, he could not focus, even on just one drink or straw at a time.  He was not alone, though, in this struggle.  I really started to feel bad for him. On the other hand, why didn't someone give him a tray and help call out all the drinks so he could put down all the drinks at once and hand them out at the table so he wouldn't have to keep traveling back and forth, adding to his confusion?  Also, why were some of the diet cokes in cans, but others appeared to be from the tap? Very strange.  We waited over an hour for our meals to begin coming out.  I say, begin, because each person was served at a different time. Out of the 15 people, three people were served first.  Then ten more minutes for the next two, and so on so that basically by the time I was served (the last one! ha! maybe that's why I'm writing this, natch), it was a good hour and half from when we sat down and the first three people had finished their meals.  As people were served, many people wanted their drinks refilled as we were sitting there for so long and also requested some extras, which ended up going to different tables each time. I have to interject that after 45 minutes, one of our friends was informed that they ran out of her ordered item.  Yep, that's how much time had passed -- enough time to run out of certain dishes. Another friend was very late, but she ordered and received her meal in record time --- maybe because the lunch rush was over? It was totally baffling, except that she did not order a waffle (word to the wise!)  We kept joking about how there's only waffle iron in the kitchen and at one point, our waitress confirmed that there are only three waffle irons!!  Look, Gussies, buy a couple more --  jeez!! You're doing well. Go crazy! Buy another iron!  Then we received our check and when one of our party paid for hers with a credit card, she received another table's check along with her receipt.  Interesting.  We told our waitress and she just laughed it off. Ha ha! That happens all the time. Yeah, I see that.  The staff was all smiles the whole time, but it really went from comical to just irritating pretty quickly, especially since the food isn't that great.

pAY606HXZ4hPLwWk2E6qMg.review_text: Great food, but then it's hard to mess up chicken and waffles.  Overpriced for the portions, definitely not as good as Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.

zClgg9OI1ySGiDnwkQBzzw.review_text: So we finally checked out Gussie's because we love Roscoe's but seriously driving down to LA for just chicken and waffles is not on the to-do list every weekend... Had minimal expectations going in based on the mixed reviews from other Yelpers.   Pros: Their fried chicken was crispy and not too greasy. Mac and cheese was gooey gobs of goodness. The waffle fries and chicken strips came out piping hot and delish.  Cons: Waffle a bit doughy - needed to be crisper. Collard greens cold. Sweet tea way too sweet. Candied yams overly sweetened too. Service lackluster and slow.  I actually enjoyed the diversity of the diners - young and old, all ethnicities, families and groups of friends, etc.   Would I come back? Undecided...

_bF7I69OrJtLQPTsWZMNqQ.review_text: Came here this past weekend on a whim. I been wanting to try it and woke up and decided to!  We were seated right away. Here's what we had:  Downtown Special! I loooooved the chicken, waffle was good too but I could not finish it.  Side of Greens: everyone who knows me knows my love for greens although they were good they def were not the best I ever had or even near it so they were so-so.  Honey Cornbread: Big think pieces which were yummy!   Minus 1/2 star for price: It was like $9 for a drumstick and waffle and $4.99 for a side of greens! I thought that was waaaay too much. Minus the other half because we waited forever for the check and I hate that.  I was in a good mood that day and it def filled my hunger! plus the chicken had me moaning as my table laughed at me!

a6_LEr9yd34_QZhbE2J55A.review_text: I would give the waffles here five stars.  We tried the red velvet, sweet potato, and regular waffles.  Al three were very good.  The fried chicken was good, but nothing spectacular.  They were a good accompaniment to the waffles.  We also got some cornbread and that was excellent.  Definitely some of the best cornbread I've ever had.  The downgrade in ratings is due to the service.  There was nothing specifically horrific, just the overall experience was not great.  We were not greeted when we arrived as there was no one at the hostess stand.  The hostess apparently was also helping to bus tables as I observed her doing this.  I get that they were busy so that's fine, but when she finally did greet us, she just asked us how many and told us to wait.  No real friendliness or apologies for being ignored or anything like that.  When we were finally seated, we were only given the regular menus and had to ask for the specials menu when we noticed that other people had them.  Ok, that's fine, mistakes happen.  We then waited around for a while before the waitress even acknowledged us.  She took our drink order, disappeared for a while, then finally came back to take our food order.  We had to explicitly ask one of the bus boys for water after our order was taken.  Maybe this is one of the places you have to explicitly ask for water, so ok.  Our food finally arrived and it was quite good, as I mentioned above.  While we were eating and getting somewhat close to the end of our meal, the waitress came by and dropped our check off without us asking for it.  Since my girlfriend has a bit of a sweet tooth, she had been anticipating ordering dessert.  She did anyway so the waitress took the check back, but again, not something I was particularly keen on.  The dessert was good, too sweet for me, but Liz seemed to enjoy it.  We paid our bill and left.  All in all, good food, less than stellar service.  There seem to be a lot of Southern style restaurants popping up lately so we'll give one of those a try before trying Gussie's again.  P.S. Livers but no gizzards?  I need to find a real Southern place that has fried gizzards as well!

BJYaU73D-IoYo-7DV1-Xug.review_text: I can now update and increase the stars.  I had gone back a second time after my first  review, and things were better but still underwhelming. Today, on my third visit, I had a totally positive experience.  Excellent service (thanks Boone) delicious cheddar grit cakes, scrambled eggs and the best pecan pie I have ever tasted.  I don't eat meat, so am not the ideal Gussie's customer, but as I live nearby I am delighted to now be able to view Gussie's as great place to go.

Rolx4E510YoPgQX9LSvx6g.review_text: Came here for brunch on Friday. I give this place 3.5 stars.  *Fried chicken livers (Sounded amazing, but it was only OK.) *Sweet potato tots (So yummy and addicting) *Cheese grits (My first time trying grits so I didn't have anything to compare it to, but my sis-in-law thought it was gross. She took one bite and put it aside.) *2 kids meals: Pancakes with fried chicken legs (Very good) *Sweet potato waffles &  red velvet waffles w/ fried chicken wings (Very good)  I'd come back for the sweet potato tots and red velvet waffles with fried chicken. The place gets really crowded during lunch time, so I'm glad we came a little early. As for the service, the waitress was very nice, but she never brought us our to-go boxes, even after two reminders. We eventually had to send our nephew to grab the stuff from another waiter while she walked in and out with everyone else's checks.

g2vWVDIIX6P8gqNYAv52PQ.review_text: CHICKEN 'n WAFFLES.......  I didn't know how they were served.  I thought that it was chunks of creamed chicken on Belgian type waffles which appealed to me.  Then a friend told me how it is served, being a foodie, I had to try it out.  GUSSIE'S DID NOT PLEASE ME at all.  When I walked to the table i saw a man eating really good looking mac 'n cheese and he said it was great.I changed course and ordered mac 'n cheese and a biscuit.  After the first bite i realized that the it was basically a ONE NOTE DISH. Although baked, it didn't have any crispy edges and the cheese wasn't really an extra sharp cheddar.  Hoping it would get better, I had another bite.  That didn't happen so I pushed it aside.  On to the biscuit.......  it certainly didn't look like a true Southern biscuit that was golden and sky high.  When I bit into it, I was flat out disgusted as there was NO FLAKINESS, NO GOLDEN BUTTERED TOP and zero flavor. IT WAS SORT OF FLAT, LARGE ROUND WITH A DOUGHY TEXTURE. It looked like an industrial biscuit that never had a pair of hands kneading the dough.  MAN, was I disappointed.  I called the waiter over and told that I wasn't not happy and did not want to eat the rest of it.  He was very nice and accepting of my reaction.  On fact, before ordering the biscuit I asked him about it and he said he'd bring one and let me taste it.  It was my exit interview.  I would not recommend Gussie's and I will not return.  The waiter was gracious.    It was 5 PM so there were only 5 of us in the very bland place.  There was nothing that said "Southern" about the place.  I noticed that some yelpers said the food was "Cheap" and you pays for what you git".........  I'd rather have great food, great reviews and  return customers.  It isn't cheap and the mac 'n cheese is $5.00 for a small bowl.  NEED I SAY MORE....... N O P E

XlF_Od3qOngwITJAX4g2ZA.review_text: Went here when we couldn't deal with the huge line at Brenda's. It was surprised at how much we liked the food.   We all had chicken and waffles. The fried chicken is juicy and the coating is light and delicious. I had the sweet potato waffles and my only complaint was that the sweet potato flavor was a little muted. It's probably hard to do that because they are so wet, but it could've been a bit more pronounced.  The service is mostly pretty good, but there were small lapses (shouldn't have to ask to have the coke you took to refill back), but they were minor.  All in all I enjoyed myself and would go back.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Definitely saw way too much chicken and waffles on the Food Network and decided it was time for me to experience this phenomenon once and for all. The place looked promising given the crowd but the food never made it to my expectations.  Teriyaki chicken wings for appetizer were decent, sort of like the frozen Tyson ones you get at Costco. The chicken and waffles itself was disappointing. The chicken was not crispy and the skin was soggy which is like the ultimate sin to fried chicken. Waffles were like Eggo waffles. Sides were the highlights with the spiced sweet potatoes (and a mediocre mac and cheese). I have to try a place that gets it done right...

fxOM0K1czdmGhtAoP1UBUQ.review_text: Give your scale the finger, embrace your inner fat kid, and embark on a journey to the South that leads to food coma in its purest and most blissful form!   - Sweet(est) Tea (ever) - Crispy Waffle Fries - Sweet Potato Waffles  - Best Mac and Cheese in town - House Ranch dressing is to die for - Ranch + Chicken Tenders - can't even handle it - Miss Pearl's Banana Pudding - Jesus approves

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: I definitely miss the old Powell's Place here. Though I'm always excited about a good chicken and waffles, I think this place is on the expensive side for what you get. I wish they allowed some more a la carte chicken parts options. Maybe I feel like a wing and a thigh? Or a drumstick and a breast? You know mix and match. Got a combo that had the leg, waffles, and scrabled eggs with cheeese/onions. Pretty solid. Wait staff got our checks mixed up but they were overall pretty nice. It's good for a quick meal if you're gonna catch a show over at the Fillmore

1O1MfZlHbQx_U5G47a90JA.review_text: Was here today and hope management reads this. The staff although new was great. It seemed like everyone went out of their way to be attentive. My only complaint of the day was I ordered a side biscuit and side corn bread and it was cold. My chicken and waffle were however hot. I was kind of disappointed, warm corn bread or biscuit is so much better. The chicken was greasy also but not in a good way. More spices in your flour please. This place has potential and I will be back to try more on the menu.

uLQeiEXcCwt8cRBwpBM-qQ.review_text: If House of Chicken and Waffles is "Chicken and Waffles done right", the Gussie's Chicken & Waffles is Chicken and Waffles done out of this world. Everything about the Chicken and the Waffles are perfect. The good news here is you are not stuck with Chicken or Waffles if you suck and the sweet/salty concoction scares you. The gumbo is dynamite, the corn bread is come to jesus good and the side sampler with your choice of 4 sides is orgasmic. I said it. I dont care if its cliche. It is.

-R_tE7WO0S0fFU-rVzQvqg.review_text: Bad service! Food not memorable. Go to House of chix and Waffles Oakland. The best for me so far. I had 2 get my own utensils! WTF? They weren't even busy? Waffles were rubbery, and the chix, well Popeyes is just as good. The only thing good about that place was my company. Sorry,  I was really excited about this place 2. =( Place is clean and nice looking, that's it.

x2yZn2ulPfd4dMA2OiW-vA.review_text: Ok I was determined to do the taste test of Gussies and Hard Knox Cafe so I went to Hard Knox.......................... Gotta say Gussies takes it when it comes to Chicken and Waffles! Love both businesses though!

igv_ezZprmcicRzgzSzpQg.review_text: Finally ate here.   Service was horrible, understandable when the owner told me everyone called in sick.   The food tasted awesome until I took my last bite of chicken which kinda looked pink in the dimmed light of the restaurant. Was hard to grab the attention of servers since 90 percent they were not there.   Payed for the check and left. (After 2 and a half hours.)  Realized the chicken was undercooked and pink since I have not been able to leave the bathroom as I got home.  The owner told me they're moving to Oakland, maybe for the best, but still isn't worth my food poisoning as I'm writing this review.   Overall this place was not the hype I expected from my friends, and as an SF native, WTF?!?!  Sorry Gussie's, I hoped for a better dinner experience. The waffles were hella soft though, don't know if that's on point.

3twGxP4fOd2WtO8GyffvpA.review_text: Yum! Did you know you are suppose to eat the waffle WITH the chicken? So in one bite, there's a bit of sweet and a bit of savory? :)   Came here with Groupon, $20 got us two dishes and leftovers. Portions are very generous!

PxKsRhpYuwbV4GQf7iu_sA.review_text: Service is good but not catering.  I love this place for the fried chicken!!  When I want some fried chicken, this is the place to be.  I always get the Fillmore Classic =)  Yummmy!

T-xWvRZ1rLf5MgEkBMZXkA.review_text: I was staying nearby and stopped in for breakfast. Having just come back from the South a month prior, it's really hard to compare their food.   I have gone to Roscoes several times in LA, so it's probably the closest measuring stick.   The waffle was light and fluffy and the syrup was so good. The fried chicken is similar to Roscoes. I ordered a breast piece, just to see how skilled the chef was in his cooking skills. He failed my test, unfortunately. The outer crust was fantastic. However, when you cut into the center of the chicken, it's dry. I guess I can only have the best prepared fried chicken in the south.   I do want to return to try their side dishes, and I'm looking forward to my next visit.

OEqKaXW4KPsFCUJW6m8VQA.review_text: I came here once with a friend on a Saturday around noon.  The service was average but the food was pretty tasty.  I came here again several months later, in January 2011, on a Sunday around 2pm.  Half the restaurant, if not more, had unoccupied tables which were not reserved but just waiting to be filled.  And there were about 20 people waiting to be seated.  Waiting... and waiting... and waiting.  My party of 2 waited for almost 45 minutes to be seated at a table that was sitting vacant the entire time.    Once seated, we got no silverware and no water, only a menu thrown down on the table.  Only a couple minutes later, another server came by to take our order which we had not had enough time to decide on.  And still, no silverware or water.  Aside from being slightly rushed, the only semi-positive thing I can say about the visit was the service we got to place an order.    Then the food came...after 30 minutes!  And our very, very easy order was served to us incomplete.  Eventually we got water.  I ended up walking to the kitchen and getting my own silverware. Admittedly, my +1 and I ate the incomplete food (betting on the fact it would take another 30 minutes wait to get the missing waffles), waited for our tab, and left without paying (which, to this day, has probably gone completely unnoticed).   Honestly, I feel that I should have been the one giving Gussie's a tab and being compensated for my time and dissatisfaction.  The restaurant was not busy in the slightest, and the staff didn't seem to be short either.  I really have no idea what the issue was - there didn't seem to be any justifiable excuse for how absolutely awful Gussie's operated that day.  When my +1 and I left, there was a young family that had been seated before us and was still waiting to be served their food.  They must have been waiting for at least an hour after being seated.  I cannot even fathom having two little children and tolerating that, nor can I imagine being a server and thinking that's acceptable.  I will never go to Gussie's again.

qxHsP7VO2bgXE-8lgCACWA.review_text: This one star is not based on the food but management. Went there yesterday and it was closed. There was a sign on the door stating that they were closed due to a flooding. Nothing stating when they would be open again. I called prior to going there yesterday and the phone just ranging, thinking they were just busy we took a chance and went. I called again today to see if they were open and still the line just rang. If your business is closed due to some sort of remodeling or mishap, good business practice would be to make a recorded message on the phone letting customers know what's going on and when if any date you will re-open. That's just common business practice. Don't leave your customers in the blind. If you value your yelp customers, you should let them know you're closed till further notice!

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: Gussies has a great selection of Southern food. Their menu includes fried chicken, roast chicken, salads, sandwiches, veggie burger + other veggie-friendly options, gumbo, breakfast combos, homemade soup, waffles (their specialty is the sweet potato, but they also have original, cornmeal, and buckwheat), and a long list of sides - i.e. mac-n-cheese, fries, sweet potato fries, collard greens, candied yams + desserts.  I enjoyed my Uptown Special (1 fried chicken breast + 1 original waffle with a pat of sweet cream whipped butter) and a side order of waffle-cut sweet potato fries. I should've ordered collard greens with my meal to balance out the sweetness. I also shared the red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting & crushed pecans. Good, but a bit rich for my taste.  Their dining room has ample elbow room and a mid-size bar area broadcasting sports.  I look forward to returning for more Southern Goodness.

dUclOE62YQHEQNz62Nn8LA.review_text: I mean really, $10 for 1 waffle and 1 chicken breast and an extra $1 charge for a very tiny side of maple  syrup?!  The waffle was good, but how difficult is it to screw up a waffle?  Chicken breast was just average.  Ambiance and service was fine.  Bottom line - VERY overpriced for what it is.  To Gussie's owners/management - I too own a business in SF, so I know how challenging it is to realize a strong financial return on your investment.  But one thing I'm sure of, especially in this economy - you will do much better if you lower your prices by approx. 10- 20%.  I have been told by at least a dozen people that your prices are too high and I have to agree.

gDnCUfo0IT_hDl85Vr-h5Q.review_text: My Mom and Dad had the Fried Chicken and greens, huge portions, but you pay for it if you order it la carte instead of a meal. Very good and tasty. I got to try the chicken!  We will be trying the Sunday Brunch Buffer next for sure!

6ZpfGwq-raI2CmM69_aqng.review_text: You know you are in the right soul food place when the fattest people you have seen in SF are sitting there enjoying a meal. Oh good, fattening food, this is what I came here for.  Super crunchy chicken, crispy waffles, flaky biscuits. This place certainly has good food.  Major complaint: slow (but very nice) service, "maple syrup" is not maple syrup (liars). No but seriously, I don't know what that syrup was, but I am from Vermont and I know my maple trees.

l2xCm8GRWVlf33CI2ePDkQ.review_text: Not one, not two, but three black hairs in my delivery.  Looked great but this is not being eaten - actually I'm fairly I'm so grossed out nothing will be eating tonight.

Hc_NL_YV5TJ5II2iu-ic1A.review_text: I left my heart...in San Fransisco...and the exact GPS location is at GUSSIES!  I have eaten here 3 times already and can't wait to go back. I am a home grown southern girl...deep south...and I know when soul food is the real deal.   With my first look at the menu the endorphins were already pumping through my body and my soul was screaming YES! I had to order pretty much everything from every category and thankfully, I had about 8 people in the group to help me out. We had the fried okra (just like my grandma's), fried catfish nuggets (just like the ones from Big Creek Mississippi), Macaroni and cheese...or should I say "cheese with macaroni?. Fried grits...divine. Smothered potatoes, black eyed peas, corn bread n biscuits, collard greens (better than my moms!) and of course....the chicken. The breast portion was so huge its enough for 2 people. The wings were huge and juicy...tender and moist but not greasy.   However, the most important experience I had here...and this place is an experience...or more like an encounter. Yes, an encounter that your soul truly will respond to! You must save room for the BANANA PUDDING.  I was truly skeptical at first since I was quite sure Gussie had not been privy to trying my Aunt Margie's Banana Pudding. In fact, I know she has not  because I never met her at our family gatherings. Right.   At first bite I was undone. I couldn't believe how almost identical it was to what I grew up with as the golden standard...the high bar of banana pudding. WELL DONE GUSSIES!!!!! You have won a loyal fan for life!  Ya'lls will be back now...ya heah?

2-pozInNN9qDKnaYLmQP8A.review_text: I love Gussies! Their chicken & waffles are to die for. The first time I ever had chicken & waffles it was here and it was so yummy. Thin crispy waffles and that brown sugar syrup is the best tasting thing ever. I have tried a few other chicken & waffle spots in the east bay since and Gussies wins hands down. The last time I went to Gussies I brought a friend along and she had the red velvet waffles - omg was soooo good. We also had fried okra and homestyle potatoes - both winners. I can't wait to go back to Gussies! I live in Hayward and it is totally worth the trip to the city. See you soon Gussies!

ZMk8HdvZksUt5LUOAsoWvQ.review_text: The family and I enjoyed our meal, the music and service at Gussies's. I got a Groupon so it was more than worth it. We have been to Roscoe's and feel that they are both good. We will definitley return and try the buffett.

bMxbtTUWIP0_we5vVtOrVA.review_text: I was so excited to go to this place, as the opening had been postponed. Finally, my friends and I decided opening nite was the nite. The place was hella busy but our server Marcus was awesome. He was so concerned about making sure that we were happy. The kitchen was extremely slow, but it was the first night. If it hadn't been for his calm and super nice attitude it would have been more of an annoying experience. Not at all. We did have to wait an unusual amount of time to get our food, but once it came WOW!!!! The chicken and waffles were off the chain. Well worth the looonnnggg wait. I will definitley go back and for sure ask for Marcus' s section. He was just as awesome as the food.

BS52_5yRSqfjZ51SvpB4wA.review_text: Not impressed with this place.  The chicken had a different  taste from the fryer it was cooked in.  Not good.  The chicken was rubbery and  I couldn't even finish anything.  The mac n cheese was good while it was warm but after being disappointed  with everything else  that too lost its appeal.  I will stick with my favorite  place on 3rd Street  instead.  I came to Gussie's on a friend recommendations but I am sorry  I strayed from what I know was good.

3ocgtgRuvVeol7IjbB1uDw.review_text: Ok I recently had a lovely getaway with my boyfriend to San Francisco, we are originally from southern cali but of course we were "tourists" in San Francisco. We came by Gussies through word of mouth and I looked at the reviews on yelp so that confirmed our visit and I LOVED IT I had the chicken and sweet potato waffles. Coming from Roscoes Chicken and Waffles area, these sweet potato waffles were AMAZING !!! It even came with homemade syrup that complimented the waffles. The sweet tea was really sweet but it was authentic, I could taste the lipton tea bags mixed with the sunny california sunshine. I wish I could have been to gussies more then once to try thier other cusines..I LOVE GUSSIES!!!!!!! o and the service wasgreat!

7wqYmXhmzQwPRtopqf67_A.review_text: The owner was very rude. I was served chicken which was not fully cooked "pink in the middle", by the time my food came everyone else was done eating. I requested to have my meal complimentary since I was unable to eat it. The owner became very irate stating people like chicken that way. She was not willing to comp my meal although I came with a large party of 10 whom all paid for their meal. After going back and forth the meal was finally taken off and the owner began ranting...The sad part about it is the food was actually tasty...the customer service is definitely not worth it. We waited for about five minutes before anyone even greeted us at the door...the tasty food is the only reason I gave it 2 stars.

tHJFStDkFxTiYUu4eE7UCg.review_text: absolutely loved having sunday brunch here.  it was awesome, because it wasn't overcrowded and packed.  the brunch drinks were great, hit the spot!  and the food was really really good, great chicken and waffles.  i got the white meat chicken, which was really moist.  Also ordered the sweet potatoe tots and the banana walnut waffles.  the waffles were just right, not too sweet.   Reminded me of the southern comfort/soul food i had back home in Houston.  Needless to say we had to take a stroll to walk off all the food we consumed!  i would definitely recommend Gussies!

66M0jhUhZKSC0_tzJl0frg.review_text: As a long time devotee to Roscoe's, which I rarely getting the chance to visit except during the occasional trip to LA, I was excited to see a chicken & waffle house open up only minutes from my old neighborhood.  My room mate and I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon and left more than satisfied.  First of all, street parking was very easy to find and there was no wait for a table at 11:30 on a Sunday.  Having been my first time there, I conservatively went for the Uptown Special (chicken breast and one waffle).  I was pleased to see that the waffles were prepared in a similar 'Scoes' fashion (soft, thin and sizable).  The chicken breast was also very crisp and flavorful, though I thought it could have been a little juicier on the inside.  Gussie's offers a wide array of traditional soul food side dishes (greens, black-eyed peas, grits, etc) so we opted for the mac & cheese, which was also very good.  The service was average, though we were in and out in just about an hour, so I can't complain.  Gussie's is definitely a sure bet for the avid chicken & waffle fan.

ep4J44sWGWwBvXL-gar00A.review_text: Party of 3 women out for a night on the town, Friday 5:30pm.   Waiter-inattentive at best Wait for apps-30 mins Wait for food-1 hour, 15 mins Wait for peach cobbler requested when we first sat down-1hour, 45 mins. Fried cheese grits-worth ordering again, not unlike polenta Fried okra with red pepper remoulade-crunchy and flavorful Chicken-FABULOUS! Juicy and perfect Waffles-pretty darn tasty Sweet potato waffles-just as described, more sweet potato taste than waffle Candied yams-sweet and yummy Mac n cheese-room temp (so so) Collards-sweet and vinegary (good flavor) Cornbread-untouched after first bite It was an overall frustrating evening as there were only 1/4 of the tables filled upon arrival so we couldn't understand the long wait for food or service. They delivered  the wrong order to us and then asked us what we ordered (what they don't write it down?). We waited another 15 mins for them to get it right. We almost missed our theater date AND the ordered for (and now comped) peach cobbler was rushed out in a doggie bag, but there was only 1 order!  Not happy about sharing, but DELICIOUS all the same.  As I was leaving, the hostess asked me how I liked the experience.  I told her it was uneven and she laughed nervously.  $-73.00 before tip.  Will I return? Definitely, but maybe only for take out.  I know that they're new, but the pacing was horrendous and unacceptable due to the $$ charged.

r55d5qteZrVNvacgPje-3g.review_text: I read the reviews before dining here so my expectations weren't too high.  My co-worker was raving about this place so I thought I'd check it out since my hubby is from the south.    We got the southern sampler (juicy fried chicken, mac and cheese, collard greens and sweet yam) --  it was delicious and the portion was huge!  i loved it!!!  licked my plate and demolished it.   We also got the sweet yam waffles with chicken wings.  It was good but it wasn't to die for.  The waffles were a bit on the thin side but its all good.. i was full from the other dish to compensate.  :)    I would definitely go back!  The bill came out to like $32 for both dishes.

BupxMA1KZEV08MHfBD1EuQ.review_text: well the food and the history chicken and waffles from 1920,s.  is very interesting but i cant handle it ( so rich in calories).  Food is excellent and the service . its ok.. Definitely . I can come back but once month is ok for. Im anorexic person.

A7CExl3pqnTPyGT9L9zhMQ.review_text: Having been to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles in LA County area, I would say Gussie's is a close second.  It was good, but chicken was cooked too dry and the syrup was OK.

XmsYOTZIpq-ZLyNnGtgjgw.review_text: Terrible service, so terrible we began to think that the wait staff was racist.  It's one thing to have the memory of a goldfish, but to purposely not give a F#@! is bad business.  It's too bad a long time establishment has to suffer due to lazy, racist, and incompetent employees.

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: My New Favorite Fried Chicken spot - besides my southern born cooking roommate, this is some of the best I've had and let me tell you what..............................................­...................... During the weekdays at lunch they have a buffet w/ Fried Chicken, Fried Chicken w/ a maple something amazingly delicious sauce baked on the Fried Chicken! mmmmmmmm, then they have sweet yams, corn bread, fried cat fish (lightly battered), good mac and cheese - Holy Cow - it was the BEST.   check it out, nice atmosphere, there was an adorable young lady running around checking on everyone. She looked truly happy - beautiful smile and excellent attentiveness. Great addition to the Western Add.

aBo4pJhFKPs5MLHobREyJA.review_text: Nasty as hell!!! Close your doors because the chicken was tasteless and had feathers all over it I didn't even eat it, the waffle...again gross!! Watered down batter that is not southern food!! I will never waste my time or money! It took 25 minutes to get a two piece and two waffles!!

NeXRy1C7PxS7bvIcQ3SymA.review_text: Conveniently located around the corner from Yoshi's.  You can eat here before your show and still have a good meal that won't make you broke.  I got a 1/2 Chicken and Waffles plate with gravy and a side of collard greens.  Strangely, the 1/2 chicken came out in three different increments.  First we got two pieces, then one piece, and then two more pieces plus the bowl of gravy.  If you order dark meat, expect the pieces of chicken to be slightly smaller.  I found the chicken to be right in the middle -- flavorful but wasn't that exciting texture wise.  I was really surprised at how good the waffle was!  It was crisp at the edges but soft in the middle.  And the best part is that they bring the syrup out HOT; it makes such a big difference!  I liked how the collard greens weren't too chopped up... big leafy pieces with its natural, slightly bitter flavor.  I was looking forward to trying the mac 'n cheese but when I did, I was disappointed.  It was really dry and not that cheesy.  I've had many chicken and waffle combos and I would say this is a pretty good place to go to in the Bay Area.

wOG2_C7GuJ70FbIah7B94w.review_text: Once again, YELP nails it:  3.5 stars is just about where this place oughtta be.    For those of you who want the short story: yes, Go.  It's fine.  Overall, everything here is good.  Nothing is stellar, mind you, but they've got a nice selection, and most of the issues I have with them are nit-picky things.  Food is good, service was fine, overall "restaurant experience" left a little to be desired, but definitely worth eating at.  Okay, for the REST of you with attention spans longer than a 30-second commercial, here goes:  I'm very passionate about fried chicken, I should probably say that right off the bat.    I liked the crispyness of Gussie's fried chicken. I liked the size of the pieces, I liked the color, the consistency of the skin.  BUT, I felt that a) it could've used a little more "herbs and spices" for lack of a better term, and b) it was definitely DRY.  I know that somewhere out there, there is someone who has figured out a way to make fried chicken that is CRISPY on the outside, and JUICY on the inside. I'm not saying that I know how to do it, but before I opened a fried chicken restaurant, I'd make damn sure I learned.  And, while the QUALITY of the chicken was obvious, the overall flavor was just kind of ... OK.  It needed more ZING.  I don't know if that means marinating in the buttermilk longer, I don't know if that means more spices in the batter, but it seemed kind of .... middle of the road.  It needed something to push it over the top.    Props go to my waitress, Deanna, who did a really great job.  She was genuinely friendly and attentive.  The kitchen made a mistake (gave me brown gravy instead of breakfast / country gravy) and she swapped that out for me, no problem.  As I mentioned in the brief summary, nothing was outstanding.  Collards were OK.  Home fries were OK.  (The country gravy was great, but the biscuits that came with it?  OK.)    I liked their mac'n'cheese.  They do it, what I would call, "Southern Style", which is to say very similar to how I've seen it done at Powell's years ago, when they were on Hayes Street.  It's not the Velveeta version of Mac'n'Cheese.  It's drier on the inside, which I like sometimes.  It's a nice alternative to the more traditional / Stouffers kind of Mac'N'Cheese.  It's not gooey and soupy, it's more butter-y, with more individual bits of cheesy goodness, as opposed to a smooth blend.  (Note: your picky kids will probably hate it if all they are used to is Kraft or KFC.)  BUT ... folks, the people who run this place, you really gotta decide what you want to be.  Do you want to be RESTAURANT restaurant, and charge restaurant prices, or do you want to be a soul food place, maybe have some daily specials written on a piece of paper near a window, and keep it casual?  Because, as a restaurant, y'all need to step up your game.  The menu that was handed to me was faded, dirty.  This is one of the first things that people see.  This piece of paper IS your presentation to your customer.  For cryin' out loud, when they get old, faded, and dirty TOSS THEM OUT.  Bad first impression.  So easily fixed, it makes me wonder why no one in charge is paying attention.    At the start of my meal, I used the Men's room, washed up, no paper towels.  Okay, that happens, I know.  I tell the first waitress I see, "You need paper towels in the Men's Room."  She acknowledges me.  At the END of my meal, a good 15-20 minutes later, I go back to the Men's Room.  Do ya think they put paper towels in there?  Would I be WRITING this if they put paper towels in there?  Of course not.  'Cause y'all are CASUAL.  As in, "Hey, we'll get around to the paper towels EVENTUALLY, right now we're busy with customers."  But guess what, taking care of the bathrooms IS part of running a restaurant.    Also, cans of Shasta on the table, that's your idea of soda?  See, that's something that I expect from a place where you walk up to a window, look at a hand-written menu that's on a black board or written on butcher paper or something, and place your order with the lady behind the window and then pay her.  (Anyone remember Gravy's?  *sigh* That place was the best.)  But when you do the whole have someone GREET you when you walk in the to place - "Welcome to Gussie's" - when you do the whole SIT DOWN, let me take your order, and when you EXPECT to get a 15 - 20% tip at the end of the meal, then WE, your customers, expect better than a frickin' can of Shasta sitting on the table.  (I don't know, maybe the is a black folks / white folks thing.)  So, that's all I'm saying: if you're gonna be a sit down, quasi-respectable restaurant, then get a Manager on Duty who doesn't let the little things slip through the cracks. If you're gonna be a casual soul food joint, then lose all the pretense of being a quasi-respectable restaurant and just keep it focused on the food.    I'd go back, there's more on the menu I'd like to explore, but I wouldn't RUN back, you know what I'm sayin'?

tH2mkwx6Dxcbuw6Uf5Tikw.review_text: Amazing food.  The sweet potato waffles will change your life!

cTrlhfni7C3xFlyIL3x1bQ.review_text: Yum Yum Yum!!!! Chicken and waffles are my favorite meal ever and I'm pretty picky about how they're made, so with that said here is my review of Gussies.   First of all, every other C&W joint I've been to in the city was GRIMEY (aka dirty) and the food did not impress me. (Well, Criola Kitchen was OK). But Gussies is actually a very nice looking restaurant with great decor. I love that they play radio hits instead of cheesy restaurant music. And the staff was SO FRIENDLY!   The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is- all sides need to be ordered separately, theres no sides included with the meals so there isn't much variation (see Home of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland- their menu has like 20 different plates). Also, they are pricey: $15-$20 bucks for a plate depending on how many pieces you want. Also, the waffle can be more crunchy.   Other than that I would totally recommend this place over the sketchy 3rd st C&W places. However if you're looking to have your mind blown try the place in Oakland.

cie1b9elyL3Xd-aXLvi6DA.review_text: What a random dining experience. Stopped in before a show at the Kabuki because nothing says Oscar movie like fried chicken. While I was anxious for this place to be equal or better than Roscoe's in LA, it fell short big time.   First off, the place is virtually empty and it didn't help that practically every light in the place was shut off or not working. Even the main entry had no lights. Service was also sparse and I was certain our server was also the one cooking in the back. I tried the 2-piece chicken and sweet potato waffle combo. Portions were a good size and really, the food was pretty decent.  Overall, I was generally confused by the whole experience and began to realize that maybe this place was more take-out quality given there was a stream of people coming in and out only. Management definitely needs to revamp this place because the idea is quality while the rest, well, isn't.

NLgTfZz_ITzmV6KiO-mGIg.review_text: What I remembered most: their signature sweet potato waffles (very good) and... the poor service. My friend presented his Groupon deal to our server, which I assume didn't make her very happy. First, she seated us at a corner, which is easy to overlook because it was right by a "blockade". She pretty much neglected us the whole time, had a sassy tone in her voice, and the food took forever to come out.  Sigh. Totally not worth going back for their sweet potato waffles.

AfTfYtWGCDHw0o5ZSIl4Og.review_text: I went to Gussie's with a big birthday party and thought the service was fantastic! Our waitress was really sweet and attentive and had a good sense of humor. Our busser was also incredibly attentive, noticing I didn't have glass of water and brought me one before I could even ask. We brought our own cake and they not only cut it for us, but served it on plates drizzled with chocolate sauce and a dollop of whipped cream which was very thoughtful of them. I really enjoyed the cheddar grit cakes and fried okra appetizers. I had the chicken and sweet potato waffles which were ok. The drumsticks were really dry and chewy all the way through. I really loved the flavor of the waffles but they are thin and on the chewy side.

7wmId4qnshL36UU_xDs3fQ.review_text: Every time I opened Yelp, Gussie's would be glaring me in the eye, so I took it as a sign to try my very first chicken and waffles.  Gussie's deserves 3.5 stars.  We headed over on a Friday night around 10pm.  No wait, the hostess was very nice, and the place was clean and comfortable.  Our server was also very pleasant, but got our order wrong and came out with a chicken breast after we had repeated thigh 4 times.    I ordered the 1/4 dark with 2 waffles.  The chicken was over-fried, very dry, but the waffles were good.  The mac and cheese was also dry and lacking flavor.  BUT I have to agree with Gary K. - there's something about putting chicken on my waffle and smothering them in syrup that made it all change.  I didn't care if the chicken was dry, I didn't care that the waffles weren't crispy.  Sweet and salty all in the same bite!  Bil ordered the gumbo and was pleasantly surprised by the taste.  Mr. O wanted a milk shake off the menu, but they didn't carry ice cream yet.  Overall, I agree with others in saying they have their kinks to work out.  But the taste is there and the people at Gussie's are super nice.  I think I'll saunter on over in a few months.

ffMnIH-CHY-fH8OBxfr98A.review_text: Love the banana pecan waffles, my husband loves the chicken and waffles. I think their food is great, the service is great, it could be a bit cleaner though, so  4 stars.

mEk8BMD6T30ZlrY_SujJnQ.review_text: NOT A PLACE TO TAKE KIDS!!!! GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR. Honestly the worst dining experience of my life ever!! So I had been once last week had a great late night meal with coworkers and decided since I live 2 blocks away to return with a friend and our kids after a day at the pumpkin patch. We were seated promptly and ordered shortly after, a few of the drinks we ordered finally arrived and were gone in no time.... My friend ordered  waters and a coke and that came after several times flagging a waiter that was not our waitress, the coke flat and undrinkable and one water that everyone wanted. 45 minutes later all of the people around us appeared to be receiving great service our waitress ignored us, the children were getting restless and we were as well. The food finally arrived for everyone but I , I was asked what I ordered by our waitress and we asked for silverware and napkins and water as she sped away. My food finally arrived no silverware to eat it, my children at this point were unable to sit any longer. The other waiter brought us water and silverware.Hungry and thirsty and no patience I left I took my kids outside for air and decided to take food to go  .... Over an hour spent here and did not eat!!!! I was so excited a restaurant to take the kids in my hood NOT!! I will never return nor recommend the food to anyone as it is mediocre. We will stick to Farmer Browns were we have taken the 3 kids on several occasions no problem.

vsR0U94KKofYof7YdETkhg.review_text: Sweet potato waffle is out of this world.  The sweet potato syrup is like nothing I've ever expereinced.  Delicous!  Biscuit with mushroom and bacon gravy is off the chain, and on the cheap.  The staff was very friendly, and my meal was served fresh, fast, and with a smile.  Can't wait to go back.

Ei7-q2fCZLaGar1GTkUtYg.review_text: I love this place! My husband and I have been here many times during the day but went for the first time at night, last night. Walking into the restaurant, right away the hostess was friendly and delightful. Our server was a genuine kind and friendly guy. I love a place that has such a good vibe from the staff, it makes me feel at home and ready to enjoy my dinner. The food of course rocked. My husband had the downtown special.
