He horked that waffle so fast, I barely got to see it. Fried chicken is always cooked to perfection, crispy on the outside and moist inside, the way it should be. I had the chowder which was wonderfully spicy. They had a DJ who was awesome rocking a lot of old school tunes. It added so much to the atmosphere and helped to make an already great time even that much better.

KbYzTFbhR4FFyWAILb-4lg.review_text: Meh.  Food was average, but nothing wowed us sadly.  Some of the dishes even came out lukewarm.  It's understandable if they were quick, but food came out soooooo slow, was it just sitting out before it got to our table?!?    Service was cool though, they let us substitute a few things in our Southern Comfort and Taste of the South dishes.  We were able to switch out a waffle from our fried chicken dish for the red velvet waffle which allowed us to try both waffle batters.    Thank goodness for my friend's groupon, I can't see myself paying full price for the meal.

GGiEucIuUFy_fT7zT63XwQ.review_text: Definitely a chicken and waffle lover --  I really love the set up of this restaurant, however -- I wish the quality of the food matched the atmosphere. Don't get me wrong, the food was GOOD, but Gussie's could definitely up their game.   The fried chicken was good. Though I left satisfied, I must admit there wasn't really anything special about it - especially compared to Auntie April's or other lowkey Soul Food restaurants.   I was really excited over the thought of a sweet potato waffle, but the flavor of the sweet potato didn't really stand out. I definitely wouldn't mind going back; however, I feel as though you pay more for the atmosphere as opposed to the quality of food.   The service could be better, but I do appreciate the fact that they serve alcohol.

t2RvfTcnXCnil3WOs4kC4Q.review_text: Mac n Cheese is great very cheesy (5stars), and the catfish nugget app is best with the great dip(5stars).  Chicken was not great, sweet potato waffes and cornmeal waffles are not memorable.  ordered take out, so i dun have to worry about the wait the other yelpers warn of.  Would give them 3 stars, but a chicken waffle place should have good CnW!

xBpkgjEcc-gXnkPDgtKnkw.review_text: As a southern boy I get some serious cravings for perfectly fried drumsticks, hot waffles and syrup. Gussie's did it up right. We will definitely be back.

h_y9QfNWJtzmLiMTF8ALSw.review_text: I don't eat anything fried, unless it is fried chicken... And I would eat Gussie's chicken anytime, but I will never eat the collard greens again... It was the most bitter tasting greens I've ever eaten before.  Also, the waffle batter didn't taste like anything special.  Not like the waffles that Roscoe's makes.    The chicken was lightly breaded with a delicious rub, and pair excellently with the candy yams.  Can I just say, the yams was  sensational, because it wasn't overly sweet or mushy.  The baked mac & cheese, was fantastic because it was dripping with american cheese.  The chicken was a bit on the small side, but if you get the taste of the south plate, you will have plenty of food.  FYI, the they don't carry sweet & low for the ice tea, which really needs it...   Oh, the red velvet cake was extremely dry, but not sweet at all...

6vZiVk2vyOVqkeNpcGHxfA.review_text: EHhh, Mediocre food, happy hour ends at 7PM. I guess a lot of places end their happy hour at 7PM, but we went here for a work happy hour, and I didn't really enjoy their food. One good thing is that they offer sweet potato fries, which is awesome, but there's nothing else i'd recommend here. Maybe I'm not a southern food type of person, maybe i've been spoiled by Roscoe's, but their chicken pieces is a little small and I didn't see anything special. Sue me.

3FlSlBadSvnKPEWlaRq6-w.review_text: OMG!! Let me say that this was my first time having soul food. I had the "Taste of the south" ANNDD was that chicken JUUUUUUICY!! Hmmmm, the mac and cheese was so cheesy this was just an amazing dish overall!! I also had the red velvet waffle and that was good too! I would defiantly recommend this. I ordered it to go so i was not able to experience the service inside, I will however return back and do so.

pwhZHIWjnBj1em-Q-GzuGQ.review_text: This was the first place I've ever had Chicken and Waffles and I loved it! What really makes this place amazing is their syrup, It ties both the chicken and waffle into an amazing sweet and savory bite. I've tried their regular waffles and they were delicious with chicken but I've also tried their SWEET POTATO WAFFLES and I will never go back to regular waffles again!  I also love:  fried sweet potato tater tots fried okra sweet tea (You have to get their sweet tea! I think its free refills any ways!)

L2Bm-Ou14ZzN0-xChI7hBQ.review_text: Being from the "real" South...not so Cal, I not only miss the food but the hospitality as well. I have eaten here at least 4-5 times, and always enjoyed it.

kv9Vg5FbJiFgcNQ_FOJ2Ng.review_text: Went on a Sunday evening so parking was easy and got seated right away. Service was eh.  Got the chicken and waffles.  Chicken not juicy, skin kinda hard. Waffle was ok.  Their syrup was good.    It's decent, it was nice checking out but didn't wow me.

J91NMCPIcU5mVgVV8vdxkQ.review_text: I went to Gussie's last night after my graduation with a party of 11 about an hour to closing time. They sat us promptly without a reservation and without any attitude. So they get a thumbs up in my book.   The food was GOOD, not the best I've ever had, but the portions generous, and the price is right! The fried catfish stole the show, and its hard to go wrong with mac and cheese and sweet potato fries. My only complaints are that the chicken was a little on the dry side and everything was a tad salty for my taste. But we all cleaned our plates....so how bad could it be?  The service was super friendly, but kinda slow. Our food came out unevenly, leaving 3 of my friends awkwardly waiting for quite a long time while the rest of had our plates. I also could have done without the overly loud live smooth jazz. But the place has character and I would definitely try it again.

HCcy2jjqhmgS6i-Qeo_eSg.review_text: I was disappointed, the fried chicken was very dry and had no flavor. They destroyed the fried chicken! Waffle was tasty, maybe it was the syrup!

4nZlMrDw-mrvmfEVT-cQrw.review_text: we got the weekday buffet which was $10.  we got there around 11:45 and were seated right away.  our drink orders were taken and we were given plates.  the buffet here is like larry flynt's hustler club's lunch buffet.  it's served on chafing dishes.  i remember the following being available for your consumption:  - fried chicken - tasty! - roasted chicken - loved it - red beans and rice - hella loved it - candied yams - hella loved it - mashed potatoes - meh, i've had better - catfish nuggets - i'm allergic to fish so i didnt try it but Jay V. said it was good - green beans - a-ok - mac and cheese - cheesy fo sheezy!!  there were a couple of other dishes that I didnt try but for $10 this was a good deal.  i wanted to try the waffle but after reading other reviews, i was scared that it was gonna take an hour to make my waffle so i skipped out on it.

OFNFtTc48LmXNk_NeZe9dw.review_text: Chicken and waffles have always been a fascinating idea to me... just as I find the fact that Mexicans eat beans for breakfast fascinating too, but that is another review!   So my friend was telling me about this new place that served chicken and waffles which she was dying to try. We had just been to 1300 on Fillmore a week before when she noticed it. I figured.... sure, why not. We don't have anything else like that in the area unless we trek out to Oakland. So, I decided to go check it out today and I was surprised by how nice the staff was, how fast the food came, how tasty it was. The portions were just right for me (I couldn't finish it). We both ordered the 1/4 chicken (white meat) with 2 waffles. I also added a side of mac-n-cheese.   I looked over to other peoples tables (it's such bad taste, but hey... I had to see what they were eating to make sure I made the right decision. I looked over and saw these gigantic dishes with rice and beans... man, it looked oh so good, but I went to try out the chicken and waffles (another trip is in store!).   Food:  Anyhoo.... back to my chicken, it could use more flavor, but the chicken breast I got was good, not the best, but adequate. The waffles, I can see where people feel it to be a little chewy, mine was too. It was not bad, but it needs fine tuning. The syrup was really good and nice and warm. I ordered a "sunrise" for my drink (aka-arnold palmer = half lemonade, half tea) and it was absolutely the best mix I had in a long time. I received refills, not sure if that was an error or not, but I would have never ordered a refill on it, not because it was not good, but because at $2.50 a pop, it adds up quickly. There was also gravy w/onions (I am allergic to raw or slightly cooked onions). The server was nice enough to bring me a bit to try out to see if it had been cooked enough to not bother me, but it did. Oh so sad :( My friend liked it, so I will trust her judgement on it. The Mac and Cheese was delish! Which for almost 5 bucks was really overpriced, but I loved how it tasted. Not greasy, not over or under cooked... just yummy. But I think the price is a bit high for the portion.   Service:  We were seated right away (they were busy, but had a table for two avail.) Our server David was really sweet. We took our sweet time figuring out what to order because they menu is quite large. But I have nothing but good things to say about him.   Ambiance:  This place is somewhat casual, although you will see people come in wearing their Sunday best too. It is nice and clean, spacious, looks like they have a private room too and a bar (I believe they have a late happy hour 10-11pm). Lots of light from the large windows. The silverware really should be upgraded to sturdier ones because my friend's fork was bent and I managed to bend mine cutting the waffles since hey were on a chewy side.   Overall:  It is a new restaurant and like everything new, you need to give it some time to settle in. I did not find anything horribly wrong with it. I will definitely go check it out again. I just hope that management is taking note of the comments made and make things even better than they already are. I look forward to making this place one of my regular stops and wish it much success.   PS -  If you miss Roscoe's that much,  just go back to LA and get your  Roscoe's waffles. You can't expect everything to be the same as Roscoe's and on top of it, we don't have one anywhere close, so what is the point? Yeah... I am ranting now... oh well! We are all entitled ;0)

zXbuUgJPaubGLVh8n-re8w.review_text: I went here with some friends and it was AWESOME! I didnt think they had a buffet, i just thought you would go up and order, but when I walked in i was surprised at the ambiance! The tables were topped with white linen the lights dimmed and a server there to greet you. I asked my friend how much the buffet costs and she said $12! I nearly fell over.   The choices were fantastic, from the fried chicken,  baked mac n cheese to cat fish, everything was hot and fresh! And when we went around lunch time, it wasnt as full as I thought it was going to be so thats also a plus.. They take cash or charge but parking is on the street, but its worth it! Haven't tried coming here for dinner, but as soon as I do I'll write a review on how the dinner service is. :)

zKcygYxaCij4xXTNruc_7w.review_text: Chicken livers are delicious! Also had the chicken wings, home fried potatoes, and biscuits...all absolutely delicious. Huge portions for the price and very friendly service. Will eat at again whenever I'm in the area.

twUwbPXoBpqDDFnPKnXUbQ.review_text: I went back to Gussie's last night, my chicken and waffles loving friend insisted. Much to my dismay the food didn't get any better, the service was actually worse (surprising since there was about 10 waiters hovering around us the whole night and it still took us 30+ minutes to get our food). Also very much to our outrage, their liquor license has been pulled, so the only thing that could have gotten me through that meal (a nice beer) was taken away from me! How depressing.

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: Not even going to pretend I'm from the South. I just know I loooove the food.   Gussie's is good, old-fashioned comfort food in a casual, family-friendly setting with super-friendly staff. The food is greasier than I'm used to, which is probably my only critique. Otherwise, the flavors are right on. I got the Taste of the South and it was the perfect sampler of classic Southern favorites: crisp, moist, tender fried chicken; soft, savory collard greens, mashed sweet potatoes (not a fan, personally, but these were done well) and rich, creamy mac 'n' cheese. Oh, and portion sizes were huge.

El_T89RshkETXeyR3sv_Hw.review_text: Our first visit was prompted by a coupon that made the total cost so low that we did a double-take at the check.  We weren't highly impressed.  We went back to pay full price, modest, for reasonable faire. I wouldn't call the cuisine "Soul". To me it's more Southern than Soul but I'm a San Franciscan so maybe I simply don't know.  We're still not highly impressed but it's OK and the price is right so there's no reason to not go there.

RsmzkgQ6S9ghtKb2DGX0Mw.review_text: I experienced Gussie at the SF Weekly Dish Event. It definitely made me want to go to their restaurant. I had the cheddar cheese grit cakes and those were really good. It was a nice crunch on the outside and you bite into moist and cheesy grits on the inside. It was like a hush puppy but better. The breading on the catfish was a bit too salty but good job on the fish. I know this may sound funny but there wasn't any kind of fishy-ness to it and I really appreciate that considering I don't like fish, especially catfish. It was moist and tender. They ran out of fried chicken so I will be definitely paying them a visit for that.

zN1M_9zrN1TpPe3c883qqw.review_text: Arrived just before noon on a Sat. Had res, but didn't need it (although restaurant started to fill up soon after 12). I had 1/4 chicken and waffles; husband had chicken strips. LOVED the waffles (ordered a third one!). Preferred strips to 1/4 chicken, but both good. Kept eating waffles so took away much of the chicken for supper. Good, friendly service. Not super speedy but the place was nearly full. We will definitely be back.

7BI4qysS-kdwPF7FnXf4hg.review_text: Great breakfast and great service.  I'll definitely be coming back here.

1RYA8zIbpe-JiP23X_SYjQ.review_text: This place is horrible. The waitress was very nice and accommodating. The gumbo was salty beyond being any kind of edible, my corn cakes were cold in the middle, and raspberry margarita tasted like pure sugar. We ended having our whole meal comped. I will never return.

F9ZXZuOzUnQYyV7DUfdZaA.review_text: Floppy fries, rubbery "chicken" and poor management. She was the type that would spit in your food if you try and complain.

Dj77pkw_EZJvR-F4RIf_BQ.review_text: i think it's hilarious reading people's reviews about being scared out of their minds coming to this gussie's...this is my hood...where i spent the last decade or so of my life...and i couldn't be happier to find such a classy establishment right in my backyard.  the 31 bus stop is right outside the front door...the windows are tinted so it's a little difficult to see inside at night...but once you walk in, you're in for a pleasant surprise.    i love the ambiance.  it's fancy for what it is and what they serve...you'd never see a kfc or roscoe's decked out the way this place is.  it has a romantic feel...and i believe they also have live music at times.  the service was great from the start.  every person working there was very attentive and right on the ball.    oh gussie's...where has this sweet potato waffle been my entire life?  by far, the best waffle i have EVER had.  it doesn't need all that butter or syrup...the waffle is enough to make me drool.  the fried chicken was super fresh and crispy...but strangely enough, i wouldn't come here solely for the chicken.  the waffles are the winner winner chicken dinner here.  oh!  and our last item...THE BANANA PUDDING!  what the heck was in the banana pudding that made it oh so delicious?  i was stuffed by the time we got to the dessert...but i made wifey get it anyway...and i swore i would only take a couple of bites...(i'm a banana hater).  but by the end, i had the bowl right in front of me and i wasn't about to share anymore of it.  besides bananas and pudding...they layer the bottom with vanilla wafers!  omg...i love vanilla wafers.  it was amazing!  oops, i forgot to mention that we also ordered the taste of the south...that plate came with 2 pieces of chicken, collard greens, candied yams, and cornbread.  everything on that plate was also yummy...my only complaint was that the collard greens were waaaaaaay too salty.  the cornbread was right on with moisture and flavor...the candied yams were good but just too much for me by the time i got to the end of the meal.  these plates are huge!!!  i would love to come back here again...but i think i need to run a couple of miles first.  see you again gussie's...and save some banana pudding for me!

9vdHmmGYK-X5zGViO0pmow.review_text: Given it was their first week, I will not dock too many points for their super slow service. I understand there are many kinks to work out with a new place and new staff, etc. I hope they work it all out, because I would love to see them succeed!  The food was great! I had the Sunday best (smothered breast and wing) with mac n cheese and.... red beans and rice??Hmm,  I asked for collard greens-- whatevs, it was all delicious! Chicken was perfectly cooked, moist on the inside, flavorful crunchy crust (even when smothered!) and the fixins were top notch and generous portions! Still had a full to go box at the end!   My BF had the uptown special- a breast and a waffle and was super pleased. I am not even a waffle person and LOVED their thin waffle and divine homemade syrup-- not your average waffle syrup, folks. We asked what was in the syrup..cinnamon? Cloves? The sweet waitress claimed nothing special, but I don't buy it. That's a valuable tight lipped employee you got there, Gussie's!  Our waitress brought us a little sampler of sides since our food took so long to come out (about 1 hr), but the chicken wings looked like they were rejects that didn't turn out right. Regardless, we were starving and it was a nice gesture.  Being from NC though, I think the sweet tea could use some work , as could the funny-tasting cornbread. But, alas, we shall return for the heavenly chicken and waffles-- and hopefully not wait an hour next time!

2ervbjRcLFjvI3UfXeLFBA.review_text: This place has a lot of mixed reviews, but I'm glad that hasn't stopped the bf and I from dining here. We've only been here twice and actually really like the food.   The 1st time we ever came here, they had a DJ. We recently went on a Friday around 9pm and there wasn't a DJ, so I'm not sure how often they do that.  Anyway, we both ordered what we had the previous time we had been here. The bf had the "Taste of the South," which is a quarter of chicken (he got a breast and thigh), collard greens, candied yams, mac 'n' cheese, and cornbread. I got the "Fillmore Classic," which comes with 3 wings, eggs (I got mine scrambled), and the option of 2 waffles, but I only wanted 1. Then we had the southern corn and red beans and rice for sides.  We didn't wait tremendously long for our food. I actually felt like it came out fast. Our waiter was on top of it and would periodically check up on us. He really seemed genuine about providing good customer service.   The bf had no complaints about his food. I tried his collard greens and candied yams and they were sweet, but not overly sweet. I actually want to get them next time. The cornbread was nice and fluffy. My wings were perfect. The chicken was juicy and the skin was crispy, but not overly fried. The eggs were standard. Loved the waffle! The southern corn was nicely seasoned. The red beans and rice were alright.   Overall, we enjoyed the food. We spent about $50 with tip and that included 2 beers as well. It's a place you have to at least try once. As far as service goes, my only gripe was that the hostess failed to seat us right away when she saw us walk in and didn't even acknowledge us. But, other than that, it's a good place to go for your chicken and waffles fix.

TGdvWqrNb4I2UeDn-1FpLQ.review_text: I was expecting a Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles...and it didn't meet those expectations at all.  I ordered the daily special: one fried chicken leg with rice and gravy and cornbread for $7.50.  The food took awhile, but I understand that frying food can take awhile.  My chicken thigh was pretty yummy and salty.  The skin was crispy and the meat was moist.  This was the only good part of my entire meal.  The cornbread was SUPER dry and cold, and it didn't come with any butter.  My rice looked sad and tasted old...you'd think having rice smothered with gravy would make my tummy smile, but the gravy tasted sorta bland; I could probably make better packaged gravy. I think the biggest disappointment was the inconsistency in portion sizes and forgetting an order.  One of my girlfriends didn't get her order because the server apparently forgot to write it down on his order pad, which we shrugged off.  BUT by the time she got her food, the rest of us were almost done with our entrees, and her chicken thigh was half the size of my thigh!  Word of advice: keep the thighs the same size for people in the same party...that way you won't have all this comparing going on.   I won't be returning here.  Wasn't terrible, but nothing to write home about.

rvQlwQjTUMAms6zv-qeXVw.review_text: My girlfriend and I went to gussies at 5:45pm tonight (12/19/09) We had been before, and absolutely loved the food, and the service was certainly nothing to complain about.  However, tonight, well, it was horrible.  We were seated immediately and the waitress took our order within 5 minutes.  The waitress did not pay any much attention to us and we had to repeat our order a few times, we were worried that she didn't get it right, but decided to give her the benefit of the doubt.  Our coke arrived, it was flat and tasted watered down, which is weird cause it comes from a can.  The restaurant was not very crowded (maybe 5 groups of people total, it was still early in the evening) yet we kept seeing orders go out to tables and get sent back due to it being the wrong order.  This made us worry a little bit.  The couple seated next to us told us they had received two wrong orders.  When we saw her bring the right order to them she was actually eating something.  We also observed the waitress taking a tables order while chewing her fingernails. This is just gross  Maybe 25 minutes in, the waitress comes by to ask us what we ordered.  She said there had been a mix up in the kitchen.  That was a lie, we all knew it was her. She confirmed our order and said it would be out in two minutes.  We waited... And waited...  By now it was 6:30pm.  We had not received our food and the waitress was paying no mind to us. We decided to wait five more minutes.  Those five minutes rolled around and we walked out.  I have never walked out of a restaurant before, and hope to never have to again.  But I have never, ever received such poor service (especially when it was not even crowded). I thought the hostess would ask us on the way out how the food was, I was kinda hoping to vent a little at someone.  But even she had long ago left.  This was very sad, as the food was so tasty when we first went.  However, we certainly will not be going back to Gussies.

fvYeQRtSc8iKDOr83SB3ow.review_text: Sorry Gussie's, you just didn't do it for me.  Decor wasn't homey enough for a fried chicken joint, the side order of gravy lacked a thick consistency and homemade flavor, the chicken was smaller than my ... hands, and the waffle - while good - didn't complement the chicken as well as some of the best chicken and waffle joints I've been to.  Waiter was as awkward as Beyonce covering you oughta know at the grammy's this year, but he grew on me.  With that said, I hope you can improve and stick around.  There aren't many chicken & waffle joints in this city, and for those of us who crave chicken & waffles, we REALLY crave chicken & waffles.

A5ldtVQWuaEl6RT5ZJ3qtw.review_text: for one, you cant go wrong with chicken and waffles.  i will take a frozen eggo and be happy.  this place just opened, so i will give the service a little break.  i had a friend order for me, so for ME it didnt take a long time to make my chicken, but for him it did...something like 30 minutes.  the chicken was pretty decent, could have been a little juicier, but i do like the batter...not overly greasy.  the waffles were solid.  i still have to go check out this roscoe's place in l.a. sometime.  who's down?  roscoe's and pinkberry!

ePVKrCdxj6NLqqs5v1MS8A.review_text: UPDATE: Just found my old receipt, the server's name was Deanna. She served us on March 25, 2012. She had a terrible attitude towards my boyfriend, who is handicapped and needs extra room for his seating. She was acting skeptical that my BF NEEDED extra room to sit since he wasn't sitting in a wheelchair or holding onto crutches. Just because you're handicap does NOT mean you must have either of those things. Also she indirectly accused us of lying about the amount of OJ's we ordered. Rudest service we've ever received in a restaurant.  Previous review below:  Great neighborhood, lots of hype, totally overrated.  Ordered the fried chicken and waffles (the sweet potato one), loved the sweet potato kick but the sweet potato waffle was not crispy one bit. Soggy! The fried chicken was okay, outside was crispy but the meat was dry. Sadly I enjoyed Popeyes and KFC more.  Service: TERRIBLE. Waitress was SO RUDE!  I ordered a glass of orange juice from her, then later I requested an empty cup with ice from a waiter so I could share the juice with my boyfriend because I couldn't finish it.  The restaurant was also crowded at the time, so the waitress barely had room to get past my boyfriend's chair. Because he has had knee surgery, he has to sit with extra room. The waitress was demanding he move his chair, and evan after he told her he can't because of his injury, she looked at him like he was bulls#itting since his jeans covered his knee.   The bill comes and we noticed that the bill had 2 OJs instead of One, so we told the waitress. She points at the extra cup with ice in it and says, "Then what's THAT?" I mean, seriously? My boyfriend and I are not liars....we certainly did not appreciate her attitude to treat us like we would make up such a petty lie.  Will not be coming back, did not feel valued as a customer and was certainly not *wowed* at all. Much better fried chicken at Foreign Cinema/KFC/Popeyes.  Or just fry the chicken yourself at home and make some eggo waffles yourself...will taste much better.

wM2QyqkF5GuD_02-3r-Eng.review_text: I had the Fillmore Classic (3 fried wings, 2 Waffles and two eggs) plus a side of grits. The waffles are the best around, but the chicken needs more seasoning. Other than the chicken not seasoned to perfection it was well worth it.

IbWSdnPb8UXbOS_J-sjrSQ.review_text: San Francisco needs;  more restaurants like Gussie's;  and hush puppies too.

vZNyh-7LEa3Y5_jE3t0KWQ.review_text: All I can say is YUM. The chick and waffles were great. Good, efficient service. Definitely a go back for more soul food. I need to try more of the menu!

bdZLmvZg7ibzD0YbLfru6A.review_text: I really want to like this place, I do.  Too bad Roscoe's C&W has set the bar so high, even though there aren't much of the C&W restaurants around.    My only real gripe is based on how much time it takes to make the C&W.  There wasn't really a lot of people on a Saturday afternoon, but it took about twice as long (if not longer) compared to Roscoe's.  It did lead to the chicken being dry, but of course that's nothing that a little hot sauce can solve.  I guess for locality's sake, it helps, but maybe they'll get better as they improve on their timing.

x-LVTbjblonQf1ACG3YzaA.review_text: I have a deep liking for chicken and waffles, or soul food (southern food) in general. I went here recently with my two roommates expecting something  a lot more than what we got. First of all I love the fact that its owned through family but I think thats its down fall too. I liked that it was packed or it seemd to be busy, but I am not sure if it was because of the live band that was trying to set up, but the serving staff was not the best. We were greated by the chef/owner with a baby in her arms.  Our hostess seem to be flustered and came off rude. We were waited on by at least 4 different servers. The menu is extensive and seems very appealing but everything on there was average tasting.  Ofcourse we ordered Chicken and Waffles because well it was something we thought we should do, sadly the other menu items seemed to be more appetizing then the Chicken and Waffles themselves.  We orderd the Grit Cakes which to me we bland and they looked if it was defrosted food.  The Waffles tasted great, the chicken alone was ok, and the server came 20min after we ordered to let us knowthey ran out of Chicken breast and they were going to subsitute for Boneless Skinless Chicken. I give this place 2 stars only because of the service. I don't mind the fact its like a "Denny's" for soul food but they need to get there act straight in the "front of the house" If it was that frantic I can only imagine the kitchen.

FpOste6Fh4ppO7jol-JlQw.review_text: Love this place!  Went here for a friends birthday brunch and ordered the Vegan Buckwheat Waffles (split them with my roommate). They came with Earth Balance butter and some quality maple syrup. Vegan and Gluten-Free I think (buckwheat is gluten-free). Who needs a regular waffle when you can have this one! And it's healthful.   We also shared the sample platter which you can choose your own sides. SAY HELLO TO YAMS! This delicious goodness was so great that I spread some on my waffles. I almost licked the bowl... We also tried the greens (made vegetarian if you ask) and the corn. Both were good, but I would probably order 3 orders of yams before anything else.   Did I mention how good these yams were? Haha.   Please note: This is slow cooked food, so it will take quite some time for your food to arrive. It's so worth it though.

LOi1qbpl2hTP0cwSDDuyBQ.review_text: We redeemed our Groupon deal tonite.  Arrived around 5:25 pm, and we were seated immediately.  Our order was taken soon after we ordered our glasses of house wine.  I had the Taste of the South which consisted of two pieces of fried chicken (choice of dark or white) with candied yams, collard greens, cornbread, and Mac cheese.  I got a drumstick and a huge breast.  Hubby had the 1/2 fried chicken which came with a breast, wing, thigh, and drumstick and two waffles.    We enjoyed everything we had. Although given a choice I might skip the Mac cheese.  Too much cheese for my liking.  Chicken meat was moist and flavorful with a crunchy outer fried skin, and the waffles were good too.   We timed how long we had to wait for our food based on previous yelpers' reviews.  Happy to say our wait wasn't long as we were the first to arrive for dinner.  However I can imagine a wait for food since the chicken is fried after you place your order.  In and out within the hour.  Had leftovers to take home.  Parking was easy since we were early, but it can be challenging later in the evening due to other restaurants and nightclubs nearby.

A02ryK2u5hA_ANkErNjuCA.review_text: Went there for a late lunch/brunch on a thursday. It was slow and very few people were there as it was in between lunch and dinner. That didn't matter, as service was quick, efficient and friendly. The young gentleman (he worked the cash register/bar) and was also my server for the 2 of us for lunch was extremely gregarious and pleasant and we expressed that we wanted to "customize" our meal, which he graciously said "he'd work around that". We ordered the fried Okra as an appetizer with the spicy remoulade sauce (Killer) and within 5 minutes our "customized" Fried chicken meals came with the sides we requested. The chicken was delicious and wasn't greasy, which is most important. We both had the red beans and rice, and that also didn't disappoint us either (Yummy!) I elected for black-eyed peas (also good) while my buddy wanted the potato salad. All of these were delicious and made our hankering for good ol' comfort/soul food quenched. All in all, it was a most pleasant experience, with great food and great service! Thanks Gussies! We'll be back!

Zia61WCddJBqIc_Z5-7coA.review_text: We went at 5:45pm because we thought we would have to wait a long time but there were only two other tables at this time. Food took a long time to come out. We had the fried chicken and waffles. I expected there to be more batter on the chicken skin and the chicken to be a little bit bigger. It was pretty small and it was still a little red inside. The waffle was fluffy and soft. I expected it to be a crispy. Sorry to compare but this place doesn't compare to Home of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland. We also ordered the red velvet cake which was dry. When we told our server it was dry he made a joke about giving us some syrup to put on it. Servers and hostess was nice enough but  food just wasn't that good.

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: Let me just preface this review by saying that with Roscoe's (in LA) as my point of reference, no other chicken & waffles joint stands a chance of wowing me like they do, but I was willing to give Gussie's the good ole college try...  Friday night, the bf & I stopped in to finally check out the chicken & waffles place that joined the famous & infamous Fillmore area of SF. It was an uncomfortable, unbearable Indian summer evening but Gussies had several fans & air conditioning to cool us down a bit.   Service was fantastic all night: the host greeted us warmly & sat us right away, our waitress was lovely & made recommendations & we never had to ask to have out water glasses filled.  The nitty-gritty: I had the Uptown Special- one waffle & one chicken breast. Plus I added a side of grits. The waffle was not soft, it had almost a tough, rubbery consistency & the syrup had a honey/candy taste, which makes me think I should have spent the extra $1 for pure maple syrup. The chicken was fried perfectly & was tender on the inside & was a decent sized portion. Skip the grits, as they are about as special as Cream of Wheat.  The bf had Down Home Fixin's which was red beans & rice, corn bread, a chicken breast & collard greens (it was supposed to come with corn, but it appears they may have been out because everyone got collard greens instead of corn.) Everything on his plate was flavorful & impressed us both. The collard greens had a good flavor & was not as tart as other collard greens I've tried.   We were too full to have dessert there but I *had* to take a slice of red velvet cake to go. It was dense & had cream cheese icing/filling (which I prefer over buttercream on red velvet) & had loads of pecans. My only complaint is that there wasn't enough cream cheese icing/filling. Throw it on there, Gussie!  We made the observation that everyone dining at Gussie's was probably not going to be a "regular;" they were trying it out for the novelty factor but may not make a second visit. I really hope this place has longevity in it's future & finds lots of "regulars" because it has so many good things going on: the service is great, convenient location, & I drool just reading their menu.  We will definitely be coming back (major plus: Gussie's is open late night on the weekends) because I'd like to try their peach cobbler, sweet potato waffles & fried okra.  Total without tip: $31 (not too shabby!)

01n9ppiSO-Ve-2-u-irvNQ.review_text: There's not much ambiance, but I would go over and over and over again for the sweet potato waffle. That thing should be on everyone's bucket list. The fried chicken was also good (not my fav), but the waffle was definitely the star of the show. Also love the mac and cheese.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: Fact. Bears eat sweet potatoes. Bears. Sweet potatoes. Battlestar Galactica.  In other words, get the sweet potato waffles (over the red velvet).  Except for the color, there wasn't anything particularly red velvety about the red velvet waffles.  They weren't as crispy on the outside as I would have liked, and the cream cheese butter was practically indistinguishable from regular cream cheese frosting.  Without a savory accompaniment (like sausage or eggs), I ended up sprinkling some salt on top, which made all the difference.  Perhaps a key improvement would be using salted butter for the cream cheese butter instead of sweet cream/unsalted.  Maybe the sweet potatoes made for better crisping in the waffle maker, or maybe that batch just got some extra time, but they were better all around.    The grits were...grits.  I'd go back on a weekday to use my ScoutMob deal on sweet potato waffles while jamming to Keith Sweat and Blackstreet, but I'm not sure I'll venture to try much else.

JenQaiv9_kAkiz0_vZK4jA.review_text: I called Gussie's two days ago- their answering machine said they will reopen Friday July 4th at 9am. Here I am at Friday July 4th 1:53pm, looking at a still closed Gussie's with a paper on their door stating they will reopen Thursday, July 10th. I called again to confirm they said Friday July 4th at 9am. Had I known this info I would not have driven all the way out here from Vallejo! :(

u0IDFEv60Ei77Xycq9NnSw.review_text: one of my favorite places to eat in SF.  the waffles- original and the sweet potato- are so good.  macaroni & cheese is prime.  yams is awesome.  the people are super friendly.  literally everything about this place is awesome & everything i've had is soooo good. love this place!

q9g-DeqW-k5NvKx8oUnQkQ.review_text: I'd previously written a review that the chicken an waffle were really good.  The waffle is still good, but boy, the chicken I had today was the blandest chicken I've ever had.  The wait staff was very friendly and the food came out fast, which was perfect because I was just wrapping up an 8 mile walk!  I needed food STAT!   I could have gone across the street to Popeye's for 1/4 the cost.  Sad to say I was disappointed today.

NpFvjy3AHPDNfqwtmYFzmQ.review_text: I think there is BUTTER in their syrup.  The SYRUP is literally the most amazing thing they have that sets it apart from other chicken and waffles places.  The chicken was pretty solid, cheesy scrambled eggs pretty good, waffles, nice and crisp.  The chicken fried steak was gross.  I swear that was not steak.  It was like battered nothing with bits of something.  I don't know.  I kept on eating it trying to figure out what it was until I realized that it was just nasty.  Anyway, BUTTER SYRUP.  That is all.

yobL2rRTkkYznuoZBnMByw.review_text: The service was a little slow to start but the food made up for it. I ordered the Downtown (1 waffle and a piece of fried chicken) and it was SO good. The prices were great and everything my friends ordered was just as good (fried pork-chops were AMAZING). I will definitely be coming back.

k6M8ERutPESVcN2WZk9e6A.review_text: Went there yesterday for a large group dinner. Everyone was pretty pleased with service and food. I ordered the catfish sandwich...delicious! Only wish it came w/2 pieces of fish (instead of one). I got the side salad...had fresh dark green lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and side of balsamic vinaigrette. I ordered the peach cobbler for dessert, it was sweet. Only with it was served hotter and had more dough balls inside the cobbler.The waitress was friendly and politely worked with our group of 17. They also had a live jazz band playing all the good hits. I would return again for dinner.

Lmr1cDBp6Kt3fOACeXvMqA.review_text: My daughter, husband and I went out for dinner, and decided to go to Gussie's. I asked for the catch of the day ( Fried Red Snapper). Five minutes later they told me they were out of Red snapper,. Because I do not like cat fish (they had) and do not eat land meat. I ordered the side sampler. Red Beans and rice, mac and cheese, collard greens and yams. My husband and daughter ordered the fried chicken breast and wing. (They said was very good) We all had the sweeten tea. (very Good)  Overall the experience was good, the waitress was very pleasant, the door man was very nice. the atmosphere was nice, the music was nice and the food was good. Hopefully next time, (yes there will be a next time )they will have the red snapper :)

tqigubhc3-nZcKGWbTEicQ.review_text: Second visit, same results. Let me be clear. The food is not the issue here. Service on the other hand....  We seated ourselves in the half full dining room during the 10$ buffet. The waitress took our drink orders then came back with our plates after a few mins of waiting. We went to the buffet and started heaping our plates full of food (fried chicken, mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, catfish nuggets, green beans, red beans and rice, all delicious enough to be satisfied with though my companion complained of access feather bits on the chicken). The catch being we received no drinks until half way through our plates when we issued a reminder to the waitress. That was fine until we wanted extra plates, then I was forced to sit arched backed, hand at the ready to go up for the next person whose eye I could catch, then the process over once again to get our check! I understand the experiance is supposed to be a laid back one, but it may have never occurred to them people were on their lunch hour and simply did not have the time..    Shame on you gussies. Had your service been better you would have acquired a new regular customer (who was already keen on supporting the all too infrequent black buisness) but alas.. with service like that it must not have been meant to be..

eDjB7sq7L6i2W1l4BbN3RA.review_text: Wow! I'm surprised this place doesn't have better ratings? Is it because San Francisco is so Smug?   I'm from Pasadena and grew up with Roscoe's right down the block. Ive also been to Sylvia's in Harlem. I have to admit, Gussies was better than both!   The Sweet Potato waffles with the sweet potato syrup are to die for. Literally if you are walking in Fillmore late at night it just might happen! Lol. Also, the greens, mac n cheese, and candied yams are the best I've ever had (even better than my grandpas famous dishes).   Give this place a try. I guarantee it. Its great food, the people are friendly, the price is right, and you will be satisfied!

44tSTN1bwtc_CaDDLI-8Qg.review_text: Made a reservation on Open Table, but still had to wait when we came in. The couple seated not 5 minutes before us had their food before we even ordered, and left well before our food came, so apparently timing is everything there. Was not impressed with the service, but the food was pretty decent, so still 3 stars overall.

9yTlruN2dBz70VF2ypI_Jg.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! Cute roomy restaurant with very friendly hostess and waitress, I ordered the Downtown plate with 1 wing and 1 waffle = YUM and of course smothered in warm butter and the BEST syrup i've tasted! Can't wait to go back! I really liked the music that was played because its my parents days and I grew up listening to those songs too so it was a nice touch. I used a Groupon for this trip but I would go back for that!

TqNsoWrbOLqxZF2lA24mpA.review_text: Looking for breakfast on our last day on San Francisco, got lost for some dinner and happend to stumble upon this place on Sunday morning.   Prices were a little high.  Clean and friendly staffed restaurant.  Fried chicken wings are yummy.  Biscuits were too floury/grainy for me. I found out that homestyle fries were like mashed potatoes and a little too salty.  Basic southern breakfast comfort food.

Jg2ReVi_F0xV3Ba7tDUslw.review_text: Awesome food, but worst service I have ever encountered. I have been to this place several times and the last two times have been horrific due to the service. It took 30 minutes just to get our water (asked for it several times) and another hour to get our food. One of my friends ordered a chocolate milk and on the menu it states free refills but the bus boy didn't even know that as he told us the chocolate milk does not come with free refills. People sat at a table next to us and got their food before us. I didn't even leave a tip because the service was so bad. The manager of this restaurant does not know how to run a restaurant as there was only two waitresses for the entire restaurant which is fairly big given this is SF.   However, the food makes up for the service. Red velvet and sweet potato waffles are amazing! The music they play is also very cool and took me back to 90s R&B.

4tC5yprYzYfg2SZM2DcycA.review_text: Yum on the juicy fried chicken and sweet potato waffles! Love that I can throw it all down with a beer.   In a matter of 30 minutes my body was so overwhelmed with grease that 2 new zits surfaced to my face.  GREAAAT!   Would I go again...yes!!! I'll buy Proactiv!

UUX3Mh6DhkEqVldc0cFRZw.review_text: Good food. Had fried catfish breakfast with grits n eggs..  The fish was amazing. .  It was all good

0cg-J0qQdQdr13-c5nL9hA.review_text: fried chicken, biscuits, fried cod, how can a place go wrong by offering that? tasty food, i went there for mother's day buffet and it was awesome, lots of items to choose from, fairly inexpensive, fresh items, great and friendly staff. i want to go back.

IQvab8zMeZrabbd8dKuY0Q.review_text: I haven't been here in about 6 months but something has changed for the worse. None of my food was seasoned. The waffle was good but that's it. What happened to this place

IcUZUldKdr3pEgOkWpQjhw.review_text: My family was craving chicken and waffles after having it at Roscoe's in Long Beach.   Was surprised to hear that we had a chicken and waffle place in the city.    Parking is difficult to find but there is a paid parking lot across the street.  I loved the food here at Gussies but the problem was that everyone in the family kept comparing it to Roscoe's.  The portions are a lot smaller here at Gussies and the fried chicken was a little on the dry side.  I loved the sweet potato pancakes and the banana pudding is the best.  Service was excellent and the waitress was the owner's sister.  Truly a family business.   The walls have actual pictures of their family esp. Gussie who is their Grandmother.  The   syrup was watery and I wish that the waffles were larger and thicker.   The chicken should be larger pieces and more moist.   If those things could improve I would give this place a 5!

clsUcSMUxmlpdcvnVPLeoQ.review_text: Gussies what? Gussies who? I give this place a year at the most to run out of money and people.  Forget about gussies and hop on over to popeye's chicken. That's the real southern chicken!  Jumbalaya w/ Rice Dish: (With precaution) In the words of my friend Christine, "how are you going to serve an Asian person f*cked up rice." We sent it back the first time with the rice undercooked, hard and the jumalaya was cold. Then we got it back the second time and the rice was overcooked and super soggy and disgusting with the result of the jumabalaya ok.   Seriously?!!!  AVOID THE SKINNNY STRING LOOKING CHICKEN STRIPS. (THEIR VERSION OF ACTUAL CHICKEN STRIPS.)  Not only was it over cooked, it was drenched in salt. Sooo salty that it knocked out the rest of your taste buds and killed our appetite. The chicken barely had any good crunch to it either. What kind of shiz is that?  Mac & Cheese was burnt, crusty and hard with barely any cheese besides the burnt crusty part.  Waffles were soggy and we didn't even put the syrup on it yet. Another "really?!" moment!  Overpriced and overrated. The only thing that I came out of that place was the mashed potatoes.   The end result, stick with the appetizers with one item, the Grits & Cheese and Mashed Potatoes. Anything else so not good.  I feel like this restaurant wanted to open up just cause someone thought they can cook. Ooo they were so wrong. This is not soul food, this is not comfort food. This would be a great place if you were majorly drunk and had nothing else to eat late at night. Then again this would be the last resort on those drunken with a hangover-happening-at-the-same-time-that-you-need-­to-eat-sort-of-moment. Though it would attract the wrong crowd. Then again, it already does.  AVOID gussies and kick it on over to KFC or Popeyes. That's the real deal.   Better yet just go to Brunos!   I gave it one star for the decor. Otherwise everything else is not so good. Menu is awful looking. Staff is blah! Please atleast act like you care about your job. You're a chicken & waffles "diner." Don't act like you're doing us a favor.   I live right across the street from gussies. So from what I hear they close down a restaurant every other year. Who's going to break that curse? Hmmm not gussies that's for sure!

9GCCoFw_UHiAHjZ4kygHgw.review_text: their weekday buffet=awesome their food=still awesome service = the kindest most awesome people, just not enough of them on crowded days and it really gets funky. My friend and I had quite an issue with the check last Saturday, and again I totally understood it bc the poor awesome waitress was SLAMMED...but still. Maybe my point is Gussie's needs to get some more staff so when things get crazy busy problems don't arise and they can just focus on making AWESOME food

_9GNEBt3f6TvLyaQ9MkGuA.review_text: I was excited to hear that SF was getting a new chicken and waffles joint.  There was decent marketing hype and I was anxious to visit with a friend of mine.    So far, I can say it's worth going back to...especially on a late friday or saturday as long as it's before 2am (when they close).  There are a few 'late' places in that area, but none that are probably this good.  Besides, where else you going to get decent fried chicken at that hour.    The summary:  fried chicken is good - light breading;  crispy sweet potato fries;  waffles are crispy and tasty;  sugar-free syrup;  decent value;  service is good;  sweet tea probably gave me a cavity;  Having been to the o.g. Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles in so-cal, this is pretty comparable.   I still need to go back to sample the mac/cheese and some other things, but so far so good.    Note - they don't yet have beer/wine.  ***UPDATE***  They now have wine/beer and the chicken strips are tasty.  Waffles are still yummy, but I would be hesitant to get the mac & cheese (they forgot about it and it didn't taste so good - bland and overcooked).

r_etoXEmNJNoySf7yoO1KA.review_text: Gussies Chicken and Waffles is the real deal...succulent and juicy fried chicken plus great cornmeal waffles.  The place was buzzing with great energy.  The service was great.  We will be coming back for sure.

-lSh8bzu8vbrmf_qH0wFDA.review_text: So I went to Gussies with a fairly large group (we had 12 people), so my experience may differ from yours.  SERVICE ------------- They tried their best, which is to say it was not terrible, and it was not good. I know it can be hard to give great service to groups, but the restaurant was fairly empty when we went so there the fact it took forever to get a refill on water was disappointing. Our waiter seemed a bit overwhelmed, and messed up a couple orders, but by the time the food came out we were just ready to eat so we let it slide.  And now on to the important stuff.  FOOD --------- I had the Uptown special w/ two eggs sunny side up. The Uptown Included one fried chicken breast and 1 waffle, and the eggs were a la carte. I DO NOT RECOMMEND getting the Uptown. Get the Downtown instead. The chicken breast is simply too much chicken for the batter. I felt it was fairly bland and tasteless. The waffle was quite tasty, and went well with the eggs.   I was told to order a chicken drumstick to make up for the breast, so I did that and it was MUCH better. The seasonings in the batter came through and I was disappointed I did the breast over the leg. My total came to about $15 including tax & tip.  SETTING ------------- Very blah. It's a fairly large space, and I know it's pretty new, but do SOMETHING with it.   If you're a fan of Farmer Brown or Little Skillet, try this and see what you think. I like both of them, and given they are much closer to me, I doubt I would ever make the trip specifically to come here again.

iK5oMORPCmoWUmannptD-Q.review_text: Mediocre chicken with mediocre waffles with mediocre service. Glad I used a groupon so I only paid half price.

HylGr2mRKE9CCC9KvdvCoQ.review_text: My friend and I were craving chicken and waffles after PRIDE, so we ventured through the slightly sketchy Western Addition neighborhood to Gussie's. Service was a little slow, and I've definitely had better chicken and waffles -- that said, fried chicken is still fried chicken, and the portions were huge. My friend and I split an entrée and each wound up with our own waffle and piece of chicken. The banana pudding we had for dessert was a little too sweet for my taste.

p_615xdI4Va16IbWqIaVKA.review_text: Another at my table commented that KFC had better fried chicken. I haven't had KFC for about 20 years, but it could scarcely be worse than Gussie's dry, flavorless product. The collard greens were much too salty. Grits with butter was the most edible item and it was nothing special.  Portions were excessive. The service was chaotic and inefficient (but friendly). I'm sure Southern food, even with its excessive use of the deep fryer, could be done much better.

9d3-A9e9VeiVllgPhqs2nQ.review_text: Ok, I've been to this place 4 times now and have enjoyed everything! But the waffles, mac n' cheese and Kahlua cake are my favs. The wait staff is friendly - some more than others!   I've also been to two parties in their private room and I had a good time at both BUT I will say that one was better than the other because of the food the birthday person selected for his party. My friend Mike picked all the right sides when he planned his party. It was about 24.00 a person and it included the chicken, yams, mac n'cheese, greens and the private room fee. Our server was totally attentive and we ordered drinks on our own. Our other friend who had a party there and she didn't order the same food and we were charged less but we didn't enjoy it as much so we ordered additional stuff on our own. They don't do waffles buffet style :-(   (they don't really work in those warming dishes thingys) but I ordered one from our server on my own..but really we had so much food I didn't need it... but I can't come to Gussie's and not have a waffle :-) !!!   I would definitely go back on my own or anyone else having a  party I can join :-)   Oh yea they are open until 2am on Friday and Saturday... good for the late night after going out!

-lMmAjajUH6Q4TJMrrYFAg.review_text: Although not crispy to my liking, the waffle was flavorful with a nice large scoop of butter and plenty of tasty syrup. The fried chicken thigh however was incredible, perfectly crispy on the outside, and juicy as a mother f@#&er on the inside, it was hands down best piece of fried chicken I've ever experienced. Also had the deep fried okra, very good. A refreshing glass of iced tea and a moderately priced bill, this placed scores 4 stars.

-nR8bKzJL-ilvjiSSbgTgw.review_text: The chicken was delicious.  The batter was thin yet crispy (i.e., I wasn't just munching on batter chips, but definitely noted the presence of crispy skinned goodness).  The chicken meat was moist and delicious--both the dark meat and the white meat pieces.  The white meat piece really looked like a commercial for fried chicken, where you bite into it and see juices dripping.    I had a combo with cornmeal waffles.  I didn't care for the waffles, but that was my own fault--the texture was too tough for me, but what should I have expected with cornmeal waffles?  Next time, I'll try the red velvet waffle instead.  We had sides of mac & cheese (very good) and collard greens (also very good, and had great flavor with pork and a little bit of spice).    Service was very good: it was very crowded, but our server was pleasant, friendly and efficient.  HInt:  We decided at 2pm on a Sunday that we were Gussie's-bound for brunch.  We made a reservation through OpenTable on the fly.  Once we arrived, at 2:30, we saw that there was a wait of about one hour; however, apparently they seat reservations before any walk-ins on the wait list, even if the walk-ins have been waiting since before the time when the reservation was made.  So when the next table was available, we sat at 2:35 (ahead of our 2:45 reservation and all of the folks who had been waiting for who knows how long).  Moral of the story: try to make a reservation even if you're also in the wait-list line.

efGXo-VjiDKHlgLkQHlUVA.review_text: My friend had never experienced the chicken and waffle kinship. I booked a reservation and told her that she was needed for dinner reservations in SF at 7pm. It was a last minute adventure due to my job that offers the benefits of a no work/life balance. That's another story, for another time.   We parked across the street in the Fillmore garage and walk over. The atmosphere was inviting and the wait staff...AWESOME! We ordered the fried cheese grits and biscuit with bacon gravy, which was HECKA GOOD!!! Our waiter was very friendly and full of smiles.   After setting aside our menus, my friend ordered the chicken and waffles and so did I. I got the southern plate. The waffles had a good brown color and tasted really good. The chicken was well seasoned and very crunchy. The scrambled cheese eggs that came with the meal, was a bit runny for my taste. If fully cooked, they would have been BOMB!   For dessert, we got the red velvet cake. I've never had red velvet cake with pecans in the icing. I liked it. The icing on the cake was a bit odd. It was lighter than cream cheese icing and had a whip cream consistency. The cake itself was stiff and dry. My friend said that parts of the cake was under cooked. The main dish was excellent, but the sides and dessert was lack luster.   Three out of five Trans fats.

Wf9Ush_S0Sa9uUPV00Zxxg.review_text: The food here was great!  I think this is the best chicken and waffle place I have been to in the Bay Area so far.  Everything was freshly cooked and seasoned to perfection.  The only reason I did not give the place five stars is because of the atmosphere.  There were chicken bones on the floor and the table was sticky.  Service was fast and pleasant though.  Great place.  I will definitely return.

QhXTWMsGdFAklrxVrDwfNA.review_text: Good food , very poor customer service. Servers would rather talk to each other rather than help customers. I hope this gets corrected before its too late.

vxZf33nIgz0URfdPNLDezA.review_text: Underwhelmed would be my one-word description for my experience here this past Sunday.  Just so many kinks to work out with both the food and service - and I completely understand this comes with the territory with opening up a new restaurant.  With that said, some day in the not-so-very-near-future I'll be more than willing to give it another try. So the service....Charles W., Charles W., Charles, Charles, Charles...I so wish I never had noticed your name on our check.  Anyway, here are two links for you regarding waiter's etiquette. PLEASE READ. - slideshare.net/bhavna123…? - starchefs.com/features/e… And a few more I'd like to add: 1) When serving coffee, please do not toss saucer & cup as if you were flinging a frisbee; the clattering will tend to startle your patrons. 2) When pouring and spilling water and ice cubes on the table, please acknowledge and clean up.  You left it for me to wipe up the water and brush the cubes on the floor...thanks. 3) Don't say you ran out of wings on one table and on the adjacent table, 3 minutes later, bring out two plates of wings, just to save face. Check with the back. 4) When one asks for water, be aware of the restaurant standards.  After asking for two waters, you returned with one room temperature glass of water in this sorry looking cocktail glass with no ice and no lemon.  And then we gaze the restaurant and EVERY table has a refreshing, tall glass of iced water with lemon...C'mon dude. Really? Have you been curious as to why you've been receiving a 5-10% tip??? I'm for damn sure not the only one who's given you .that amount of tip... Thank god for our Hispanic bus person - he fricken rocked. Now on to the food.  The chicken was rather tasty...good crunch...piping hot...the highlight of the lunch.  The waffles on the other hand were pathetic.  I mean, I don't know if there exists a particular style of waffle that is soggy & flimsy (so much so that I struggled to cut with just a fork...actually NEEDED to use a knife).  There might be... I'm just saying, these were WAY soggy. Or maybe I'm eating my chicken n waffles wrong? If so, somebody please enlighten me. Not what I was hoping for here. Maybe it's unfair to compare my experience with Gussie's to my experience with Roscoe's - at least at this point in time.   *SIIIGH* Disappointing...

3m2gZtPlkQBe7U7MRn4sHw.review_text: Great concept and location. Poor execution.  I was excited to try this place, but after my visit, I don't think I will be returning. The food was okay. Nothing came out really warm. My chicken wasn't warm and far from juicy. The mac n cheese was a lukewarm mess. The cornbread was dry.  The thing that killed my experience overall was the service. The service sucked. I understand being busy and trying to work through a rush with a limited staff (I work in a restaurant myself), but don't complain to your customers about it. Instead of getting her hustle on and putting a little speed in her step, our server chose to complain to us about how busy it was and told us she would get to us when she could.   I felt sorry for the table next to us. When it came time for their check to arrive, they got one for $90 (obviously not their check). While we waited to finish paying our bill, the couple next to us told us that they had a similar experience to ours (lukewarm food and crappy service). By the time we left, they were STILL waiting for their correct bill to arrive.  If this restaurant wants to last in San Francisco, they will need to step up their customer service skills big time and crank up the heat in the kitchen.

73afVe2aDhU-n7p6c2a9kA.review_text: I've been craving fried chicken for a while. After class, I couldn't fight the feeling anymore. Fried chicken would be mine. TODAY.  I decided to try Gussie's because it wasn't too far out of the way, it was open, and I had been meaning to try it after reading some reviews. And really...it's fried chicken and waffles. Always worth a shot.  I decide to take it home so I can make sweet, sweet love to my chicken in the privacy of my own home (and because I wanted to be near my bed when the -itis set in).   The collards were pretty good. The corn? Eh...it's corn. How can you fuck that up? The mac and cheese was good, but not the best I've ever had. The cornbread was yummy.  Now, on to the chicken. The main event. LET'S DO THIS.   I was really disappointed. The chicken was extremely dry and the flavor was so boring that I already forgot about it. I just finished about 30 minutes ago.  The staff was nice, though. So they have that going for them.  I highly doubt I would go there again. And I am *still* craving some good fried chicken.

cEdyAEZMNkTG37SxseT6rQ.review_text: Ordered chicken strips. What arrived? Undercooked/unidentifiable meat. When brought to the manager's attention she said we "ordered wrong" and it's not her fault, with absolutely no effort to amend the situation.   Poor management. Bad chicken (or was it fish - we couldn't tell what kind of meat it was actually). We won't be back.

WBa7O7JY9Qq-wMxcodUdKg.review_text: I liked it ALL ALOT!! the only reason it didnt get a 5 star was the service @ 1st I walked in with my 2 girls and they were rude until my Handsome Hubby came in 10 minutes later with our handsome baby boy... then we got exceptional service;)  I had the Cat Fish, Hubby got the Herb Chix, kids got the Chix and Waffle and we sared the sampler- DELISH!!

rUogQgFEhid8om3oDomeKg.review_text: Close to my house?  ding. Offer take-out?  zing. Chicken and waffles? bing.   Southern side dishes? BAM.  Great right?  Well in practice it's more like, just ok.  The chicken and waffles were just mediocre if you ask me.  The waffle was too eggo for my taste and the chicken was just a little too bland/greasy.   The side-dishes like mac and cheese and the yams were great!  I loved em.  Again, this is a place that's nice to have around my house but it's pretty middle of the road.  Hit or miss.

84922U9IEY2i_AFysvKU1Q.review_text: Been coming to Gussie's since they've opened. I'm a big fan of soul food and Roscoe's made me fall in love with chicken and waffles. Fried chicken is a necessity for me every week. Usually I leave satisfied with the food, but yesterday was more of a fail.   About 5 minutes after being seated, we ordered two beers. They came about 10 minutes later and we assumed that's when our waiter would take our order. But no. I think there were only two servers and it was pretty full, but it took forever for our waited to come back. We kept making eye contact and noticing him looking our direction, but didn't approach us. Menus closed, looking impatient, trying to get his attention, 75% done with our glasses of beers.. He finally took our order literally 18 minutes later (only know cause of the time stamp on my beer pic). Appetizer came about 15 min later and entrees about 15 minutes after that.  What we ordered:   Louisiana shrimp chowder - came room temperature, not hot as I expected a soup would come. At this point, we thought that it would take forever to get a new one so just ate it. Nothing too special. Pieces of shrimp over cooked. Couldn't tell the difference between textures of shrimp and sausage. Color was the only thing that set them apart.   Fillmore Classic - chicken and waffle combo still on point. Great seasoning and crisp on chicken. Waffle sweet without much syrup.   Sundays best - chicken still seasoned good and crispy. Breast a little over cooked. One section was hard to chew because it was hard and dry. But still satisfied my craving for fried chicken. Mac and cheese a little dry. I think I got the corner because a bit of it had extra hard cheese on it. Greens cooked perfectly.   Overall, gussies food isn't too bad. Hits the spot usually. I just noticed that their service is allllllways slow.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: Try their Sweet Potato Waffle! Really good!! Their mac and cheese is really good too. I gobbled it up with some Crystal hot sauce. Yum. Chicken thigh was juicy but not really memorable. Their house coffee is disgusting. Don't get it.  Overall it was good but not great.  3.5 stars

Dbq1m-h1FMEdqN0UjFS_DA.review_text: GAAAH Gussie's Chicken & Waffles....Why do you tease me ??!!!  One day I will have my food within 20 minutes, the next day it can be up to 45 minutes!   If you are NOT an alcoholic please try the caramelized pear cocktail it is sooo tasty!! One of my friends was making these weird noises as she was gobbling around the edges of the martini glass (HILARIOUS).  Chicken & Waffles pairs well with one another, except afterwards when your tummy hates you!  Anyways, overall keep up the good work!  Please take note: Time Management and you will earn back a star!

YOZP4_4Xiu1iQ6qtD4kE5g.review_text: I purposely bought a Groupon for Gussie's because I wanted to stuff my face for less. So as their prices go, I'm not really in a position to judge.  That being said, get the sweet potato waffles with wings. Don't ask, just do it. They're savory-sweet, light, and so much fun to eat. I would go back just for those. Crispy wings with sweet potato anything - you've got me there.  The servers are nice, though it's a typical seat-yourself diner-esque environment. Fairly convenient location, lots of seating, and the variety makes it all worthwhile.

s0w3WzdDomUz3Fc3zB7mDA.review_text: I've never had anything but great service and awesome food here.  Perhaps it's hit and miss?  I will say that we've never braved the buffet, and that might be part of our success.  Heading to Gussie's (or ordering out) is becoming a habit with my good friend who happens to hail from Louisiana and moved here by way of Arkansas.  I qualify with this so that her review of the chicken will mean something.  She said it's legit.  Good fried chicken like mom used to make. The sweet potato waffles are to die for.  I order them every time I eat there.  This place has ruined all other fried chicken for me.  That being said, some of the other items are not as good.  The catfish nuggets were awful.  Soft, soggy, and completely flavorless. The greens came out cold and just tasted bitter, not the earthy sweetness I've had other places.  The service is always great.  We've made the mistake of going in on a weekend night when the DJ is playing (90s R&B, it's always fun to watch the entire restaurant groove on the sly while chowing down) and it can be too loud for conversation.  All in all a great experience and I usually recommend them to friends.

x6neO5lXM-V4UIXsdEVwPw.review_text: I never had C&W before Gussies or since but I cannot imagine that it gets any better than this and have no desire to try any place else. Absolutely perfect.  I mighta deducted one star because their Bloody Mary completely lacked any alcohol that I could discern but then I thought again of that gorgeously crisp, hot, succulent chicken breast and gave them the boost deserve.  I've been there four times and will be going back.  Service is superb, too, from both the waiters and bussers.

9OXGWy6UWCxZFCAlezlg3A.review_text: It really sucks when you have such high hopes for a new place to try out... Your friends are raving about it... Your Yelp buddies are talking about it... and then you go check it out and the food while good is ruined by the crappy service of one waitress. Keep your attitude Ms. Jackson rip off. Seriously.

EZDA0JnQXTSmUGMeDNaYxw.review_text: As they say of boring classrooms, if I had a day left to live, i'd spend it in Gussies... eating here feels like an eternity. Service is friendly, but extremely slow. Foodwise, the chicken is tasty, but more bone than chicken. The waffle is always thin and under-crisp. The waffle makes me sad. Price-wise, you can do a lot better for the area.

y6I7waddCQUpHKelJ9sC2g.review_text: I purchased a Groupon to Gussie's and was pleasantly surprised it could be used for their weekday lunch buffet.  At $12 a head, you get to eat the following to your heart's content:  -fried chicken (only thighs, wings, and drums, and if the buffet server is close to empty I suggest waiting a few minutes for them to bring out piping hot, freshly fried chicken.  Also, I found that some batches were more brined than others)  -fried catfish (I had high hopes for this since it is cornmeal crusted and I love cornmeal, but unfortunately the fish itself was extremely dry and I had to douse it in Crystal's Louisiana hot sauce for flavor.)  -meatloaf (the sauce was a little sweet and quite good, I just wish there was more of it to seep into the meat!)  -green beans (I think they were from a can?)  -rice (didn't try, there was too much other stuff to eat!)  -pork & beans (delish!!!!  this was actually my favorite dish in the buffet!  The pork was smokey and melted in your mouth, the beans were properly cooked, and the stew had a little kick to it.  I want that recipe!!)  -mac n cheese (the cheddar-y less creamy kind, which I'm actually a fan of)  -candied yams (2nd best thing!  Awesomely sweet, so amazing when you eat them hot.  I liked the big pieces though since those we're as mushy.  Not nearly as good as Cami's candied yams from T-Dubs on Friday's, but still tasty enough to have me stuffing my face with them even after I was already full.)

Q-7F_ZKGkOmcuGjjX0SS6Q.review_text: I had high hopes for this place, after both having it recommended by a friend and having recently started a love affair with chicken and waffles at Hsrd Knox. We were told to sit wherever we wanted, then proceeded to wait ten minutes to get meus. The chicken, the collard greens, the waffles were bland and forgettable. The ocra was ok, but nothing remarkable. The candied yams were awesome, I'll give them that. The $40 bill was a when it hit home that we'd just paid so much for something we could've gotten at Popeyes for $10.

9kvzAuCNFpuu-Smx2Uf4FQ.review_text: Came here for the first time a week ago & it was just as it is rated "A-OK."   Staff was somewhat friendly and attentive. There were multiple tables open, but my group of 4 patiently waited over 10 minutes by the "Please wait to be seated" sign. We had to ask the hostess 2 times for more water, bc none of the waiters were present. Each time she just held out her finger for us to wait I suppose? She was doing nothing at the time when she walked by twice.   Our waitress was okay. Somewhat confused, because she started off not friendly, friendly, then not friendly again. I needed to ask for BBQ sauce 4x for it to finally be served.   Food was mediocre. I had chicken and waffle fries. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles. Waffle was good, but it was just way too greasy for me.  Will I be back? Probably not. I think I'll just settle for a fast food chain if I want fried chicken.

4nzxjTbN7gTho8bDhZyOIw.review_text: The food here is pretty good, but the wait time for your food is extremely long. Other then that, I will definitely eat here again, and recommend this place to my friends.

caTyk-CW_wiY7znfJrCXqA.review_text: Not too bad, but not the greatest.  Their shrimp chowder actually wasn't too bad.  Had better fried chicken and waffles.  But they did have an interested red velvet waffle - that was interesting.  Service was prompt, but the place was also pretty quiet during lunch rush hour.

8AsEEy-t53_oAbQ57_kkQQ.review_text: I went awhile back and wasn't super impressed with the food. So I decided to give it another try two weeks ago on a Friday afternoon around 1pm for my birthday because Scoutmob had a 50% off popup deal. At the recommendation of my uncle, my friend and I both had the lunch buffet. The buffet had fried chicken, grilled chicken, mac/cheese, gumbo, fried catfish, rice and beans, and a few other items. We must have gotten there towards the end of the lunch rush because there wasn't much food left. Everything seemed really salty. The only thing I enjoyed was the mac and cheese.   I went again the Thursday after because my uncle gave me a $20 voucher that was about to expire. Went with my mom and I had the Fillmore special--3 wings, subbed for a red velvet waffle, and 2 over easy eggs. She had the Downtown Special--1 thigh and a waffle. The chicken wasn't the disappointing part this time...it was the waffle that was a major letdown. Red velvet is supposed to be fluffy; my red velvet waffle seemed like it was food colored and had a really in-your-face sweetness to it that made my teeth tingle.   Service: I don't understand how a restaurant such as Gussies can get away with having only one server and one bus person during lunch hour. It makes service really slow and inefficient and takes forever to get the check or refills on drinks.  Needless to say, the next time I'm in the mood for fried chicken, I'll be taking my business to Hard Knox. I highly doubt I'd recommend Gussies to friends and family.

7E1WFEYrERa3HRctePd2mA.review_text: The chicken was nothing too special - a little bit dry, even the dark meat, and not the best flavor or cuts of meat. The service was extremely friendly - lots of smiles and assurances and kindness - but slow, as other Yelpers have noted. Our server also forgot one of our sides, so we didn't get to try the honey cornbread :( There was also live music beginning at around 8:30p - it was really loud. Samba. The singers weren't too good.  I can confirm that the waffles were pretty limp, but that doesn't mean they weren't delicious! The sweet potato waffle in particular was excellent - even my girlfriend, who doesn't like sweet potatoes, enjoyed them a lot. The sweet potato waffle comes with a special sweet potato syrup - the combination of the flavored waffle, delicious syrup, and generous helping of butter was a real treat!

LhnkTF7pP1nY6AiN2WfWVA.review_text: WOW! Went there for Sunday brunch and I probably won't eat again until Monday's breakfast. My wife had pecan waffles and I had waffles with Southern Fried Chicken. Everything was very good. Waffles were crisp and tasty. The chicken was really tender, moist and flavorful.  Defintely plan to return.

DjXEUA6ltpOCgzy3Q8D_xg.review_text: So anytime I get a Groupon/LivingSocial/Bloomspot for a restaurant, I always Yelp it first. If it isn't @least 4 stars, I don't give it a 2nd thought. But because I'm such a fan of chicken & waffles, I totally ignored the reviews and for that Yelp, I'm sorry, I will never doubt you again UNLESS ...we'll deal with that later.   We came here with a Groupon for breakfast. The decor is ok and they have a lot of  space. The hostess and servers were great during the whole experience. This place in my mind has the potential to be so much greater than it is currently. I wanted to like this place so much but here is my 2 Yelp cents.   We ordered the catfish sliders and 3 wings with a waffle/mac n cheese. First it surprised me that with those 2 plates plus an apple juice, came to nearly 30 bucks?! That's crazy because you would think for 30 bucks in a chicken & waffle joint you could get so much more.   Now the food. My waffle was horrible and I mean I don't think it was cooked all the way. Too soft and still tasted like batter. Chicken wings and mac had flavor but it didn't taste fresh-- it was like it had been sitting around for a while. This is coming from a fried chicken lover & it takes a lot for me to bad mouth some fried chicken. We've had fried chicken recently where you could taste the flavor and the freshness of the chicken and it just didn't happen here.   My gf got the catfish sliders, it was only 3. After the first one she was like yummm but when she got to the 2nd starting not feeling so hot.  Barely made it through the 3rd and after eating here, neither of us felt so hot for a while & we both had the worse case of NASTY burps for a few hours after words. That has never happened to us. I know TMI but it's the truth. We drank tea and lots of water for mostly the rest of the day.  I can get the frustration of small business owners with Yelp, especially restaurant owners because a bunch of bad reviews could be bad for business. At the same time Yelp is a great barometer for what you're doing right/wrong.   Like I said  before I really wanted to like this place. Again,  the server and hostess were very friendly and the service was great. The problem is the food was bad, almost really bad.   Unless I hear of some turn around I probably won't visit this place again :(
