NGB191E4SRA9EO1Pbyqkbg.review_text: Overall my experience here was a pretty good one. The service was a little bit slow, but they seemed to take care of us as best as they could. I ordered the taste of the south which came with greens, mac and cheese, candied yams, corn bread, and of course, fried chicken. The food was amazing except for the bigger piece of the fried chicken was over cooked, tough, and dry. I would definitely come back here for the side-dishes, but not so sure if i'd ever really "crave" their fried chicken. If this wasn't a fried chicken place i'd give them 4 stars, but since they have chicken in their name, i'll give them 3.

ZCy8vPs3Ixv2y3BmJ1-VUg.review_text: Chicken was great, not heavily battered, and the cornmeal waffle was delicious. Appetizers of fried okra and Cajun hush puppies were also great. All highlighted by a yummy peach cobbler. Service was a little slow but they were nice

l-fe24FmqxPW1i0Jaii3ZA.review_text: I don't get how this place only has a cumulative 3 star rating.  Just conjuring up memories of Gussie's for the purposes of writing this review, my mouth is watering and I can't get this damned smile off my face!  Thanks to Yelp's trusty Android app, I was able to narrow down my pre-Outside Lands food fiesta to Gussie's, which was just a short drive from our hotel.  After scoping some of the reviews, I'm super glad my brother and I weren't scared off -- because we had an amazing experience!  The service was stellar and incredibly friendly.  Our server's smile just melted my heart -- and trust me, that is no easy feat.  She was so patient and helpful (along with all the other staff around) and this was just at the beginning of a weekend lunch rush.  Bro and I decided to split:  a 1/2 fried chicken with 2 waffles (one regular for him, one sweet potato for me -- gotta do it!) and their fried pork chop special with 2 sides (mac and cheese, and collard greens).  Add to that a biscuit with gravy and some cornbread, and we were all set.  (It was a coffee kinda morning for me; bro opted for sweet tea.  Yay!)  The meats: Although the chicken was a *tad* dry in the middle of the breast, EVERYTHING ELSE was just spectacular.  You could tell that this was the real deal: soaked with special blends, pan or oven fried to perfection, and seasoned and served with love.  I didn't feel guilty at all digging into this.  The fried pork chop, after you made it past the delicate yet solid fried outer coating, just melted in your mouth.  How is this so good???  When I grow up I want to fry chicken and pork chops like Gussie does.  The sides: Mac and cheese was standard, but what set it apart was the serious hint of sharp cheese you could taste in each bite.  It is quite ballsy to do this btw.  The collard greens were so perfect, just like I remember from my black mama's cooking over in Richmond CA.  No funky aftertaste, and you could still taste the 'green' part of the side dish.  The carbs: Waffles were so-so; flavors were all there, but I was more impressed with the regular maple syrup than the cinnamon-ish one provided with the sweet potato.  Cornbread was delicious per the usual, and the biscuit was nice and fluffy -- but the true star of the show was the gravy!  I poured that stuff on my chicken and waffles like a Turkish bath.  The food and the service were both top notch.  I hope Gussie's makes it out here on Eddy -- I shall return for Funky Fridays and all you can eat southern goodies!  Thanks for a great lunch.

KP5PUBrgnMVXy0hEWZDzbQ.review_text: I soooooo wanted to like this place. Like, really, really badly. I love chicken and waffles and after taking the 31-Balboa past it too many times to count, I was stoked when a friend proposed we meet there for breakfast. Unfortunately, the only good thing I was able to draw from the experience was that the staff is really nice.   We went around 9:30 on a week day and the place was empty (bad sign?) Regardless, we sat down, I ordered coffee and we both ordered the standard chicken and waffle b-fast. I didn't get my coffee until I reminded the waitress about it when our breakfast arrived and, I repeat, we were the only people in the place. Okay, whatever I thought. She spaced and the food will make up for it. Ugh, not even close. The chicken was dry and flavorless. Like, KFC would be considered 5-star cuisine compared to this stuff. The waffle was soggy and cold and don't even get me started on the syrup. It was so runny and flavorless that I used half the container and not only did it fail to add any flavor to the waffle, it also made my plate look like I'd spilled water on it. Needless to say, I was completely disappointed.   On our way out, the staff encouraged us at least twice to come back one night for dessert, so maybe that's what they hang their hat on. I sure hope so, because the two items in this place's name are the two items you should definitely avoid.

DV4QEPdw50m40wrp9oGgDA.review_text: I had a great experience at this place.  I have eaten southern food from New Orleans to San Antonio to Richmond VA, and this is as good as any I have eaten.  The gumbo was great, the chicken was perfect and the waffles were the kind I remember from my childhood.  I whole heartily recommend this place, it is LEGIT.

_nh8mK8Kfu5JDDGF8_BeYQ.review_text: If you're eating in, go when you are not hungry because by the time the food comes, trust me, you will be hungry after a long wait! The foods ok but the service was not too good. the people are nice but they are just really disorganized. I ordered takeout by phone so it would be ready when i reached the restaurant. Once i got there i had to wait 30 minutes. Then they got my order wrong, but they were really nice about it and agreed to refund the meal. The chicken was good, so was the mac and cheese. The greens were oddly sweet for some reason. Il probably go back in a few months and see if  they are a little more organized.

khlbUHQs5slIU6499xdaaQ.review_text: This review is on the SERVICE ONLY! I DO NOT EXAGGERATE I WILL GIVE THE HONEST TRUTH ON MY EXPERIENCE!   We have been to Gussies 2 times before and LOVED, hints why we are back a 3rd time! So as far as the food I can honestly give 4 stars as long as the order comes out right.I recommend the red velvet waffle and chicken wings, the mac and cheese is good as well!   Well Yesterday 9/28/14 my husband and our 3 kids went to go and have brunch and we saved our appetite because we knew we were on our way for our stomachs to blessed with good food. My baby was up from his nap so it was lunch time for him and anyone with kids knows that after that nap you have 1 hr to feed the hungry child.   WELL..... Lets say that the moment we walked in we weren't greeted one of the waitress was in the bar area doing something on the register and didn't say give me a moment I will be right with you nothing. After she walked out the Manager (I assume because every time we come shes in street clothes and not a uniform) says that someone will be with us.   Now we are seated after a short wait. The busser got us some waters as soon as we sat down and I asked him for lemon.....wait 5 minutes now lemon.......I let it go. We looked through the menus and after 10 minutes we were ready to order. We gave out waitress about 20 minutes and then I asked for a waitress because we were all ready sitting down for almost 35 minutes. Why should I have to ask for a waitress? anyways I didn't mind I just wanted to order because my son (2 years old) was becoming restless and hungry. We order mind you I also asked the waiter for lemon as well..... we wait.....and we wait.....another 20 minutes pass and we hear the manager cussing out the cooks because they were messing up orders let me say that they need a door that enters that kitchen because we heard everything! O yea and we are still waiting.......The manager passes and I ask her for lemon and we are still waiting.....well about 45 minutes pass by and we are still waiting! Did I mention that out waitress didn't bother to come and check on us NOT 1 time, to apologize for the wait, ask us if we needed anything, to just have that customer service attitude....NOTHING!!!! The 2 waitresses and the Manager has an attitude because the cooks were messing up.   O and we are still waiting! I have the busser get the waitress and I ask her how much longer....Well she tells me she has 5 tables ahead of us O I WAS PISSED!!!! You couldn't tell us that when you realized how long it was going to be?  O that's right you didn't come and check on us not 1 time! The customer service here isn't the best we had a good experience the 1st time, and ok the 2nd, but this last time mad me mad as hell because everyone had an attitude, NO ONE didn't bother to check on us, and when she told us about the 5 tables before we could make a decision she was the 1st to say and I quote "Well I can just cancel your order" with an attitude. We got up and we left. As we were leaving I heard the manager say why does a table have to wait 45 minutes for food. I was over it, we crossed the bridge to be fed some good food not attitudes and horrible service.   Now will I be back? I don't know, like I said the food is good but the service has to get better a waitress with an attitude is just like getting a plate of nasty food. It ruins your whole experience.   We went over to Soul Groove on Larkin and Golden Gate....Lets just say the service was way better, a happy environment, and we sat down and had our food fast. The owner was GREAT and has a GREAT ATTITUDE!

hibZh2q4LBywyTRd9ir0TQ.review_text: Very very good. Grits cakes for the win

q35o54dDJ5ciM2M3F5DRRA.review_text: Say what?!  Everyone at a certain bar I frequent have been babbling on for weeks and waiting with baited breath for this joint to open.    Totally believe the hype!  The food was excellent, but let me break in down about something I usually don't rave about: THE SERVICE.  We had ordered okra to start and it was taking awhile.  A fellow named Joseph (not our server) had come over to say he noticed that we had been sitting there awhile with nothing on our table.  He apologized profusely and went to check on the issue.  He came back with a cup of their Gumbo for us to try and explained the issue.  The gumbo was TO DIE FOR.  In just a few seconds our okra appeared.  It was pretty good, but nobody can really beat my great Aunt Faye's okra, ya know?  The refills on our sweet tea came swiftly and our "Uptown Special"s came with perfect timing after that.    I'm not a huge fan of "regular" syrup, but Gussies has syrup made from brown sugar instead of maple and it was DIVINE!  The chicken was perfect and really quite tasty.  We also had a biscuit and cornbread just to try it.  The cornbread was a tiny bit overdone and the biscuit lacked something.  But Josh and I are pretty picky when it comes to home-cookin' and nobody really beats my mom's cornbread.  Overall, the place looks great, the food was great and the service was impeccable.  We will be back very soon to try everything else on the menu.  BONUS: They're open LATE.  Until 2am on the weekends and 11pm on weeknights.    They also have red velvet cake, but they were already out.  That must mean it's completely ridiculous.  Can't wait to go back to try it!

Kgi-p4JW_GSlsWSN-25ySA.review_text: Sweet potato waffles all the way!!!  Once you have the sweet potato waffle, you'll be a die hard fan too!  Their chicken is definitely tasty.  I wish they had spicy chicken but a little hot sauce can help.  Yumm....  Also, try their macaroni and cheese!!!  It's definitely made from scratch and not the yucky instant type.  Boo to instant!  Yay to Gussies!!!  The only downside to gussies is the wait.  It can take a little bit longer to get your food but it is definitely worth the wait.  I'll definitely go back and wait a little longer if it's to get their sweet potato waffles and chicken!!   Lets go!!

UDVcFiwlqc1sTuICHw_5CA.review_text: I went here on Saturday and the food here was sooooooo good, really reasonably priced and everyone there was so nice!  The hostess was really sweet and our waitress (I think her name is Deanna) was really great.  But I seriously couldn't believe how good the food was!!!

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: Four stars for the waffles (sweet potato!! and regular), scrambled eggs w/cheese and onions, and service.   Ordered- Gussie's Signature Sweet Potato Waffles + fried chicken $12.79 Southern Comfort (2 waffles, 2 pieces of fried chicken, two scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese and onions) $13.79  I wasn't a fan of their fried chicken since it didn't have enough seasoning, but it was cooked well. However, I would come back just to eat the waffles (especially the sweet potato) and the scrambled eggs. The other perk was the maple syrup they give you was still warm!

kmxA9_lUmg7lmwJvMVJN7w.review_text: I went for a friend's birthday, so I read the reviews before going here with low expectations to start.   As I entered I was surprised by how the place looked. Great ambiance, warm feeling. I would not expect this place to serve chicken and waffles. With that thought in mine I thought, maybe all the bad reviews were wrong...hm.  We were seated in the back (9 people). Looking at the menu I was shocked to see the prices, a bit expensive for one chicken and one waffle ($7.50). So I thought maybe i'll just order a side dish since I'm not that hungry. NO WAY! One side was $4.50, so I decided to just get a meal since it would only be $3 more.   I was the last to order and I noticed that he didn't write it down. I turned to my friend and said, "I bet that I'm not going to get my food, he's going to forget." Food came and I was right, one missing.   The order came. SMALLEST PIECE OF CHICKEN I'd ever seen. The taste of it was alright, nothing spectacular about it. The waffle was good, really sweet, friend said it smelled like a gingerbread cookie. Tried the eggs. I could make it at home, just add cheese and green onions. No special surprise on the palate.  I looked over and saw that my friend didn't finish her biscuit. I tried it, OMG, HORRIBLE! NEVER order the BISCUITS.  It tasted like uncooked dough. If you want a good biscuit go to Popeyes a block away or to Brenda's French Soul Food.  I won't be back. At least the birthday girl enjoyed herself, that's all that matters, right?

GPo8hF7NKr1-aPhhv4DjQw.review_text: I'll be honest, I get called "Snow White" and "Katy Perry" on a daily basis, but don't be fooled by my florescent Celtic skin, best believe this girl has some soul underneath. With that said, I firmly believe that chicken and waffles is one of the greatest food combinations known to man.  The first, and arguably most important, thing to say about Gussies is that they have $2 Tuesdays! Not only can you get a pint for $2 (and a decent one, there's no fine print about being restricted to Budweiser or other unimpressive drafts) but chicken wings are $2 too.  In general, I'd describe Gussie's as lowkey. Don't come looking for white tablecloths and super attentive servers bringing out immaculately prepared meals. The chicken is slightly dry but all the food is homey - like when your Mom cooks you something that's slightly lacking in flavor but you love it anyway. The red velvet waffles are delicious and definitely give the sweet potato waffles a try, ordering the original waffles goes without saying.   Sometimes you've got to feed your soul too, and Gussies gets the job done.

EfLECHdYuO5z8RsPCzGaDA.review_text: Came here for their Friday Night Buffer for $10.00.  We called and they said that there was chicken wings, veggies, catfish nuggets, beans, etc on the buffet so we decided to check it out.  Well there wasn't any fish-chicken wings was the only meat but there were beans, rice, sweet potatoes, mac and cheese and strings beans and the chicken wings were pretty damn big.  Everything was delicious-even the sweet potatoes which I didn't really care for last time.  My only complaint is that the mac and cheese wasn't hot enough-just room temperature.  :(  The service was good and NAJ was awesome. What a great server! She was really in the woods with the other tables but she remained very sweet and extremely professional.  Would I go back? Heck, Yes!

OMk4lxMonh9Ot3h4kH4oHw.review_text: This is the spot to go to have some breakfast/lunch!  I ordered a sweet potato waffle and chicken. Their chicken was really crispy & juicy! WAY better than your typical KFC. Their waffle was okay, it was good but I felt the waffle was a bit too soft as though it was microwaved. Other than that, the service was great, food was great & vibe was greaat !

p8EP6glSqdEHLODWpYViRA.review_text: I have never been to Gussie's until yesterday, Sunday.  I ordered sweet potato pancakes and chicken strips.  The pancakes were good, but as my partner said after I asked him to taste the strips, they were "inedible".  Our server was pleasant when we ordered, but when I asked her if the chicken used in the strips was breast meat she got defensive and combative and said that the vender they use provides them with breast meat and that she saw her mabager cook them instead of offering to make the situation better.  I said they were more like cartilage which was tough and chewy.   The situation could have been handled much differently.  There were two tables of people on either side of out 2-seat table.  I was embarrassed by our server's reaction. She brought our check including the price of the strips, but then she took it away and replaced it with one minus the price of the wings, perhaps at directive from her manager.  The server needs customer service training and an attiude adjustment.

aSrg7d4JXaU33cN7OgqUYQ.review_text: Great portions, great prices, Sweet potato waffle is especially tasty, great for brunch!

KxT8tTfFzOyYsoLGbMWdOw.review_text: Decided to try this place out when I saw it on groupon. I used a deal where we got 20$ worth of food for 12$, which was pretty worth it.   I ordered the red velvet waffles which come with cream cheese topping, instead of the usual butter. When it came, it looked awesome, but it tasted pretty meh. Lol, if I could, I would have requested for some butter instead of the cream cheese.  My boyfriend ordered two waffles with two chicken pieces. Which tasted pretty good! It's actually what I would have preferred. I loved the waffles, they were soo yummmz. When I took the first bite, it was SO good. But it really could have been because I was so hungry.  Pretty good, I would come back. Red velvet waffles let me down. Overall, it's an okay place to hit up with the reasonable prices.

qcXm7gmXSLpozOl13xuppQ.review_text: I don't understand why this place only has 3 stars! I can only assume since the restaurant is fairly new, the food and service could still be a bit uneven. But I went for brunch with my husband and enjoyed it all.  We both ordered the SF Special, which comes with a fried chicken breast, wing, two eggs, grits or home fries, and cornbread or biscuit.  1. The grits were amazing - creamy and delicious. It was the first time I really understood why people go crazy for grits.  2. My husband got the home fries, and they were more like mashed potatoes - in the very best way possible.  3. Fried chicken was very moist. Must have been an "on" day - many other reviews mention dry chicken.   4. The biscuit was buttery and delicious.  5. Portion sizes were giant. I was full for about 8 hours after finishing my plate (in retrospect, I should have left the eggs).  The service was a bit patchy. At one point, we didn't see our waitress for what felt like 20 minutes. But I think she was covering the whole restaurant, so maybe they were understaffed.  I'll definitely be going back to try dinner.

IEj22Gc-8NxlqlOvt9WUVQ.review_text: After reading great reviews I decided to try this Gussies on a recent trip to SF.  To my DISAPPOINTMENT the service was the worst experience to date. I will keep this brief, but as I was writing this I noticed other patrons of the same day also commented about the BELOW POOR SERVICE that day. It was 1-1-11 and early afternoon when we (party of 3) showed up to Gussies. It was full of people and we waited 20min just to be asked if we were here to eat. After 30 plus min we were seated. The table was not prepared and we had to ask for silverware twice. After we ordered we had to feed the meter twice, and it ended up taking over TWO HOURS to receive cold food that was half correct. We watched two tables that were seated before us eat and leave before we had received our food. The table to our right was waiting for half as long ended up leaving. The table of two behind me had to ask the waitress where there food was, and to their surprise she didn't remember what they ordered.  Once they got there food, the lady called the waitress over and told her it was cold. The waitress said they were understaffed and apologized. They left Gussies UPSET. We voiced our concern to the waitress about our food and waiting time and she said we would be comped for the delays and the COLD FOOD. When we went to pay the lovely so-called acting manager gave us a gracious 20% off our food. When I went to pay with $20's the so-called manager reached into the waitresses apron and made change because evidently the register was short. We were so hungry we toughed it out, but really it was the WORST EXPERIENCE IN MY LIFE! WORST!

yiGZLFU9YVpJU9CnUNhhyQ.review_text: Came here yesterday for brunch with my daughter and my brother. My daughter had chicken strips and waffles which she seemed to love! My brother got the buckwheat waffles and eggs which he loved. I got the sweet potato waffles and mach and cheese and OMG it was amazing. I'm not a fan of butter but the butter they provided was light and fluffy. Not your traditional syrup either! Has to be homemade! They were the best waffles I ever tasted! The prices weren't the best but per the quality of the food and setting of the restaurant it was well worth it! Also the staff was really nice! Warm and welcoming! Must try!

TWT_xYR1EVvzlnsTHYRI8g.review_text: This is the second time that I've been here and the service was better. There is this one lady hauling ass and was very friendly and I didn't get her name but she was working on a Saturday morning of 4-28-12.   These are the two things I've tried  Waffles: It's sweet and savory....awesome. I think I found my favorite waffle place in SF.  Chicken Wings: The selection of the wings are pretty big and the meat fell off the bones.  Red Velvet Waffles: This was too sweet and savory. Can't complain here.   The only thing I didn't like was probably the sweet tea. Maybe I'm so used to other types but it was ok. Overall though, I would visit this place in a heartbeat If i'm craving.

1QWjhjA2nzBT9cfl2QOjUw.review_text: Crispy waffles, warm and light and perfect resting place for the butter/syrup.  Chicken was dope.  All around great experience at a refreshingly quiet spot in SF.  Definitely returning to Gussie's in the near future to try some of their other stuff, but you're coming to the right place if you just want some damn good chicken & waffles.

y6hQpJU3-uOlsGeWZuL5Vw.review_text: Food: 4 Service: 2   This review is rather difficult for me to write. I personally prefer to score reviews based solely on the the food, but the excruciating wait for our food was just unacceptable, even for a grand opening...and yet we waited.  I'm a huge chicken & waffles fan and so far, Roscoe's is still the one to beat. My friends and I happened to stumble upon this place by chance on Saturday and was told the place just opened the day before. Surely I was excited to see if this place could offer better...  So is the food better than Roscoe's? Yes and No. Gussie's nailed the fried chicken department. It's very delicious with a nice mix of spices and seasoning. And crispy without being overly fried and greasy. The meat is tender and juicy - better than Roscoe's.  But what counts the most are the waffles and this is where Roscoe's still crowns supreme. Still, Gussie's served up some pretty good waffles with the right amount of chewiness and texture. They're lightly crisp around the edges and smothered with butter, makes for a damn good meal. But for taste alone, Roscoe's secret blend just can't be beat. But Gussie's does come close.  Unfortunately, the wait for our food here was beyond what is considered acceptable by any means. Sure, we gave them the benefit of the doubt, but seriously, how hard is it to screw up making batches of waffles and fried chicken ? After our orders were taken, we waited an HOUR before we got served and the staff even managed to mix up our orders . At least they provided us with samplers of their sides.  The staff is friendly nonetheless and the interior decor is very upscale- you wouldn't even know you were at a waffle house going in. And prices are reasonable. I'm sure service will improve once the weeks go by...but damn...

6R3dBSBoS7GPjT4w7s3EcA.review_text: Love this place.  Great food, great prices, even better portions.  This was my first chicken and waffle experience and I can honestly say that its gonna be hard to top.  I recommend the Southern Comfort, for the full chicken and waffle experience. I also recommend the Taste of the South, candied Yam was amazing.  We sat down by the bar and was waited on by Steve, perhaps the manager?  Either way I'm glad we sat at the bar, great service and great food.

Us8hXd8UeePYFqTb3EAZDQ.review_text: Everything was just mediocre. It wasn't like I expected it to be. This place is quite fancy looking inside and out(+1 star). I thought it would a bit crappy but it surprised me at the front door. I ordered the Fillmore Classic with some candied yams as my side-dish. The Fillmore Classic had three pieces of chicken wings, a waffle, and your choice of styled eggs. The waffle was okay. The chicken wings were also only okay, I like didn't like the batter, it wasn't satly/flavored enough. But I liked how the meat was juicy enough. The candied yams were way too sweet! It looked way too mushy. Not like how I imagined it to be.  I went with some of my friends, so some of us ordered something different. Some of them ordered the sweet potato waffle. I got a taste of it and I wished I should've ordered that. It was so good(+1 star). It was quite sweet. I think their's came with two breast meat and two waffles...I'm not sure..forgot. But they didn't have eggs to go along with it. But I still recommend the sweet potato waffles instead of the regular ones!  Plus one more star for the wonderful waiters/waitresses!

75Y0JxVARcdLuruLWw9mRg.review_text: First, let me just say, I lived and grew up in Alabama for 11 years so I know my southern food. I was really craving authentic fried catfish and this place is within walking distance so I decided to try it.   I got my food to-go. So anyway, I get inside and the delivery guy was pretty annoyed with the kitchen because his orders weren't being processed fast enough. After about 15 mins of waiting and no line in front of me I finally got my order in. I ordered the catfish plate and a substitution of the eggs for greens. And an a la carte chicken breast. Another 15 mins pass and the cashier was really sweet so I was patient. I get my food and go home.  I was pretty annoyed that I got home and realized, both the biscuit and grits that came with my meal were left out and I'm willing to bet those greens were canned Sylvia's collard greens...way too sweet and definitely not home made. The fish was fresh and the chicken was pretty good. Somehow I got potato salad and it was decent. I give them 3 stars only because I miss the south and the fish was a quick fix and because the cashier was sweet. But honestly it should've been 2 stars for-meh, I've experienced better   Bottom line: The food was still only subpar...not completely authentic southern food and wait time a little long but I was told they were a little short staffed. I could've just gone to Popeyes down the street and been satisfied.

5p1GCpsjuid6QGge1bD80Q.review_text: So, I saw that this restaurant was one of SF's best places to eat, and I thought-lets try it!  We made reservations, which we found weren't necessary.  The ambiance was nice and appropriate for the type of down-home food that you get here.  My family went on a Friday so, there was a live DJ there who played 70's and 80's R&B music.  My children were dancing in their seats.   The wait for the food wasn't long at all, and the waiters and waitresses all seemed to support each other to make sure that the patrons were happy.  There was a $11 buffet (with a 2 drink minimum) which included all you can eat fried chicken, green beans, yams, beans and rice, mac and cheese and more, but we ordered from the menu.  My menu was ragged and on it's last leg, but I could still read it..missing corners and all.  I had fried okra, mac and cheese, grits and fried chicken.  The chicken was good but not "the bomb".  The macaroni and cheese and fried okra were really good!  The Tabasco remoulade was brilliant!   My daughter had a piece of chicken and mac and cheese.  She ate all of her mac and cheese and fell into such a deep sleep that we knew she had the "itis".  We had to carry her back to the car.  She never got to eat her chicken, but she got good sleep- LOL!  Service was great, music was joyful, noise and people in the Fillmore made the experience nice.

P-hyIvns2yjD4Tuy9I3p4Q.review_text: So good! My fiance and I came here on a Sunday morning. It was probably the perfect time because they were not busy as I would have imagined on a Sunday morning.  I ordered Gussie's Signature Sweet Potato Waffles with two pieces of chicken legs.  My fiance ordered the Southern Comfort (two delicious original waffles, two pieces southern fried chicken and two eggs scrambled with cheddar cheese and onions). When our plates were placed on our table, the aroma of the sweet potato, butter and fried chicken suddenly woke me and my appetite...it looked oh, so good! The chicken legs were crispy outside and really moist inside, just how it should be! The batter was really light, not a whole lot of buttermilk and fried flour taste--if you love friend chicken...ya'll know what I mean. :)   I will definitely come back...very soon.

vtLoC7_iIpl1nUmxVp_gzg.review_text: Went into this establishment after a nice night out on the town... Figured the combo of greasy chicken and syrup covered waffles would help increase my stamina on a cold Sunday afternoon!    So the joint was hopping and it took some time to get our order in, but the menu is so large we needed some questions answered, oddly enough we settled on the Southern Comfort.  The whitemeat chicken was very dry, so stick to the dark meat.    The waffles weren't crisp, but if you like them like soft sandwich bread, then this is your place. One waffle was so underdone, we thought we were supposed to cook them ourselves.  I wont be back very soon, but when the urge exists, I'll try the Yams and sausages.  Tips:  And be sure to try the cornbread and maple syrup...  Go for dark meat for moistness!

vDiR3_PkjogpnJHRZxD9bg.review_text: Gussie's was the quintessential one-star dining experience: unimpressive on all counts.  When we arrived, we were told that the wait would be 40 minutes.  I was incredulous, as there were only two tables in front of us on the waiting list, and we are, after all, talking about fried chicken and waffles here.  How long could it take?  Surprisingly long, as it turns out.  After around 20 minutes we were seated. We noticed that we seemed to be flanked by dissatisfied diners; we overheard one couple next to us who had been waiting for an hour and a half.  For chicken. And waffles.  It took a while for the server to take our drink orders, and then we settled in to what would end up being over an hour wait.  I know this because we timed it with a stopwatch.  Here are our notes:  6 minutes: Mimosa arrived. 10 minutes: Our food order is taken: Uptown special (1 waffle and a chicken breast) and 2 cornmeal waffles with drumsticks. 20 minutes: We find out the folks next to us have been here for an hour and a half. 38 minutes: The server tires to bring us another mimosa which we didn't order.   40 minutes: The server comes back with the same mimosa and leaves it on the table.  I have to flag her down and convince her that we didn't order it.  Later this mimosa somehow finds its way onto the bill of the couple to our left, who also didn't order it.   49 minutes: Tummy growl 54 minutes: Food arrives.  My order is wrong (wings instead of a chicken breast), but I resolve to eat my meal instead of waiting any longer. 1:09 Finished meal. 1:14 Check arrives.  Here's the deal:    1. This place is too pricey for what it is.  Fried chicken and waffles (even cornmeal or sweet potato or whatever) shouldn't be $13+ a plate, unless it's really something special.  However...  2.  The quality just isn't there.  The food was ok, and the cornmeal waffles were tasty enough, but its nothing special.  You can make a better waffle, without the wait and the terrible service.  Which brings me to the...  3. Long wait and terrible service.  This is supposed to be simple and hearty food that comes out quickly.  No one is there to sip drinks and savor to ambiance (of which, by the way, there is none).  This kind of place should fill you up quickly so you can go about your lazy Sunday in a chicken n' waffle induced euphoria.  Hopefully I have provided reasonable evidence to support my 1 star review.  In the time this meal took, I could have learned how to make chicken and waffles myself, procured all the relevant ingredients, and prepared a delicious meal for a fraction of the cost.  My advice is to stay away.

3YRFiXwJF-V2D1iWejgDRw.review_text: I don't know why so many yelpers felt the need to 1 and 2 star this place.  It's large, and packed, its bound to take some time to get your food.  The food is good, the service is polite and the atmosphere is great. It's a 4 star review for me, but I had to give it 5 just to balance out the overly negative reviews prior.  Good food Good service Easy to get to.  I be going back.

sgjVACLRT7rujB40AOZfqw.review_text: I had to wait a few days to write this review just so I wasn't overly harsh. We came here after discovering that the all you can eat korean bbq place had a 2 hour wait. So maybe we were already a little miffed, but considering it took us an hour and a half to get our food I think we were probably better off with the wait. In short the service in and of itself is enough to make this a one star review. It took a half hour to get our order placed. Another hour for it to be cooked.   The waffles weren't bad but they were a bit soggy. In Gussie's defense though the chicken was definitely freshly fried, and was pretty good.   The cherry on the whole thing though was that a meal for four came to $65, we put in $80 expecting to get change. It never came. We definitely will not be returning.

8VDD1XDtb30HM66M26RtPQ.review_text: ***  disclaimer, I should have wrote this followup three weeks ago but failed to do so.  Since my first review I have been back to Gussie's two additional times and would have been back even more frequently but I felt bad that I did not update my initial review***  Gussie's Round 2-    Wait Time:  My food was out in 15 mins flat!  Food Quality: 4 out of 5.  Everything that I ordered was available this time.  Mac & Cheese, greens and chicken was on point.  The yams cold use some help though.  Put a little extra soul into it and you can hide the fact that they are canned yams.  Overall my second experience was far superior than my initial encounter with Gussie's.  The staff was on point, food was fast and good and the manager (Chance) took good care of me.  My only recommendation is that you serve the sides with "A Taste of the South" in bowls so that the chicken and cornbread do not get soggy.  Gussie's Round 3-   This time I took a different friend to try to blend in and to obtain a different perspective.  I waited nearly 30 mins for my friend to show up.  Gussie's staff was great as they frequently offered me drinks until my friend arrived.  When she did finally show up, Gussie's staff  complemented me on my patience in waiting.  she felt bad which turned out to be a good thing for me :)  The Food:  This time I decided to try there signature Chicken and Waffle's...It was great!  Typically I don't care for wings but they had the right amount of flavor and crispness.  The waffle was a nice golden brown and the syrup tasted like it was real maple...delicious!  Conclusion:  Now since I have finally completed this installment of my review on Gussie's I will be back.  And similar to other late night eatery gems such as papusa's, burritos and pizza, Gussie's will now be enshrined as a must eat restaurant for any out of town guest and post late night evening events.

wXGx5Jsr6qkOdu83vp5tKg.review_text: HATED IT!!!!  I wont be returning. Service was horrible, the wait was awfully long for medicocre food!

2RjsiNX7yIWZQMmpU3onVg.review_text: Okay this place is freaking amazing. They forever will have my business. I went here a few months back with my bf and a friend. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich because well, it's fricken delicious. They were taking a bit of time and told me that my sandwich was going to take a while because the bread was stale, and they were sending someone out to get new bread for my sandwich.  Okay, that itself deserves 5 stars. I mean they could have told me they couldn't serve the sandwich because they were out of bread, but they sent someone out to get more bread so I could have my sandwich. Seriously, if I could give them 10 stars for their service I would do it. That's dedication to customer service right there.  Not to mention the food was just as amazing as ever. Delicious, succulent, crispy fried chicken and mmmm waffle fries.  Next time I want to try the red velvet waffles, if I can tear myself away from the chicken sandwich.

XCASLI4jw3XoMwAYJJkc0w.review_text: We had a party here for about 30 people for work.  It was perfect.  The room felt not too big, not too small.  The buffet was all set up with chicken, greens, beans, macaroni & cheese, and sweet tea.  Everything was hot and delicious.  Then waffles to top it off!  Yum.

7-VyouRA--Ae-VBNoMxfDw.review_text: Service- really friendly, but slow. Took a while to make out order and get our food.  Food- I think I like popeyes or KFC  chicken better, mine was a bit dry. The Potatoes were really good, best part of my meal. A bit pricey.   Atmosphere/ambiance- felt a little empty and loud. Smelled weird.

yR_Eyjp58p-bAwORI-B3Jg.review_text: Been here twice, both times on a weekday during lunch time.  Each time, the place was not very busy, but oddly enough, the service was on the inattentive side and slow.    For a place with "chicken and waffles" in the name, I'd expect those items to be the best on the menu.  Unfortunately, this is not the case.  The first time, I chalked up the dry, flavorless chicken to being in the buffet warmers too long, but the second time, I ordered my chicken from the menu and the result was the same.  The only slight improvement in ordering it freshly cooked as opposed to getting it off the buffet line, was that the chicken was hot and crispy.  Other than that, the flavor was bland, with a capital B.  Not even a hint of seasoning on the chicken.  Not even basic salt and pepper.  That's just crazy to me.    If not for the sweet potato waffle I ordered on my second visit, the experience would have been totally disappointing.  The texture of the waffle wasn't that great, but at least I did taste the sweet potato in it.  I didn't come with regular syrup though, which was what I was expecting.  Instead, it came with some kind of thin sweet liquid, that I'm guessing was sweet potato cooking liquid.  Once I got over the initial surprise of not getting maple syrup for my waffle, using that "sweet potato" liquid made eating my waffle enjoyable enough.    Would have gotten dessert on this second visit to Gussie's if it weren't for the fact that the waitress forgot to give us the dessert menu and came back with the bill instead. Just that error caused my lunch partner to give her an offensively low tip, even though she really enjoyed her food.  But then, this particular lunch partner, needs very little encouragement to leave small tips where ever she goes anyway.   Normally, in a situation like that I would have made up the difference to give the server a tip that would represent at least 15%, but I just didn't have enough money with me that day, to pay for my item and then also tip for two people.  That was really embarrassing for me.  I wouldn't be surprised if the waitress cussed us out after she saw what was left on the table for her.    Although I'm a generous tipper, I don't like wasting my money on "blah" food, so Gussie's will not get a third visit out of me.  My lunch partner has no shame, so she will most likely be back to eat at Gussie's again, with her "non-tipping" self.

ZVxh68z6aqdjPAeRFaj5qw.review_text: I understand this place RECENTLY opened so I shouldn't expect great service - but waiting 45 minutes before I get any food is ridiculous.  The server was sweet as apple pie, but that doesn't help me when I'm hungry.    The food - mediocre.  I'm from Houston, I know what chicken and waffles is supposed to taste like.  The sweet potato waffle was good, not extraordinary.  The chicken, a bit dry.  Price - moderately priced.  Not expensive, not cheap.  Atmosphere - similar to a diner.  Nothing fancy, not low end.  Decent food, decent price... just expect to wait while sitting at the table.  OH!  And the sweet tea?  Sweet my a$$!  It was bitter as hell.....

xzt3gE7M1WAIrY3je5fjFw.review_text: The chicken great, the mac and cheese yummy and creamy, and the yams sweet just like I like em! The service not so great. We didn't have to wait we came on a Friday night around 8pm, so I'm not sure when they're peak time is, but that was good. They need more servers here to provide better customer service here. I had a groupon so that's really the only reason I came. The place is not super special, but I give 5 stars for the fried chicken and the mac and cheese and yams. I got the $10 buffet which you can't beat. I tried my husbands sweet potato waffle, but ever since I had one from Pinx Catering I can't have it anywhere else. I won't go out of my way to come here but if I'm starving and it's super convenient I would come back. Gussie's please work on your customer service!

9y62h6P5TzcFja-b80VvKQ.review_text: This place exceeded my expectations once I saw the place.  The place is really generic looking.  The food was good.  I actually ordered a salad and the veggies were fresh and delicious.  The service was a bit lacking at the beginning, but once we got settled all was fine.

pF6cdwPdOxTJWEFotjigLw.review_text: Normally do not bother writing negative reviews as "$#@! happens from time to time" but I have to warn all of you about the service here.  7:40pm  Sat down and the waiter promptly came by with our menu.  7:50pm  Ordered couple Long Island Ice Teas and Okra for appetizer 8:20pm  Had to call bus boy to get waiter to ask about our drinks 8:30pm  Finally got our drinks BUT still no appetizer 8:45pm  Okra came out. Waiter said only 2 cooks working in back 8:55pm  Owner comes by to inform us food will be out shortly, does not offer to accomodate us for the horribly long wait... 9:00pm  Finally get our dinner, food was adequate but by this point I had lost my appetite.  Waiter knocked off the drinks from bill.  Sorry but I will not be returning.  PS Their cornbread was pretty good FWIW.

I9RtKqkuzv0HYbyEq6jFIA.review_text: Great Chicken &Waffle spot. I can't believe it's taken me this long to go. I wanna come back and try the peach cobbler. Good food, nice setting, service is ok. Win win for a date night!

3vMaVYNyGcuzIG5PwUN10Q.review_text: I came here with my boyfriend last week and it was our first time trying out soul food. It was a great experience! I ordered the downtown special. (I think my boyfriend ordered the uptown special.) I can't even begin to say how delicious the pancake was! The chicken drumsticks that I had were great too, but I wish I had ordered another pancake. Definitely coming back one day. Thanks to our server Pia who was great and very attentive :)

e-8mxbsxWj5lSLt1fzsTZg.review_text: I had heard so much about Gussie's that I had to come see what the fuss was about.  I took my cousin there for her Birthday.  The food was off the chain.... And so was the DJ.  We plan on going back in the next couple of week.

zlmM6gt7GHQOx1mgQKTVFg.review_text: So...I'm still waiting for my food and it's been over an hour.  I thought the pervious reviews about the lag time were over exaggerated but they are for real.  WOW.. I am hungry, and my mood is not getting any better dealing with the ignorant host that doesn't understand what customer service is. (Sunday 12pm at the restraurant.)  And now I'm finishing my review about Sunday's experience.  So the food took a long time.  Longer then it ever should!  I can't give an unbias review of the food since I lost my appetite waiting for it.  But I will so it was okay.  I did enjoy the sweet potatoes and the greens.  I could skip the fried grits.  I like it better the old school way. ;)  So my end recommendation is..WAIT TO GO TO THIS PLACE.  They're having issues with their kitchen.  One person is making the fried chicken and waffles, and another is making the sides.  Apparently there is a communication breakdown and it's causing the massive delays.  Since they just opened last Friday I'm gonna cut them a break and give them a 2 star and re-visit the establishment when they iron out the kinks.    Btw...special shout out to Sinclair!!  You are the saving grace of my first visit.

LZzyszEXnhr3KzPs6GWM1g.review_text: Food: 4/5 Price: $$ Portion: 3/5 Appearance: 3/5 Service: 4/5 Presentation of food: 3.5/5 OVERALL: 4/5  I had their Gussie's classic, waffle and chicken. Fried chicken is good in flavor, definitely is a DIFFERENT take on the batter. It's not your typical fried chicken, definitely worth trying. I can see that it can be a 'hate-it' or 'love-it' batter. I personally don't mind it but I do prefer the classic fried batter where its CRUNCHY&CRISPY, this one is just crispy.  As for the waffle, its really good! Their syrup is on the sweeter side so don't put to much! Put a little at a time! I would definitely come back just for their waffle!  Also their Sweet Tea is AMAZING! If you love ice teas and home made sweet teas, this is the spot to get it!

Ccz02NKJE_lAFNonm8mgJQ.review_text: I came here for the first time on Sunday. I found this place on yelp and wanted to try it out. I ordered the chicken, waffles and Mac and cheese. My husband really enjoyed the chicken and I really like the waffle and there maple syrup. My daughter loved the Mac and cheese. Everything here really taste homemade. Love it!   The place is very nice modern and importantly it's clean. The hostess, waitresses and waiters are all really nice. I love the fact that there is an affordable parking garage right across from the Resturant, no need to drive around the block a hundred times looking for parking.   Next time we come to the city we will definitely be stopping by Gussie's!!!!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Wow some folks have been exceedingly harsh on Gussies but I've always had a good experience from the food to the service. This long overdue review highlights my faves at Gussie's.    First off, I don't really like chicken and waffles so in full disclosure, I've never had the waffles here. That doesn't stop me from coming here despite the namesake because I think the fried chicken is pretty tasty. Sunday's Best combines perfectly fried chicken smothered in gravy (lots of gravy) with comfort sides like collards and red beans and rice. Top this with some cornbread that is the right amount of sweet and savory. You also get breakfast all day - there are few places in SF serving country fried steak and this caloric monster (worth the occasional indulgence) always nostalgically brings me back to the south. Gussies ups theirs with a bacon gravy + eggs, home fries and a biscuit. Big portions here so the prices come down when you consider your to go box.     The weekday lunch buffet is pretty decent and is a good choice if you like variety. You get the fried chicken + comfort side like mac and cheese and candied yams but you also get to sample other items like fried catfish nuggets or the herb roasted chicken. Decent selection especially if it's your first visit but for $12, I would prefer to order off the menu and get some fresh fried chicken instead. Happy hour is another good time to try Gussies out. Afore-mentioned catfish nuggets and all other apps are half off and pints go for $2.75. They set you up nicely for some fried chicken action after.   Lastly, Gussies is one of those places where this deep-fried chicken loving fella can satisfy those cravings while having lunch with a vegan friend. That's right. Gussies does a vegetarian plate that can also be made vegan upon request and it's a nice plate of vegetarian comfort food. In a city where Southern comfort food is often hard to find, I'm glad at least we have Gussies.

hrGytwpmg-3rVy6lyjlVhQ.review_text: Poor customer service is a turn off for me. I was with my mom and I didn't want her sitting by the door. It was too cold, my mom, is 70 plus years young. The tables along the wall were all empty and they refuse to let us sit there.  Spending our money, we want to be comfortable. Very poor service, will not return back.

HpuBO4V0rzQOV05Dt-6hfQ.review_text: If you come here, you cannot leave without trying their Red Velvet Waffles, and their Sweet Potato Waffles. You will thank me later. Both are to die for!!   Service here is always excellent. Waitresses are really helpful when you need some help with ordering or giving suggestions.   The reason why I decided to give them 4 stars instead of 5 was because they don't really have a lot of Chicken Breast options. (If you decide you wanted to swap out the dark meat for white meat, it's $2 extra).  They have Buffet Brunch from Mondays thru Thursdays!!

JnnDzf5_sBsGZyU1S9csiA.review_text: I want to start of with I hate to give a bad review... However I have eaten at Gussies 3 times now. The first two times the food was AMAZING.... I had the Shrimp over rice the second time but I subbed the rice for Grits  it was flavorful the sauce was rich and just delicious! The prawns were a decent size.... Now speed up a few months to last weekend I decided to go back for the shrimp and grits....  It was a saturday around 5pm and there were maybe 3-5 other tables there.... when my food came it was luke warm the sauce was lumpy with lumps of raw flour, the shrimp were tiny bay shrimp with the tails on, I counted 4 shrimp.  I asked if could have it re heated my server was amazing so the single star goes to him!  I got my food back and the shrimp were not seasoned like they were in the 1st dish that I sent back and the sauce was still lumpy and not seasoned  it was just bad. I don't think I can ever come back to this place...

OV_E6HgjXd6oQFbgt_pzyQ.review_text: I came here once before with a friend and really liked the placed! So me and my gf took our moms here for a lunch the saturday before mothers day since I had to work. We got there around 3pm and no problems with seating our party of 5. The service was excellent, theyre all very knowledgable about the menu.. and the menu.. YUM!! I think we ordered everything. We had the chicken and sweet potato waffles, both white and dark meat (and the chicken breast is the size of a womans C cup and juicy! lol), red velvet waffles, the side sampler with mac n cheese, candied yams, potato salad, greens and I lost track of how many orders of cornbread we had! Everything was so good! The prices are reasonably priced. This place is a gem!

HqJQmrfGIjBID6_olSG6fw.review_text: Bomb.com the Fillmore classic with red velvet waffles was heaven in my mouth!

JWhAWXPLRv8HPJprP99BKw.review_text: I've only ordered for delivery, but overall, I was very pleased.  The flavors are pretty good, but some of the portions are surprisingly small.  The gumbo portion shocked me the most, so little for over $8!  I guess there are a lot of ingredients in there, but still.  The fried chicken thighs were puny too.  But, my high review is because they have a fantastic fried chicken salad.  It has all of the fixings I love in a salad, the chicken is perfectly juicy, and they give you extra Ranch dressing!  Yum!

Ny7loGeI-VP5SULERjLLew.review_text: Why the rave?  This place doesn't serve catfish, it's talapia.  Whoever is in the kitchen has no clue what southern food should taste like.  Their peach cobbler was a gooey mess and expensive.  The waffles thin and unappetizing.  Nice decor, but not worth trying again.

SP_UTqEG-qSsrojnT3nF4A.review_text: Oh man, the macaroni and cheese is absolutely amazing! Their brown sugar syrup is just as amazing.   Great place.

PNTbcuPX5V81XibwrNzskg.review_text: I think this place hits flavor on the head, plus really nice servers! I was craving some Southern cooking- the only down side is that I try really hard to eat natural meat, that is humanely raised and I know I am not going to find it everywhere but it would have put the icing on the cake! I really enjoyed my food and so did my boyfriend- plus cocktails :))

uCfbiox-Ux_1OUjDEqSBaw.review_text: Good stuff!  Sweet potato tater tots appetizer with chipotle sauce...yum.  Wish I could go back to SF for some now.  I had gumbo and hubby had a chicken lovers omelette.  Is it weird to have fried chicken in an omelette?  A little bit, but it was god.  Daughter had a huge piece of cornbread and some eggs scrambled to her liking--good comfort food for a kid recovering from a virus.  There was live music since there was a jazz festival going on in the area (Fillmore?) and it made the atmosphere really fun.  Service was quick and the decor was enjoyable.

VoXB2nZoA6KdicU9rskb8Q.review_text: I had the uptown special. Delicious waffle, chicken was kinda dry. The service was friendly, atmosphere cute. I think I'll def go back to try more things!!

yesKNzX5okRc_Nvll95n3w.review_text: Just went once, but the folks there were super-nice, and the dish I had was great: fried chicken, black-eyed peas and corn. Cornbread came with it and that was to die for. Loved the chicken and BEP;s, the corn was good. The fried okra was OK. My friend had sweet potato dish and it was great. Happy hour was very nice as well! $3 drafts. I'd definitely go again. Want to try the greens....

anSJThb6sQByQS9sPIC3bg.review_text: Word of the Meal: HOMEY  This is my second visit at Gussie's. Being a die hard Roscoe's fan from Los Angeles, I welcome Gussie's with open arms. I went on a Friday which I believe was Throwback Friday where they have a DJ spinning 90s jams and a buffet with a two drink minimum. My party, which consisted of the Mister, a friend and I, didn't go for the buffet but the drinks we ordered we delicious. One was a fruit sangria, the southern bell, and a bellini. We had the hushpuppies for an appetizer and it was fried perfection. The chicken was crispy, juicy and the waffle was chewy and delicious. I enjoyed the syrup the most. It must have been a hazelnut or maple butter that didn't taste like your run of the mill syrup at the grocery store.   All in all, the food at Gussie's is straightforward and homey. When I go back, I will definitely try the buffet and return on Fridays for Throwback Fridays. The music was on point! It just added a good, down, homey feel to the conversation and brought back some good groovin' memories.

pOsSRzm0ZOXE9FcJ5pWxYg.review_text: WE'RE #1!   WE'RE #1! bit.ly/bHK10H The fact that SF is the leanest city in the US came as a pleasant surprise to me.  I especially enjoy reading articles like this after having a big ol' plate of Chicken and Waffles for dinner.   Since the yelps for Gussie's have been very mixed, I wasn't sure what to expect but happily the Fried Chicken was fab.  We got the 1/2 Chicken with both White and Dark meat.  Every piece was as fried chicken should be, crispy and nicely spiced on the outside, moist on the inside and lots of flavor throughout. However, the Waffles that came with it were a brunch buzzkill.  If these waffles are made to order, how is it they have such a great buttery flavor yet the gawd awful spongy texture of a microwaved Eggo waffle?   The Chicken Gumbo was similarly disappointing.  The menu described it as "spicy chicken sausage, chicken, onions, bell pepper, house seasonings and a few secret ingredients topped with fried okra."  However, what we got was a tasteless, unappetizing bowl of brown mush, with a scoop of rice on top.  Unfortunately, adding loads of Tabasco sauce didn't help the cause.  Nor did the random chicken bone that I found in the bowl.  Nor the fact that the gumbo was not hot. Not cool. ***I would like to give a shoutout to all the skinny jeans loving hipsters and waify Marina girls for averaging out out my soul food loving booty so that SF is tops for random city fat measuring polls.  Go us!

p1Fg32FAnMoRkXlznU07Xw.review_text: So my friend and I went over there yesterday.  The happy hour deal is pretty good, if you get 2 drinks min. you get half off the appetizers or the combo sampler plate.  We got the sampler plate with the yams, okra, potatoes, and rice/beans.  I was mostly impressed with the yams and the rest of it seemed just ok.  The rice/beans were really plain on bland white rice.  The potatoes didn't seem special and the okra was pretty tasty in a corn fried batter.  Then we got....   Well of course the chicken and waffles.  I have to say this was the best fried chicken I've ever had.  Very nicely executed and not greasy.  I liked the fact it was breaded lightly because it didn't feel like I was eating just fat.  Then the waffle was very good too.    Next time I would like to try the collard greens and the macaroni & cheese.

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: This is quite the little novelty that'll either close shop because of it's lack in consistency or make a lot of modifications and promises to lure unhappy first time and only time guests to it's restaurant.   Now I'm a lover of the Chicken and Waffles combination and I will make the trips to Atlanta for Glady's, L.A. for Roscoe's, and Oakland for House of Chicken and Waffles and this place by far is a poor excuse and should never be included in the same sentence as these other reputable establishments again.  First of all, when you walk into any restaurant there should a host, a sign, or something to kind of give you the down low as to what you should expect. Walking in around 1 p.m. for a casual Friday lunch I expected it to be a little busier but not busy enough that there was no one around to greet you at the door. I proceeded to do what any curious person would do and just peruse through the menu as I waited. That gave both my boyfriend and I enough time to pick out what we wanted and by that time, the host casually walked up, plucked the menus out of our hands after giving us a dirty look for enough touching them before they were given to us and sat us at a tiny table even though the entire restaurant was about 20% full.   Initial experience aside, I didn't come here for 3 star Michelin service so the greeting was brushed off to the side. We sat down, studied the menu again to ensure our choices were truly what we wanted and waited. And waited. And waited. For about 10-15 minutes. Then our server came by to get drink orders and the full order because at that point, I wasn't going to let her get away from us. We ordered the sweet tea, downtown special and the sweet potato waffles.  The food came out in a timely manner but this became the trifecta of a bad meal:  1. The waffles were rubbery. 2. The syrup? The syrup was like candy and my sweet tea was thicker  than the pathetic excuse for syrup they placed on my plate. 3. My chicken has hairs. HAIRS!! 4. My chicken was bone dry which is hard for dark meat to do. 5. I'm not paying $1 more for decent syrup-that's an insult. 6. She never once offered a refill. 7. She never once checked in on us. 8. Chicken skin was burned to the point where it cut the roof of my mouth. 9. The syrup was no nasty, my poor boyfriend only pushed his plate around and asked for a bubble tea to get rid of the sicky sweet taste.  For $30, it was a waste of space and time for us that fateful Friday afternoon. The only time our server was prompt with anything was the bill when my boyfriend finally motioned for it with his credit card. I get the feel that they're vastly understaffed but I believe they're out of their honeymoon period and novelty will wear off soon if they keep their practices up.

9TA1OuMJoVnhq1el6X1_fw.review_text: Had lunch today with a friend. Although the menu said the buffet was from morning till 3pm [We were seated at 2:30pm].  They closed down the buffett and had very little food left.  *Sad Face*  But onto the food. It was good.  Fried Chicken was ok, but like the top layer of the chicken [where the meat was, not the skin] was a lil dry.  I had to really chew to pull and eat the sliver layer of chicken off.  It was still tasty tho. Scrambled eggs were good.  The Honey glazed Cornbread was good and moist! The Waffles warm and soft.  The potatoes were good, although the gravy on the potatoes was a lil too salty. Which can be good or bad depending on how you look at it.  Certainly made me wanna slurp the gravy up.  Then again, this is soul food, so I knew it wasnt gonna be super healthy. Waitstaff was very nice and refilled our water.  Wasnt super busy though, so yeah, it was easy to wait on us. Prolly only like 8 people total eating at the time.  Most reviewers had similar experiences. Hit or miss depending. Food was nothing super sock blowing, but still not bad. Right in the middle.  Id come back again.  Hopefully they would honor the 3pm Buffet time next time I come in.

ATxYYNlvJl7fYYJG3JPZ2A.review_text: I thought the chicken was very tasty.  It was seasoned perfectly and the waffle was great too.  The mac n' cheese was good, but I like it a bit creamier.  I was a little disappointed that they were out of the red velvet cake.  Overall, I thought the food and atmosphere were great and I will be returning.

h9NqARoD3oR5p4z5p6uJzA.review_text: I had a deal for this place, so I took my mom to get some fried chicken and waffles when she was in town. The chicken was great, but the waffle was super disappointing. Kinda thin and got "stale" pretty quickly. I remember the mac n cheese being pretty delish. big portions here, and I was thinking I really want to try 1300 on Fillmore next. So far, Auntie April's has been the best waffle for me! It's just a treck to get there... yelp.com/biz/auntie-apri…

c3jTXFMhFlsKrbLZcprF4w.review_text: Walking into Gussie's is one of the best dining decisions you can make in the city. What a wonderful escape from the overrun hipster scene in this city. Drinks: AMAZING, food is even better but my favorite part of Gussie's is the service. We had two different waitresses serving us and they were BOTH fantastic. They also support Dining Out for Life which makes them even cooler. Go for the sweet potato waffles OR the veggie platter.

ukTRXi3Hvqu0KTkQvLW9dg.review_text: I would give this more stars but I didn't get to taste the food. I walked in, waited in the reception are for about 10 minutes, no one paid us any attention; so we sat at a table for another 10 minutes, again no one paid us any attention. At this point we left, and so ends my experience at gussie's chicken and waffles.

8frCo1AwIu46N_1jInwAWw.review_text: I don't know, it was a weird experience.  We (three of us) waited for 45 minutes for a table at 10a.m. on a Saturday; which I didn't mind because I thought that their popularity must indicate good news for our stomachs.  Well, the food was okay but not okay enough to warrant the long wait.  I had the chicken breast with a side of waffles, and the other two had some dark meat with waffles.  My chicken breast was moist and had a good crunch, just no flavor; the same was reported for the dark meat as well.  And the waffles were, eh, crunchy but too thin.    The service wasn't too good either.  Our waitress didn't come to our table until 10 minutes after we were seated.  And then it took her another while longer to take our orders.  And then she seemed irritated when we asked for stuff, such as extra napkins and hot sauce.    I think we're going to stick to Belgium waffles and home-made fried chicken ;)

BxUoZq-GKrytLoZwr5xB3A.review_text: I wasn't sure that chicken and waffles was a good combination.. but I ended up having a very nice meal! It's different from what I'm used to have but it was very good.  Will recommend it to friends.

9M9OmSx7pg98QsnL96oW1w.review_text: Last week we went into Gussie's. We had 8 people.  Service was super fast. Chicken was hot and juicy with nice crispy skin. Waffles were great and the syrup is really yummy. I had the regular waffle which was great. Folks that had the sweet potato waffle also loved those. And people who got sides thought the mac n cheese and collards were great.  We loved the chicken so great, we ordered extra wings and they came super fast. They were larger than we expected, perfectly cooked.  We ate every bite.  The price is really great and we found parking easily.  All in all, a really outstanding experience. We will definitely be going back.

gJ-0tS8WfLjcNpknRy9yqA.review_text: Overall nice place for chicken and waffles.  Location. Overall not bad. Definitely out of the way, but there are several good bars around to leave after.  Atmosphere. Kinda sucks but it is similar to the true chicken and waffle places in harlem.  Food.  Fried chicken was a bit underseasoned and could use salt. The batter must be a bit too thin or too watery. The skin basically starts crispy for the first 5 minutes and gets soggy quickly so eat it fast.   Waffles were great. Nicely crispy yet tender on the inside. Definitely the best option here. Get the maple syrup.  Greens. Very nicely seasoned and braised. Perhaps a bit too acidic, but overall a good example of cookery.  Candied yams. Too rich. The yams were perhaps too buttery and rich to eat. You could only really consume a bite or two.  Mac and cheese. Overall average. Very rich and uses white cheddar. Perhaps a bit underflavored. Salt does not make up for the mediocre cheddar they used.  Value. Probably one of the better values in SF. Without a doubt worth the 10-15$ per plate.

HgRHN0jVVsTwuhqqtnQGsQ.review_text: I got my first taste of chicken & waffles at the ever-so-famous Roscoe's in the Los Angeles area. Chicken and waffles make a delicious pair (even though my boyfriend's first response was... seriously?!).  Came here with another couple on a Groupon deal. Parking wasn't difficult to find, but we came on a rainy Saturday. I expect since it's in the Fillmore district, parking normally would be hard. So plan ahead to look around.  The restaurant is nothing fancy. It has ample space for a lot of customers and will easily fill up during dinner time. The place is very comfy, great servers, good level of noise.  Among the four of us, we shared two servings of chicken and waffles, an appetizer of catfish nuggets and an order of 'Taste of the South'. Chicken and waffles are just chicken and waffles. It's nothing fancy - but the waffles were buttery and soft, the chicken was crispy (and great with either gravy or honey). The taste of the south wasn't exactly my favorite, but my friends really liked their candied yams and baked mac-n-cheese.  Definitely would come back when I'm craving something unhealthy. :)

ZOC5ytZHm4mBd-I6EFULJQ.review_text: I've been here 4x now and it's still the same, the first time was a bday get together and was not happy with that soupy mac n cheese. Let alone the over cooked, miniature chicken pieces and of recent xmas toy drive function where i didnt eat any of the buffet, i ordered a seperate plate n yes the waffle itself was good if you like crepes and again was given two over cooked miniature pieces of chicken the thigh came off a baby chicklit. They said times r hard for everyone so trying specials to get people in, no their over rated n over priced, they just opened in a location where these other cultures that eat there don't have a clue! Sorry real talk here.

lt2knwW5AnTWnXL7J5-f7Q.review_text: We came here because of the Groupon they offered. It is very nice inside and the one waiter that was working was very friendly. I ordered the chicken lover's omelet and my wife ordered the uptown special. My meal was very good. Loved the grits and omelet. My wife had the uptown special which consisted of a large waffle and a large fried chicken breast. The waffle was good and they gave you a large pitcher of syrup. The chicken however was really dry which was disappointing. You'd think with one of their staples that they would get it right. Overall the food was good and a nice atmosphere. Towards the end of the meal it became much more crowded and there was still only the one waiter. We had to flag down the busboy to pay our bill. They definitely need more staff.

wjQv92px4xHjbBoATkOTUw.review_text: I had been wanting to make a trip to Gussie's for years now. My family was visiting and we finally found the opportunity to stop in. The fried okra, regular waffles, cornmeal waffles and fried chicken were all fantastic. The chicken pieces are gigantic and easily leave you with some to take away for a second meal!

WB7yrm93ZaTk8RaGro8v6g.review_text: I've been here quite a few times and I would say its just alright.  The food is nothing to die for and nothing to complain about. The chicken is similar to KFC and the biscuits are just ...ok.  However, the service is normally slow and makes it hard to frequent.  If your in the area and starving for soul food- I would go.. otherwise... just pick another spot.

E_4n_NyJP55yDtIodv95Ng.review_text: Standard chicken and waffles. I had a combo special and enjoyed everything. I had a side of red beans and rice that taste wonderful and my friends mac & cheese was smooth and cheesy! My only suggestion is if you are going to buy alcohol, just buy a beer, the cocktails are a complete waste of sugar water and money.

86K9TcfsFVHKa5tKnX0y5g.review_text: Really enjoyed their fried catfish, chicken and of course the sweet tea. Being raised from the south, I have to say this is only place in the city I've found that makes food that's close to home. Love the restaurant atmosphere as well..most differently my husband and I will be back

hF27U7xF8E3Dix4eTawraA.review_text: Most recent visit: December 2009: The Sweet Sticky Thang cocktail is on hit. Go figure lol.  ========================== (August 2009) Yes, two stars because I've most certainly experienced better. No skin off my a** to those who resent the two or three stars. Some of the people who left reviews for this with 5 stars couldn't have had any other chicken waffles in their life. I can't understand. So funny. Visited on a Wednesday night, right after the ProAm game - around 10pm The ice water they serve doesn't taste like milk lol. That is definitely a plus plus plus to me. The macaroni and cheese was just macaroni and some cheese, period.  No oooohs or ahhhhhs; more like no no no nos. My friend ordered some cornbread and it look as dry as the cornmeal before the batter is made. The waffle and my one chicken breast wow. I ordered the Uptown Special - one chicken breast &amp; one waffle, though I think breawsts should come in twos just like the thighs do. that's besides the poin though. When the waiters brought out our plates, we were looking at each other like uh where is the rest of my chicken that we ordered. did u accidentally put the rest of my one piece of chicken on the other person's plate, and u left the other ones in the fryer? At least the flavor wasn't lacking but damn. I wouldn't mind paying the 12 bucks understanding the restaurant business is expensive esp in san fran, but sheesh. The waffle was thin and more chewy than waffle crispy texture. The syrup tasted like there was some kind of coconut after taste. Service: Well there was only about four tables occupied and the ratio of employees to patrons was like 10 to 1. Kind people. I rather have them stuck up or snobby, serving great food. Oh well. I might give the restaurant another try but not for another few months.

tl7BzUtnzAj_r1WYFXLiug.review_text: Man, this was tough. I wanted to love this place but it fell a tad bit short.  Showed up around 9:30am [alone, of course] and I am not acknowledged.  So, I make my way over to the back and seat myself -_-  ...no water, no utensils, no menus, no greeting... Damn, am I invisible?!   Finally, someone comes over and brings me water and lets me know that the server would be right with me. "Right with me" meant 5 minutes which puzzled me cause there were only two other people there and already eating, but OKAY bish.   My server comes over and she's too cute! omg. Too bad she was a bit sluggish. I ordered The Uptown - one fried chicken breast and a waffle. [~$10]  I wanted to cry. Granted, I got  the chicken breast, but goddamn that shit was dry!!! Like, I just wanted to quit chewing and give up all together but the waffle really saved this experience. It was lovely.   I'm willing to come back and give this place another chance but I'm not into being ignored, so nah, I'm cool.   Least the waffle was good. *shrug*

kS1MQHYwIfD0462PE61IBw.review_text: they are still obviously working out the kinks... ambiance doesn't feel "southern" but is nice staff trying their best, gave us a few sides to sample since the food was taking so long had the 1/2 chicken with waffles and sweet potato fries (underseasoned) fried chicken was crispy skin but dry inside waffles soft, artificial-tasting syrup so should probably go for maple syrup interesting they have a soju menu -- sorta the "in" thing right now, also easier to make cocktails without the full liquor license also interesting they offer a sweet potato waffle but $9.79 for 2?? hopefully timing of serving the chicken improves so that it'll be less dried out

umwonFnEP0osgYGKrxLJQA.review_text: My first time eating chicken and waffles (together, mind you) and also the first time actually eating at a soul food. I ordered the Fillmore Classic and it was very good :) The chicken wings were fried perfectly, the skin was crispy and the meat was soft and juicy. The waffles were delicious and the eggs were so-so.  Besides the food, the service was great. The waitress who helped us was very sweet and kept visiting my table a lot, she even gave us extra napkins without us asking or knowing! Man shes good. Now that`s what you call "Southern hospitality" Next time I will come back, maybe next time to try their $12 buffet.

7gkNrtyepBIWSObcA7EWzQ.review_text: Hey everyone I live 9 block away from this place and I want go this afternoon so I when there with my brother.  The place is great the food  I order the downtown Chicken abd Waffles I waffle and two legs I love Legs now this Legs was had to much in them oil my drink not good.  Now my brother love his drink .  I think I need to try it one mire tine but if it suck again WOW

cx55R4U3t7zX4fytdUZLSg.review_text: The food is good, I ordered chicken and waffles. The food took a little long to come but its worth it. They do not cook there breast fast like some places which lives it dry. The breast was dripping juice which made it worth the wait. The only issue I had with this spot is that the waffle are too damn thin but they taste really good. They need to made them thicker. Good spot to visit when in the Filmore area.

2p5MWSzQZv1kkYwix7Hujg.review_text: Other yelpers are spot on.  Went there with 9 people for dinner, and had some great food and bad service.    Food: Between the nine of us, we covered the menu pretty well.  The fried okra, catfish nuggest, and grit cakes were all good starters.   Chicken and waffles were the hits of dinner, the sides were universally unloved (but not awful).    Service: Very nice friendly service, just lots of little problems.  First, they were really cool about seating our party without knowing exactly how many of us would be there, and were cool w/ adding tables as we needed.  The server was there right away to get drinks/apps orders, but they came out sporadically (some people finished their drinks before other drinks had arrived, apps delivered but no plates to eat off of).  Dinner was much of the same, probably 20 mins between when the first entree arrived to the last.  Again, the server was nice about it and apologetic.   Other notes: The "gussie's backyard brew" is miller high-life.  I love that, but some might find it weird.    All that said-  do take out.

CRQxUA153gfihCM7eR8psA.review_text: Called and put me on hold for 20 minutes. I kid you not. 20 minutes. I called back and complained I was on hold for 20 minutes saying I was ready to order...you guessed it, they put me on hold.  Change your process. Someone ordering takeout is more valuable and more profitable than someone taking up table space. Being able to answer the phone properly and take orders is an essential part of customer service

6EdZ_TvAys9OBYPGZma98g.review_text: Honestly, I was VERY excited at the prospect of eating here.  A few of us had a rare chance to eat lunch together during the week and we wanted some soul food.  On our way to Farmer Brown, we saw this BRAND NEW spot.  Here is my review:  The Good: -The chicken was crispy and flavorful. -The waitress was very nice and it really wasn't her fault (see below).  The Bad (and UGLY): -The service was HORRENDOUS.  It took us 2.5 HOURS to eat lunch!!!  Ridiculous. -My meal came out 45 MINUTES before anyone else's at the table. -The sides are small and over-priced. -The waffles were not very good. -The biscuits nearly broke my friend's tooth. -We watched as people who were seated after us were served and some people seated before us were still waiting for their food as well. -Excuses, excuses, excuses:  The myriad of different excuses were that our waitress had a dispute with the cook, the order was accidentally overlooked, the food was coming right up (riiight), and that the fryer was malfunctioning. -The orders only finally did come out because we had told them that we were going to leave and to give us the bill.  All-in-all, I DO NOT recommend this place.  The look and feel has tremendous potential...let someone who has even a slight grasp of how to run a business take over.  PLEASE.

DzclmbuW4_ogw3VujAgLPw.review_text: Service was consistently disappointing (not accommodating, pretty slow, forgetful).  The chicken was pretty good, but not exceptional - nothing mindblowing.  The sweet potato waffles had potential, but were on the soggy side.  The chicken-mushroom omelette was pretty tasty.  And at least there were coffee/diet coke refills!

_ihaHggkCj4b9mOeSxKokA.review_text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and it was a super dud. I can't speak for the chicken since I'm a vegetarian, but the waffles were fine. Not special, just fine. The cocktails were super cheep at $6, but they were so watery we hardly touched them.   What bothered me was the slow service.
