For a while we were the only ones in the restaurant, and it still took forever for them to help us. The waiter forgot everything we asked for, including the bill.

wWMAM2-ObWCx_TNoZXvjTA.review_text: We will definitely not eat at this restaurant ever again. We were seated fairly quickly. They took our drink order and we ordered our meals. We waited for 45 mins before our food finally made it out. We ordered a side of gravy with our meal, they forgot to bring it. We asked for it and it took another 10 mins before it arrived.   It was cold, not appetizing at all. . My chicken was over cooked and very tough to eat. . Sides were served cold.  The waffles looked and tasted like they came straight out a box. They were not attentive to our needs at all.  We asked a waitress that was walking by for more soda. She stated, she wasnt our waitress and continued to walk away. I was done at that point. . No bueno !!

RDXe_RjQm-t9Mk9QI5YjvQ.review_text: So far I have been here twice.  This is some GOOOOD Food. Fried chicken, yum, candied yams,yum yum, mac and cheese,yumyumyum, greens, wow, and nana puddin. Me likes alot.  I wish I lived closer. I think that would be dangerous.

2VPIJXJKbkSNU1lIQV7Uew.review_text: My squeeze and I have been here three times in two weeks. I'd give it 5 stars, but as people have mentioned there are hiccups in service and sometimes with some food items that I imagine good management will resolve.  Why do we keep coming back? We *LOVE* the sweet potato waffles with brown sugar (not maple) syrup. We *LOVE* the moist on the inside, crispy on the outside fried chicken. We even love the fried triangles of cheese grits and the onion and cheese scrambled eggs. (Sweet tea was a bit too sweet for me, and I have a southern mother.)  I almost didn't write a review because I would hate to see all those hipsters roll downhill from Kate's Kitchen and cause long lines at our new favorite lazy weekend morning place! But Gussie's is so tasty, it deserves a yelp.

07p1XwEmcGrV42Fn0k0mGQ.review_text: Ew.  There was absolutely nothing remarkable about their fried chicken.  How dare they call this a "fried chicken and waffle house"?  Their fried chicken was bland and tasteless.  The batter was far too thick, unevenly distributed and (gasp!) the chicken was insanely dry - mind you, I had a breast and a wing.  A dry wing?  That's just sad.  Their waffles were nothing but a huge, soggy mess.  It was neither crisp nor crunchy.  It was soft and bread-like, hell, I think Eggo makes better waffles  The only saving factor was the maple syrup drenching out the horrible bland taste of that huge, doughy wanna-be waffle.  Highlight of my meal?  The potatoes, reminiscent of Popeye's version full of Cajun spices and savory flavors.  Upon leaving, another patron was telling their party "It was such a hike to get here but soooooo worth it."  If I wasn't so damn polite, I'd whip around and say "No it AIN'T."

JlHLKG6w75hUmLmXZGuW-w.review_text: Oh man... Gussie's. First i want to give a shout out to to the awesome hostess last night (Friday 4/13) who was super flexible with us given that many of our guests were arriving late. She did what she could to put us at an accommodating table and was very patient. Once I was seated, it got weird.  I first witnessed a poor busboy trying to deliver a tray of waters, dump it all over another patron's table. Shit happens right? The guy cleaned up the deluge of water and was apologetic. Moving on.  We're still sitting waiting for our order to be taken when around the corner comes a woman from the buffet with a stacked plate. Lo and behold, she slips on the puddle of water on the floor from the spill and goes down. The plate explodes and shards of ceramic, mac n cheese, collards and chicken fly everywhere. Restaurant goes ape shit.  After a 5 minute struggle trying to get the woman off the floor, the mess gets cleaned up. The best part was the wait staff accommodating the lady by dragging a table over to practically where she went down so she could sit there and eat rather than walking back to her original table. Again, weird. The amazing hostess then got the woman plates of food from the buffet for the rest of the night so she didn't have to walk.  The food was good. I got the downtown special with a side of mac. Totally superb and I'm from South Carolina so I know what's legit.  Overall an interesting experience. They have to do something about the slick tile floors.

uNIyxmljF0IVuVEifJNQ6g.review_text: My brother-in-law wanted to take me out for my birthday so we scheduled a time to meet up, gather the family and friends, and grab a bite.  We weren't sure what we were in the mood for so we drove around town for a while, checking the status of various wait lists.  We finally found Gussie's since he had heard some good things about it, and I'm ALWAYS in the mood for great soul food!  I started off with a pint of IPA, which was too bitter for my tastes, but was great for washing down the subsequent heavy foods.  We ordered the fried chicken liver appetizer which we all felt were a little too "iron-y" for us, but the delicious smothering sauce was great for masking the flavor.  I went with the Southern Comfort which came with two buttery waffle, two pieces of chicken, and an odd scrabbled egg side.  We also ordered the side-sampler with red beans and rice, mac and cheese, collared greens, and mashed potatoes to share.  The leg piece was overcooked but the thigh was perfect, but my favorite part was definitely the waffles.  Soooo good!  The sides were hit or miss but the collared greens did stand out and offered a little sweetness that was very welcomed.  Service was friendly and there was a cool vibe in the restaurant and neighborhood.  Prices are slightly higher than Hard Knox, but to be honest, I actually like the competitors a tad better, especially with the mac and cheese.  However, the waffles at Gussie's can't be beat!  Food: 7/10  Service: 8/10  Price: $$  Atmosphere: 8/10

9sxvJvvTtw8y2YRDcaL9nw.review_text: Chicken & Waffles! I was so excited to try this place. Got there on a Friday night around 8:30 pm and was seated immediately for a table for 6. NO wait! WOW! They even seated us without our whole party being there. That's rare in the city.  Our waiter was OK. He couldn't tell us if Gussie's brew was dark or light beer. Shouldn't he know? The beer was OK according to my bf who loves beer.  We ordered the chedder cheese grit cakes as our appetizer. It took about 30 min for it to arrive. It was average.  Almost an hour went by and FINALLY our food arrives. My bf and friends ordered the Taste of the South. It was suppose to come with collard greens. Our waiter said they ran out. However, 30 min later, we noticed the table next to us had collard greens!  The sides were cold. We told the waiter and he took the food back. It was microwaved and returned to us. I ordered the Fillmore Classic. I was disappointed with the waffles. The fried chicken was good though.  Since there was a delay in getting our food, the manager gave us a 20% discount. That was nice. However, since we had 6 in our party, there was an automatic 18% gratuity in our bill. Service was overall horrible despite the manager trying to help make it up.  I probably won't go back.

lLQfQkI555lSB0lxgvrVXw.review_text: I was eager to try an alternatives to Brenda's, and the atmosphere was decent. However:  -The food took a while to come our table (a larger group seated after our party got their food before us). -I ordered the 1/4 white meat and eggs with a waffle on the side. While the chicken was large, it was dry and bland, and overall a task to get through (and I'm a eater). Even when I ate it with the waffle, the chicken somehow made the waffle drier. -the service was nice but inconsistent: we had to obtain our own utensils.   On the bright side, the sides and waffles are good. It's just hard to excuse the mediocre chicken.

xCu63RJg9HmKJTtFkYW84w.review_text: I've used yelp in the past few years, but never to actually review a place.  I decided to jump on here today and write something due to the fact we ordered at 1:00, had an appointment at 2:30, and left at 2:10 without receiving any food.  The food that did get out to customers looked great, and I'm sure after a month or so they'll have it down.  Just a heads up for people looking to be in and out within an hour or so.  They comped the drinks when we offered to pay, which was nice.  2 stars for effort, but I've never waited on an order for over an hour and walked out anywhere, especially here in SF.

CWQEIoajZb79todnOuKeiA.review_text: Wasn't fabulous but just ok. Waffles were not crispy. Chicken was moist and tender though. Pieces were ridiculously big. Liked that they took reservations and no hassle.

S_jBvOShrOy--ndONRPpig.review_text: The first time I ever came here (years ago) the food was great.   I'm a huge fan of chicken and waffles and ugh, I just wish I wasn't so disappointed in this review I'm about to drop.  The food now..isn't so great.  I came back here last week with my parents.   The woman that seated us acted pretty rude.  I understand that she could be having a bad day and/or they were stressed, but she gave us the cold shoulder and wouldn't seat us at a table near the back corner (not the actual back of the restaurant) because there happened to be a reservation there. I wanted to have a bit of privacy talking to my parents about culinary school.. that conversation went downhill once we started eating, by the way.  The restaurant seemed pretty empty when we asked why we couldn't be seated anywhere else AND THEN she explained that we couldn't be seated anywhere else besides this one table in the middle and she left my parents pretty annoyed and I; feeling pretty awkward.  I ordered some fried chicken (dark meat) with a side a collard greens and mac n cheese, and the chicken tasted pretty bland but had a nice golden crust. My dad ordered something similar instead with white meat, and black eyed peas and some rice and beans. Technically, just mediocre.  Here's what my mom ordered: some type of seafood chowder (I forgot what it was but it really was not worth remembering) that came lukewarm/cold..not even warm, at our table. And she ordered some fried catfish. Both of which were bland and really disgusting. The candied yams that my mother had on the side were good though. I mean, that was a plus. I mean I am really really sorry, but it was gross.   Our server was such a sweet guy, the candied yams were good. The whole experience of eating here seems like one of those embarrassing moments you never want to think about.

MIDv5jrDZc3ePwLbRXE3Jw.review_text: The food actually exceeded my expectations from the yelp reviews! The chicken was pretty good, fried nicely and not overcooked or dry like other reviews. The waffle was good too! Not as crispy as I like, but I kinda left it on my plate for awhile.   I would give this place a 4 stars if it wasn't for the horrible service we got right when we walked in. Supposedly they were training a new hostess, but she passed by me and my friend more than 3 times without acknowledging us or even making any eye contact. And then when we asked why she seated another party of 2 who came in after us first, she gave us all these excuses which might be legitimate. However, when we were waiting, she was super friendly to this other couple and almost seated them before us. They were nice enough to tell her we were there first, and then she seated us. Everything else took super long, waiting for the menu, water, AND the bill. The food came out fast tho. This place would have way more potential if they hired more ppl or ran more efficiently.

IIgPgBrdyBzxlzbnfUVHaQ.review_text: Whoever thought of combining crispy chicken, sweet maple syrup and a waffle = amazing  = must have inspired the person who made the McGriddle  = best day of my life (....I kid...kind of)  Gussie's was my first (holy) experience trying chicken and waffles, and I'm a fan! Can you tell?   We each got two pieces of chicken that came with two waffles and scrambled eggs with cheese. It's all a blur because all I'm doing is thinking about how good this place was. Parking was relatively easy to find but service was pretty slow. Nice, but slow.   Pinky promise we'll be back.  ~M

aY-fl7-WbVBNNj2qY-phfg.review_text: In search for the best Chicken and Waffles in SF, I went to Gussie's for a late Friday lunch (3:00pm). Overall, the food was good, not superb but overall solid.    I ordered the 1/4 dark meat fried chicken and waffles combo for $13, $1 cornbread, and sweet iced tea $2. The highlights of the meal were the chewy waffles and 2 SMALL chicken pieces-a thigh and leg.  I guess I'm used to genetically enhanced Foster Farms mutant jumbo chicken legs and thighs so I won't complain too much. Although the sweet tea and cornbread were good, they weren't special, I wouldn't order them again.   The only minor problem I had was with the service. Service was very slow for the 6 people and I in the restaurant. I needed refills of butter and tea and had to wait 15min for someone to come out from the back. Not cool.

LVU0HyS3qGrO8JqNghFzMA.review_text: Opening night was great, the food is...incredible. If you've never had chicken and waffles (like me before last night) you will be doing yourself a huge favor if you have it here for the first time. They get everything right, last night they were serving free sampler platters and even the food that I wouldn't normally get is outstanding. This place is bound to be a homerun.

xtwAxVmK4CVX8AfQntfteg.review_text: The Dish: Obviously got the chicken & waffles. We also ordered the red velvet waffles. All in all, it was just a very average if not below average experience. The candied yum (which typically is favorite) was too chunky, not smooth, and didn't taste all that great. The mac 'n cheese looked hopeful, but didn't taste great at all either. The chicken was better, but again, not the best I've had. It was too greasy and most of the chicken was bone. The Red Velvet is worth a try for sure - where else can you get red velvet waffles? But, note that if you're not sweet on sweets (hah, pun intended), it's not going to be that great. Even for my boyfriend who isn't picky at all, could hardly finish it.  It's also far from bart stations or anything in general so unless you live around the area, it's a hassle to get to. Definitely not sure if I'll ever go back.

7OVHoqFFDLI-mPn0mINZXg.review_text: Located in the heart of the ever so crazy Fillmore, this place is EXACTLY what we needed! We were all craving chicken and waffles, but we were sad that the best places were in LA! Somehow, this little hole in the wall with papers covering the windows, sure brightened our morning!!! Chicken is served a million different ways, there are too many styles of waffles to choose from, the wait staff made us feel like we just walked into a family's kitchen! Everything was amazing! And, they even had a fresh buffet going on! A true gem was finally found in San Francisco! You must try the chicken accompanied with the sweet potato waffles!!! OMG!!!!!!! Heaven never felt so good!

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Vince treated Rufus and I to a delicious breakfast Sunday morning for some pre-Niners game fuel (I've included Smooshy because he got plenty of my left over chicken at the table, lucky boy!). I'm all about fried chicken. I'm all about waffles. And together they're a match made in greasy, doughy, heaven.  The sweet potato waffle was delightful, as was the cornmeal. The chicken, though, was the real winner of the morning...! It was extremely moist and juicy, perfect atop a buttery, syrup-soaked waffle. Every once and a while (read WAY too often) I allow myself to indulge in this way and I never regret it. That's the kind of sh*t you don't say sorry about the next day. You just work extra hard at the gym on Monday while reciting "It was worth it," over and over again.  For all the pooch lovers out there; they have heated outdoor seating. Bring your furry friend along!

LDgIplZS8fGuCEh_0sHAFw.review_text: Food is AMAZING!! Everything is good!!! Makes me miss the SOUTH!

a_uX1c6jrlMC54_y2ZbaXA.review_text: I have no idea how the other food is here but if you only have one vegan food item on the menu, make it a good one or why bother? You don't HAVE to have a vegan food item, you're a chicken and waffle restaurant. I'm just saying that what if someone tries the vegan waffles who's never had vegan food before and they find out how sour, soggy and salty they are and never want anything to do with vegan food again?! We thought maybe the sides would be vegan like the collard greens or black eyed peas but they weren't so we had the waffles. We couldn't even finish them. (insert sad trombone sound effect here) (psst, Sheba Ethiopian down the street saved us! yum!!)

5DFyU3lDIssIzVU2nYdtXg.review_text: Chicken and waffles are great. Gussie's, however, is not. I love chicken and waffles and was excited to discover a new spot in San Francisco.  i went during brunch-time and it was very frustrating. The coffee took 15 minutes, the meal came after close to AN HOUR. The orange juice was sour, and the list goes on. The chicken was just OK, but definitely would have preferred almost anything else, even KFC. The waffles were also on the dry side and cold.  The "sausage" and "home fries" dish was embarrassing. The sausage was a slightly red and burnt hot dog and the potatoes were a mashed mess.   I say definitely don't come here for breakfast, but if you've never tried chicken and waffles, you might give it a chance. I've always heard pretty good things so maybe they were just having an off day. Who knows, maybe I'll give it a second chance.

lTSOYYA8RbW1SB7C7y1piA.review_text: I have to Yelp Gussie's because of two things.  The sweet potato waffles and our waitress.  First, our waitress was fantastic.  She was so funny and so nice.  I felt like we'd been friends for years.  And, she's the one that recommended the sweet potato waffles.  I'm more of a waffle traditionalist and only ordered it because of her recommendation and because I figured I was going to be having fried chicken with it (not a tradition for me), so I should step out of my standard routine.  Wow!  She was so right.  The chicken was great too.  I'm still not sure I get the combo, but it was good.  I went for breakfast, and I'm thinking the combo might work better for me for a late night, after-a-club meal.  They've got a lot of other things on the menu, which sound good too.  But, I'm afraid that when I go back, it will be hard not to go for the sweet potato waffles again.  I guess time will tell.

edVYKDdJzNibDd3b4G9XrA.review_text: Perhaps things will improve with time.  To be fair, we were seated immediately when our entire six person party was complete.  That's where the good service ended.  At this point, we'd met the threshold for an automatic gratuity so I suppose there was little in it for the server.  We waited for ten minutes before being greeted.  At the table, there wasn't a drink menu so we wasted our first long-awaited interaction with the server asking for said drink menu (they were out of three listed beers).  The table then decided that we would make the most of our server's next rare visit and order everything all at once.  I ordered a cup of gumbo ($8.29! a bowl was $10.29) and the grits cakes.  The gumbo was marginal, a mealy mess with stringy chicken and rice with perhaps four small pieces of the purported chicken sausage.  It was described in the menu as being garnished with fried okra, but didn't arrive as such.  The grits cakes were also described as being served with a jalapeno artichoke dipping sauce, but this sauce didn't arrive.  The cakes had nice flavor, but due to their size, they'd be hard to have as an appetizer for more than 3.  I would suggest they make the cakes smaller as to make them more plentiful.  My daughter ordered a chicken sandwich and the server failed to ask her which side she wanted.  He returned minutes later to get her macaroni and cheese selection.  A member of my party ordered the Taste of the South with greens.  It arrived with rice and beans and no warning of such.  Apparently they'd run out of greens (!).  All in all, everyone at the table enjoyed their food.  Another member that actually got waffles said that they were the best she'd ever had.  My daughter ordered the chocolate/coffee/kahlua pound cake.  It was nothing short of amazing.  We came to this selection because they were out of red velvet cake (!)  My thought is that if you're new, you know you'll make your money on the weekends, so I'm unclear as to why they would be out of various items for a big night.  Randomly, despite being out of greens, as we exited the restaurant, the foyer/bar area reeked of the stench of collard greens.  It makes me wonder if the server fibbed on their availability to cover his error in entering the order (there were three Tastes of the South ordered, he probably failed to differentiate the greens order).  We'd heard before that the service was terrible, our experience doesn't dispute that.  The food is perhaps worth it if you're in the area.

HyAwLfPoVU1Ah7VkUyseiQ.review_text: I went here last Friday with a couple of friends and it was almost as bad as my experience at Rosco's Chicken and Waffles.  The waitress was really sweet, but she did not get my order right and I never received my drink but everyone did.  Granted, I have a lot of food allergies, so my drink request was a little harder than the others, but she never came back to say anything.  Finally, I asked and she said the bartender was busy helping her with the tables and she never put my order in.....STRIKE 1.  Next, our food came out and I asked to substitute the potatoes for yams, but my place came with the potatoes on there anyway and NO YAMS or VEGAN CORNBREAD.  She said that my yams were on the way but they never came and she never came back to check on us......STRIKE 2.  Plus, the food was not that good.  I don't know how to cook, and I can do better than that.  Finally, we had to flag the waitress down to get our bill and we let her know about all the issues.  She offered to discount our bill, but I fill like I should not have been charged at all.    Needless to say I will not be going here again.  The only positive thing I have to say is that they had a wonder live jazz band.

3UzVsIOwGAQr6wS6GXW_zw.review_text: I had high hopes for this place.  The anticipation while passing by on the 31 every day on my way home from work was building up for weeks.  Finally! I thought, a fried chicken place, that's open late, that is near my house, that has corn bread as well!!!!!!!!!!!!  I've been there twice so far.  The first time (about a week and a half after their grand opening) was horrible (bad service, our food took FOREVER, and they were out of SO many dishes!), the 2nd time (about a month and a half into their opening) was decent (the food was ok but still took a bit to long).  I plan to go back in a month or so.  Hopefully they would have fixed the kinks that all new restaurants experience!...

ajqkgns5kaRBd_waDctV_g.review_text: Love Gussie's! The chicken and waffles are awesome! Gussie's waffles have nutmeg in them, which make this one of the best places to get chicken and waffles in the bay area. The chicken used to be bigger then the last time I went,but it is flavorful and your tummy will leave happy!

Awy-ujDOZ_rzl100HOXx0w.review_text: This place is going downhill, service wasn't too good. Food was whatever. go find somewhere better..

s_5Bzg2CH9arzlftK7qmVQ.review_text: Truly enjoyed my first meal here and plan to come back at least once a month with my friends and family. I have lived in the Bay Area all my life but i don't come to the city very often but I will make it a point to come enjoy their food again...  The food was great and we all had an awesome breakfast, the restaurant is nice and comfortable, the staff is extremely friendly we had a great time with them.  They make their syrup, we were trying to talk her into bottling it  so we could take some home.  it is soo good! Go try them!!

d9GqbTaONpyCQlfeldsZcg.review_text: It's okay it can be better. But I do like how they have a live dj and the yams are good they're nice and whole. This place can be so much better  if the staff was more high spirited and if the food was made with love. But it's an okay spot if you're craving some soul food

D-rKFBb1s4_4vpDA9Wjiog.review_text: Good chicken, the waffles got cooked a little to early and the wait was horrible, but i blame that on the place being less than a week old.  Since they're open pretty late, and are not crazy expensive, I definetly plan on going back, but i might wait a month or two so they can get the kinks out.

xrmotYcYX-LG6NptSfOKgw.review_text: I was delightfully pleased and will definitely return.  My husband and I have dined at other restaurants who are part of the famous "Roscoes" family and I believe Gussies is the best!  I enjoyed the signature flavors of the sweet potatoe waffles and the Soulgria is absolutely delicious, but will sneak up on you.  My husband really enjoyed having the feeling of a home-cooked meal while eating out.  I'm holding one star back to give the wait staff an opportunity to improve a bit on customer service.  Having been a waitress at one time, I tend to notice things that could use a little more attention, but the service we received was adequate.  Looking forward to my next meal there!

ls-WY3otUdgAjsdwwzXyOw.review_text: Nothing is better than good old southern comfort food to cure a hangover. A friend had highly recommended their chicken and waffles so we decided to give them a try.   The staff here are very friendly and it wasn't busy at all the time that we came. (11am?) I guess she could tell we partied a little too hard the night before because she rushed out with glasses of water.  I ordered the Downtown Chicken, which consisted of their famous waffle and a chicken thigh. I also ordered a side of collard greens and deep fried okra.   The chicken: with their syrup was really good, otherwise, it was a little tough.  The waffle: Mmmmm... i could eat these waffles all day. One waffle is probably enough though. I got pretty full after devouring mine.   The collard greens: They were too bitter for me. I personally like them a little saltier.   Okra: I think this is what got me apart from the waffles. I love okra, and the batter around these little guys was delicious, especially when paired with the remoulade sauce they give you.   My friend got their Mac and Cheese, and I think that one is also a winner.   I wouldn't come back here for the chicken or collard greens but the waffles, okra, and syrup are awesome. The syrup IS thin, but it has some distinct, addictive flavor...I think it's brown sugar or cinnamon, or maybe both. What ever flavor it is, it will have me coming back for more.

s_8y9EUxlOQ_HsV_L5jfWw.review_text: I've been here three times already and my first time was about a month or so ago.  That is how much I like this place!  Great food and great service each and every time.    The fried chicken is great.  The sweet potato waffles are awesome. However, what keeps me coming back is the Gussie's Down Home Chicken Gumbo.  This is a must have!  $2 Tuesdays is a great day to give Gussie's a try if you have yet to try it.  You can't beat $2 chicken wings!  They also have Happy Hour where appetizers are 50% off and draft beers are $2.75.  This is really a great place to satisfy cravings for Southern comfort food!

tUN8uOkMnk1fHWbvi0Nk6g.review_text: Great spot. Not exactly like another Roscoe's, but from the two times I've been there. They remembered what a friend and I ordered. So, their customer service is defintely a plus.

V35nuFCTRIZdru0-WV1MFA.review_text: I ordered up a delicious plate of cornmeal waffles, with two pieces of chicken.  The food tasted great.  The waffles were probably the tastiest waffles I have ever had.  Delicious!  The only issue I had was witht he Diet Coke I ordered.  They opened cans to pour it, but weirdly, the Diet Coke was almost completely flat.  I sent it back, and could see from my table as the waiter opened a new can, poured it, and brought back yet another completely flat Diet Coke.  Totally fixable.  The staff was very friendly.

hQhW5x7P83KwGuagwHIBwA.review_text: Fried chicken breast was ok, but not craveable.  It needed more salt/flavor.  The skin could be less fatty.   Fried chicken thigh was fried way too long.   Sweet potato waffles were good, but the first order came out hard / over-cooked.  The re-order came out great. I wish their waffles were thicker.   The cornbread waffles were yummy.  The biscuit was regular....nothing special.   Butter was good.   Brown sugar syrup was yummy.   The side gravy was a lumpy starchy cold mess.  Very disappointing.   The banana pudding was good,.... but overly sweet.  You just need one for the table.   DO NOT order the peach cobbler ....it was nasty.  It should not be called cobbler.  It tasted like canned peaches in layers of dry biscuit bread.   Gross.   Grits were super lumpy.    Server was slow and inattentive.  I had to ask for refills, etc.   I think they can improve these issues and be much better.

pXeGiGgexdzYoVz-uhObAw.review_text: So sad because I heard great things about this place + am a chicken and waffles newbie so was curious to try their version of this combo. Didn't have the heart to give 1 star.   Got 1/2 a fried chicken with 2 sweet potato waffles & a side of cornbread. If it weren't for a discounted certificate, it would have cost me $24 vs the $12 I paid. Short version: underwhelmed. Did we go on an off night? Certainly not a 4 star experience.   The service was friendly but not smooth.   Fried chicken - Got all white meat & wasn't too dry - only a little dry. Looked good but not crispy & would have preferred more seasoning in the batter. The breasts & wings were good sized at least. Not dwarf sized like KFC.   Sweet potato waffles - Super thin! At first I thought they shorted me 1 waffle because they were so thin. Not like in the photos. Where was the sweet potato? Pureed or cut into microscopic pieces? They were soggy & too thin to be fluffy. I can make much better waffles in my belgian waffle iron at home. Plus for the price, it should include pure maple syrup instead of charging $1 extra for it.   Cornbread - eh, I can make better. Tasted like from a box. No corn kernels in it. Would prefer drier & more corn flavor.   Friend got the peach cobbler. It didn't look edible - pale, goopy, cold & not served with ice cream! Huh? WTH? It was described as being cooked in an iron pan but arrived in a glass bowl. Again, I can make better at home - in fact I spent every day for a week perfecting peach cobbler.   The friend who took me there stated that the food quality is inconsistent. Too bad.

nhxGVZUWNySJTfNVEWZtCQ.review_text: My Groupon was going to expire in the next couple days and I wasn't about to miss out on fried chicken and waffles. I invited a co-worker along and we headed over.  We arrived at 6:50p and saw several open tables. The hostess asked if we had a reservation (we didn't), and then told us that there would be a half hour wait. We both looked back into the dining area. "But it's empty in there." That's right, on second glance, it was maybe a quarter full.  We were told that all of the tables in there were reserved. A couple of girls walked in a few minutes after us and were given the same story. One of them pulled out her phone, went to Open Table, and found a 7p reservation for 2. She booked it, called the hostess back over, and showed her the reservation. Defeated, the hostess seated them. I wish I had thought to check OpenTable!  The chicken and waffles are delicious, but not excitably better than most other places serving chicken and waffles. Go here if you're in the area and craving a chicken and waffle fix, but make sure to get a reservation.

Myjso5BLymk1tPNCanfE-A.review_text: Sunday afternoon at 1:15. Tried to do the waitress a favor by sitting at the bar because she told us it was busy. She came back a few minutes later and asked for our drinks. This simple task took around 10-15 minutes and for awhile we had no idea who was serving us. After pathetically waiving down one of our two-three waitresses we placed an order.  The order took at least 45 minutes. We tried to order an appetizer and it supposively came  with our entrees. It took so long. The waitresses were seemingly retarded or overstimulated because there were some really simple/few demands stemming from our side.   Food? um, ok? I agree nothing very special about the waffle or syrup but when consumed in correct order (with fried chx and eggs) simply cannot go wrong.  The one star is because I did not feel a need to tip. I have worked in several restuarants (local frisco) and would never not tip someone because of poor service; it is supposed to be an understanding. However here I felt completely unnoticed and blatently unimportant (we watched the hostess talked like blah blah for at least 10 minutes!).  In fact, I felt a srtong urge to stand up and leave after a ten minute wait to process and print my check (not including paying for it). Also, some serious stingy behavior with the whole pure maple syrup for an extra dollar. None of those ingredients are expensive and the prices are already steeeep.  The busser (mexican dude) did an awesome job. Fives stars dude  THIS PLACE CLAIMS TO BE A WAFFLE HOUSE IN THE HEART OF THE FILLMORE AND IS A LET DOWN WHEN CONSIDERING THE COUNTLESS TRULY WONDERFUL THINGS SAN FRANCISCO HAS TO OFFER.   YOU ALL SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOUR SELVES

pZDQSy-tMqrl2rOKtAHNbw.review_text: The service level varies depending on the host and server, but when you get a good host, a not-so-stuck-up/over-it server the sweet potato waffles are worth it. So worth it, in fact, that even though my first experience was host-server-awful I came back the next week.  "the chicken is good, but only with the waffle" -Me.

A5sWfulS5Ar7466TY8cZKw.review_text: Good food. Good service. Biscuit was a bit stiff, but the sweet potato waffles are excellent. A little expensive, but the portions are large. We'd come back.

PJPAdYfNIzvhwDrNgofl_w.review_text: I would love to give Gussies 4 stars for the great meals I have had there but they are very inconsistent. It's like they have two shifts of people working there. I might get a fab meal where everything is well prepared or I get uneatable food and half the order is missing and no resolve when calling to rectify the problem. I have not given up on them but they need to do some house cleaning and get rid of the half asses that make there nice restaurant look bad. I'm still rooting for you gussies, I'm hooked to your fried chicken livers and that is saying a lot considering I used to cry as a child when mom made me eat liver.

-miCR-5MWWboUjy-yu7Etg.review_text: Damn good chicken and waffles! The waffle is pretty thin though..I prefer a Belgian style.  Service can be slow even if you are one of the few customers.  Never tried the buffet, but I looked at it and it seemed like a pretty good deal.  Wish they served waffles on buffet, then I might consider.  Be careful driving around for parking, the neighborhood seems a little rough.

XdM2sxztF7JX6DZ6Qk4r9Q.review_text: Three o'clock on a Sunday afternoon and this place was packed. Who knew? Chicken and waffles, long a harlem staple has a popular home in the Fillmore.  The menu is filled with variations of waffles with either fried chicken or chicken wings. I ordered the Country Cornmeal Waffles (A Southern favorite! Two old-fashioned cornmeal waffles prepared light and crispy with two pieces of succulent fried chicken or three crispy fried chicken wings 12.59). There's an option to order real maple syrup (additional dollar) over the regular syrup. (Advice...charge the extra buck and deliver just the maple syrup...much better. ) The chicken was cooked perfectly. The waffles were as fluffy as advertised. Service was good, decor was...well, it was fine. The prices were a bit high for the offering, the chicken was a bit on the small side though the waffles were big. Parking garage right across the street. Not bad.  3.5 stars

BoFtTUqpXocFjHDmO8HWyA.review_text: SO AWESOME!!!  Went here for a friend's birthday and it was amazing!!!  The fried livers were so delicious, and the fried okra and grits rocked. The sweet tea is great, too. Some of my friends who joined me are from the South, and they said this food is very authentic.   -Prices are VERY reasonable and very generous portions. -The fried chicken is excellent; it felt very high quality, the meat was cooked perfectly, and even though it was fried, it didn't taste greasy or heavy. Very yummy & crispy, and perfectly seasoned. -The green beans are SO delicious-- they were so good my friends actually stole most of them off my plate when I wasn't looking. - Mac n' cheese rocked - The waffles were SO, SO good!!  - The fries were excellent. I did find the yams a bit too sweet (but my friends gladly finished them for me). - Corn bread was fantastic  Also: For this birthday dinner, we came as a party of 15, and I was VERY impressed. Nice ambiance and feel to the restaurant. The staff was extremely sweet and accommodating- even though we had more people than we anticipated, they graciously added another end-table to fit in the extra people. We had excellent service and often several waiters would assist our party, check in with us, refill drinks, etc. Our main waitress kept checking in with us to make sure everything was perfect.  Bonus: For my friend's birthday, we brought in her favorite, home-made cake. The waitstaff took the cake in the kitchen, put in candles, presented the cake, and then served it to us with whipped cream and little chocolate syrup swirl designs on the plate--- no extra charge! They were SO sweet!!!!  I don't think I have ever seen such amazing service. It was really refreshing to eat out in SF and have such a attentive and sweet waitstaff.  Definitely try this place-- food is excellent, great bang for your buck, and everyone who works here is really friendly. I will definitely be coming back.

-eEKOlSVCGU2v4aARLSQOQ.review_text: Since my daddy is from North Carolina, I know a thing or two about Southern Food.  They do have some wonderful things on their menu and they know how to do Chicken and waffles.  However, I rate a Southern Food restaurant on how they cook their collard greens.  They do not do it correctly here.  Yes, yes there are different ways to cook things, but I cannot forgive undercooked collard greens...there is no amount of creative license that makes that okay.  If you go here, please stick to the chicken and waffles.

92fgr5mLOMQt6l3PwnT_mA.review_text: Ordered food and it literally never came.... not very happy.

TofKl2M5fJuYjJiJwXoL8A.review_text: This was my first chicken and waffles experience so I really have nothing to compare the place to but overall the place is not bad.  Not having that big an appetite, i ordered the "downtown special" of 1 waffle and dark meat chicken.  The waffle was super yummy!  Homemade and thin served with a big dollop of honey butter and their brown sugar syrup.  Mmm, just describing this for you is making my mouth water for it again!  The fried chicken thighs were nicely battered and browned.  Crispy but maybe fried a bit too long for my taste.  But the batter had a nice taste with just the right amount of spices added to it.  My friend had the sweet potato waffles which were really good...had a nice sweetness to it.  She loved them so much that she finished them off and left most of her chicken on her plate because she was so full from the waffles.  We also ordered deep fried okra as an appetizer, which IMO weren't really tasty.  The batter seemed too thick on some of the okra so you couldn't taste it much.  The pieces that had a thin coating were just fine.  Overall though, once you added some hot sauce to the okra the taste improved.  I'd try this place again if someone wanted to go but I wouldn't go out of my way and make the drive from San Jose just for chicken and waffles.  They do offer a buffet on the 4th Sunday of every month...might try that so I can get a taste of more of their dishes.

q6N-ls6_eWLkp9BpZDxZjg.review_text: Damn.  Want a waitress that'll come by your table chewing on some food while she's taking your drink order? No?  Ok, ok... what about if she's chewing her nails while taking your food order? No? Really?  Oooook... How about... If she tells you "the kitchen lost your order" and asks you to re-place it 20 minutes after you gave it to her to begin with? Damn, that's not appealing to you either? I can't please you.  This one for SURE I know you'll want... What if you're left over an hour waiting for your food, and not attended to, in a pretty empty dining room, with no hostess to complain to as you FINALLY walk out starving and bound for McDonalds? Eh? Eeeeh? Got ya didn't I? No? Oh well...  I know that you're wondering how I gave 3 stars with that shit experience eh? Well I'll tell you... I had been there once before and it was GREAT. We had a competent waiter who wasn't gross or disgusting, he got our order right, and he was fast. Oh, and the food... The food was pretty damn tasty.

rjE_SpqTmW-mrQOSAmGhdQ.review_text: Wow, finally tried this place and it was a major disappointment!   My fried chicken was SO overcooked that I couldn't even cut through parts of it (see pic for proof). It was greasy on the outside and super dry on the inside. The sweet potato waffle tasted good, but it lay sad and limp on the plate. Also, don't order the chicken fried steak. We sat there wondering what it was. There was very little gravy, and most of it had soaked into the soft doughy breading to create an odd mealy surface, yuck!  Positive: the service is very friendly (but slow)!

--4q8EyqThydQm-eKZpS-A.review_text: Yeah buddy! This may be my fave soul food spot in the Bay. The chicken and waffles were hella good and mac n cheese tastes homemade. I wasn't crazy about the greens but with a little gravy and hot sauce, they were good. Good service. Can't wait to come back with my newly copped daily deal coupons :)

6cCeINjgIkCc5taJ8uMR6w.review_text: Been back with a Groupon for lunch.  It wasn't busy and yet the food was still pretty bad.  The fried chicken was just as dry and terrible as before.  They cooked the chicken to the point of almost burned.  Just awful.    The peach cobbler we received last time was outstanding.  Super delicious!  Besides that, bleh.  Won't be back.

l5RRNN-zimH7hfPsawixlQ.review_text: We wanted to get out of our usual East Bay rut for breakfast spots so off we went to Gussie's for Chicken & Waffles. We arrived at 8:25 AM. to find a hand lettered sign on the front door that noted they wouldn't be open until 8:30! The staff immediately came to open the door & greeted us with smiles. Our server, Amanda, was great.... very cordial, but not too chatty (as servers can sometimes be!) Our order took about 15 minutes to show up at our table which was perfect timing to get down a cup of hot coffee. We both ordered the Uptown Special. The chicken breast was still juicy as isn't always the case when white meat is deep-fried. Crispy, hot waffle was just fine smothered in butter & syrup.   The staff genuinely seemed to appreciate that we were there which always wins big points with me. After all, we all have choices so I only go back to establishments where the staff doesn't act like they're doing me a favor! See you again soon for gumbo & grits.....

9Z1bb1l1N5zMK6aZxzqx2A.review_text: One fantastic city morning we ventured to Gussie's Chicken & Waffles. To my delight, we were greeted by Marilyn. Marilyn & I were instant friends! This might seem expected (because I am so loveable) but this women knew just what I needed & she called it like she see's it. I imagine she see's a lot of people like me; bloodshot eyes, drooling at the mouth for food that might absorb the previous nights poison and slightly impatient for a little hair of the dog. She called me out, and then politely explained to myself & the group how they do it as Gussies, where the name came from, the upcoming Food Network events, and most importantly the best item on the menu!   Drinks were served (Mimosa's of course) and food was ordered. I trusted Marilyn and went with the Sweet Potato Waffle with Sweet Potato Syrup and 3 pieces of chicken!!! As we guzzled our mimosa's we were also informed that Queen Gussie was in the house! What a treat, a chance to meet the queen herself! This idea was quickly forgotten as plates of chicken and waffles began to arrive at the table. No need to wait for my dining companies, I went fork first into my orange colored waffle. Sweet potato covered in sweeter potato, I really can't think of any other carb-tastic way to start off my morning. I was kind, and shared my sweet potato syrup with my friends because they were not as wise as me and didn't order as Marilyn directed. I could see the jealously in their tummies and heard the sweetness in their voices when they asked Marilyn for the recipe. I'm pretty sure that once you go sweet potato syrup you never go back.    Just as my stomach was beginning to reach maximum capacity, the Queen exited the building passing our outdoor table. I couldn't resist letting her know just how satisfied I was with her amazing recipes. I gave her a nice shout out & promised I'd be back!!

dI1bia690US9b9SJxur8Pw.review_text: I was extremely disappointed. 10 bucks for a dry, over-fried, dried ochicken breast and a generic waffle left much to be desired. I expected more from a restaurant managed by a competitor on The Taste.

HsItDau8N5Ssreb8zfc2qQ.review_text: Deserved a new review. Our waitress was super sweet and gave us some great service. Had chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy.  Everything was excellent but I have to say the biscuits and gravy were outstanding!   I am going to be craving them all week now

kNXCw1neuD5OZTq4M0wxWA.review_text: I had the Southern Comfort. The chicken thigh and leg were okay. The waffles were okay. The syrup is hot! be careful with the pouring as it is very watery at that temperature..  Nothing too special, but it was good food. Will come back again if I was craving chicken n waffles again.

Bi9pwJu-wpNU_darEkROaQ.review_text: With genuinely warm service inside a homey, comfortable restaurant that uses 70's serenades commonly sampled by hip-hop as its snug soundtrack, this place breathes soul food and Southern comfort.   Snuggled down and tucked in, I had to regain posture when routinely checked in by service that was so nice you had to think twice (like why are you so nice) because my face had the most genuine maple syrup I've ever tasted in my life, with waffles that were the smoothest, most buttery, and such moist texture - I seriously could not stop eating, and unique fried chicken tasting authentic that finished off my thoughts that this place is truly exceptional. Given such the Southern comfort factor, I felt such at home.  It's not just about the food.  You just feel so damn comfy after their savory, chow-down food, their warm, genuine service, and their intimate, dim-lit restaurant and atmosphere that you'll come back for more. My only complaint is I've had dry chicken before.

2H6gAvXrIwMTsXhixfKMrw.review_text: A soul food joint that sells soju...?!?  What the hell is going on here?  Anyways, came here for a late night dinner with a friend and got the Fillmore Special.  Customer service is friendly and didn't mind accommodating us 30 minutes to closing.  Waffle was soft instead of crispy and fried chicken was kinda bland.

hpffQUMlFzNVFddmmx1RUQ.review_text: I always thought that both the fried chicken and the waffles here were equally mediocre, which should certainly spell certain doom for a place with those two foods both in its name. That being said, sometimes you crave grease and sweetness and you need something hearty for breakfast because the night before you passed out after drinking four beers and eating a handful of dry rice krispy treats.  So until yesterday, Gussie's and I always had this relationship where I'd go eat there and kind of enjoy it and kind of not. But two things happened yesterday to make me reconsider my opinion of the place. One, my girlfriend ordered the fried chicken sandwich. The chicken and breading and everything on the sandwich were far superior to the wings I usually get with the Fillmore Special. The sandwich was so god, it had us both comparing it to Bakesale Betty's in the east bay.   Unfortunately, the other thing that happened was that after taking a bite into her salad (by the way, get the salad with ranch and put it on the aforementioned fried chicken sandwich - it's divine), my girlfriend heard a crunch. Not a good, crispy crunchy sound, but a "holy shit, there's a handful of dirt and topsoil in my salad" sound. And, sure as semen, there were several leaves visibly covered in dirt.   I don't know how the ratings for restaurant cleanliness are calculated, but if a place FORGETS TO WASH ITS PRODUCE, then I think nothing more than a C- is warranted.   Yes, we complained, and yes we were perfectly in our right to. We got a 20% off discount, which probably might have been more significant if I hadn't licked her plate clean for the fried chicken sandwich crumbs.   We also ordered an orange juice that never showed up.  So the question is: does a delicious fried chicken sandwich make up for mediocre service and dirt in a salad? I don't know. Not really.

J2CisPyKMZ5pqIGaOEQwaQ.review_text: Happy Happy Joy Joy and sooo stuffed.  The chix was juicy and the waffles just melted in my mouth.  The Mac & cheese was to die for.  The portions were large and the prices very reasonable.

lQwmS-JdFMRaKVpHHgqUvA.review_text: The food is great. BUT, they never have the cole slaw to go with the delicious Chicken Sandwich---don't know what the problem is. We won't going back because the service is getting increasingly slow. We wait a long time to get order taken and even longer to get food, like over 45 minutes. Again, what's the problem? The place is getting more run down looking and the menus are shotty and dirty. They need to be updated for sure. Everyone is so nice and the food tastes good, but we have better luck doing take out. If they improve on service and clean the menus, we'll be back.

2ic8_qN11tczNgMoHlY2kg.review_text: My friends and I were in the neighborhood on a Saturday evening.  We decided to try Gussie's Chicken & Waffles.  It was our first time!  There's outdoor seating, which looked really nice but probably not for the gloomy SF evening.  The decor actually looked quite fancy, but simple.  The waiter was nice.  We ordered three downtown specials: one waffle and your choice of a thigh or drumstick.  I had chosen the thigh thinking that it would be bigger, but the drumstick was actually bigger in our case.  The waffle was big.  There was a slab of butter and syrup available.  It was all so delicious and filling!  My friend was really thirsty after we left though.  Our bill came out to be around $25 (not including tip), which wasn't too bad if you ask me.  I would come back here again one day.

t_oC5ikSdXNkbNYWk_Ef9A.review_text: Service - eh. Took a while for food to come out. But I sure liked my Arnold Palmer.  Food was pretty good. Fried okra hit the spot. Chicken and waffles were pretty good, mine were pretty crispy. Grit cakes I'll pass on next time.  I really liked my waffles. Maybe it was a good day for them.

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: I'm not from the France-icized part of the South, so the whole Cajun / Creole slant is my confuse food, not my comfort food. The unadorned and straightforward Gussie's comes closer to real home cooking from my part of the South than other Bay Area places I've tried, including: Brenda's French Old Skool Home of Chicken and Waffles Boxing Room ...and a few others. @ YOU BETCHAS (You can bet I'll order these anywhere that has them. It's tough to find them all on one menu in the Bay Area, but they're here at Gussie's.) Hushpuppies: Either my third or tied-for-second fave Bay Area hushpuppies so far. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Fried Okra: Ditch the dipping sauce and have it straight-up. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… (Chicken) Livers: A necessary part of Liver Wafflewiches. Necessary in general, too. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Cornbread: Too sweet. It was like yellow cake. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Iced Tea: Lifeblood. Southerners could have a vampire show called "True Tea". photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… @ WAFFLE STUFF Red Velvet Waffles: Possibly why you're here. Not too different than other waffles, though. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Cornmeal Waffles: Dunno on their own; once I put livers in, it was a done deal. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Regular Waffle: Pretty regular. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Liver Wafflewich: Cornbread / okra optional. #secretmenu photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… @ WAFFLE-LESS COMBOS Chicken & Grits: Mine came with a DD breast. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Random Combo: When you just can't decide. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… @ OTHER SIDES Sweet Potato (Waffle) Fries: I'm that guy, you're so fly... photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Chicken Fingers: The least exciting thing we've had here so far. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot… Grits: FINALLY a place lets grits just be grits - no cheese, no shrimp, no ton of butter. photo yelp.com/user_local_phot…

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: My new favorite restaurant.  This time, I had a beer, okra appetizer, mac and cheese, and chicken breast and waffles.  The okra appetizer was good, there's a little too much breading but you can easily remove it.  The mac and cheese, ugh so good.  Probably #2 in San Francisco (#1 being Wolfgang Puck).  I'm usually a dark meat fan, but my friend insisted on getting the white meat.  All and all though, even the chicken breast was really good.  The chicken itself is super moist and the skin is crispy the way chicken should be.  And the waffle, cooked perfectly.  Why I needed to update my review?  Well, our server accidentally forgot to put in our order so we ended up waiting awhile for our food.   Well, guest relations immediately came over, apologized for their mistake and gave us a discount for the inconvenience.  It's really this kind of customer service that makes a good restaurant stand out from a great one.

F7uWUagHgjDlZK8ss2EpDQ.review_text: food was pretty good. had the sweet potato waffles-awesomeness.the sweet and the salt is what makes the chicken and waffles combo work.  but the buffet could have had more "meat" to it literally and figuratively.  Managers were nice but the server could have been better and a little more friendly.

kQu9Vr4LG8vAJ7IPyLxEQg.review_text: So there my friends and I were, post Halloween debauchery and needed to relive the previous night with some brunch.  First thing I saw... $12 bottomless mimosas; DONE AND DONE.  This started the brunch off on a good note, all of us ordered that.  But after about 1 pitcher each of mimosas, we were DRUNK, and therefore HUNGRY.  The food took forever, and we didn't get anything that complicated:  Waffles and Fried Chicken... duh.  I think we were there for about 2.5 hours total... and while we didn't have anything else to do, it killed the mood towards the end.  Maybe I will come back to try some of their other southern comfort foods, but I will be sure to block off a good chunk of time to do so.

Uu2j7a3C9vqNm_7bT7Uw5w.review_text: I liked this place. I went this afternoon for lunch and we were greeted by a hostess with a sweet voice. It's a little dim inside and the tables haven't fully been bused down (we opted for the cleanest looking table).  Aside from the ambiance, I also needed my water to be re-filled which never happened :( There is a pretty extensive lunch buffet; it had everything I wanted except for the waffles so I opted to get the sweet potato waffle with 2 wings. The chicken was also quite good. I would say the seasoning was there--it could have been a little more tender on the inside and crispy on the outside, but it's better to cook thoroughly than to undercook, so no complaints. Everyone else in our party finished their plates so I'm thinking everyone liked it.  While I'm not in a hurry to try Gussie's again since this is decadent Soul Food and I should be watching my health more, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others.   3.5/5 stars

aKndC_HHcLSYuC0Z6EtkXA.review_text: What a treat ! Great atmosphere, reasonable prices, very tasty food.

Kl9-VA0M5YObB7i4IpDkPQ.review_text: This place is ALMOST everthing I look for in a restaurant, minus the underwhelming food.  Great atmosphere--check Friendly and attentive wait staff--check Amazing chicken and waffles---????  In my dining past, I've had a-maz-ing chicken and waffles.  I genuinely wanted to add Gussies to my list of a-maz-ing chicken and waffles, but I just couldn't.  Yes, the chicken was moist and nicely cooked, but I craved something more crispy and juicy.  I felt a bit empty after my chicken was finished, like something was missing from the texture and flavor.  The waffle was soggy and did not come with nice and thick syrup.  Granted the flavor of the waffle was good, but the texture and overall well-done-ness of it was not there.  I had a bite of my friend's mac n chese, and it was good enough for me to regret not ordering it, but it couldn't save the disappointment I felt with the CnWs.  Maybe Gussies was having an off-day in the kitchen.  Maybe I should have ordered my waffle extra crispy with real maple syrup.  Maybe I should have ordered mac 'n cheese with a side of greens.  Maybe this, maybe that.  Bottom line: I just don't know if I'd go back here again for my CnWs fix.

QymOYAEGw57orxKt7QJWqw.review_text: Gussie's Chicken & Waffles in the Fillmore -   Yes, its sometimes Hit & Miss and I've been fortunate enough to have it be more "HIt" than Miss.    I was recently taken to Gussies's for my birthday and all went well for our large party.  I was sufficiently jealous of other plates on the table but totally satisfied with my own plate. plus I had such large portions that I had a take home box.  BTW: an utterly delicious surprise warmed up the next evening, just so beyond yummy that I wanted more.  NOTE: next time, also order a meal to go for leftovers (kinda scary but I'm gonna do it)!!   No doubt that I've heard the horror stories, however, I am trying to cut them some slack in this troubling economy considering location and desire for a local businesses to drum-up & receive local patronage that is sustainable enough to begin to make staffing choices and menu changes as seasons can denote. I'm supporting Gussie's because they're just a "NATURAL" for San Francisco and the NOPA neighborhood.

u2YlsPFHoVNJy0zx32AZbw.review_text: Came here on a Thursday night before a show at The Regency; it's been a while since I've been here so I forgot the golden rule about this place - DON'T BE IN A RUSH. This is not the place where you order and 5 minutes later you got hot food on your table, nope, this place moves at a much SLOWER pace. It doesn't matter if they have one table or a full house, this place will always make you wait.  BUT, the wait it worth it! I ordered the uptown but with a vegan buckwheat waffle (not because I'm vegan but because I'm lactose intolerant), heck yeah! The buckwheat was good! Sure I'd love to have had the sweat potato waffle but I have to play it on the safe side. As for the breast of chicken, holy snap that was darn near perfect! It was juicy but had the deep fried skin we all shouldn't love but do!  How much did I enjoy my meal? After the concert I was disappointed that the place wasn't still open because I wanted to be a fat pig and go for second dinner!

nOTDEZUWv4fmDqd1pRSk_A.review_text: Peanut butter and jelly. Chips and salsa. Eggs and bacon. Grilled cheese sammiches and tomato soup. No, this isn't my lame attempt at playing "The $25,000 Pyramid" against myself. (I grew up watching 80s game show reruns on the USA network, hence the reference.)  These are foods that work oh so well together, and after my meal at Gussie's, undoubtedly chicken and waffles should be part of this list!   Before I get into the food, there are a couple of noteworthy things I wanted to point out about the overall experience. First of all, I was pleasantly surprised to discover that there was absolutely no wait to eat here at 7:30 on a Friday. Score! (These days, I feel like the minimum 30-minute wait is an obligatory part of the SF dining experience.) I also very much appreciated the service - everyone was very friendly, and our waiter in particular was all about the details. For example, when my husband accidentally dropped his knife, our trusty waiter noticed that and brought over a clean knife with fresh napkins without our even needing to ask for one. When we ordered coffee to go with our dessert, he apologized for the short wait for the coffee but mentioned it was because he started a fresh pot since the one that was ready had been sitting out for a while. This level of attentiveness was yet another pleasant surprise...something we didn't expect at a "roll up your sleeves and dig in" type of place.  And now for the moment of truth: the food. I very much enjoyed both the chicken and waffles. The waffles had a nice almond-esque flavor and were the right level of crisp. (I've had my share of soggy waffles before, which = no bueno.) The chicken, though tasty, wasn't the same level as the revered Gus' in Memphis or Willie Mae's in New Orleans. The batter had a good flavor to it, but where I feel the chicken slighty missed the mark was the texture. It wasn't as moist as it could have been and the batter felt a bit heavy (though not terribly so).   However, the one menu item that blew my mind was the mac n cheese. My husband and I both agreed that this was probably the best mac n cheese we've ever had, and we're both certified mac n cheese-ologists. The cheese had formed this delicious crust around some of the noodles, and in other parts of the dish, it was smooth and creamy. Overall, it tasted like it had been pan-fried first and then baked. But no matter how it was cooked, it was pure heaven! The turnip greens and the peach cobbler skillet were also good, but the standout was really the mac n cheese.  Just as I have made my fried chicken pilgrimages in New Orleans and Memphis, I'm similarly going to have to do one for chicken and waffles and try the one and only Roscoe's in L.A., but I'm glad to have gotten my start with this new fab food pairing at Gussie's!

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: A solid 3. Tasty food, i had the chicken and waffles. Definitely want to come back for the desserts and hopefully next time they will have their liquor license.

zg41KpiWCb3YsbmZZtvF8Q.review_text: Very good fried chicken.....  serving size is excellent, price is very affordable for a resto in San Francisco,  and if you are craving for waffle and chicken I suggest to come visit Gussie's they are awesome, love their waffle, syrup is served hot, chicken wings are so crispy and juicy, no red blood inside when you cut it open.  Ambience is good, it's also good for dinner.

ox8RA6UGlrIEmiHWTNUnyw.review_text: This place is aight..... My girl makes better chicken and the waffle are tasty but need to be more krispy!

su8EWjIuqXs9lfuLWdEqNg.review_text: I ended up checking out Gussie's when my sorority convention was in SF.  The three of us ended up each ordering the brunch buffet which was a WIN! The buffet included: cabbage (not over cooked and well-seasoned), mac and cheese (yummy), fried and jerk chicken.    As if the buffet wasn't enough.. we ordered a side of a red-velvet pancake complete with whipped cream frosting and nuts to share and greens.  Both were mouth-watering and worth ordering!    Overall a really good experience. The sangria left a little to be desired but I can't wait to return!

Pd6LXnvQx5p8ZXlRf_D2wA.review_text: This place deserves more stars that it has. This was the second time I have been here and service and food was as amazing as the last time I've been here.   The staff are always super friendly and are quick to refill drinks, and they have quite a sense of humor.   Forgive me but I forgot what I ordered. But it basically consisted of red beans and rice, Mac and cheese, a waffle with butter on top and a big piece of chicken breast. The red beans and rice were PERFECT. Such a simple meal can taste so damn good. The Mac and cheese, I don't know what they put in it but it's so delicious! It's cheesy in all the right ways and the macaroni shells aren't over or undercooked. The chicken was fried to perfection. The skin was just the right amount of crispy and the meat super moist inside- YUM. The syrup that comes with the waffle is warm and adds a more home-y feeling to it. Like having breakfast with family on a Saturday morning. The waffle, the salty butter and sweet, warm syrup all compliment each other so well!  I will be coming back here more often. Love this place a lot! I highly recommend this place to everyone :)

8lmIvTJ3mToz2qrvu8N1sw.review_text: If there was an option for 0 stars this place would get it.  I ordered delivery through grub hub (whom were wonderful trying to troubleshoot the problem).  I paid $80 in cash and regret paying in cash.  I went through the delivery and discovered that there were two items missing.  I called grub hub and Alex was wonderful.  He called the restaurant and had it set so that the items would be delivered.  Cut to 1 hour later the items were NOT delivered yet.  I called back and Beth, also wonderful, attempted to get in touch with the restaurant.  When she called back she let me know that she was unable to get in touch with them and that she would follow up with them in the morning.  So what is the moral of the story????  Gussies Chicken and Waffles feel as though it is ok to short their customers and steal from them.  Is that harsh...perhaps but I am unsure of what to call it when you pay for items that you do not receive.  So yes they stole CASH from me.  Not only will I never order from them again but I will repost this review once a week until everyone in San Francisco reads what kind of business practices this restaurant has.

k_0zNmr6Tr_juw69f6JXDg.review_text: Started off with their Sangria, which I had never had. It was delicious! The grits were perfect, just the way I like them. My pork chops were amazing. Batter was scrumptious and the yams were sweet to perfection! On top of the food being delicious my server was a 10!

Yf-KBTWH0LxWr7YPfo7RIw.review_text: If you like sweet potato waffles with fried chicken wings this is the place to go. The price was $13.99, a fantastic value for a huge portion of waffles with large and meaty chicken wings. We also ordered the breakfast special, which included nummy bacon and grits. I found this place through Groupons, and this saved me $8. The BEST service we've ever experienced. The odd thing is that Mon. thru Thurs. They didn't open until 11 AM, so check the hours before showing up. We were asleep in the doorway when they opened.

akdUN1LwfMULFUl2VL0rGg.review_text: Gussie's service is going down....  Seems like the morale has significantly decreased.  I'm visiting Brenda's Soul Food Restaurant, when visiting The City.

8tVs6_heND17zXelvOQrTw.review_text: Yum! Savory and Sweet! Collards were not my favorite, but overall - nice service and good chicken/waffles!

MF-WgJHyaKF3avhbQ5Uaqw.review_text: Food was great!  My husband and I has been coming here a lot so we tried pretty much everything from the menu and we can honestly say that we were NOT disappointed.

OY32TwbyMP1z6MIyirm0Yw.review_text: I had really big hopes for this...unfortunately it let me down.  The chicken was okay, the waffles weren't anything special,  and what's up with serving "fake" syrup?  Is it really that expensive to provide maple without a $1 upcharge?  They are trying though, the servers were very nice.  Although, the host & hostess act a bit aloof.  What for?  No need to be snooty or cold.  The grits app was dry, the corn muffins a bit dense too...sorry guys I'm not going to be back.  Did I mention that it was overpriced too?  Booooooooooo.

BevYtvKWEqEvbH0WrkQIvw.review_text: My cousin gifted me a groupon for $20, so I brought a friend with me.  We each got chicken and waffles; I got the fried chicken breast, and it was huge and juicy. I also got the sweet potato waffles. Delicious. It came with sweet potato syrup. Also dope.  We ordered three sides, but our server suggested we order another because they are 4 for $10. So we did: Baked mac n cheese - so good! Shoulda got two! Collard greens - a little bitter, but better with waffle syrup! Southern corn - surprisingly delicious and refreshing And red beans n rice - classic.  Overall, about $20-25 per person, but worth it. Better than Roscoe's.

M2TYlXC-glvLa_tZRAcSZg.review_text: This place was freakin delicious! Dont take my word for it? Well I went with a friend who is a transplant  from NOLA and he agreed! Food was great with very generous portions. So much so that I ate everything and saved the chicken cause I thought it would hold up the best as a left over. OMG its sooooooo good. I love the spicy syrup and the sweet potatoes. The combo of sweet and spice is perfect and leaves you trying to figure out how they get it to be so good. Didnt have the waffles but the cornbread was good as well as the mac and cheese. Service was great, we didnt have to wait for seating and felt well taken care of but the waiter. There was also a live band which made conversation a bit difficult but still was a nice change of pace from the usual SF fair. So glad I found this place.

BRoArFY14sGGIT0d6-KgBQ.review_text: Good overall lunch experience!  Four of us ate lunch here. I had the lunch special for $7.49, which consisted of 2 fried chicken thighs (nice size, a bit too crispy for me, but the meat was juicy) ... a side of red beans and rice (very tasty, had strips of pork in it) ... cornbread (best I have ever eaten). A delicious, filling lunch for the money.  One of my friend's had a grilled chicken sandwich. The breast was a extremely generous.  My other friend, who introduced this place to us, had sweet potato pancakes. They looked real good...nice and golden brown.  The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but for lunch hour I would go again and try something new. I like their Southern menu. They serve breakfast all day -- so this is something I will try next time. The decor is modern, with jazz music playing in the background.

KWnGQSp3xUJTJZRiLwuc9g.review_text: Gussie's is my kind of soul food. The waffle, syrup and chicken combo is delicious, especially with the smooth sounds of funk, soul and 80's jams playing in the restaurant.  I've never been there on a Friday when there's a DJ playing, but every time I've seen it they're always poppin'.

-9SYlt1DzZ9SbREGu4VPVg.review_text: fried chicken is good!  server not too attentive!  Overall, the food are better than Hard Knox cafe!

6jnME-iyq4MXoVcjfU06vg.review_text: Overall, the sides and appetizers were great, the portions generous, and the service super friendly. Would recommend if in the neighborhood and would probably return.  Fried Chicken= a bit on the dry side, not impressed. Waffles= tasty but not crispy if you like them that way. Syrup amazing! Sweet potatoe (they spell it like Dan Quail does) tots= MUST try!! fried chicken liver w/onion rings= great to share with a group black eyed peas and greens=great! My bf said the pork chops were good but a bit overcooked and the gravy was great. Banana pudding= very good! rich and the Nilla wafers were still crisp.  Just got home from a dinner for 7 on a Saturday night. We had a reservation so no problem waiting for a table. The waitress, (Maria I think) was very sweet and pretty attentive.  The dinners are huge and almost nobody cleared their plates. Our 3 appetizers were great,  Fried chicken liver and onion rings, the sweet potato tater tots, and the cat fish nuggets were yummy but probably the least favorite of the 3. My friend observed the the deep fried stuff felt "light" I ordered Uptown, 1 piece of chicken and 1 waffle. The waffle was tasty and the syrup was delicious but they were barely browned and more chewy then I like. I ordered a thigh but got a leg. The bus guy said he would bring me a thigh (and handed me the plate including the leg) but never came back with it. I wouldn't have made a big deal but the drumstick was overcooked and dry. Eventually we asked the waitress and she did bring out a thigh but by the time it arrived, everyone else had finished their meals.  we split the bill 6 ways for 7 people and each paid about $33 which included tip and a few beers and "Soulgria".

nmOmKgzS1eahZgtHZPDUjw.review_text: 1 Star is for the Friendly & Attentive Servers and butter on the waffle.  I was really psyched to try this place but was deeply disappointed in the outcome of my visit. So I ordered Chicken & Waffle's and a side "ala carte" (as stated on the menu) of rice and gravy.  Here's my assessment:  *Chicken was really dry (granted it was breast piece) but the dish is attached to the establishment name one would expect it to be good. *Flavor was ok, nothing out of the ordinary *Side/Ala cart order of Rice & Gravy was putrid, lets just say for $3.99 I got 4oz of rice & gravy in a tiny sauce dish.  In disbelief I kindly asked the server if this little thing was the "side order" and he said "yes". So I asked him if I could ask for more gravy because that thing I kid you not had about 2 tablespoon of gravy. He quickly and gladly gave me some :) Which I really appreciated because this help salvage the dry chicken.  *Tax & Tip included I paid $18 for a disappointing meal.   I would give it another try though, because I believe it takes a few tries.

MWuPitr2L7gDUhqRB4i4IA.review_text: Sooo, I just went here for brunch yesterday and there were some really great items on their menu.  I tried a few of the hearty dishes:  Mac'n'cheese... Sharp Cheddar is the secret and they have it down Fried Catfish... Not fishy, flakey, and had a nice crispy cornbread coating The service... The girls were super friendly and attentive The Fried Chix... Very flavorful and crispy Hot Sauce... Finally a soul food restaurant with Crystal.  :) The Mimosas... Very strong, I caught a little buzz of the first one! :)  Things that could have been better: The Gumbo... It was missing, well something... I did like that they topped it with fried okra though The Red Beans and Rice... In my opinion, could have been a bit smokier with more Ham The Greens... In my opinion, could have had a bit more spicy, and cooked a little longer.  All in all, good food, good service, and I heard their Lunch Buffet is amazing!  :)  I would give them 3 1/2 stars.

y_sVbJ1gUa7En0a91Hhf-A.review_text: We have good news and bad news.  The good news is that the chicken and waffles are fantastic.  The waffles are the best I've ever had.  And the chicken was done just right, crispy and tender, but not so hot that you can't taste it.  Nice cool atmosphere, too, and the staff is professional.  This must be what you get when you cross San Francisco with Birmingham.  The bad news is this:  I still can't figure out what's so great about putting chicken and waffles into the same meal.  IMHO, they do NOT taste good together.  Maybe chicken and waffles, like beer, is an acquired taste.  It's not that I'll avoid the place now.  But if we go again, I'll have either the chicken, or the waffles, but not both.

g3suHxtH49EZc5McdMhInQ.review_text: Hey y'all. Lookin' for some good southern cookin'? As far as chicken and waffles go, Gussie's is the real deal. I've been passing by this joint for years while riding the 31. I finally got the chance to try this after my buddy Michelle found an awesome Groupon deal: $10 for $20 worth of food.  We met here for lunch on a Wednesday at 1-- just in time for their $12 weekday lunch buffet [Tuesday to Friday, 11-3]. The waitress was nice enough to let us browse the buffet before deciding if we wanted to get it. It consisted of chicken, veggies, and mac & cheese. We decided we wanted the full authentic experience so we ordered the Uptown Special for about $10: one chicken breast and one waffle. We also ordered sides of cornbread [$1 for three squares] and mac & cheese [less than $3].   The food was finger lickin' yummy and the portions were ample, but my only complaint was the super slow service. At one point, my friend and I were the only ones left in the restaurant yet it took forever just to get our order taken and to get coffee refills.   My recommendation: Stop by here for a relaxed meal with a friend, but choose a day when you're not in a rush.

G96eAh4n0ksknavhExYr6A.review_text: So i love Gussies the service that day was great and the food was the bomb.  the only problem i had was one of there hostess /servers had on old tear up jeans and a regular shirt while everyone else wore the restaurant shirt.  i would love to go back to gussies one day and try everything else on the menu.

hX_FpZwL95a9RwnZe8G-cA.review_text: This place is AMAZING...  I had never tried "chicken n' waffles" before but during class my friend saw a picture on someone's face book of a huge waffle with chicken wings and said to me .. "WERE GOING HERE!"  It took us a good 20 min to decide what to get because everything looked so good. I opted for the "Up-Town Special" and my friend for the "Fillmore Classic" w/ sweet potato waffle. Both were amazing.. and they have the best Mac 'n Cheese.  Service was great and they were all very friendly in suggesting this they like best from the menu.  Anyone who has not done the "chicken n' waffle" thing is missing out.. Gussie's is the place to be!

N5gDtRPD197lzhmjFgxMNQ.review_text: The soul food here is yummy. I have had the ice tea, smothered chicken, macaroni and cheese, yams and waffles. All items were very good. I did not have any problems with the service. I know people that visit this place a couple times a month after church on Sundays and never have any problems with the service.

zZha2AcC31exjvxun055PA.review_text: +1 for friendly consistent service +1 for yummy mac and cheese and red bean rice  +1 for DELICIOUS FLUFFY WAFFLES  I know some people don't like the waffles here and usually i don't like eating waffles -- but here -- I like. Why? the waffles are light and fluffy and when you dress it with the light maple syrup -- it's not too sweet, corn syrupy and heavy like a lot of american places.   The chicken is nothing to rave about, but the portions were huge. Don't forget to add the hot sauce!  The collard greens were BLEH. Had a funny after taste.  The mac and cheese was good -- perfectly cheesed.   The red bean rice was delicious and was a good buffer for the chicken.  Call me a fat ass, but yes I got all of these ... i wanted to try everything =) It was a perfect meal for a post drunken night out on the town. -- Might hurt the wallet a little especially if you were spending the night before.   In sum, it was good, but not as good as roscoes in LA.

DBHgOQVokQ4LmQGlI1H8lw.review_text: Yuck..  I wish I wouldn't have read all of the past rave reviews for this place because it made me even more disappointed once I ate there.
