Reasons: 1) Extremely oily chicken, so oily that it saturates inside the actual chicken itself leaving a taste that reminds me of the cafeteria food chicken I ate in jr. high. 2)No crispy skin on the chicken. WTH? just oil soaked chicken skin that slid off the meat once I cut into it. 3)The waffles tasted like frozen waffles. The food that I ate looked NOTHING like the photos that are posted here. :-/ I ordered banana pecan waffles and these mother fuckers first brought me the frozen waffle and then came out with a tiny plate of chopped bananas and pecans. Am I wrong for thinking that the f'kn bananas and pecans would be cooked INSIDE the waffle?  4) Hard.ass.biscuits.

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: Came here because of a Groupon special that they had, 50% off. The place is hard to find parking around. The restaurant itself is fairly clean. The place was fairly empty around 8pm when we arrived. The place didn't really start getting busy till close to 10pm.  The prices for what one is getting is really high. Plates average around $10+. The portions are very small. The chicken itself had no special flavor or seasonings. I had the sweet potato pancake which was nice. The cornbread was again nothing.   We should had gotten the $10 Friday Buffet, since we were there on a Friday anyhow.

3ydG8dwXw2gytUkqEHR6Tw.review_text: A classmate from City College recommended Gussies. Tyrone said that I should try the chicken and waffles and the cat fish.   I do not know Southern cooking, as I have not had many opportunities to try it. The few times I have tried Southern food it has been Cajun style.  The fried chicken and gumbo at Gussie's is delicious!   For me, the chicken and the way it was prepared and cooked was far superior. Much more so than anything Colonial Sanders cooks up with 11 herbs and spices.   Speaking of herbs and spices, oh! The flavor! Outstanding. I enjoyed everything, the gumbo, the potato salad, but especially the fried chicken.   Gussies has take out. You call in advance and place an order. Credit cards are accepted.

0i_B5OU--tDXfYeLj-Aujg.review_text: So have you ever been really excited about a place and took your family or friends and they werent impressed? Well thats my experience..Im on the fence about this place. I've been here twice, both times a while ago. I really liked my food, I've been on a mission to find good chicken and waffles since The Bay does not have a Roscoes. I actually really liked the chicken and waffles here. The chicken was really good and the waffle had a unique flavor. My family however was not so into it. My sister, a fellow yelper who shall remain nameless, is very picky, was not feelin it at all. She got chicken and waffles the first time and snapper the second. She said it was just okay and thought the service was bad.  Both times the service was lack luster. The waiter/waitress seemed unattentive or just out of it. So that really made us unsatisfied. If I wanted to come back my fam would NOT accompany me. If they can get their service in order this place would be highly recommended.

JgSMZ6MUZGf38cSBajknww.review_text: Wow, I should have gotten the hint when we came there and they closed early, number one bad sign of a restaurant not worth going to. God was trying to tell us that it wasn't meant to be, well me being stubborn, and wanting to try out gussie's, made me want it more. Chicken and waffles; I love. I was hoping to say eat your heart out rosco's but gussie's made it just disappointing. The catfish appetizer was the only thing good, and the service was hectic. I get it, soft opening, but seriously this restaurant isn't brand new, they just redid the old fried chicken place. Which I must admit had better fried chicken than this place. I feel like if you are going to have this be known for their fried chicken, please have it be AMAZING. and it wasn't it was dry, and the waffles were chewy. Yes a chewy waffle, not crunchy like it's suppose to be when you go to a chicken and waffles place.  I guess you can say that I am defintely a chicken snob because I love it so much, and if kfc has better fried chicken, no I mean safeway has better fried chicken for a quarter of the cost, then I think it is pretty shitty to charge almost 10 bucks for chicken and waffles

f8XpY3E02ANVBKn1PIRGVQ.review_text: Ok, so it's hard to rate them a star because the food tastes pretty good but their delivery service is complete crap.  Every time that I have ordered from them, some items were missing.  The worst is that through their ordering system, everything has to be done online so you can't speak to anyone.  Also, the orders are always cold.  So definitely do not order delivery food from there as you will not get what you paid for!  What a scam!

IhCAVnWWnwDjyrJyPpiBPg.review_text: Great addition to the area.  I ordered the Downtown Special, which came with 2 fried chicken drumsticks & one original waffle (7.79, not bad!) The chicken was tasssty & the waffle was amaaazing, it was cinnamony-ish can't properly explain :) but it was off the hook! Also, ordered a side of Mac n Cheese & a cornbread, the Mac was cheesy & just right, but they could've served it in a bigger plate LOL just sayin'.  The cornbread was a pretty big slice & ended my meal off just right.  Customer service was OK, we were seated immediately, got our order, but the time to get the check seemed like the longest since I damn near swallowed my food in 10 minutes.   Yummy place! Gotta try their desserts next time, they all sound sooo good!

k9RolU7Bt9LyKvMZ0hzjLw.review_text: Okay, I'm ready to admit it - I'm officially obsessed with this place.   Not only did I eat there twice (that's TWO times) this past weekend, but I can't stop talking about it to friends & family. So I suppose I should just let it all out here.   First off, I am one of those silly vegans you hate, though my friends and boyfriend are both meat-fans. It is rare that we all find a place to enjoy, whole-heartedly. But I believe Gussie's may be the perfect spot.   The first visit I ordered the vegan buckwheat waffles with EarthBalance and syrup. I've been dreaming of waffles since the day I left the dairy world, and am so glad to be back in the club. These thick and fluffy squares were delicious, filling and priced right.   On my next visit I went with the Vegetarian Plate - which can be deceiving - I checked, and everything on the dish is not only veggie, but also vegan. Let me start with this item by saying I couldn't finish half of this. Literally, I was stuffed before I'd hit the halfway point. The meal consists of spicy potatoes, cornbread, black-eyed peas, beans & rice, and collared greens. Its a bit more price-wise - $10ish - but can very easily be split by two.   To top it off, the whole staff is super friendly, there's booze for sale and the meat-eaters in my life say the chicken is moist & tasty.   Oh Gussie's, I'm in love!

cNqpVwQu8bB6sqTua8Wd5w.review_text: After trying Roscoe's down in LA, my best friend and I were on a hunt to find some good chicken and waffles in San Francisco.  We had this right after running the Bay to Breakers, and it definitely filled our stomachs right after a long intoxicated run. I ordered the downtown special (chicken thigh and waffle) with a side of honey cornbread. The side of honey cornbread soon became 2 because it was too delicious for words..I wish I could buy a whole basket of those. The biscuits were pretty bland, so I had to drench it in butter and honey. They were very soft and flaky though so i still enjoyed it. The hot sauce was sweet, and the syrup was on the more cinnamony side...not sure if I was a big fan of that, but I was so hungry I didn't care. Everything tasted good at that point.  Next time...sweet potato waffles!

eSl3Ov4b6VQm6Ju60-vPuw.review_text: I really love their chicken and waffles, but they really need to work on their service, or lack of. I've been coming to the place for a while and it has always lacked. Just some attention to the customer would be nice. ie, take customers order within 5 mins and check in with them once in a while. This is the only place I know where the service staff hides in the back from the customers they need to serve.

p05BaSFza5U8MRUXAciB2Q.review_text: Finally made it back for a second time and this time was please with the results.  The waffles, which were a disappointment the first time for me, came out just right, although I think I prefer a little lighter and crispier dough.  It tasted like a waffle should taste.  The fried chicken was just as good as before, but my only mistake was not ordering all dark for my order, a personal preference.  As a side, I opted for some red beans and rice.  I don't know which way is more authentic, smashed or whole red beans, but the flavors of the dish were great.  T got a side of grits, which she and J loved.  Service was OK, being that it seemed like there was only one waiter working the floor.  Food came out superfast, which again surprised me.  They have also added patio dining out front, which is a nice little touch.  All in all, Gussie's is a great place for southern cooking and worth a try if you're in the mood for Chicken and Waffles.

vIyq_ZHtGZT1Qx98UsgiKw.review_text: One soggy waffle and one itsy bitsy chicken for around $8.00.  Waffe was soggy but the maple syrup was good.  Little chicken thigh was crispy and moist but I was very thirsty afterwards.  Really I think if anyone wants soul food and plenty of it for the price one can not beat Hard Knox.  Sorry Gussie.

8Aq_UdlsrjhBwGWb_U-xRA.review_text: Gussie's Chicken & Waffles might be located in the heart of the old Fillmore jazz district, but my recent dinner here gave me the blues.  If you run a restaurant that specializes in chicken and your kitchen staff can't tell the difference between a chicken thigh and a chicken breast you've got problems. That basically sums up my dinner experience here.  It's 6 PM on a Wednesday night, and the place isn't busy at all.  There were a maximum of four tables occupied when I was seated.  The waitress and server, Amanda, greeted me and asked to take my drink order right away.  She returned right away with my drink in hand and asked if I was ready to order.  Since the name of the restaurant clearly states "Chicken & Waffles" that's what I wanted.  I ordered the quarter chicken and two waffles and asked the waitress for the quarter dark option printed on the menu.  For a dollar more I asked for the real maple syrup. The server was excellent.  After a bit of a wait (maybe 12 minutes) she walked over to my table to let me know that my order was next in line and I would be getting my food soon.  I wasn't in much of a hurry really, but I was definitely hungry having skipped lunch on an unusually busy work day.   My food (static4.px.yelp.com/bpho…) arrived a few minutes later, and it smelled fabulous.  The waffles look like frozen Eggo waffles and its color immediately told me that these wouldn't be crispy as it had not even reached a golden brown color yet when it was pulled out of the waffle iron.  Unlike Eggo waffles though Gussie's recipe is very chewy.  To make things worse the knife I was given was very dull, and instead of easily cutting through the waffles my knife was simply gnawing through it and tearing it apart.  Although I didn't particularly like the chewy texture I thought the waffle tasted good. I still hadn't noticed the wrong chicken piece when I picked up the chicken leg and took a bite.  The chicken leg was nice and moist and the flavor was good.  I liked that the batter was very thin and the chicken didn't seem to be oily.  I'd bet I would have liked the chicken thigh just as much, but I never got one.   The waitress reacted by saying something similar to "that certainly looks like a breast".  I assured the waitress it was okay since I really didn't want to sit there and have to go through another long wait just for another piece of chicken.  The chicken breast (static1.px.yelp.com/bpho…) was very disappointing.  Although it had the same tasty batter on the outside the chicken meat inside was extremely overcooked and very dry.  Taking gulps of liquid with each bite couldn't save this piece of chicken.  It was that bad.  I didn't even finish the chicken, and I hate wasting food! Although I'd like to return and hope for a better experience I'll probably wait awhile before doing so.  I would have gladly given Gussie's three big stars but to screw up my order and give me a super dry piece of meat loses a star.  For a dinner costing over $17 I could have had a lot better.

08kuNTVgJ1UUZF7QziNSLw.review_text: The best chicken and waffles restaurant in SF. $12 lunchtime all you can eat buffet. Did you hear that? ALL YOU CAN EAT CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. Good prices too. Less than Hard Knox and the food is better than Hard Knox in my opinion. Hard Knox macaroni and cheese  is pretty good though, so that is a toss up.    And, if you are not in the mood for chicken and waffles, they have chicken gumbo that is so good that even when I wasn't hungry and feeling sick, I took a bite and came back to life! Ate that whole bowl. Don't miss out.

uDYNXKTd_cixNNfsyWg57Q.review_text: The first thing I heard when I walked in was the DJ playing "Alright"' by Janet Jackson.  I knew right away that I would like this place.  The food was just as good as Roscoe's.  Unfortunately, we noticed the buffet after we ordered our meals so it's safe to say that we'll be back....

SQIl43bNVRme0dvCFL7T4A.review_text: I went here on a very uncrowded day with a group of 20 of us.  It was my first time trying chicken and waffles at a chicken and waffle joint.  Anyways I guess we went on a great night because everything was on point.  Service - was perfect.  Food- warm, on time, perfect, great.  I had a mixture of everything and I would say I enjoyed everything on the menu.  Especially the red velvet waffles.  A few of the friends there have had roscoes and said it was better than Roscoes.  All in All a good experience

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pic)  More of 3.3 stars.  The seasoning of the skin was great with garlic but the meat was on the drier side. Maybe next time I will try the drumstick or wings instead.  The waffle was quite delicious but you have to pay extra $1 for pure maple syrup.  Saw a sign of $2 Tuesday (2 fried chicken wings / Soju & Sake shots / pint of beer.) Wonder if there's a limit of how many you can order.  The great thing about this place is it opens all day, perfect for a late afternoon brunch. They also have a good varied selection. Will have to come back to try other items.  This place is comfort and exciting at the same time with warm service.

CsuGVxHZYe0w7v6ZrAUwUg.review_text: A friend and I have been waiting until they worked the kinks out before trying this place. So we went for lunch today. Overall, it was 'meh'.  My friend and I both ordered 1/2 chicken with grits. In contrast to many of the reviews here, our food arrived in ~10 minutes. Things were looking up...until I see the plates the waiter is about to place in front of us.  I told the waiter, "Those aren't ours.  We didn't order waffles.  Ours is chicken with grits.". The waiter replied ,"It all comes with waffles.  I thought you wanted a side of grits.". He went back into the kitchen and brought back one tiny bowl of grits. I was unclear on the concept -- were we supposed to share this little bowl?  Eventually he brought another teeny bowl of grits after I asked him about it.   As soon as the confusion with the order happened, I asked to see the menu to clear up the confusion. I showed the waiter that what we ordered WAS chicken AND grits NOT waffles. His response was "Ooooh. I thought you wanted this 1/2 order of chicken that comes with waffles. "  Can you say more training of the wait staff needed?  Learn your menu!  I like the chicken, except for the piece that was bone dry and stringy. Blech. The grits were OK. The accidental waffles were blah -- waffles should be a little crispy.  The dining experience did not measure up to the cost of the food. I won't be back for a long time.

1rDkwRI4MHsQBJ5ONmCsIQ.review_text: its good and its  bad.  ordered the the "downtown" but waiter said they ran out of dark meat. WTF? how can a CHICKEN and waffle place run out of CHICKEN? ok so give us the "uptown".  ordered rootbeer...OUT OF rootbeer? again WTF? place was dirty when i left i almost fell on some spilled milk that no one cleaned up.  I gota say though that the chicken i did eat was NOT GOOD.  i'm going to be honest about the SWEET POTATOE waffles and the home made syrup.... it tasted AMAZING!! but  im definatly NEVER going back!

hlsbWpD1qCSkPrjncxvoYg.review_text: I was showing a friend this yelp site and was shocked to see that gussie's only had three and a half stars. All the people leaving negative reviews are tripppppppin....   I've been here twice, got the chicken and waffles each time, been with friends who got other things and were more than satisfied. I lived in LA for 4 years and loved Roscoe's while I was down there, but I will say that I think Gussie's trumps Roscoe's just by a little bit. The chicken here is slightly more tender/less dry in the middle... also their syrup is ammmmmaaaazing. it just has a slight butterscotch taste to it that makes the waffle so damn delicious   The service has been great - no complaints. Be courteous to them, they will be courteous to you. I came in the middle of the day on both occasions and it was not crowded. Got seated and served in a reasonable time frame. The first time I was there, Billie Jean came on and I kid you not.. every single table started singing and rockin to it.... good crowd.   anyway, just leaving this review to offset the negative reviews cuz this place is the bomb.

YYR4WrO2ijr9WRsaWIoZNQ.review_text: On a whim, wanted to give this place a try - was very pleasantly surprised - started with a wonderfully spiced shrimp/corn chowder with andouille sausage...was very, very good start to meal. Then moved on to 1/2 Southern Fried chicken with cheddar cheese grits and sweet tea - chicken was delicious - moist on inside, crispy on outside with a nice coating.  Cheesy grits were also quite good - and accompanied all this with one side waffle - which was also great...nice balance to the savory part of the meal!!!

5NCKuC2ESkDQIsy1gc-dlg.review_text: OMG... the wait is worth it- I PROMISE! The waffles are simply amazing. My fiance tried the bourbon chicken sammie and loved every minute of it. I know it takes a long time to eat but they make up for the corn bread at the beginning. Try it and thank me later. The corn bread MELTS in your mouth :X

9UpANgtN6vhUPoY1rSBnMg.review_text: I have to start by admitting that I'm a chicken and waffles virgin.  I love both fried chicken and waffles, so I was excited to try Gussie's. I happened to be nearby after a work meeting on Tuesday, so I dropped in for lunch.  My waiter and bus-person were both very friendly and competent.  The bus-person was particularly attetentive. The waffles were tasty (I paid an extra buck for pure maple syrup--definitely worth the up-charge).  However, I wasn't very impressed with the chicken.   I ordered the 1/4 chicken with dark meat and two waffles. The skin was tough, and the meat was a bit dry. But, I figured it was good enough, so I didn't say anything.  However after finishing the leg, I discovered that the thigh was even tougher, and once I managed to cut into it, the meat was stringy.  Maybe it had been pre-cooked a day or two before and then re-heated in the fryer?  I'm not sure.  But, it wasn't very good.  I probably should have said something after the first bite, but by the time I was convinced that I wasn't just being too picky, it felt like it was too late to complain.  Not sure if I'd go back or not.  Maybe it's worth another try.

uVHIn8n4JWE5P3krHroD3w.review_text: We decided to come here because we had a $15 for $30 to try this place out. This place is pretty classy on the inside for a southern restaurant. I ordered Gussie's Signature Sweet Potato Waffles with two pieces of fried chicken for $12.79. I don't remember exactly what the bf got but it was huge for just a dollar more. I loved my sweet potato waffles and the chicken was pretty tasty too. We got the red velvet cheesecake for dessert. It was a huge slice but not very tasty. I know there are cheaper chicken and waffle places out there but unless I can find one with tastier sweet potato waffles, I'll be coming back here!  Update: I came here again a second time with a large group of people and I ordered my sweet potato waffles with chicken again. It was just as good if not better than the first time! My fried chicken wings were really crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. It was reported from others in my group that their chicken was too dry though. =/ I was so hungry I finished everything this time. My tummy's happy & I'd return when I'm craving sweet potato waffles!

ntlvfPzc8eglqvk92iDIAw.review_text: Dang it.  I really wanted to like Gussie's Chicken & Waffles, but sadly, my visit was not to be on a good day for Gussie's.  Upon entering, a sign directed us to seat ourselves, however, with many of the tables occupied, several of those that were free were dirty and not wanting to seat ourselves at a dirty table, we opted for a table in the center of the restaurant, a minor inconvenience.  Gussie's was clearly understaffed during our visit, as it took more than a reasonable amount of time to bring the menus and then take our order, but what was the rush, it was a lazy day with no plans other than a lunch of chicken and waffles.  We ordered the Uptown Special and Downtown Specials, both with one waffle and either white or dark chicken, but sadly, the namesake items were both just "meh".  The waffle was thin and had to be consumed quickly, as it sogged up as quickly as a bowl of corn flakes do when milk is added.  The thin waffle had a nice flavor, but I was expecting a thicker portion.  The Uptown, which included the white breast was dry and the batter was underwhelming, nothing to really distinguish it to belonging to Gussie's.  Priced at $9.29, it was an ok value, but nothing special.  Food and bits of paper littered the restaurant floor and our water glasses stood empty for most of our meal, only being refreshed at the point were we were almost done with our lunch.  In addition to the chicken and waffles, we ordered the gumbo, which had the consistency of chicken soup, than a true gumbo.  The shrimp chowder left a burning sensation in the back of ones throat, similar to canned cheese, which we suspected, but could not confirm to be one of the ingredients.  My dining companion and I decided that we would give Gussie's another try, but not order the namesake items, hoping that upon our return visit, we would have a better experience, however, after paying our bill, we checked out the all you can eat buffet and finding it looking rather, um, simple, uneventful, kind of blah looking, decided that this would be our last visit.    Honestly, I was rather disappointed in our visit, I've driven by Gussie's so many times and really wanted it to be a great experience, but sadly, was left disappointed.

ZLSLYAd2Ef1OUBmphZX4lw.review_text: I recently went there this weekend, was greeted nicely by the hostess, but sat down to a waiter who only came around twice at most.  The snapper was good enough for my Dad to eat the whole thing.  My mom ordered a drumstick and waffles.  The waffles were so good ! and the maple syrup so on point !  the sampler was good for everyone, Dad had collard greens and candied yams, I had southern corn and macaroni and cheese.  The candied yams are to die for and the mac and cheese is always good.

xlrUX_n5xsLjeW-3Uuw6Dw.review_text: Best chicken and waffle place i've been to period.  Sweet potato waffles tasty and fluffy +1 Moist flavorful chicken (breast meat very tasty and not dry at all) +1 Gravy over rice very savory and tasty +1 Smothered potatoes not bad  Mac and Cheese dry variety but still very delicious +1 Creamy grits - add a dash of salt and pepper and couple of shakes of hot sauce +1 Fried okra very slimy, but that's expected. Came with a nice zesty sauce.  I will come back soon and often. This place is very good, compared to some of the other chicken and waffle places I've been to which either messed up the waffles or the chicken.

M271Ac7UKVaQ9U5AOvc_9A.review_text: 3.5 stars, but 'tis the season for giving, so I'm rounding up.  Expensive.  Hard Knox gives you a lot more food, and is definitely a better deal.  Seriously, $9 for a drumstick and one waffle?  The fried chicken is okay.  Not glorious, but not bad either.  The waffles were pretty good too; they're not the thick kind that you can completely drench with maple syrup.  In fact, they're sweet, but kind of thin.  Their maple syrup tasted different than the one that comes out of my Aunt Jemima bottle, but I think I might've liked it better.  $2 Tuesdays can get you two wings, and some other drinks that are cheaper then as well.  Service is friendly, but the restaurant was really empty when we went for some reason, and it was around 7:30ish.  Strange.  My friend and I agreed that the decor didn't "match" the type of food they serve.  It looks like a Denny's in the countryside - super clean and cute, but just.. "chicken and waffles are served here?!" for us.  I will go back for waffles because I like their maple syrup :)

J4u9s_MScFsfQWBqEX5eQg.review_text: Red Velvet Cake is sooo Yummy!!!

TMr5z8JDuGPc0I-5WfpBMQ.review_text: Came here after seeing a Groupon for Gussie's.  I've had chicken and waffles once, at 900 Grayson in Berkeley, and THAT WAS a certified 20, no lie.  So I had pretty high standards prior to coming here...  that is why this chicken/waffles deal was just ehh.  The chicken was so much more dry and not as tender, and the waffle wasnt as fresh and crispy as I'd like it to be.  I'd give them a 2.5/5, 3/5 ish...  The mac n cheese was delish! 4/5. also the chicken wings were pretty good...3.5/5.    anyways, if you're coming here for chicken and waffles, GO TO 900 GRAYSON INSTEAD and you won't ever regret it!

XXWIhBtNMExhX5jTyMYnag.review_text: MMM.....I LUV ME SOME CHICKEN & WAFFLES!!!  A soul food joint has been long overdue for SF, and Gussie's did not disappoint. The waffle was cooked perfectly, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. And, the fried chicken was excellent; crispy skin,  moist and juicy  meat.  Delish is the verdict!

UjEmLCieVaT5wq5-dfzWJw.review_text: First time I've ever had chicken and waffles....together.    When I first got my food and started to eat it, it tasted like nothing but plain ol' fried chicken and waffles that werent even good. I thought to myself "what's so special about this", until I saw how my friend was eating it. Cut the chicken put it on top of the waffles, then add the syrup, gravy, and hot sauce. What a difference that made. It went from being so completely normal to something different and actually tasting good.  3 stars for the food. Waffles were kind of soggy and the chicken was dry but 5 stars for serving them together! = 4 stars!  Can't wait to go back!  But corn bread is dry and nasty.

LrvKFG_j93umkuctQwvLEA.review_text: I'm impressed. It took a while for me to warm up to the chicken and waffle idea. Let me tell you, Gussie's does it right.   Perfectly cooked waffle; crispy outside and warm and soft inside. The fried chicken was seriously excellent; crispy tasty batter and moist  chicken. The friend okra is also very good, you can actually taste the okra instead of just batter and some random thing in the middle.   They are open late too. I will be back.

gV1NfR6jf8VgXft0J8tMJQ.review_text: The two times I have been to Gussie's the food has been great. I especially enjoyed the tenders and the yams. I love how hot and tasty they are. I tried a taste of the waffle which is really good.  And my boyfriend likes the fried chicken. I am sure we will be back.

Dhl0d-8Tgp4ihCtVc6LYSA.review_text: Went with one of my closest friend and it was eeehh. The service was slow and popeyes chicken is better than this place. They had live music which was nice and "soulgria" aka sangria.

AU0ifrgyuY2E1ukRqq2GVw.review_text: Grandma?? Is that you back there in the kitchen??  LOL, that is what I wanted to say because those fried chicken "wangs" (that's right, I said WANGS!!) took me waaaay back.  So far back that I thought I was back on the East Coast where people know how to cook southern food in their sleep and still not miss a beat!!  Being from the East Coast, I cringe every time someone tries to take to me soul food or southern food restaurant in California.  Gussie's got it right!.  Don't go trying to add some California flare to Southern cooking messing the flavor up (I won't call any restaurants out this time ahem, Oakland, Sacramento).    I played it safe with my food order just to see if I was going to add this place to my "wannabe poser" list as soooo many so called southern or soul food places have landed in CA.  I was pleasantly surpirised.  I had the chicken and waffles (Fillmore Classic) along with a couple of sides.   MMM-MMMMMMMMMMMMM... I just slapped somebodies momma (may have been my own) cuz I was in heaven.  The litmus test was the mac and cheese.  At least on this night, it was perfection!!  Rich, cheesy but not too thick and mushy or runny.   If your mac and cheese is runny and/or soupy, please come take some lessons from Gussie's on how to do it right.  The wings were just crsipy enough, but probably could have used a bit less salt (for my liking).  They were still flavorful enough that I overlooked the slight saltiness.    As far as the waffles - well, I don't believe you can mess up waffles (and if you do mess them up, may be consider NOT calling yourself a restaurant).   The meal was very filling and definitely worth another visit back to see if Grandma is working in the kitchen!

wHppQZ2kYK-g6pasjGii-Q.review_text: My true vote would be 3.5 stars. It's all scientific...and mathematical. Let me explain.   I don't know about you, but I don't wait until the end of my dinner to look at the dessert menu. I mean, come on--I'm serious about my sweets. I gotta make sure I leave room for a worthy dessert. You know what I'm saying. I know you do. So imagine my surprise when I don't see Sweet Potato Pie on the menu. Sorry Gussie's, but you lose one star right there.   I got The Taste of the South. The chicken was excellent. The greens were just right. The candied yams were good, and the mac 'n cheese was all right. The corn bread--a little dry (and could afford to be a bit sweeter). The lackluster cornbread: another half a star off.   This place is very new, and three (and a half!) stars are pretty good as far as I'm concerned. I am definitely going back to try the sweet potato waffles. Besides, in this little big city of ours, I'm a big fan of kitchens that stay open late...not to mention of having a cold beer with my soul food.   The atmosphere: a bit loud, but I didn't mind. In fact, I like hearing people having a good time while I'm eating. It's comforting.   Staff: Gussie's--hire more black folks for your wait staff please. All the wait staff around us were white. The people who were bussing the tables: brown folks. Something felt weird. I know, I know...my yardstick, Sylvia's in Harlem, is not a fair comparison, especially given the 6% (and dwindling) Black folks population in SF.  :: sigh :: Black flight is probably a topic better suited for Racialicious, not Yelp.   (Food is political, people.)

Q5OXcttCyUwTysu6nCN5Og.review_text: I always get the Fillmore Classic with an additional waffle and I would always leave happy and full.Their chicken was always perfectly cooked, so every bite gave me butterflies.  One night, I think it was a Friday, there was  DJ playing soul music! The ambience was wonderful and everyone in there was in a good mood.It was buffet night, too but I was really craving my usual so maybe I'll try that out another time. Servers are always very friendly and would constantly check up on you.   Honestly, we were going to try another chicken and waffle place, but we always leave Gussie's satisfied, so what the heck.   Also! Don't forget to try their banana pudding, it's heaven in your mouth.

CXTg1hBggbk5uKt99aw6PQ.review_text: I think the taste of the food overall is good. It takes a while to arrive but all soul food takes time. The food style doesn't lend itself to delivery in that the items are best eaten as soon as possible, but on the other hand I like having the option of grits and fried chicken delivered. I had the fried chicken and waffles, cheddar grits, mac n cheese, and gumbo. All were tasty except the mac n cheese, which was just ok. I will definitely order from here again but probably not every week.

bSl6ejEd8TnZfUH9rpyBLg.review_text: Solid food. I would've given 5 stars but the service is pretty darn bad. Took forever to be served and then had to track down waiter for check.

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: Just seeing a "Chicken & Waffles" sign reminds me of Atlanta living. It must be said that Gussie's isn't even close to the chicken and waffles I have had for the last 10 years of living in the south, but it was still exciting to experience CA's version of what used to be a staple for me. Its also lovely having Gussie's right down the street from our new apartment.   Service - 4 (close to 5) stars. The second we opened the door...we were greeted and treated very well. Our server made sure we were very happy without overdoing it.   Food - 3 stars (swaying some towards 2, but overall 3)  What we ordered... *Buttermilk battered chicken strips, which came with waffle fries and honey mustard. This is basically one of my favorite meals...when I'm looking for something fried, easy and all around not very good for you. :) *Boyfriend went with the Gussie's Chicken & Waffles, which is basically 2 pieces of fried chicken (drumstick and breast) and 2 waffles. I hate to say this, but the waffles weren't that impressive. They looked like they came out of a standard waffle iron and they were a bit underdone.   Overall...they advertise "Chicken & Waffles" and they deliver just that. If that's what you're looking for...give them a try, BUT if you're used to the southern  version...keep your expectations low.

tkcUGC5N4WvUPlSG-KCfhw.review_text: Came here after church for lunch since i was craving for fried chicken and waffles and wanted to see if it was as good as Roscoe from socal.   My brother and i walk inside the restaurant, we thought it was a nice and clean restaurant. I order the fillmore classic which include waffle, 3 fried chicken wings, and eggs while my brother order downtown style which have 1 waffles and either a choice of thigh or drumstick.  While my brother and i were chit chat and using the phone while waiting for our food, we was wondering why we were whats taking so long which we waited for about 20 minutes or more. Usually it doesnt take that long to bring out the food. While we waiting for the waitress who got our orders, my brother suggested that if she forgot what our orders was, we should just leave since we didnt want to wait long and i was really hungry.  When the waitress came to our table, we ask why it was taking so long, thats when she told us that there was a party of 20 in the back and told us that our food should be out shortly.   As for the food, i thought the chicken wings was a bit dry on the drumstick part and somewhat moist on the wing part. The waffle was alright not too special. I had scramble eggs which was good.  I would have gave this restaurant another star if there wasnt a big party on the day i went since the workers here are nice and keep checking on us. But if i rate on the food only, i give it a 3 since it was average but i dont mind coming here again

20BkChIDTA5UKQWzw0SCmg.review_text: The food is decent and the wait is to eat and get our food was way too long. We ordered our food, but the waiter forgot to put some of our food items on the ticket. Also, we ordered mimosas and they told us that they needed to go to the store to buy champagne. I wouldn't recommend coming here again, as they are other better places that serve chicken and waffles.

jWzfOtGKSBSBGncHje547Q.review_text: In contrast to other reviews, I thought this place rocked! It's nothing fancy inside, but the servers were pleasant, we were seated right away (at 10:30 on a Sunday), and the food was VERY TASTY!   If you are looking for chicken & waffles, McDonald's style, then just go to McD. This place does take a little while to get the food, but it is so worth it. They make everything to order, so there the waffles, are hot, with just the right amount of 'crisp'. The chicken is AMAZING. No idea what kind of spices they use for the batter, but it is delish!

gELwQeYees4tVxCOQyRclQ.review_text: Great serivce, watered was refilled and we were checked up on. I ordered the sweet potato waffles with chicken. The first thing I noticed was that my chicken pieces were way smaller than my friend's and we ordered the same thing. I thought "okay, maybe the taste will make up for it." Nope. The chicken was underseasoned and KFC probably would have tasted better. Not exactly sure what I was expecting from the waffles but they tasted really sour. I couldn't even finish it. I'd rather go to Hard Knox Cafe for bigger portions, cheaper and better tasting food.

Fb9OJcwLue1rgdbvcDXpFw.review_text: I love love love Gussie's!  I've been a bunch of times and it's my go-to place for out-of-town guests.  What could be better than amazing soul food, live jazz and the nicest staff around?  The service there is amazing, seriously you feel like you're in someone's home.    Everyone from the host, to the waiters, to the busboys are always checking in, anticipating your need for extra napkins, and making sure you not only have what you need but you love it.  Once the waitress felt my chicken was over cooked and offered to have it redone for free.  It's hard to not order my standard Uptown Special which is a delicious fried chicken breast and the best waffle I've had since the 80's when they started making hard-as-rock Belgian waffles filled with air.  Luckily, someone always gets something else off their huge menu that I get to try.    The Mac & Cheese is perfect, the way it should be.  The grits are as close to the real ones I get in the south  and are great with a side of southern corn.  The sweet potatoes are good.  I didn't love the collard greens, but did love that they didn't put pork in them since I don't eat pork.  I even really liked their veggie sandwich and buttermilk chicken salad, yes, they're menu is huge!!    They've got Blue Moon and other great beers on tap and fun soju drinks, including a bloody mary brunch special on the weekends.    I can't say enough about Gussie's.  I'll be going here probably too often.

baD0m5hJdUYEqmJaV3uMdQ.review_text: After going to the Disney Museum with my wife earlier in the day (btw I highly recommend the museum), we were craving for some southern food and in particular, fried chicken.   Our first option was Hard Knox Cafe a few miles down but it was closed, which sucked. But we had a backup and ended up at Gussies. The reviews were a little hit and miss but we were already in SF so why not give this place a whirl.  First off, the area is not sketchy like some people mentioned. Geez people, grow a pair. What constitutes a sketchy area? Minorities? Don't even get me started, lol.  Anyways, my wife and I went at an odd time (around 3:30 pm) on a weekday but that was great b/c it was empty, which is great if you're impatient like me.  I'm not a big fan of waffles so I didn't try them; neither did my wife. I ordered two chicken breasts, a side of red beans and rice and collard greens. The sides were pretty good. My wife ordered similar sides, along with some yams and smothered potatoes. No complaints either way.  But it's all about the chicken. Like others mentioned, the chicken is pretty dry. It has a nice crisp but the inside is not very juicy. The portions are huge though, so beware. One chicken breast is plenty for a big appetite. I was in beast mode so I ate two!  The service seemed a little on the slow side but not too bad. However, like I said, we were pretty much the only ones there, so I'm not sure how i'd feel going and waiting with a huge crowd. That being said, the waiter was pretty nice.  Overall, you get a good amount of food for the price. The quality of the chicken isn't as good compared to other places, hence 3 stars. I'd probably go back here late night with some friends after some drinking but not sure i'd go out of my way to come here again.

LHvW_odr3bpGqFwJR3AedA.review_text: Ordered online for pick up this week.  Came in early to scope the place out. It had been recently closed and I just moved to the neighborhood and was hoping it would be a cool place.  Seem to do a good pick up and delivery business while I was there but the restaurant was pretty dead even for a week night.  That being said...I waited 10+ minutes past the time they said the food would be ready...  Why?  They weren't busy.  I read other reviews about the the extreme wait and I would have to agree...even for pick up :(  The food was not half bad...ordered a salad, chicken/waffles, and sweet potato fries...will try again...hope the wait time goes down.

6_ZUomq74115CybROvIv7Q.review_text: Went there and they were a mess! Food takes awhile as they are working out the kinks to their brand new staff.... the bar tender cut his finger and was tasting drinks he made over and over to make sure it tasted right.   I appreciate the effort to make the drinks taste great, but the manhandling of drinks is not so appealing. My chicken was a bit dried and shriveled up.... took like 30 minutes to get my food.  For a fried chicken place, it is a bit pricey. I'll come back again in a few weeks once they get their stuff together

9QhhnQlTnV5kOfju6rBWWw.review_text: Gussies!  Their red velvet waffles/ pancakes brought me and my boyfriend here. It was delicious! The cream cheese frosting was AMAZING! Oh, and the fried chicken was amazing as well :) I always come back and order the waffles and chicken!

aIISk4lrzKp6rQJpgwj_fg.review_text: Sunday Brunch Buffet... BOMB!  Maybe it was the company- gotta love my bia's... full of laughs and huge appetites! Or maybe it was the buffet set up of fried chicken, chicken and rice, buttery grits, potatoes, mac n cheese, cornbread, catfish nuggets, eggs, biscuits and gravy! This is the first buffet that I sampled a little of EVERYTHING AND LOVED IT, especially the fried chicken with mac n cheese.  The only thing missing was the waffles, but we definitely took care of that with a side order of the Original AND a Red Velvet Waffle topped off with a yummy cream cheese butter mixture... and might I add- I don't even like cream cheese!   Good times, good friends, good food... I heart you, Gussie's!

YnIQUD0ExmWDzEqJuwQM2Q.review_text: I have to be honest and say that I went into this place with 3-star expectations and I was still let down. To their credit, the waffles were cooked perfectly and the syrup was good and warm, but the chicken left a lot to be desired, mainly because of the dredge.  Whatever dredge they used on the chicken lacked any character, it had absolutely no spice, and was salty and tough, and not even flaky. Some reviewers said that the chicken was cooked perfectly, and yes, it was cooked well, not too dry, but that's to be expected for a chicken dinner. The same dredge apparently made it on to the fried okra, which was similarly tough and tasteless, although the chipotle sauce that went with it (definitely very southern style!) was good.  Verdict: I'd rather have KFC.

Hy24EYEHAAFL4ar6xWSgOg.review_text: I feel like this place is a hidden gem. we originally went there with a groupon coupon last year. but i've always wanted to try it out. we live in San Bruno so it's a about a 15-20min drive. We went for breakfast on a sunday morning around 10:30ish. it wasnt too crowed yet. there are only two servers and i think 2 kitchen staff but everyone makes you feel like fam.. they have good service and great food. I had the two's a crowd with was out of this world delish.. two eggs, two chicken wings, and home fries,.. guess what it was so good we ended up not using our coupon in hopes to come before it expires and plus our meal was way less than the coupon. So we just recently came back to use the coupon. i ordered the same but i added a yummy waffle.. oh my goodness it was so dang yummy.. very sweet and tasty.. my eggs are always cooked so perfectly and that chicken oh my.. super duper yummy.. all i can say is i want this place every sunday morning.. gotta try it out if you like southern food.

5LS6gHgGukP7kw-Sdh9_6A.review_text: Ok so we came here because we were in the city and this place had great reviews and we wanted chicken and waffles.    Pros: Waffles were really tasty.  Not crunchy but very tasty.  I recommend the sweet potatoe waffles.  Thy come with bacon syrup which is delicious.  Can't believe I ate 2 whole waffles.  Gave 1 extra star for the waffles.    Cons: -Service was lacking.  When you enter the restaurant the entrance where you wait and get seated is around the corner from the main restaurant so the host can't see people come in.  There wasn't a host at the host area for most of the time we were there so people had to wait a few minutes before being seated. -Table service was slow as well. - I guess everyone loves the fried chicken here but I found ours to be over fried so it was really dark, almost burnt. Maybe we just came at the wrong time.  Also I found the batter to be too dense for my liking.  I felt very greasy and kind of sickly after eating the chicken.    We probably wouldn't come back just for the waffles.  Next time we're craving chicken and waffles we'll try another place.

0lr8AwfdokdGaUnlbYLZRA.review_text: Awesome meal. I had pork chops with red beans &rice and collard greens. Taste just like my momma's. My boyfriend enjoyed his sweet potato waffles and chicken. I'll definitely return.

N7c-mVGRDyrM4UIP8YmrnQ.review_text: Every time I visit SF, I stop at Gussie's. And when I move here, I'll be a regular. The food really is that delicious, but the service is so. very. slow. Not necessarily bad, because the staff can be very nice, but I always feel like I'm waiting for them to come around to ask for something. . . drinks, the check, napkins, etc.   Don't let that discourage you from trying this place, thought. I love their chicken and waffles. The chicken is always fresh and juicy; the waffles are on the thinner side, but I like mine that way topped with butter (and syrup on the side). I always think I'm going to try something new, and I never do. Can't beat an old favorite!  Their raspberry lemonade is like sugar coma deliciousness. No free refills, though.

mWlNSy7K44OsVwDjnbQASw.review_text: I went on 12/18/09 at around 7 before a concert. I had great service by 2 male waiters, delicious food, and plenty of tasty sounding options. I had the chicken and waffles, 1 each, even the maple syrup was tasty and warm. I would have never found it if I wasn't wandering around finding something better than the norm on Fillmore. What got me in there was the clean atmosphere, then the menu sealed the deal, you gotta read the whole menu, the to go menu is missing stuff. This is my new chicken and waffles place for sure! The price certainly is worth it. Oh and they have a bar too!

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: This is where you will find THE BEST Red Velvet Cake in the Bay Area!!!  I will bet ANYONE on this one!!!  It's delicious, heavy, not too sweet, is slathered in cream cheese frosting (as it should be!), and the side is scattered with pecans...MmmmMMMM!!!  In fact, I love this cake so much that my husband purchased one for my at-home birthday party last night!!  It ain't cheap, but nothing good ever is, and it'll easily feed ALL of your friends and then some...this cake is HUGE!!!  My friends also agree this is the best Red Velvet they've ever had:  my friend requested it as her cake for the baby shower I threw her in November!  She'd had it first at my birthday last year, and couldn't get it out of her mind!!  There are many other things I love at Gussies, too:  The Fried Chicken is delicious and moist (I only get dark meat, btw, so I have no idea how the white meat is)...the Mac'n'Cheese is flavorful and rich and soooo much better than any of the other soul food and/or bbq joints I've been to in the Bay Area...  The Fried Chicken Livers are a great starter for those rare people like me who love liver!    I really enjoy the Red Beans and Rice, too, although I will admit to having had better...but still, if you're craving that, it'll hit the spot!  Sweet Potatoes are delish, although again, not super-special...but they most certainly get the job done!    The Corn Bread is moist, sweet, not too heavy, and served in generous hunks...if you're looking for fussy corn bread with jalapenos or corn kernels or anything else in it, this is not the stuff you're looking for...but if you want good old-fashioned corn bread?  This is the stuff!  I'm actually not generally a fan of waffles, so while I've tasted the waffles here, and think they are just fine, I'm not a great judge of them in general...but my partner seems to think they're swell, because he hungrily devours them every time we go here!  I really enjoy the cocktails they make here:  a little bit out of the box, tasty, and not too pricey!  This is a GREAT place to take kids, to bring large groups (I've brought 20 people without the management batting an eyelash!), or to come for a casual evening out.    There are PLENTY of VEGETARIAN options here, including the rice and beans (which usually have a giant hamhock in them at other restaurants), and they even make VEGAN buckwheat waffles and cornbread!!!    Be warned:  Sometimes they have live jazz here in the evenings, and when that happens, it's WAY TOO LOUD to talk to anyone at your table!  I personally avoid those nights...it's probably a good idea to call in advance if you don't want a loud assault on your ears over dinner!  And sometimes if they are having a slow night, they'll close early...another good reason to call in advance if you're thinking of heading over there on the later side!  All in all, this is my favorite Southern-style soul food restaurant in SF.  I've been to Farmer Brown's, which left me cold.  I've been to Blue Jay and didn't understand what the fuss was all about.  Memphis Minnie's sides just didn't do it for me.  Etc.  You get the point!  Lest you think I'm a Californian who doesn't know her hamhock from her chit'lin's, I used to live in North Carolina.  I've been to all of the Southern states in the U.S.  I've had some truly epic soul food in my life.  While Gussie's may not be The Best Evar, it's certainly pretty darn good!!  Trust me on the Red Velvet Cake!!!

KyDLmbQy_2Xyi_j09wVCGg.review_text: I would rate zero stars if i had the option. Bar none - the Worst meal I've eaten in years. Sweet potato waffles sickeningly sweet -- and fried chicken was really dry. The red velvet cake tasted like it had freezer burn- and was completely dried out- inedible.  After a few bites- I threw entire meal in the trash- a HUGE disappointment. Was hoping to get some good southern fare.

k5-4BOgPOKHKNYaM4etmRA.review_text: I'm always on the search for Good Soul Food. I've tried many in San Francisco and Gussie's is One of the Best. The Fried Chicken is Tasty and Flavorful.  The Collard Greens, Southern Corn, and Bisquits are delicious as well. The atmosphere is down-home, casual and pleasant. I've been going since if first opened in 2009. Give it a try and see for yourself.

EyoQnr7l0Mf9XRgNqE16ag.review_text: 1 star because the wait staff are over-worked and still remain friendly. With the exception of the sweet potato waffles the food would get a negative.  The whole episode started badly, hostess stand is unmanned. Waited 4 min and finally someone came round and told me she would be with me shortly, that happened twice before she disappeared for good. Now 7 min have gone by and a couple arrive and are waiting as well. Near the bar area is a phone so I decide to call the restaurant in hopes of drawing someone's attention. Phone rang and rang, I can hear it but seems that no one serving can. Now 2 more people arrive and then 3 more people arrive, so now there are 8 people waiting for a hostess and I have been waiting for 12 min. Finally I grab a bus boy and ask for help. Someone final comes out and seats me.  Waiter takes my order and now the wait and wait and wait. Finally my appetizer arrives and now more waiting and waiting and waiting. The waiter finally appears and tells me he's forgotten to place my order and asks what I ordered. He is very friendly and apologetic. 3 min later the food arrives with what I think looks like a piece fried chicken, it should really be called overly dry chicken and it should come with a steak knife so that you can cut into it. Bottom line the food is really bad and as someone else mentioned if you call yourself a chicken and waffle place you should have some good chicken and this place doesn't. The waiter was great and comped my meal for the wait, but unfortunately the food does not make up for it.   The wait staff are running around doing the best they can and despite their constant coming and going they are still very friendly.

kYVpQrlb7l3D5jTPPKduLA.review_text: I came here months ago with my boyfriend on a Friday night. It was pretty late, but we were able to find parking a block away. We were debating between Hard Knox, which was already closed at the time, and Gussie's. Since Gussie's was open until 12am, we decided to eat here. It wasn't very crowded on a Friday night; maybe a couple of people, but that's it. The restaurant is very clean, well lit, and tastefully decorated. The waitress was very warm, welcoming and was very patient when we asked questions about the items on the menu.  I'm not too sure what the plate was called, but I ordered a piece of chicken with corn while my boyfriend got the chicken and waffle combo. We decided we both wanted to try the macaroni and cheese as well so we ordered a side of that. The waitress was reaaally trying to sell their chocolate kahula coffee cake to us and since we already ate before visiting Gussie's, we passed. While waiting, I noticed that Gussie's has a dance floor set up in the back. Pretty cool! The wait for the food wasn't too long at around 15 minutes for both of our meals. Our macaroni and cheese, however, came later because the waitress forgot to put our order in. No big deal, though!  My corn wasn't a corn on the cob like I expected it, but instead, it was loose kernels cooked with seasoning. I didn't really like all the flavorful seasoning on the corn, so I passed on that. The chicken was good, but not the best. It didn't give me that wow factor that I was looking for. My boyfriend, however, enjoyed his meal and said that Gussie's was better than Hard Knox. The macaroni and cheese was very good! Nice and ooey gooey cheesy.. my favorite! The waitress gave us the chocolate kahula coffee cake on the house! How sweet. :) I'm sad that we were going to pass up on it because it was SO good. Probably my favorite dish of the night! Definitely get that chocolate kahlua coffee cake!  Overall, the bill was decent. I saw the prices for the other on items on the menu and thought it was pretty expensive, though. I'll probably be back for brunch or something!

mfUrpbt61HIW6K1Aic3KCw.review_text: Chicken and waffles are one of my new favorite dishes! Gussie's has delicious chicken breast and waffles. I would say the portions are fairly small because I almost always have leftovers, but at Gussies I was able to finish all of my food.. Or does that mean the food was just that amazing? Either way, if you're in the area, do give it a try!

rg8gO0JL2h9O4FKEYjfrPQ.review_text: The BF and I had the lunch buffet today which was wonderful. which we have never had. We usually order off the menu.  Food:  Fried Chicken Baked Chicken Salad Yams Chicken Gumbo Cabbage Meatloaf Mac n Cheese Fried Fish  and more  We loves everything we had. I also had the Sweet Tea which was a hit.. Will definitely return.

qywdcThAC1NFsDpc_yVkaA.review_text: Good fried chicken, average waffles, friendly tho kinda flaky service. Decent people watching.

gVmv4JrNMlEcNSV5Zu2MDQ.review_text: Avoid this place !!!! Poor customer service and the place smelled like old chicken grease.

ngxiCDMvj8RbUbUrXkwBZA.review_text: I never thought chicken and waffles would go together. I was wrong. The food is delicious and the portions are large. A little pricey but their sweet potato pancake was off the hook.

OjJPqQCQF8jRfKMMQPhGYg.review_text: Gussie's is a pretty decent place to get your fingers on some good ol' soul food.  The location is easy to find, just off Fillmore Street and they've done a nice job with the decor,  It is simple, clean, and somewhat visually appealing.  Service is "down home" and comfortable, but not polished.  I had the signature dish, chicken and waffles. The fried chicken was really quite good.  The outer was nicely fried, flavorful, but not overly spicy.  Best of all, Gussie's avoided the dreaded dry bird, serving up a fairly moist half-breast.  The accompanying waffle was satisfying, if not spectacular.  Served with either maple or brown sugar syrup (I had a little of each), it is a thin waffle, not Belgian. After shunting about 90% of the butter off to the side, I tasted both syrups then loaded up on the maple. Since I'm farm boy from rural PA, maple syrup is sort of like chocolate to me -- it makes most everything taste good.  The maple syrup container didn't pour very well and leaked like a sieve, leaving a nice puddle of syrup on the table -- an example of what I mean by lack of polish in the service, this kind of thing is easily rectified.   The portions were adequate for me, which would make them more than enough for most.  Gussie's chicken and waffles were better than many I've had before, but not as good as some.  Although, anything I've liked better has been a bit more expensive.  So, I'm giving Gussie's my "Price/Performance Best Pick" on chicken and waffles.

L0llF8KpCg5vdEZIXkbO8w.review_text: Came here a awhile ago with my mom and friends. While I liked the food, the service SLOOOOOW, to the point I had to leave my party with my cash for the meal and take off.  Decided to give them a second chance, and go on a weekend when I have time to kill.  Sure enough, food was good. They had a very nice sinful red velvet waffle. The chicken was decent. They forgot one of the sides but brought it out quickly after we pointed it out.   They get a pass mainly because the food's great. I'll go back but NEVER on a lunch hour or anytime I'm on a schedule...food was slow but service was acceptably friendly and the waitress kept our glasses full.

PadmV2GEoA6mWpQUpPh7Ig.review_text: My girl friend and i came here yesterday to give in to our Fried Chicken craving... The place wasn't packed for a Saturday, so we got seated right away. The restaurant was in front of a bus stop, so if you don't want to worry about parking, just take the 31 bus from Union Square and get off and get on in front of the restaurant. -1 star: They didn't have Kool-Aid.... -1 star: My girl friend's utensils, was DIRTY. unwashed. At this point, i've already lost my appetite. yelp.com/user_local_phot… -1 star: The service took FOREVER. Thinking that it wasn't packed. I however, do like that our server need not be told. She refilled our water glasses without us asking; and kept on following up if we needed anything else. -1 star: The food isn't good. The chicken and waffles were rubbery. The mac and cheese was not cheesy with the cheese only use as a topping. It was also hard to fork from it's little bowl;i felt like I didn't get my money's worth. The syrup isn't legit. I expect the chicken to be crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside. Their chicken...even if i got a piece of thigh, was DRY. it was also very exhausting to chew on. If there's such thing as fake chicken...this was it. The waffles weren't soft and flaky and the batter was tasteless. I usually do a test run, sampling it without the butter and the syrup first. It failed my tastebuds. I will not come back nor recommend this place. I am still on the hunt for a decent Chicken and Waffles place comparable to Lo lo's in Arizona.

YJPCxg8ocP2xeFxdNYDi6A.review_text: Came for a late lunch, early dinner (4:30-5:30 pm) and man oh man! The waitress was very sweet, the setting was very relaxing and food was very delish! Had sweet potato waffles, chicken, Mac & cheese & sweet tea!!! Great first time visit! Hope to revisit!

Tl0aowpKqiwXaa15iTTC3A.review_text: I went with a party of 12 and I must say very dissapointing. They weren't ready for us when we arrived  so we had to wait about 15 minutes The buffet food looked as if it had been there for a while and picked through. Crusty, burned/scorched and soggy.  I definately wasn't going to eat that. . The menus were worn and wrinkled and the waitress quickly asked for them back after we ordered because they were short on menus. I ordered the "taste of the south" which took well over an hour to arrive. The mac n cheese was ok, the greens had the stems still on them and the sweet potatoes were canned. Also my food could have been hotter. One person in our group never got their  catfish meal so she canceled. All in all the food was just so so. It's very hard to make good soul food, even harder when mexicans are cooking it. Blacks don't make burritos, whites don't make chinese food and asians don't make pizza. Just saying. This dining experience would have been better had it  not been for the atrocious service and lack of lighting. If you have a flashlight on your smart phone you may need it. The waitress sucked, plain and simple! The  gratuity was already included in the total bill, which was over $200 so the waitress had no reason to provide good service, she was guaranteed a tip. Anyway, I won't be going there again and will discourage anyone I know from going there. Good service means alot and Gussies definately lacks it.  I don't see them in business in the next two years as word will get around about them and people won't go.

Y3JSs_5yjCjRceGApqaksg.review_text: This is a new restaurant that opened about 3 weeks ago, so i decided to try it.  When i walked in, the atmosphere reminded me of a Sizzlers don't know why, just did.  So anyways, I ordered a fillmore classic which consisted of 3 pieces of chicken, eggs, and two waffles.  It originally comes with 1 waffle; the second waffle is extra.  Maybe i was expecting too much because i hadn't had chicken and waffles in a long time.  I found everything to be bland.  The fried chicken had no flavor what-so-ever besides the flour batter.  My waffles weren't anything spectacular either also bland.  i would only come here if i were really craving chicken n waffles, since this is the only place in the city that serves it.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: I prefer Popeyes fried chicken, but the waffle was good (though its still nothing like Roscoe's waffle.)

CG2F4yJJYwhGcKnb8-bzGA.review_text: Thanks last few times that I have been here, it has been great.  I am changing my original review to a 3.  They have gotten better, much much better!   Guess I went on the day they were serving cold rubbery waffles.  Everything else we had was good.  The waitress forgot some items that we ordered and still tried to charge us for them.  She said the manager was out and she could not void the ticket.  Note to the kitchen staff, waffles are better hot!  There is no place like Roscos chicken and waffles.  They rule hands down each and everytime.

vGvla9arJLQJ8xmKFfkLOg.review_text: My co-workers and I have ordered from Gussie's in the past and decided to splurge for a group lunch today ($87 for 6 people).  We placed our order through GrubHub and received and estimate of 1 hour to deliver food. The delivery guy arrived on time, but half of our order was missing. Delivery guy was apologetic and asked us to call restaurant to fix. I spoke with the manager on the phone and she apologized for leaving pieces of our order out but also told us we ordered incorrectly (there is a section on grubhub where you can write in additional requests and we asked for mac and cheese instead of fries) even though the website says you can do this "for an additional charge". Manager stated the rest of our food  (waffles, chicken fingers, corn bread) would come in 20 minutes and she would give us the mac and cheese as "long as you know you you can't do that for future reference". The forgotten food arrived 35 minutes later and looked pathetic. It wasn't clear whether the buttermilk chicken strips were chicken or fish and they were pink in the center and rubbery throughout. The "sweet potato" waffles were pale, limp and had no sweet potato flavor. The $0.99 corn bread was a 2x2 dry corner piece. I called the restaurant again to confirm whether we had received regular or sweet potato waffles and chicken vs fish because we couldn't tell. Manager stated the sweet potato waffles were "sometimes not orange" and that "we don't even serve fish strips"- though you can clearly see pictures of strip shaped "catfish nuggets" in other yelp reviews. I informed the manager that we typically loved Gussie's but that today's food and services were not up to their usual standards. The manager admitted leaving out half of our order was incorrect but that "you think you can do whatever you want, but you ordered things that weren't even on the menu" and she refused to acknowledge my concerns about the poorly cooked chicken/fish and made no further attempts to improve our customer satisfaction.

_I4auBOXuFP5QdZg1IYGiw.review_text: This place was awesome. Try it for yourself, these reviews had me scared. I went there with a few friends so we were able to try a lot of the items here. I had NO complaints with anything. The chicken was cooked perfectly, I even took a piece home and it was still juicy that night. The catfish was good, the coffee was fresh, the service was good...I was pleased. The sides we tried were excellent, we had the mac n cheese(mmmm), smoothed potatoes (omg), red beans n rice (boyyy), and the yams (on point). Now the waffles...still can't wait to get back to them. Sweet potato waffle was so good...you don't need syrup, the butter was the perfect topping. The red velvet melts in your mouth with the cream cheese butter. The cornmeal waffle was a soooo good with their signature syrup. We were all very satisfied with our food...and we had the queen of picky eating with us lol. We will be coming back soon!

uVwJeAXbFyQB7T97EaOC3A.review_text: I have come here about 4 times and I can honestly say it's amazing !!! Chicken and waffles with a side of Mac n cheese! YUM!! I've tried other places but I continue to come back! It's really amazing food! What more can I say other than try it!! You won't be disappointed!! I've seen a few reviews about bad service but so far I've had good experiences. I hope I never have a negative customer service experience here because the food is too good to be ruined by someone's negative attitude!! The only thing I have been disappointed in so far is that it was closed on Sunday when it was supposed to be open. They probably had an event or something and had to close but if the schedule says open they should be open :(. Other than that, FIVE STARS Gussie's!! Keep ur food and customer service good and you'll never fail in my book :)!!

r1vJjiNGoLgn9y8JAUeQ0w.review_text: Meh.  Nothing too spectacular.  Ordered the cornmeal waffle which looked exactly like my friend's waffle and tasted like a normal waffle.  Waffle isn't crispy it's soft if you're into that kind of thing.  Chicken wing on the other hand was juicy and hot and crispy.  It's about the right amount of food for the price and there were leftovers to be had but I've had better.

v25_RmOUicsCuZYu6r2TBg.review_text: Food is pretty good but not fantastic. Anyone who has had the real Roscoe's in LA would just say that this OK. The fried chicken and waffles were decent but don't stand in comparison to Roscoe's. The soul food was quite delicious though. All of the sides were pretty damn good! I will definitely be giving this place another try...

cXnyIjO9pM-ANcsIgaQSfQ.review_text: We were making the rounds in SF on our weekend getaway from LA so we had to eat at Gussies!  The service as well as the food is delicious.  They were suspiciously similar to Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles here in LA, but hey, I'm not mad at them.  The staff was friendly and professional.  I ordered eggs, turkey sausage, grits (the bomb.com) and a corn meal waffle (so good, although i wish it had-had a little more cornmeal to make it stand out from the regular waffle) all in all it was a very tasty waffle!  The rest of my party ordered chicken and said it was very good (not as good as Roscoe's) but very good.   If you are in the SF area and are craving some good Chicken & Waffles go to Gussies.  You will not be disappointed.

3UROecoOnHN8LFdaQbkSdw.review_text: I know Gussie's gets lots of complaints on here but I enjoy it! The only nay I have to say is that occasionally I've found that they use too much salt.   Which brings me to my main concern with Gussie's. It's hit and miss. Some days the mac and cheese is bomb some day's it's salty. Some days the greens are smokey and delectable other days it's blah, but to be fair I never hate it because there are dishes that are consistently good like the catfish, the red beans and rice, and the RED VELVET CAKE (which is some of the best I've ever had). The chicken is not make- you- wanna- slap- yo- mama good but it's tastey. And chicken and waffles is just f***in good!  Rules for Gussie's  1. Go to the Brunch buffet on Wednesdays for $12 2. Order a la carte and take a friend to share. 3. Order the Red Velvet Cake but make sure you order early because the desserts go fast on the weekends

8p2sKVE5CE5d1Yuj_O9Zrw.review_text: For now, 3 stars.  Don't get me wrong, I liked the food, but they are still working out some little issues and once those are cleared up, I will return and re-review.  The little issues: Service mainly... They must have had 6 waiters/waitresses serving 15 tables or so while I was there and yet, somehow, I didn't get my sweet tea until after my appetizer arrived and I reminded my waitress about it.  And when I received a leg and a thigh with my 1/4 WHITE meat chicken and 2 waffles entree, I was disappointed.  There food was better than there service, thats for sure.  The cheddar cheese grit cakes were something which I had never had before, and I am still not really sure who thought up the idea of deep frying cheesy grits, but touche.  They were served with an artichoke jalapeno spread which added to the cakes quite a bit.  The fried chicken was good, I was hoping for great, but it was just good and the waffles were good too, but again, I think my high expectations led me to be a little more disappointed than I would have been normally.

NFU-bQYhVh2hHud49BNryQ.review_text: i was really excited for gussies to open but it was quite a disappointment.  i love chicken and waffles but the dishes we had here were just OK.  the fried chicken i had was dry and eggs were way overcooked.  we tried both the regular waffle and sweet potato waffle and both were nothing special.  my friend commented that it was comparable to going to an IHOP.  when you're in the mood for chicken and waffles, try little skillet instead...way better.

hOeJFQl-iY5Pey54LpDdVA.review_text: take out  fried chicken - bc it was take out it steamed a bit in the container so no comment on the level of crispiness of skin - skin had a lot of visible remnants of feathers  - not too oily for a fried item - the meat under the skin lacked flavor  - not dry but not juicy either - under-seasoned  - i've had better  waffle - that probably steamed too - didn't make teeth feel gritty afterward  - flavor was mild  collard greens - not familiar with how it should taste - bitter, peppery, salty  yams - very sweet - a lot of butter  order was messed up but it was compensated so that was okay

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: It's rare that I allow myself fried chicken.  (Kevo's being the exception) A gorgeous girl's birthday is not the time to stick to one's diet however, so chicken and waffles it was.  The chicken was easily some of the best I've ever had - crispy, not TOO greasy, and perfectly seasoned; and the sweet potato waffle was divine.   Service was fantastic, even when dealing with our large group, and the owner is a total dreamboat. Maybe I should allow myself fried chicken a little more often.

n8zo_DJYs9jgxqbX6pMbbg.review_text: DON"T BELIEVE THE LOW REVIEWS...THIS PLACE ROCKS!!!  I love Gussies, the prices are reasonable (and cheap on Tuesdays) and everything is delicious. I recommend any piece of fried chicken and the Banana Pecan waffles. That is my favorite combo. My mom is a fan of the regular waffles and my friends seem to be partial to the sweet potato.   The only thing better then the food is the service, the staff is super friendly and although the kitchen can cause a bit of a wait it is well worth it.
